Deign on the passing World to turn thine Eyes,

And pause awhile from Learning, to be wise

致谢

ACKNOWLEDGMENTS

如果没有 Evander Lomke 的启发和鼓励，这本书就不会存在。他在一封圣诞节电子邮件中发现了这本书的灵感，建议写一份大纲，然后最终签订了合同。从几年前的那一刻起，他一直在那里，在手稿的撰写和修订过程中提供鼓励和宝贵的建议。David Barker 巧妙地指导了第一版的扩充和大量修订。Kim Storry 和她的工作人员迅速而仔细地准备了手稿以供出版。一如既往，我最感激的是我亲爱的妻子 Annette Tomarken，在整个过程中，她提供了中肯的批评和敏锐的校对眼光，这一切都是在她完成自己的学术项目期间。

This book would not exist without the inspiration and encouragement of Evander Lomke. Having located the germ of an idea for the book in a Christmas e-mail, he suggested writing up an outline and then eventually issued the contract. Since that point a few years ago, he has always been there, offering encouragement and invaluable advice throughout the composition and revision of the manuscript. David Barker skilfully guided the first version through expansion and extensive revisions. Kim Storry and her staff promptly and carefully prepared the manuscript for publication. My greatest debt, as ever, is to my beloved wife, Annette Tomarken, who throughout the process provided cogent criticism and a keen eye for proofreading, all during completion of her own scholarly project.

分析的电影

《社交网络》（2010）

介绍

INTRODUCTION

使用当代电影来教授文学理论的想法来自我的学生。他们抱怨文学理论阅读作业充其量是令人费解，最坏的情况是难以理解。因此，我在阅读材料中选取了一些中心思想，并用比理论家们更通俗易懂的术语来解释它们，因为理论家们的著作毕竟不是为本科生而写的，而是为该领域的专家而写的。当学生开始明白过来时，我鼓励他们回到书面文本，并将这些理论应用到他们作为新兴文学评论家的问题中。令我惊讶的是，几乎无一例外，学生们都在当代电影中找到了这些思想的例证和用途。在一个难忘的场合，一名学生在讨论雅克·德里达的作品时说道：“塔伦蒂诺博士，德里达太烂了，你应该看看《杀死比尔 2》！”塔伦蒂诺的电影以暴力著称，所以当我妻子看到我从录像店拿着《杀死比尔 2》回来时，她吓坏了。但看完这部电影后，我意识到这名学生说得对，德里达的一些思想可以应用到这部电影中。在课堂上讨论这部电影时，很明显学生们从这部电影中领悟到了他们在阅读时没有领悟到的思想。

The idea of using contemporary film to teach literary theory came from my students. They complained that the literary theory reading assignments were at best puzzling and at worst incomprehensible. I therefore selected some central ideas in the readings and explained them in less abstruse terms than those of the theorists whose writings were after all intended not for undergraduates but for specialists in the field. Once the light began to dawn, I encouraged the students to return to the written texts and to apply the theories to their problems as budding literary critics. To my surprise, almost without exception the students found illustrations of and uses for these ideas in contemporary movies. On one memorable occasion, a student remarked in the midst of a discussion of the work of Jacques Derrida, “Dr. T., Derrida sucks, you should see ‘Kill Bill 2’!” Tarantino’s films were known to be very violent, so my wife was horrified when she saw me arrive from the video shop with “Kill Bill 2.” But after viewing the film that did indeed strike me as very violent, I came to realize that the student was right; some of Derrida’s ideas could be applied to the movie. During discussion of the movie in class it became clear that the students grasped from the film ideas that had eluded them in reading.

学生们继续推荐与课堂上讨论的理论相关的电影，我开始意识到文学理论的主要元素可以通过分析某些电影来解释。由于本书收录的许多电影都是书籍改编的，大部分是通俗小说，因此理论既适用于文学也适用于电影。本研究的重点是电影，因为学生和许多普通观众对电影比对文本更熟悉。此外，电影的受众与文学理论甚至文学不同，而且可能更大。

Students continued to recommend movies related to the theories discussed in class, and I began to realize that major elements of literary theory could be explained by analysis of certain films. Since many of the films included in this book are adaptations of books, for the most part works of popular fiction, theory pertains to literature as well as movies. This study focuses on movies because students and many members of a general audience are more at ease with films than with texts. Moreover, movies reach a different and probably larger audience than literary theory or even literature.

我强调这里收录的电影不是艺术形式的电影，而是卖座大片，因为它们为本书的两个目标奠定了基础：

I stress that the films included here are not artsy forms of cinema, but blockbuster mainstays because they provide the basis for the two goals of this book:

1

1

向非专业人士介绍一些与我们日常生活相关的文学理论的基本概念；

to introduce the non-specialist to some basic conceptions of literary theory that relate to concerns of our daily life;

2

2

展示文学理论的神秘概念是如何进入我们的文化的，并且可以通过对我们所有人都有启发的商业成功电影来理解。

to show how the arcane notions of literary theory are entering our culture and can be understood by way of commercially successful movies that speak to all of us.

我的目的是展示理论如何通过电影阐明以及电影如何通过理论阐释，而不是评判电影的艺术价值。

My object is to show how theory is clarified by film and film is elucidated by theory, not to judge the artistic merit of the films.

本书由六章和最后一节“文学理论教学建议”组成。每一章都专门介绍与几部近期电影相关的一种理论或理论家，教学建议分为与每一章相关的部分。我希望读者至少熟悉每一章中的一部或两部电影。首先，必须明确一点，由于我不是电影专家，我对电影的分析不会涉及技术语言。电影在这里是一种教学工具。事实上，我很快就发现我的学生比我更熟悉电影技术。然而，他们对大多数这些电影并不尊重，认为票房成功不太可能包含重要的想法——实际上根本不包含任何想法——除了那些提高票房收入的想法。所以我从他们那里学到了应该看什么电影，他们对电影的反应如何，然后能够教他们（或者我希望如此）理论如何帮助我们了解他们喜欢电影并从电影中学到什么。

The book is comprised of six chapters and a final section of “Suggestions for Teaching Literary Theory.” Each chapter is devoted to one theory or theorist in relation to a number of recent films, and the teaching suggestions are divided into portions related to each chapter. My hope is that the reader will be familiar with at least one or two of the films in each chapter. At the outset it is important to make clear that, since I am not an expert on cinema, my analysis of the films will not involve technical language. Film here serves as a tool for teaching and learning. In fact, it soon became clear that my students were more attuned to cinematic techniques than I was. Yet they had little respect for most of these films, believing that box office successes were unlikely to contain important ideas—indeed any ideas at all—except those that improved the ticket sales. So I learned from them what movies to watch, how they responded to them, and was then able to teach them, or so I hope, how theory helps us understand what they enjoyed and learned from the films.

在第二次教授这门课之后，我开始意识到文学理论与大众文化有着特殊的意义。文学理论被认为是最困难和最复杂的专业之一，涉及一些业内人士认为故意晦涩难懂的文本，目标读者是某种专属读者群。然而，教授初学者的最大问题是认为理论是为更高级的生物准备的，他们说着别人听不懂的语言。在这方面，这本书的合同的起源就很有意思。开设这门课的时候，我在大学教书多年，出版了不少书籍和论文，都是为学术界而设计的，而不是为学生或普通读者设计的。但我碰巧与我职业生涯早期的一名学生保持着定期的电子邮件通信，他后来成为了本书的出版商 Continuum International（现为 Bloomsbury Publishing 所有）的高级编辑。我“青葱岁月”时的学生埃文德·洛姆克 (Evander Lomke) 是我之后一代，但我的学生之前一代；他的眼光是双面的，介于教授和在校学生之间。从他的角度来看，这本书似乎具有超越课堂的意义，能够引起更多读者的兴趣和潜在吸引力——我只能希望他是对的。

After teaching this class for a second time I began to realize that literary theory—considered one of the most difficult and complex of specialties, involving texts thought by some in the field to be written with deliberate obscurity and intended for a sort of club of exclusive readers—had a particular relevance to popular culture. Yet the biggest problem in teaching beginners is the belief that theory is for a higher order of beings who speak a language that no one else understands. In this respect, the genesis of the contract for this book is of interest. When this class was initiated I had taught for many years at university and published a number of books and essays, all designed for a scholarly and academic audience, not for students or the general reader. But I happened to be in regular e-mail correspondence with a student from an early part of my career who had become a Senior Editor at Continuum International (now owned by Bloomsbury Publishing), the publisher of this book. Evander Lomke, the student from my “green and salad days,” was of the generation after me and before my students; his vision was Janus-faced, in between his professor and current students. From his vantage point the book seemed to have—I can only hope that he is right—a significance beyond that of the classroom, to have some interest and potential appeal to a larger audience.

在开始之前，我应该澄清一下，这里提出的文学理论概念并非被该领域所有人都接受。我的观点基于两位最早教我理论的教授拉尔夫·科恩和诺思洛普·弗莱的观点。弗莱的巨作《批评的解剖学》（1957 年）是理论在实践批评中的应用。弗莱和科恩都认为理论的目的是为了解决文学分析的问题。尽管理论在更高的普遍性层面上，但它是文学批评家的帮凶。1969年，文学理论首次出现在大众视野中，科恩创办了该领域最重要的期刊《新文学史》 。文学理论被公认为一门学科。然而，必须记住的是，有些人认为文学理论是美学的延续，始于亚里士多德和柏拉图。我的立场是追随科恩和弗莱的脚步，将文学理论应用于电影的实际批评。我并不想断言这些电影的制作人对理论感兴趣，也不想用电影来举例说明理论。相反，一些当代电影帮助我们理解理论，而理论反过来又让我们更欣赏电影。这些思想本身植根于我们的文化中，是过去被称为时代精神的元素。将一部特定的电影应用于特定的理论不应被视为排除将同一部电影应用于本研究中的其他理论之一的可能性。事实上，许多电影都说明了这些理论，这再次表明这些思想正在渗透我们的知识环境。

Before beginning, I should make clear that the conception of literary theory presented here is not accepted by all in the field. My view is based upon that of the two professors who first taught me theory, Ralph Cohen and Northrop Frye. Frye’s great work, The Anatomy of Criticism, (1957), is an application of theory to practical criticism. Frye and Cohen shared the belief that the purpose of theory was for resolving problems of literary analysis. Although at a higher level of generality, theory served as the handmaiden of literary critics. Cohen founded the most important journal in the field, New Literary History, in 1969 when literary theory was first recognized as an academic discipline. However, it is important to keep in mind that some view literary theory as a continuation of aesthetics, beginning with Aristotle and Plato. My position, following in the footsteps of Cohen and Frye, applies literary theory to the practical criticism of film. I do not wish to assert that the makers of these films were interested in theory or in using film to exemplify theory. Rather, some contemporary movies help us understand theory, and theory in turn gives us a greater appreciation of cinema. The ideas themselves are embedded in our culture, an element of what used to be called the Zeitgeist, the spirit of the age. The application of a given film to a particular theory should not be seen as precluding the possibility of applying the same film to one of the other theories in this study. In fact, many of the movies are illustrative of a number of the theories, another indication that these ideas are pervading our intellectual environment.

对于那些像我一样不相信文学理论是哲学分支的人来说，第一个问题是，为什么它在 20 世纪 60 年代和 70 年代成为一个新的专业领域。文学理论的出现是为了回应 20 世纪中叶各种形式主义的盛行，即假设某些主题是文学所固有或内在的。这些观点，从欧洲的结构主义到美国和英国的新批评，都源自 20 世纪前 20 年在西方声名鹊起的俄罗斯形式主义者。形式主义者断言，如果正确理解了艺术的结构或形式，它就包含或传递了明确的主题。雷内·韦勒克和奥斯汀·沃伦在《文学理论》（1946 年）中提出了一种“规范”理论。科恩将文学的这一概念解释为一层蛋糕；从任何一侧切下一片都会切穿所有的层或规范。韦勒克和沃伦的论点旨在断言，无论读者的观点如何，规范都会引发类似的主题。例如，TS 艾略特在《J. 阿尔弗雷德·普鲁弗洛克的情歌》中说，“我们日子和生活方式的烟蒂”将烟蒂一词变成了沉闷、平凡的现代生活的象征。对于韦勒克和沃伦来说，无论你是否认为《情歌》具有讽刺意味，这个主题对于任何细心的读者来说都是显而易见的。然而，到了 20 世纪 60 年代，内在性或“规范”的理论受到质疑；出现的主题被视为批评家们共同持有的隐性意识形态的结果。一旦形式主义的意识形态被揭露，规范理论就会被抛弃，新的主题和不同的解释就会变得更容易被接受。理论用于解释和捍卫各种新方法。因此，后形式主义者能够断言，艾略特的“屁股”不必只唤起一个主题；例如，它可以指日常生活的日常乐趣，而不是现代生活的无精打采。这本书以解构主义开始，因为在我看来，文学理论是通过解构形式主义而形成的。

The first question that arises for those who, like myself, do not believe that literary theory is a branch of philosophy is why it became a new field of specialization in the 1960s and 1970s. Literary theory arose in response to the preponderance of formalisms of various kinds in the mid-twentieth century, namely, the assumption that certain themes were inherent or immanent in literature. These views, from structuralism in Europe to New Criticism in the United States and the United Kingdom, were derived from the Russian formalists who came to prominence in the West during the first two decades of the twentieth century. The formalists asserted that the structure or form of art, if properly understood, contained or imparted clear themes. René Wellek and Austin Warren, in The Theory of Literature (1946), devised a theory of “norms.” Cohen explained this notion of literature as a layer cake; a slice from any side cuts through all of the layers or norms. The point of Wellek and Warren’s argument was to assert that whatever the point of view of the reader, norms evoked similar themes. For instance, T. S. Eliot’s phrase, “the butt-ends of our days and ways” in “The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock” transforms the term for cigarette butt into a symbol of dreary, mundane modern life. For Wellek and Warren, whether you saw “The Love Song” as ironical or not, this theme would become clear to any attentive reader. By the 1960s, however, the doctrine of immanence or “norms” was being questioned; the themes that emerged were seen to be, in part, a result of an implicit ideology shared by critics. Once the ideologies of formalism were exposed, the theory of norms was discarded, and new themes and different interpretations became more acceptable. Theory served to explain and defend various new approaches. The post-formalist was thus able to assert that Eliot’s “butt-ends” need not evoke only a single theme; it could, for example, refer to the quotidian pleasures of daily life rather than to the spiritless quality of modern life. This book begins with deconstruction because in my view literary theory came into its own by way of the deconstruction of formalism.

本书的理论选择是个人的，而且毫无疑问，完全不同的选择也完全可以成立。有这么多理论可供选择，很难达成共识。我的选择是基于这样的信念：这六种理论是后来理论的基础，而且已经对我们的文化产生了深远的影响。

The choice of theories for this book is personal, and a strong case could no doubt be made for an entirely different selection. With so many kinds of theory to choose from, consensus is unlikely. My selection is based on the belief that these six theories are fundamental for the theories that come after them and have already had a profound effect upon our culture.

所要收录的理论如下。本书首先分析了雅克·德里达的解构主义概念，因为尽管它不是一个成熟的理论，但它提供了所有其他理论家使用的策略。第二章探讨了米歇尔·福柯对学习学科的看法，因为知识的本质是任何理论的基础。下一个问题，即知识的交流，将在第三章关于沃尔夫冈·伊瑟尔的读者反应概念中讨论。由于人文学科的知识侧重于人和人类的困境，因此第四章探讨了雅克·拉康的个人身份概念。第五章讨论了社会以及我们如何分组和对待个人，该章讨论了弗里德里克·詹姆逊的新版马克思主义。由于前五位理论家都是男性，因此最后一章重点介绍了埃莱娜·西苏的女权主义观点，这是男性理论的另一种选择。本书收录的所有理论家都来自文学理论首次被认可为一门学科的时期。在我看来，他们的开创性工作为后来者奠定了基础。我希望在姊妹篇中分析一些较新的理论家，他们以创新的方式建立和修改了前人的工作。

The theories to be included are as follows. The book begins with an analysis of Jacques Derrida’s conception of deconstruction because, although not a full-fledged theory, it provides a strategy used by all of the other theorists. Chapter Two looks at Michel Foucault’s views on the disciplines of learning because the nature of knowledge is fundamental to any theory. The next issue, the communication of knowledge, is considered in Chapter Three on Wolfgang Iser’s notion of reader response. Since knowledge in the humanities focuses upon people and the human dilemma, Chapter Four considers Jacques Lacan’s concept of personal identity. Society and how we group and treat individuals are the subject of Chapter Five, a discussion of Fredric Jameson’s new version of Marxism. Because the first five theorists are men, the last chapter focuses on Hélène Cixous’s feminist view, an alternative to male theory. All the theorists included in this volume are from the period when literary theory was first recognized as a discipline. Their pioneering work forms the foundation, in my view, for what comes after them. I hope, in a companion volume, to analyze some of the more recent theorists who build upon and modify in innovative ways the work of their predecessors.

章节顺序也遵循了解构主义的顺序。如果批评的规范或绝对性受到质疑，那么第一个也是最基本的问题是，我们如何重新评估艺术所传达的真理（第二章）。如果没有一种意识形态比其他意识形态更优越，那么不同的信仰体系会如何影响解读（第三章）？此外，这些不同的方法如何改变我们对自我和个人身份的概念（第四章）？接受不同的意识形态会改变我们的政治前提（第五章）。最后，如何理解女性的观点，并在这个新框架中占有一席之地（第六章）？

The order of the chapters also follows that suggested by deconstruction. If the norms or absolutes of criticism are called into question, the first and most basic issue is how do we reevaluate truth(s) communicated by art (Chapter Two). If no single ideology is privileged above others, how do different belief systems influence interpretation (Chapter Three)? Moreover, how do these different approaches change our concept of the ego and personal identity (Chapter Four)? The acceptance of diverse ideologies alters our political premises (Chapter Five). And finally, how is the female point of view to be understood and given a place in this new framework (Chapter Six)?

本书中所有理论均经过精心挑选，因为它们与文学批评和我们的日常生活息息相关。解构主义被视为一种策略而非理论，因为当一些电影制作人和理论家使用解构主义超越德里达时，它只服务于道德目的。福柯表明，追求真理不是自由的，而是受到文化结构或知识学科的限制。拉康认为，自我，即我们的个人身份，不是驱动力和本能的功能，而是话语的功能，尤其是语言的功能。詹姆逊认为，传统的马克思主义历史力量辩证法因关注文化产物（尤其是文学）的形式和结构特性而发生了改变。西苏认为，理论本身是一个不断发展的过程，正在破坏其自身的结构和凝聚力。

All the theories in this book are selected because they have a bearing upon both literary criticism and our daily lives. Deconstruction is seen as a strategy not a theory because it only serves an ethical end when used by some film-makers and theorists to go beyond Derrida. Foucault demonstrates that the pursuit of truth is not free but constricted by the cultural constructs or disciplines of knowledge. Lacan believes that the ego, our personal identity, is a function not of drives and instincts but of discourse, most notably language. Jameson asserts that the traditional Marxist dialectic of historical forces is altered by attention to the formal and structural properties of cultural artifacts, particularly literature. Cixous argues that theory itself is an unfolding process, undermining its own structure and cohesion.

显然，本书所讨论的问题不仅适用于文学，还适用于生活。知识或真理的本质、个人反应在解释中的作用、我们存在或自我的结构、政治力量的本质、女性对男性世界观的替代等问题对我们所有人来说都是根本性的，构成了我们文明的基础。当我们看到新文化从压迫和极权主义中涌现出来时，分析文学理论与大众文化之间的关系将有助于我们理解我们的文明，并使其适应快速变化的世界。

Clearly, the issues of this book have an applicability beyond literature to life. Questions such as the nature of knowledge or truth, the function of personal response in interpretation, the structure of our being or ego, the nature of the forces of politics, the female alternative to the male view of the world, are fundamental for all of us, forming the basis of our civilization. As we see new cultures emerging out of oppression and totalitarianism, analysis of the relationship between literary theory and popular culture will help us understand our civilization and adapt it to the fast-changing world.

理论的出现是为了捍卫差异、关于真理和知识的新观念、新的解释观点、新的自我概念、新的政治秩序观念、新的女性形象。差异或差异性是当今世界的主要问题，无论是在中东反抗暴政，还是在我们自己的文化中少数群体为争取认可而奋斗。那么，文学理论与大众文化相关就不足为奇了吗？

Theory arose in defense of difference, new ideas about truth and knowledge, new views of interpretation, a new concept of the ego, a new notion of political order, a new presentation of the feminine. Difference or otherness is the main problem in the world today, whether it be in the Mid-East fighting against tyranny or in our own cultures where minorities struggle for acceptance. Is it any wonder, then, that literary theory relates to popular culture?

由于本书是在教学背景下产生的，因此似乎应该包括“文学理论教学建议”。本书的每一章都与专门讨论教授这些概念的部分相关联。但对我有用的方法可能对其他人不起作用。我们在课堂上都有或发展了自己的风格和声音。尽管如此，使用电影涉及一个相互的过程。学生们教我他们如何看待这个世界——一个独特的视觉世界——我试图学习如何将文学理论置于那个背景中。成功后，两个世界开始对话，我的文本导向世界和他们的视觉世界。结果，这本书跨越了艺术、流派和世代。我相信，理论是促成对话的桥梁。

Since this book arose in a pedagogical context, it seemed appropriate to include Suggestions for Teaching Literary Theory. Each chapter of the book is linked to a section devoted to a discussion on teaching these notions. But what seemed to work for me may not for others. We all have or develop our own style and voice in the classroom. Nevertheless, the use of films involved a reciprocal process. The students taught me how they see the world—a distinctly visual world—and I tried to learn how to place literary theory in that context. When successful, two worlds came into conversation, my textually oriented one and their visual one. The result, this book, crosses arts, genres, and generations. Theory is, I believe, the bridge that enables the conversation.

第一章

CHAPTER ONE

解构

Deconstruction

摘要：我从解构开始，因为本书中的所有其他理论家都将其作为一种策略。讨论的第一个主题是去中心化，克里斯托弗·瓦尔兹在昆汀·塔伦蒂诺的《无耻混蛋》（2009）中扮演党卫军军官汉斯·兰德，体现了这一点。德里达的第二个关键思想，即起源神话，与《无耻混蛋》有关。由于德里达的主要贡献是他的隐喻概念，第二部分使用《杀死比尔》来解释他的观点，即死亡是隐喻所固有的。然而，第三部分是对《黑暗骑士》的分析，清楚地表明电影超越了解构，走向了道德目的。电影超越解构的另一个领域是历史，在《无耻混蛋》的讨论中有所考虑。解构主义在道德目的上的另外两种运用体现在《谍影重重 2》和《人人都说我爱你》中，前者旨在强调个人诚信，后者旨在强调一种新的友谊。最近两部电影《解构哈里》和《风云人物》是解构主义讽刺运用的例子，特别展示了解构自我如何达到道德目的。

Summary: I begin with deconstruction because all of the other theorists in the volume use it as a strategy. The first topic of discussion is decentering, illustrated by Christoph Waltz who plays SS officer Hans Lander in Quentin Tarantino’s “Inglourious Basterds” (2009). The second key idea of Derrida’s, originary myths, is described in relation to “Inglourious Basterds.” Since Derrida’s main contribution is his concept of metaphor, the second section uses “Kill Bill” to explain his view that death is inherent in metaphor. However, the third section, an analysis of “The Dark Knight,” makes clear that the films move beyond deconstruction toward ethical ends. Another area where films move beyond deconstruction is history, considered in a discussion of ”Inglourious Basterds.” Two other uses of deconstruction for ethical ends are seen in “The Bourne Supremacy,” the goal of which is personal integrity, and “Everyone Says I Love You,” designed to highlight a new kind of friendship. The last two films, “Deconstructing Harry” and “Man of the Year,” are examples of satirical uses of deconstruction, demonstrating in particular how deconstructing ones self may serve an ethical purpose.

本书以解构主义作为开篇，原因有二：1）后面章节中的所有理论家都使用解构主义作为策略；2）电影背景下的解构主义提供了一种将文学理论与生活、与我们日常生活中的问题联系起来的方法。在一次采访中，德里达被问及他对“解构主义”一词在日常用语中的广泛使用有何看法。他回答说，即使人们没有像他希望的那样理解它，这个词在日常用法中也一定有某种意义，对此他并不感到不高兴。本章将展示理论家对解构主义的使用与其在日常生活中的适用性之间的关系。

This book begins with deconstruction for two reasons: 1) all of the theorists in the succeeding chapters use deconstruction as a strategy; 2) deconstruction in the context of film provides a means of relating literary theory to life, to the issues and problems of our everyday existence. In an interview, Derrida was asked what he thought of the term deconstruction being bandied about in common parlance. He replied that, even if people did not understand it as he would wish, the term must have some meaning in common usage and about that he was not unhappy. This chapter will show how the use of deconstruction by theorists is related to its applicability to daily life.

由布拉德·皮特和克里斯托弗·瓦尔兹主演的《无耻混蛋》（2009）生动地诠释了解构主义。事实上，这部电影的核心情节展示了一位电影制作人和一位电影院老板如何解构纳粹主义。故事涉及希特勒和他的工作人员参加一部关于一名德国狙击手单枪匹马杀死近 300 名盟军士兵的电影的首映式。因此这部电影被命名为《国家的骄傲》。在观影过程中，一名年轻女子纵火焚烧了电影院，她的家人被纳粹杀害。使用的燃料是易燃的旧胶片。在被活活烧死的同时，希特勒和他的高级军官们观看了电影院老板制作的一部电影，告诉她的受害者，他们正死于一名犹太人之手，而这名犹太人在电影院燃烧时大笑。这部纳粹电影是希特勒的心血之作之一：他希望用自己的游戏打败犹太裔好莱坞大亨大卫·塞尔兹尼克。塔伦蒂诺扭转了希特勒的局面。我们看到元首和他的将军们如此迷恋德国狙击手的英勇事迹——想必我们在塔伦蒂诺的电影中也是如此——以至于他们没有意识到电影院里正在展开的杀死他们的阴谋。

“Inglourious Basterds” (2009), starring Brad Pitt and Christoph Waltz, provides a vivid illustration of deconstruction. In fact, the central plot of this film demonstrates how a movie-maker and a cinema owner deconstruct Nazism. The story involves Hitler and his staff attending the premiere of a film about a German sniper who single-handedly killed nearly 300 Allied soldiers. Hence the film is entitled “Nation’s Pride.” During the viewing, the cinema is set on fire by a young woman whose family has been murdered by the Nazis. The fuel used is highly flammable old films. While burning alive, Hitler and his senior officers are shown a film made by the cinema owner informing her victims that they are dying at the hands of a Jew, who laughs as the cinema burns. The Nazi movie is one of Hitler’s pet projects: he wishes to defeat David Selznick, the Jewish Hollywood mogul, at his own game. Tarantino turns the tables on Hitler. We see the Führer and his generals so enamored with the heroic exploits of the German sniper—as presumably we are by Tarantino’s film—that they are unaware of the plot to kill them unfolding around them in the cinema.

去中心化和克里斯托弗·瓦尔兹

Decentering and Christoph Waltz

塔伦蒂诺所描述的过程是解构主义的基础，德里达称之为“去中心化”。对于希特勒和他的工作人员来说，纳粹宣传电影《民族的骄傲》是说服德国军队能够赢得战争的核心计划。对于盟军来说，放映这部电影提供了一种摧毁第三帝国的手段，而纳粹在沾沾自喜的时刻（除了一名军官，他决定不泄露秘密）措手不及。德里达解释道：“在中心，元素的排列或变换[…]是被禁止的。[…]因此，人们一直认为，中心在定义上是独一无二的，它构成了结构中的东西，它在控制结构的同时，也摆脱了结构性[…]。中心不是中心”（《结构》，第 84 页）。德国最高统帅部无法理解《民族的骄傲》怎么会成为摧毁德国军队指挥结构计划的核心。电影院是去中心化的另一个例子，它被德国人设想为避难所，并因此而变得安全，但盟军却把这个安全的避难所变成了坟墓，一个阻止逃生的火灾陷阱。塔伦蒂诺使用风格化的暴力，这是他大多数电影的标志，这一点在这里表现得非常明显。由于肤色问题，纳粹阻止“黑人”放映员放映电影，于是他把一支香烟扔进一堆电影胶片里，点燃了火，而阳台上的“无耻混蛋”则用机枪射杀了德国军官。这场大屠杀凸显了这一场景的超现实、奇幻性质：重点不在于这可能发生，而在于想象的可能性是基于将中心从希特勒及其随从转移到电影院老板、放映员和“混蛋”。将纳粹政权转向自身，与其说是一种历史可能性，不如说是一种富有想象力的飞跃，涉及对传统假设的激烈质疑——在这种情况下，纳粹可以控制历史记录。因为解构的目标与其说是颠覆体制或改变事物的状态，不如说是将公认的前提付诸实践，动摇我们的思维方式。

The process being portrayed by Tarantino is basic to deconstruction, what Derrida calls “decentering.” For Hitler and his staff, “Nation’s Pride,” the Nazi propaganda movie, is the heart of a project to convince the German army that they can win the war. For the Allies the film screening provides a means of destroying the Third Reich which, in a moment of self-congratulation (with the exception of one officer, who decides not to give the game away), is caught off guard. Derrida explains as follows: “At the center the permutation or transformation of elements […] is forbidden. […] Thus it has always been thought that the center, which is by definition unique, constituted that very thing within a structure which while governing a structure, escapes structurality […]. The center is not the center” (Structure, 84). The German high command is unable to comprehend how “Nation’s Pride” can be the center of a plan to destroy the command structure of the German army. The movie-house is another example of decentering in that it was conceived by the Germans as a refuge and made secure as such, but the Allies convert the secure refuge into a tomb, a fire trap that prevents escape. Tarantino’s use of stylized violence, a hallmark of most of his films, is very much in evidence here. Prevented by the Nazis from doing his job because of his skin color, the “Negro” projectionist flips a cigarette into the pile of film reels, igniting the fire, while the “inglorious basterds” in the balcony machine-gun down the German officers. The carnage points up the surreal, fantasy-like quality of the scene: the point being not that this could have happened but that the imagined possibility is based upon changing the center from Hitler and his retinue to the cinema owner, the projectionist, and the “basterds.” Turning Nazi power upon itself is not so much a historical possibility as an imaginative leap involving a violent questioning of customary assumptions—in this instance, that the Nazis can control the historical record. For the goal of deconstruction is not so much to subvert the establishment or change the state of things as to put accepted premises into play, to shake up our way of thinking.

唯一一个具有这种思维、了解敌人计划如何利用电影院的德国军官是纳粹党卫军军官汉斯·兰德，他是唯一一个预见并揭露盟军阴谋的德国人。他分散注意力的能力在电影的开场一幕中就体现出来了。他被称为“犹太猎人”，来到一座法国农舍寻找一个犹太家庭。当兰德（由克里斯托弗·瓦尔兹出色地扮演）在农舍采访法国人时，观众看到的是德雷福斯一家躲在地板下。兰德的言行体现了解构主义。首先，他解释了他对“犹太猎人”绰号的骄傲，他解释说，这一成就源于他不像德国人那样思考，而是像犹太人那样思考。他接着说，德国人的行为像鹰，因此认为犹太人会藏在鹰会选择的地方。另一方面，犹太人的行为像老鼠，因此在鹰不会想到他们的地方寻求庇护。他接着指出，将犹太人描述为老鼠并不比称他为“犹太猎人”更令人反感。两者都只是在适应自己的处境：兰德在做他的工作，而犹太人则在为生存而挣扎。

The one German officer capable of such thinking, who understands how the enemy plans to use the cinema, is the Nazi SS officer, Hans Lander, the only German to anticipate and uncover the Allied plot. His ability at decentering is seen in the opening scene of the film. Known as the “Jew Hunter,” he comes to a French farmhouse in search of a Jewish family. While Lander, brilliantly portrayed by Christoph Waltz, is interviewing the Frenchman in the farmhouse, the audience is shown the Dreyfus family hiding beneath the floorboards. Lander’s speech and action illustrate deconstruction. First he explains his pride in his moniker, the “Jew Hunter,” an achievement, he explains, that derives from thinking not like a German, but like a Jew. Germans, he continues, act like hawks and therefore expect Jews to hide in places a hawk might choose. Jews, on the other hand, behave like rats and therefore seek refuge in places where hawks would not expect them to be. He goes on to point out that it is no more offensive to characterize Jews as rats than to call him the “Jew Hunter.” Both are merely adapting to their situation: Lander is doing his job and Jews are struggling to survive.

兰德表明自己是一只能够从老鼠的角度看问题的鹰派，他明确表示他知道法国人窝藏了一个犹太家庭，但如果他合作，他自己的家庭将免遭杀害。请注意，兰德在这里转移了法国农民的注意力，将他的关注点从德雷福斯家族转移到了自己的家庭。此外，正如我们将看到的，语言在这一场景中至关重要。兰德是一位熟练的语言学家，他开始用法语与法国人交谈，然后改用英语，法国人听得懂，但犹太家庭听不懂。兰德用英语与法国人达成协议后，又改用法语，告诉犹太家庭调查已经结束。离开时，他用德语命令手下用机枪射杀地板下毫无戒心的家庭。正如我们将看到的，语言和对词语的操纵是解构的关键要素。

Having established that he is a hawk able to adopt the perspective of a rat, Lander makes clear that he knows the Frenchman is harboring a Jewish family on his property, but that if he cooperates his own family will be spared. Note that here Lander decenters the French farmer’s focus, moving his concern from the Dreyfus family to his own family. Also, as we shall see, language is crucial in this scene. Lander, an adept linguist, begins the conversation with the Frenchman in French, then changes to English, understood by the Frenchman but not by the Jewish family. Having made his pact with the Frenchman in English, Lander reverts to French, stating, for the Jewish family to hear, that the investigation is over. Upon leaving, he orders his men in German to machine-gun the unsuspecting family beneath the floor. As we shall see, language and the manipulation of words is a key element of deconstruction.

在这里我们注意到，去中心化是解构主义的一个基本原则。任何立场，无论是物质的还是智力的，都包含着解构主义本身就是毁灭的手段：德里达经常使用“接缝”一词来暗示任何人类构造的脆弱性。在《无耻混蛋》的这个场景中，这个过程变得更加复杂，因为犹太人用老鼠的中心取代了德国鹰的中心，而兰德预见到了这种解构形式，发现了犹太人的藏身之处。这一幕清楚地表明，去中心化并不能免受解构的影响，也不能免于被解构。这一点是《无耻混蛋》主线情节的关键，正如我们已经提到的，希特勒试图使大卫·塞尔兹尼克去中心化，而塔伦蒂诺本身也去中心化了。因此，在我看来，解构不是一种理论，而是一种服务于理论的策略：任何通过解构得出的立场本身都容易被解构，因此任何道德举措都超出了解构的范畴。我将论证本章中用来阐释解构主义的电影最终超越了解构主义，并且后续章节中使用解构主义的理论家们最终也进入了不同的层次。

Here we note that decentering is a basic principle of deconstruction. Any position, whether physical or intellectual, contains within itself the means of its own undoing: Derrida often uses the term “seams” to suggest the vulnerability of any human construct. In this scene from “Inglorious Basterds” the process is compounded, for the Jews have replaced the center of the German hawk with that of the rat, and Lander, anticipating this form of deconstruction, has discovered the hiding place of the Jews. This episode makes clear that the decentered is not immune to deconstruction, to being itself decentered. This point is key to the main plot of “Inglourious Basterds” where, as we have already suggested, Hitler’s attempt to decenter David Selznick is itself decentered by Tarantino. For this reason deconstruction is, in my view, not a theory but a strategy that serves theory: any position arrived at by way of deconstruction is itself susceptible to being deconstructed, so any ethical move goes beyond the realm of deconstruction. I shall demonstrate that the movies used in this chapter to illustrate deconstruction in the end go beyond it, and that the theorists in subsequent chapters who use deconstruction also conclude by moving to a different level.

起源神话和“无耻混蛋”

Originary myths and “Inglourious Basterds”

就我们的目的而言，解构主义产生了两个重要思想。一个是去中心化，如上例所示，另一个是起源神话。两者是相关的，因为中心意味着一个故事或一个解释其中心性的叙述，以及一个涉及开端或起源的叙述。德里达创造了解构主义一词，表示一个既不是破坏性也不是建设性的过程，而是一种摇摆不定的技术，或者用德里达的话来说，在两者之间“玩耍”，目的是质疑或“去中心化”公认的二分法，并揭示起源解释的神话元素。这种分析的目标是揭示德里达所说的控制形式。例如，兰德向农民指出，我们对老鼠和鹰的厌恶是不合理的，没有经验证据，因此我们准备好兰德最终改变他的态度，认识到一些犹太人的鹰派品质。

For our purposes, two important ideas emerge from deconstruction. One is decentering, illustrated in the above example, and the other is that of the originary myth. The two are related in that the center implies a story or an account explaining its centrality and a narrative involving a beginning or an origin. Derrida coins the term deconstruction to suggest a process neither destructive nor reconstructive, but a technique that oscillates or, to use Derrida’s term, “plays” between the two for the purpose of questioning or “decentering” accepted dichotomies and exposing the mythic elements of explanations of origins. The goal of this analysis involves uncovering what Derrida calls forms of mastery. For instance, Lander points out to the farmer that our abhorrence of rats versus hawks is irrational, without empirical evidence, and thus we are prepared for Lander to alter his attitude at the end, recognizing the hawk-like quality of some Jews.

德里达在其早期著名著作之一《人文科学话语中的结构、符号和游戏》中讨论了这个问题，他解构了著名人类学家克劳德·列维-斯特劳斯的分析，后者对文化神话的看法基于“生与熟”之间的区别，这是自然/养育二分法的变体，即遗传或本能的品质与习得的行为。德里达表明，列维-斯特劳斯对生与熟区别的解释实际上表明，这两者从未完全分离。因此，德里达非常重视列维-斯特劳斯的言论，即没有一个社会没有乱伦禁忌，这一言论引发了关于生与熟区别的问题。和熟的，因为无法确定乱伦禁忌是天性的结果还是教养的结果。作为一个常数，乱伦禁忌可能完全是教养的作用，每种文化都遵循前一种文化，或者是自然的结果，是人类基因库中固有的元素。德里达的观点是，列维-斯特劳斯的生熟二元论不是一种经验现象，不是一种自然现象，而是一种为解释自然而设计的模式。

Addressing this issue in one of his early well-known works, “Structure, Sign and Play in the Discourse of the Human Sciences,” Derrida deconstructs the analysis of the famous anthropologist, Claude Lévi-Strauss, whose view of cultural myths is based upon the distinction between “raw and cooked,” a variation on the nature/nurture dichotomy, that is, inherited or instinctive qualities versus learned behavior. Derrida demonstrates that Lévi-Strauss’s account of the distinction between raw and cooked actually shows that the two are never completely divorced from one another. Hence, Derrida makes much of Lévi-Strauss’s remark that there is no society without the incest taboo, a statement that leads to questions about the distinction between raw and cooked, since it cannot be determined whether the incest taboo is a result of nature or nurture. As a constant, the incest taboo may be solely a function of nurture, each culture following the one before it, or the result of nature, an element inherent in the human gene pool. Derrida’s point is that Lévi-Strauss’s raw–cooked dualism is not an empirical phenomenon, a natural occurrence, but a pattern devised for the purpose of interpreting nature.

德里达所说的模式或模型，是塔伦蒂诺以章节标题和卷号的形式，展示了他作为诠释者的签名，这是本章讨论的两部电影中都使用的一种手法，用印刷语言打断生动、暴力的画面。就像戴眼镜的图书管理员误入电影布景一样，屏幕上插入的印刷文字提醒观众，尽管这些电影看起来混乱无序，但其创作目的是有艺术目的的。因此，我们被鼓励去解读、去阅读我们面前的视觉事件，无论它意味着什么。虽然我们可能倾向于相信一部动作快、对话简短的电影主要是即兴创作的，但书面文字让我们质疑这种假设。口语和书面语言的并置让人想起德里达对这种二分法的分析。

What Derrida means by pattern or model is provided by Tarantino’s presentation of his signature as interpreter in the form of chapter titles and volume numbers, a device used in both of his movies discussed in this chapter, to interrupt vivid, violent images with printed language. Like a bespectacled librarian wandering misguidedly onto a movie set, these insertions of printed words on the screen serve to remind the audience that, despite the appearance of mayhem and chaos, these films are written with an artistic purpose. We are thus encouraged to interpret, to read, in every sense of the term, the visual events before us. Although we may be tempted to believe that a film with fast-paced action and clipped dialogue is largely improvised, the written word leads us to question that assumption. And the juxtaposition of oral and written language is reminiscent of Derrida’s analysis of this dichotomy.

德里达另一部有影响力的著作《论文字学》发表于 20 世纪 70 年代，内容涉及假设，探讨了“原始神话”的概念，即未经审查的关于起源的信念或记述，它们被视为事实或无可争议，但根据德里达的说法，它们需要解释。他的主要例子是言语先于书写的信念。从圣经中关于宇宙创造的记载中，我们理所当然地认为上帝说了“要有光”，而不是写下来。但德里达指出，用来证明早期文化原始口语性的文献，无论是古代史诗还是圣经文本，如圣经或古兰经，都是书面作品，都提到了书写，因此我们缺乏言语先于书写的确凿证据。德里达的观点并不是书写先于言语。这本身就是另一种绝对的二分法，或者德里达所说的“二元论”，需要解构。相反，他希望将演讲和写作二分法付诸实践，并质疑两者的相互排斥性。为什么？因为德里达断言，为了获得权力，所有人类构造都偏向于一种起源。哲学思想从来都不是中立的，而是涉及德里达所说的“特权”某些元素优于其他元素。所有人类构造都涉及权力等级制度，而这些权力等级制度在很大程度上有利于当权派。然而，对于德里达来说，将绝对的——公认的二元论和起源神话——付诸实践并不一定意味着逆转或革命，因为替代方案同样可以被解构。

Another influential work by Derrida, dating from the 1970s, about assumptions, Of Grammatology, considers the concept of “originary myths,” that is, unexamined beliefs about or accounts of beginnings which are taken as factual or beyond dispute but which, according to Derrida, involve interpretation. His prime example is the belief that speech precedes writing. We take for granted from the Biblical account of the creation of the universe that God said, rather than wrote, “let there be light.” But Derrida points out that the documents cited to demonstrate the original orality of early cultures, whether the ancient epics or scriptural texts, such as the Bible or the Koran, are written works and make reference to writing, so that we lack conclusive evidence that speech predated writing. Derrida’s point is not that writing preceded speech. That would itself be another absolute dichotomy, or what Derrida would call a “binarism” subject to deconstruction. Rather, he wishes to put into play the speech–writing dichotomy and question the mutual exclusivity of either. Why? Because Derrida asserts that all human constructs favor one origin over another for purposes of power. Philosophical ideas are never neutral but involve what Derrida calls the “privileging” of some elements over others. All human constructs involve hierarchies of power that for the most part favor the establishment. However, putting the absolutes—the accepted binarisms and originary myths—into play does not necessarily for Derrida involve reversal or revolution, because the alternative is equally subject to deconstruction.

在《论文字学》中，德里达重新审视了结构主义（法国形式主义）的主要思想家费迪南德索绪尔的假设，即口语决定书面语言的结构：

In Of Grammatology Derrida re-examines the assumption of Ferdinand de Saussure, a key thinker for structuralism, the French version of formalism, that oral language determines the structure of written language:

此外，我们应该说它是模型而不是结构；这不是一个构建并完美运作的系统的问题，而是一个明确指导运作的理想的问题，而事实上，这种运作从来都不是完全语音的。[…]它不响应任何绝对和普遍本质的必要性（《 文字学》，39）。

One should, moreover, say model rather than structure; it is not a question of a system constructed and functioning perfectly, but of an ideal explicitly directing a functioning which in fact is never completely phonetic. […] it does not respond to any necessity of an absolute and universal essence (Of Grammatology, 39).

由于涉及解释性决策，而不是客观描述，德里达更喜欢使用“模型”而不是“结构”这个术语。其他模型也可以选择。对于德里达来说，语音学是索绪尔模型的基础，它不能支持语言学作为一门科学的任何主张。相反，基于语音学的语言学是一种有影响力的理论，它建立在一种重视口语而不是书面语的解释之上。“文字学”这个术语是索绪尔“符号学”的替代，索绪尔的语言学版本是一门重视口语而不是书面语的语言学科学。文字学适用于口语和书面语，因此其起源问题尚未解决。

Because an interpretive decision, not an objective description, is involved, Derrida prefers the term “model” to “structure.” Other models could have been selected. For Derrida, phonetics, the basis of Saussure’s model, cannot bolster any claim for linguistics as a science. Rather, linguistics based upon phonetics is an influential theory founded upon an interpretation privileging the oral over the written. The term “grammatology” is offered as an alternative to Saussure’s “semiology,” his version of linguistics as a science of linguistics that privileges the oral over the written. Grammatology applies to both speech and writing, leaving open the question of origin.

这种替代的好处不仅在于赋予书写理论所需的空间，以对抗以语词为中心的压制和对语言学的服从。它还将把符号学项目本身从语言学的统治中解放出来，尽管符号学的理论范围越来越广，但语言学仍然把符号学组织起来，仿佛语言学既是符号学的中心，又是符号学的目的。尽管符号学实际上比语言学更普遍、更全面，但它仍然被当作语言学的一个领域来规范。语言符号仍然是符号学的典范，它作为主符号和生成模型：模式（《文字学》，51）。

The advantage of this substitution will not only be to give to the theory of writing the scope needed to counter logocentric repression and the subordination to linguistics. It will liberate the semiological project itself from what, in spite of its greater theoretical extension, remained governed by linguistics, organized as if linguistics were at once its center and its telos. Even though semiology was in fact more general and comprehensive than linguistics, it continued to be regulated as if it were one of the areas of linguistics. The linguistic sign remained exemplary of semiology, it dominated it as the master-sign and as the generative model: the pattern (Of Grammatology, 51).

德里达并没有颠倒等级制度，宣扬书面语言学是一门新科学。相反，他断言，关于哪一个优先的决定不能是理所当然的，而应该基于合理的论证或解释。《无耻混蛋》这个标题既说明了语言的趣味性，也说明了德里达感兴趣的那种二元论。《无耻混蛋》与汉斯·兰德截然相反。兰德精通四种语言，是一位受过良好教育、老练而温文尔雅的欧洲人；《混蛋》是无所畏惧、直率的美国犹太人，但他们的首领是中尉奥尔多·雷恩，他是一个不留活口的坚强的乡下男孩。《混蛋》的任务是用棒球棒打死纳粹分子，然后剥去他们的头皮。塔伦蒂诺不断利用欧洲人的细腻和美国人的直率之间的对比。影片最令人难忘的片段之一是阿尔多·雷恩和他的两个同伙假装是意大利人，兰德用流利的意大利语滔滔不绝地向他们讲话，揭穿了他们的谎言。然而，塔伦蒂诺比德里达更进一步，他不满足于玩弄和打破这种欧洲-美国二分法的平衡。片名《无耻混蛋》表明塔伦蒂诺站在粗鲁的美国人一边，他们不仅打败了纳粹，还给他们打上了纳粹标志，这一道德举动将在本章后面讨论。片名中的拼写错误——这种错误更有可能与受教育程度较低的美国人有关——进一步证实了塔伦蒂诺站在奥尔多·雷恩及其团伙一边的观点。事实上，特伦蒂诺在戴夫·莱特曼秀上表示，片名的拼写错误是“他的拼写”，塔伦蒂诺明确表示他认为这部电影是他的杰作，奥尔多·雷恩在电影结尾汉斯·兰德额头上刻上纳粹标志时使用的正是这些词。

Again, Derrida is not reversing the hierarchy to herald a linguistics of the written as the new science. Instead, he asserts that decisions about which one takes precedence must not be taken for granted but be based upon sound argument or interpretation. The title “Inglourious Basterds” is illustrative both of the playfulness of language and of the sort of binarisms that interest Derrida. The “inglourious basterds” are the polar opposite of Hans Lander. Adept at four languages, Lander is a well educated, sophisticated, and urbane European; the “basterds” are fearless and forthright American Jews but for their leader First Lieutenant Aldo Raine, a tough country boy who takes no prisoners. The mission of the basterds is to beat to death with a baseball bat and scalp Nazis. Tarantino continually plays with this contrast between European finesse and American bluntness. One of the more memorable moments of the film is when Aldo Raine and two of his cohorts pretend to be Italian and Lander exposes the deception by speaking volubly to them in fluent Italian. Tarantino, however, goes beyond Derrida in not being content to toy with and upset the balance of this European–American dichotomy. The title, “Inglourious Basterds,” indicates that Tarantino sides with the uncouth Americans, who not only beat the Nazis but also brand them with a swastika, an ethical move to be considered later in this chapter. And the misspelling in the title—errors that would be more likely to be associated with the less well-educated Americans—reinforces the point that Tarantino sides with Aldo Raine and his gang. In fact, Terantino stated on the Dave Letterman show that the misspelling of the title was “his spelling,” and Tarantino has made clear that he regards this film as his masterpiece, the very words Aldo Raine uses at the end of the movie when a swastika is carved on the forehead of Hans Lander.

对于文学分析而言，解构主义在隐喻分析的背景下最为有用，德里达在这方面所写的最重要的文章是首次以英文发表在《新文学史》上的一篇题为《白色神话：哲学文本中的隐喻》的文章。德里达所说的隐喻的含义可以从他在文章开头提供的文学例子中清楚地看出。在阿纳托尔·法朗士的《伊壁鸠鲁花园》中，其中一个角色为形而上学家的语言提供了一个隐喻：

For purposes of literary analysis, deconstruction is most useful in the context of the analysis of metaphor, and the most important piece that Derrida has written in this regard is one first published in English in New Literary History, entitled “White Mythology: Metaphor in the Text of Philosophy.” What Derrida means by metaphor is clear from the literary example he offers early in his essay. In Anatole France’s The Garden of Epicurus, one of the characters offers a metaphor for the language of metaphysicians:

[形而上学家] 不应该用刀子和剪刀，而应该把奖章和硬币放在磨石上磨平，直到王冠上什么都看不见，[…] 无论是爱德华国王、威廉皇帝还是共和国 […] 都没有任何英语、德语或法语。[…] 通过磨刀者的活动，词语从物理概念转变为形而上学概念（“白色神话”，7-8）。

Instead of knives and scissors [metaphysicians] […] should put medals and coins to the grindstone to efface [them] until nothing is visible in their crown-pieces, […] neither King Edward, nor the Emperor William, nor the Republic […] having nothing either English, German, nor French. […] By this knife-grinder’s activity words are changed from a physical to a metaphysical acceptation (“White Mythology,” 7–8).

由于隐喻是文学的一个关键因素，有些人认为它是最重要的因素，德里达展示了解构主义如何应用于文学批评。隐喻在所有话语中的重要性在整篇文章中都得到了明确阐述：“与其说隐喻存在于文本中[...]，不如说这些文本存在于隐喻中”（《白色神话》，第 60 页）。这里的重点不是文学是一个巨大的隐喻，而是隐喻必然具有解释性，这是所有文学的特征。这意味着隐喻无法逃避或超越；没有任何单一的概括或压倒性的概念可以让哲学或任何其他学科掌握。用德里达的话来说，不可能有隐喻的隐喻。为什么呢？因为一旦建立了隐喻的隐喻，它就会受到解构的影响。

Since metaphor is a key factor in literature, some think the most important one of all, Derrida shows how deconstruction applies to literary criticism. The overall importance of metaphor in all discourse is made quite clear throughout the essay: “it is not so much that metaphor is in the text […] rather these texts are in metaphor” (“White Mythology,” 60). The point here is not that literature is one huge metaphor, but that the necessarily interpretive nature of metaphor is characteristic of all literature. The implication is that metaphor cannot be escaped or transcended; no single generalization or overriding conception can be found that permits mastery by philosophy or any other discipline. In Derrida’s terms there can be no metaphor of metaphors. Why not? Because the moment one establishes a metaphor of metaphors, it is subject to deconstruction.

这种说法的目的是强调解释的功能，强调关于起源的决定的基础和二分法中一方的特权，因为文学比喻通常被视为不是直截了当的，而是需要阅读或解释。例如，最著名的隐喻之一是但丁的多叶玫瑰，传统上被视为爱情的形象。玫瑰的刺通常被视为求爱和浪漫的考验和磨难。但德里达认为隐喻“总是包含着自己的死亡”（《白色神话》，74），这为多叶玫瑰可能被视为反爱或冷漠的象征提供了可能性，就像受伤拇指上的刺一样冷漠。同样，重点不是要颠覆传统的爱情假设，而是要指出，这只是基于未经审查的解释的假设。为了避免我们倾向于将多叶玫瑰视为隐喻的隐喻，我们只需想象一位技艺高超的诗人使用蔓生玫瑰（单层花）来代表但丁用多叶玫瑰呈现的一切。隐喻永远不能被封装或包含在某个更大的概念中，这一观念是文学、文学批评和文学理论的核心。任何试图将隐喻比喻成隐喻的行为都会成为另一个可以被解构的隐喻，也就是说，艺术家可以利用它来颠覆哲学上对主宰或整体的尝试。想象一下，有人在进行这项分析时，画了一幅单叶玫瑰和多叶玫瑰相互缠绕的图画，以致于无法茁壮成长——这是对这种隐喻描述的隐喻。

The purpose of this assertion is to emphasize the function of interpretation, to highlight the basis for decisions about origins and the privileging of one side of a dichotomy, since a literary trope is usually seen as not straightforward but calling for a reading or interpretation. For example, one of the most famous metaphors is Dante’s multifoliate rose, traditionally seen as an image of love. The thorns of the rose are usually viewed as the trials and tribulations of courtship and romance. But Derrida suggests that metaphor “always has its own death within it” (“White Mythology,” 74), providing for the possibility that the multifoliate rose could be seen as a symbol of anti-love or indifference, as disinterested as the thorn is in the wounded thumb. Again, the point is not to reverse the traditional assumption about love but to point out that it is just that, an assumption based upon an unexamined interpretation. And lest we are tempted to think of the multifoliate rose as the metaphor of metaphors, one need only imagine a skillful poet using the rambler rose, the single-layered flower, to represent everything Dante presented with the multifoliate one. This notion that metaphor can never be encapsulated or contained within some larger concept is at the very heart of literature, literary criticism, and literary theory. Any attempt at a metaphor of metaphors becomes another metaphor subject to deconstruction, that is, it can be appropriated by an artist to subvert the philosophic attempt at mastery or totality. Imagine someone attending to this analysis drawing a picture of single and multifoliate roses so entwined as to prevent either from thriving—a metaphor of this description of metaphor.

死亡与“杀死比尔”

Death and “Kill Bill”

隐喻中固有的死亡、玫瑰的刺，是德里达的核心思考，包括但不限于文学批评：

The death inherent in metaphor, the thorns of the rose, is a central consideration for Derrida, including but going well beyond literary criticism:

这种死亡无疑也是哲学的死亡。但这种“死亡”可以从两个方面来理解。有时，哲学的死亡是一种特定的哲学形式的死亡，哲学本身在这种形式中得到反思和总结，哲学在达到其实现时与自身面对面。但有时，哲学的死亡是一种哲学的死亡，这种哲学看不到自己的死亡，也再也找不到自己了（“白色神话”，74）。

This death no doubt, is also the death of philosophy. But this “of” may be taken in two ways. Sometimes the death of philosophy is the death of a particular philosophical form in which philosophy itself is reflected on and summed up and in which philosophy, reaching its fulfillment, comes face to face with itself. But sometimes the death of philosophy is the death of a philosophy which does not see itself die, and never more finds itself (“White Mythology,” 74).

这里的死亡意味着历史意义上的变化，即相对于过去的变化和演变，意味着人类世界思想的不断展开，意味着一种或多种文明对其自身基本假设的质疑。

Death here means change in the historical sense of variation and evolution from the past, a human world of unfolding ideas, a civilization or civilizations questioning its own basic assumptions.

也许因为解构主义关注的是隐喻概念，而隐喻的核心是死亡，昆汀·塔伦蒂诺的电影尤其适合作为例证。我将首先研究《杀死比尔》第一卷和第二卷（2003-4），然后再回到《无耻混蛋》（2009）。由乌玛·瑟曼和大卫·卡拉丹主演的《杀死比尔》关注的是死亡与出生之间的关系，尤其是暗杀与怀孕之间的关系：开场是电影情节的关键，比娅告诉比尔，她怀了他的孩子，而比尔却开枪打死了她。事实上，所有主要情节剧中角色都是训练有素的杀手，他们对受害者几乎没有道德顾忌，除非是儿童。即使当团伙头目比尔杀死了或者认为他杀死了比亚的女儿，他也会救下并抚养她的女儿。如果说《杀死比尔》是暗杀的隐喻，那么比亚子宫内的孩子则使杀戮变得非中心化。在开场第二章之后的第一集中，比亚发现自己怀了比尔的孩子。比尔派她去杀死一名女人，而这名女人则派一名杀手去杀死比亚。当两名女杀手在酒店房间见面并拔出枪时，比亚让对手看一下妊娠测试结果。另一名杀手确信比亚说的话属实，于是同意离开，但不开枪。但这种母爱的柔软中心并不成立；它与死亡自由交织，尤其是在结尾处，比娅谋杀比尔，与其说是因为比尔企图谋杀她，不如说是因为比尔没有告诉她女儿还活着。第一卷的最后一行是比尔的问题：比娅知道她女儿的事吗？因此，塔伦蒂诺认为，做母亲和谋杀以一种奇怪的方式联系在一起，可以相互解构。一方面，比娅决定暗杀比尔，因为她谋杀了她未出生的孩子，或者至少在最后一章之前她都是这么认为的。另一方面，在下一集，也就是第三章中，比娅当着一个四岁女孩的面杀死了孩子的母亲，她是袭击婚礼派对的团伙中的一员。然而，尽管看起来做母亲和谋杀是自由交织的，处于一种动态平衡中，在不同时刻，其中一种占主导地位，但正如我们将看到的，塔伦蒂诺最终还是偏向了做母亲：比尔死于他违背了母性本能。

Perhaps because deconstruction focuses upon a concept of metaphor with death at its core, Quentin Tarantino’s movies are particularly apt illustrations. I shall first examine “Kill Bill” Volumes I and II (2003–4), and then return to “Inglourious Basterds” (2009). “Kill Bill,” starring Uma Thurman and David Carradine, focuses upon the relationship between death and birth, in particular between assassination and pregnancy: the opening scene, the key to the plot of the film, presents Bea telling Bill that she is pregnant with his child as he shoots her. In fact, all the main characters are trained killers who have few moral scruples about their victims except when these are children. Even when Bill, the leader of the group, kills or believes he has killed Bea he saves and nurtures her daughter. If “Kill Bill” is a metaphor of assassination, killing is decentered by Bea’s child in utero. In the first episode after the opening scene, Chapter Two, Bea discovers that she is pregnant with Bill’s child. She has been sent on an assignment by Bill to kill a woman who in turn sends an assassin to kill Bea. When the two female killers meet in a hotel room with guns drawn, Bea asks her counterpart to look at the pregnancy test. Convinced of the truth of Bea’s claim, the other assassin agrees to leave without firing her gun. But this soft center of motherly love does not hold; it is in free play with death, particularly near the end when Bea murders Bill not so much because of his attempt on her life as for not informing her of the survival of her daughter. The final line of Volume One is Bill’s question: does Bea know about her daughter? Tarantino thus suggests that mothering and murdering are somehow related in a strange way, capable of deconstructing one another. On the one hand, Bea decides to assassinate Bill for, or so she assumes until the final chapter, murdering her unborn child. On the other hand, in the very next episode, Chapter Three, Bea in the presence of a four-year-old girl kills the child’s mother, who was part of the group that attacked the wedding party. However, although it may appear that mothering and murdering are in free play in a dynamic equilibrium where one or the other predominates at different moments, Tarantino, as we shall see, in the end weighs the balance in favor of mothering: Bill dies because he violated the maternal instinct.

对我来说，最令人吃惊的发现是，这部关于杀手的暴力电影在母亲和孩子之间达成了和解。但在第二次观看《杀死比尔》后，我对暴力的态度发生了变化。我的学生解释说，塔伦蒂诺的暴力是风格化的，但第一次观看时，我感觉受到了侵犯。在第二次和第三次观看这部电影后，我发现自己开始嘲笑那些最初让我感到恐惧的场景。游戏性和游戏性是解构主义的标志。《杀死比尔》描绘的杀手将童年视为神圣不可侵犯，这一事实使整部电影成为一种幻想游戏，最明显的是剑斗，特别是当比娅单枪匹马击败整个“88 帮”时。但即使当比娅在受害者女儿面前杀死母亲时，她不仅放过了孩子，让孩子目睹了她的死罪，还告诉孩子，当她长大后，她有权为母亲的死报仇。影片的结果是一场蓄意谋杀和离奇喜剧。一名职业杀手为受害者生下了孩子。Bea 的养育本能与她亚马逊式的剑术相结合，使她成为影片的女主角；作为叙述者，她向我们展示并告诉我们她是如何征服比尔和他的团伙的，我们将会看到，这场胜利实际上是一把双刃剑。

The most startling discovery for me was that this violent film about assassins achieves resolution with mother and child. But then my attitude toward the violence changed after viewing “Kill Bill” a second time. My students had explained that the violence of Tarantino is stylized, but at my first viewing I felt assaulted. After watching the film for the second and third time, I found myself laughing at scenes that at first horrified me. Gamesomeness and play are hallmarks of deconstruction. The very fact that “Kill Bill” portrays killers who regard childhood as sacrosanct renders the entire film a sort of fantasy game, most obviously in the swordfights, particularly when Bea single-handedly defeats the entire “Gang of 88.” But even when Bea kills a mother in the presence of the victim’s daughter, she not only spares the child, a witness to her capital crime, but tells the youngster that when she grows up she will have the right to avenge her mother’s death. The result is a scene of premeditated murder and bizarre comedy. A professional assassin mothers the child of her victim. Bea’s nurturing instinct combined with her Amazonian swordsmanship serve to make her the heroine of the film; as the narrator she shows and tells us how she conquered Bill and his gang, a victory that is, as we shall see, literally a two-edged sword.

为了在比尔的游戏中打败他，她需要一把洪索剑和白眉的致命五指动作。在这里，我们面对了德里达的起源神话概念。为什么洪索和白眉帮助比亚杀死比尔？洪索为比尔打造了一把剑，这把剑在电影中我们见到比尔之前就出现了，这表明这是比尔性格的关键，而白眉训练了比尔，告诉他这项技术，但不是教给他，而是教给了比亚。我们没有得到这些问题的答案，只能假设这些剑术和徒手致命格斗大师认为比尔对比亚的所作所为是错误的。塔伦蒂诺的起源神话是一种道德原则：他把自己作为电影制作人和作家的技能投入到一个喜剧幻想中，讲述一个杀手/母亲如何利用她作为训练有素的杀手的能力和她作为儿童保护者的愤怒来报复比尔和他的团伙。但这里的复杂之处在于，Bea 的敌人是字面意义上的家人。Bill 不仅是她孩子的父亲，而且其余的人也是她的姑姑和叔叔。事实上，Bea 称 Bill 的兄弟为“巴德叔叔”。此外，我们在婚礼彩排时得知，她没有其他家人。这部电影如此清楚地体现了解构主义，因为另一个人，即敌人，与 Bea 本人有着密切的联系。

In order to beat Bill at his own game she needs a Honso sword and Pai Mei’s lethal five-finger maneuver. And here we confront Derrida’s concept of an originary myth. Why do Honso and Pai Mei help Bea kill Bill? Honso has made a sword for Bill that is shown early on in the film before we see Bill, suggesting that it is key to his personality, and Pai Mei has trained Bill, told him about the technique, but taught it not to him but to Bea. We are not given answers to these questions but can only assume that these masters of the sword and unarmed lethal combat believe that what Bill did to Bea was wrong. Tarantino’s myth of origin is an ethical principle: he devotes his skill as a film-maker and writer to a comic fantasy about how an assassin/mother can use her abilities as a trained killer and her rage as a child protector to get revenge against Bill and his gang. But the complication here is that Bea’s enemy is family in a literal and surrogate sense. Not only is Bill the father of her child but also the rest of the gang are surrogate aunts and uncles. Indeed, Bill’s brother is referred to by Bea as “Uncle Budd.” Moreover, she has, we are told at the wedding rehearsal, no other family. Deconstruction is so clearly illustrated in this film because the other, the enemy, is intimately bound up with Bea herself.

主角们组成了比尔称之为“天生杀手”的家庭。这句话适用于比尔亲自训练的杀手团伙，指的是塔伦蒂诺的同名剧本，1994 年奥利弗·斯通将其改编成同名的著名且备受争议的电影。《杀死比尔 2》中的家庭暴力性质在一开始就很明显，当时 Bea“又名妈妈”解释说，她要报复比尔，比尔是训练她杀人然后试图杀死她的杀手大师。但这当然是另一个起源神话，因为我们不禁想知道这种杀手本能从何而来，它的来源是什么。我们最接近这个问题的答案是在电影的最后一章，我们遇到了 Bea 和比尔的女儿 BB。BB 告诉她妈妈，当她看到她的金鱼在毯子上扑腾时，她决定踩死它，而不是把它放回水里。我们该如何理解这个故事？我们是否应该将这个孩子视为天生的杀手，还是这种童年的残忍对父母和学校老师来说太熟悉了？或者，既然比尔鼓励 BB 讲述这个故事，那么这是比尔的起源神话，他扭曲地试图为不告诉 Bea 关于 BB 的事情辩解，因为她也是天生的杀手？这些关于杀手起源的解释都不太充分，尤其是因为比尔和 Bea 是否拥有像 BB 那样的童年是值得怀疑的。德里达用伊曼纽尔·列维纳斯的公式来描述这种现象：“一个从未存在过、也永远不会存在的过去，它的未来永远不会以存在的形式产生或复制”（ 《论文学》，71）。Bea 和 Bill 除了电影中展示的过去之外没有其他过去，因为塔伦蒂诺希望他们除了帮派之外没有其他家庭。为什么？为了描绘家庭杀手的绝对异类，一个家族内部的冷血杀手。塔伦蒂诺对这一悖论的兴趣在第二卷中开始变得清晰起来。

The main characters comprise the family that Bill calls “Natural Born Killers.” This phrase applies to Bill’s gang of personally trained assassins and is a reference to Tarantino’s screenplay of that name revised in 1994 by Oliver Stone into the famous and controversial film using the same title. The family nature of violence in “Kill Bill 2” is made clear at the outset when Bea “aka Mommy” explains that she seeks revenge against Bill, the master killer who trained her to kill and then attempted to kill her. But that of course is another originary myth, for we are left to wonder where this killer instinct came from, what is its source. The closest we come to an answer to this question is in the last chapter of the film when we meet B.B., the daughter of Bea and Bill. B.B. tells her mother that when she saw her goldfish flopping on the carpet she decided to step on it instead of putting it back in the water. What are we to make of this story? Are we to see the child as a natural-born killer or is this sort of childhood cruelty all too familiar to parents and schoolteachers? Or, since Bill encourages B.B. to tell the story, is it Bill’s originary myth, his twisted attempt to justify not telling Bea about B.B. because she is another natural born killer? Any of these explanations of the origins of the assassins is hardly adequate, especially since it is doubtful that either Bill or Bea had a childhood like that of B.B. Derrida uses Emmanuel Levinas’s formulation to describe this phenomenon: “a past that never was and can never will be, whose future to come will never be a production or a reproduction in the form of presence” (Of Grammatology, 71). Bea and Bill have no past beyond that shown in the film because Tarantino wants them to have no family except that of the gang. Why? To portray the absolute otherness of the family killer, a cold-blooded assassin within the family. Tarantino’s interest in this paradox begins to become clear in Volume Two.

第二部分以也许是电影中最令人震惊的一幕开场，“巴德叔叔”活埋了比亚。他为什么选择这种残酷的死亡方式？巴德是《杀死比尔》第一卷结尾处枪杀婚礼派对的那群人之一，正如巴德后来对比尔所说，比亚应该得到报仇。所以他等着比亚来找他，用岩盐射中她的胸部以“让她平静下来”，然后活埋了她，解释说他这样做是为了报复他的兄弟比尔，当比亚选择结婚并离开帮派时，比尔感到被背叛了。活埋比亚是去中心化的一个生动例子。愤怒的比亚想要报复巴德听从比尔的命令；巴德把她关在棺材里，让她独自沉浸在自己腐蚀性的愤怒中。巴德不仅杀死了比亚，还让比亚亲自刺杀她，希望她用仇恨和毒液耗尽自己微薄的空气，从而在某种意义上因对复仇的痴迷而死。他甚至给她提供了一个手电筒，大概是为了让比亚能够亲眼目睹自己的死亡。但正如我们所料，任何形式的解构本身都会受到解构的影响，因此比亚的复仇欲望被引导到师父白眉教给她的武术中，白眉训练她用双手劈开木头。白眉也是另一种解构形式的来源，正如我们之前提到的，比尔死于比亚从白眉那里学到的一种技巧，而白眉是比尔介绍给比亚的。塔伦蒂诺将白眉训练比亚的情节单独列为一章，标题为“师父”，暗示比尔将比尔置于中心地位。此外，为了延续代理家庭的主题，在杀死比尔（Bea 的第一任主人）时，Bea 谋杀了她的主人/训练员，也是她的情人和她孩子的父亲。

This second part opens with perhaps the most shocking scene of the film when “Uncle Budd” buries Bea alive. Why does he choose this cruel form of death? Budd was one of the group at the end of “Kill Bill, Volume I” that gunned down the marriage party, and, as Budd later says to Bill, Bea deserves her revenge. So he waits for Bea to come after him, shoots her in the breast with rock salt to “settle her down,” then buries her alive, explaining that he is thus achieving revenge for his brother Bill, who felt betrayed when Bea chose to marry and leave the gang. Burying Bea alive is a vivid example of decentering. A seething mass of anger, Bea seeks revenge upon Budd for following the orders of Bill; Budd imprisons her in a casket, leaving her to stew in her own corrosive anger. Instead of merely killing her, Budd makes Bea her own assassin, expecting that she will exhaust her meager supply of air with hate and venom and so expire, in a sense, by way of her obsession with revenge. He even supplies her with a flashlight, presumably so that she can, so to speak, see her own death. But, as we would expect, any form of deconstruction is itself subject to deconstruction, so Bea’s drive for revenge is channeled into the martial arts taught her by the master, Pai Mei, who trained her to use her hands to break through wood. Pai Mei is also the source of another form of deconstruction in that, as we mentioned earlier, Bill dies by way of a technique Bea learned from Pai Mei, who was introduced to Bea by Bill. Tarantino gives the episode of Bea’s training by Pai Mei a separate chapter with the title “The Master,” suggesting the decentering of Bill by Bill. Moreover, to continue with the surrogate family motif, in killing Bill, Bea’s first master, Bea murders someone who is her master/trainer as well as her lover and the father of her child.

《杀死比尔 2》中风格化的暴力提醒我们，没有人比朋友和家人更能激起愤怒和攻击性，他们知道如何制造愤怒和仇恨，或者唤起欢笑和爱。电影中有很多可预测的反应的例子。也许最突出的是巴德叔叔的死。家人或帮派成员艾丽·德赖弗把买洪索剑的钱放在一个装满现金的手提箱里带给了巴德。她知道巴德对这笔钱如此着迷，以至于他无法抗拒打开箱子数钱并陶醉于他的新财富，让里面的黑曼巴蛇反复咬他的脸。令人惊讶的是，这个身体暴力的场景以一种野蛮而滑稽的方式体现在文学中；就像一个研究助理报告她的发现一样，艾丽·德赖弗向巴德读她关于黑曼巴蛇的笔记，痛苦地扭动着。在自由发挥的背景下，行动和思想、言语和写作相互污染。艾丽把焦点从金钱转移到巴德身上，决定不刺杀他，而是让他自杀，就像巴德对比亚做的那样。但她自己也受到了她释放的同样力量的影响巴德。Bea 最终通过挖出 Driver 的另一只眼睛打败了她——这是 Bea 从 Pai Mei 那里学到的另一项技巧，Pai Mei 挖出了 Driver 的眼睛，因为 Driver 对待 Bea 的方式同样傲慢无礼。最后，Elle 已经失明，被留在拖车房里与黑曼巴蛇在一起，她很可能会以她为巴德设计的死亡方式死去。

The stylized violence of “Kill Bill, Volume 2” functions to remind us that no one is better able to provoke anger and aggression than friends and family members who know how to produce rage and hatred or to evoke laughter and love. There are numerous examples in the movie of predictable reactions. Perhaps the most prominent is the death of Uncle Budd. Elle Driver, a family or gang member, brings Budd the money for the Honso sword in a suitcase full of cash. She knows that Budd is so enamored with the money that he will be unable to resist opening the case to count it and revel in his new wealth, allowing the black mamba inside to bite him repeatedly in the face. Surprisingly, this physically violent scene is literary in a savagely comical way; like a research assistant reporting her findings Elle Driver reads her notes about the black mamba to Budd, writhing in anguish. Action and thought, speech and writing contaminate one another in a context of free play. Moving the center from money to Budd, Elle decides, instead of assassinating him, to let him do himself in, much as Budd did with Bea. But she is herself subject to the same force she unleashes on Budd. Bea finally defeats Driver by plucking out her other eye—another technique that Bea learned from Pai Mei who had put out Driver’s eye for the same kind of arrogant disrespect that Driver displayed toward Bea. Finally, now blind and left in the trailer home with the black mamba, Elle is likely to die by way of the very means of death she devised for Budd.

在《杀死比尔2》的结尾，我们看到了这个家庭逐渐解体。比亚杀死了比尔，以保护女儿免受父亲的伤害。但最终权力不仅仅是被颠覆了。比亚并没有取代比尔成为天生杀手的头目。她躺在浴室的地板上，抱着一只泰迪熊，一边哭一边笑，她失去了爱人、丈夫和孩子的父亲，战胜了她最强大的敌人。但她的未来却不确定。她会满足于做女儿的母亲吗？女儿可能表现出杀手本能的不祥迹象？比亚能领导一支新的杀手团伙，同时抚养孩子吗？权力解体后，与其说是改变了，不如说是被质疑了，被从根基上动摇了。一个女人取代了男人​​，但她还承担着抚养孩子的责任。

At the end of “Kill Bill 2” we see the gradual deconstruction of the family. Bea has killed Bill to protect her daughter from her father. But in the end power is not merely reversed. Bea does not take Bill’s place as head of the natural born killers. She lies on the bathroom floor cuddling a teddy bear, laughing and crying at the same time, having lost a lover, husband and father to her child, and having overcome her most powerful enemy. But her future is uncertain. Will she be content to be a mother to her daughter who perhaps shows ominous signs of the killer instinct? Will Bea be able to lead a new gang of assassins and also raise a child? Power when deconstructed is not so much altered as thrown into question, shaken from its moorings. A woman has replaced a man, but she has the added responsibility of a child.

尽管如此，在我看来，《杀死比尔 2》的结局暗示了一种超越解构主义的举措。在影片的结尾，比娅接受了作为母亲的责任，在这方面，与其他帮派成员不同，她的复仇动机不仅仅是个人的。作为影片的叙述者和“女主角”，比娅身上有一种洪索和白梅所尊重的个人正直，而这是影片中其他任何人都无法拥有的。为什么重视母性在《杀死比尔》中并没有明确说明。塔伦蒂诺在他的下一部影片《无耻混蛋》中阐明了他的道德立场。事实上，本章中其他影片中形成的道德立场将成为中心关注点：超越德里达，这些影片因此暗示了解构主义在我们生活中的作用。

Nevertheless, the conclusion of “Kill Bill, Vol. 2” seems to me to suggest a move beyond deconstruction. At the end of the film, Bea has accepted her responsibility as a mother, and in this respect her motive for revenge is, unlike that of the other gang members, not merely personal. As the narrator and “heroine” of the film, Bea has an element of personal integrity respected by Honso and Pai Mei that cannot be attributed to anyone else in the film. Why motherhood is valued is not made clear in “Kill Bill.” Tarantino clarifies his ethical position in his next film, “Inglourious Basterds.” In fact, the ethical positions developed in the other films in this chapter will become a central concern: moving beyond Derrida, these films thus suggest the function of deconstruction in our lives.

走向道德终结的解构：《黑暗骑士》

Deconstruction toward an ethical end: “The Dark Knight”

现在应该清楚了，本章关于解构主义的关键思想——我的中心——结合了去中心化和揭露起源神话。电影制作人揭示了任何人类构造的“缝隙”或弱点，然后可以超越德里达，改变中心思想或核心思想，得出与原意相反的结论。这种特殊的解构用法使一些电影制作人能够将解构主义与我们的日常生活联系起来。克里斯托弗·诺兰的《黑暗骑士》（2008）是政治权力背景下的一个很好的电影例证，克里斯蒂安·贝尔饰演蝙蝠侠，希斯·莱杰饰演“小丑”。在这部《蝙蝠侠：侠影之谜》的续集中，“小丑”是众多对蝙蝠侠着迷的人之一。但与其他试图模仿蝙蝠侠的人不同，“小丑”解构了他，这一点在电影的开场就明确了。在领导银行抢劫案时，“小丑”杀死了所有同伙，因此他像蝙蝠侠一样将哥谭市的坏人赶走，但不是为了城市的利益。相反，他展示了自己顽皮的本领——他射杀同伙就像一个挥舞玩具枪的孩子一样——并排除了被任何帮派成员告发的可能性。虽然蝙蝠侠可以通过预测其他模仿者的行为来轻易揭穿他们的面具，但“小丑”提出了更大的挑战，因为他既不想取代蝙蝠侠，也不想按照自己的形象重塑蝙蝠侠。事实上，“小丑”在与蝙蝠侠的对峙中解释说，他杀死蝙蝠侠并不是因为他需要他，而是为了二元关系的“自由发挥”，正如我们所见，这是解构的一个关键思想。

By now it should be clear that the key idea in this chapter on deconstruction—my center—combines decentering and the exposure of myths of origin. Film-makers uncover the “seams” or vulnerabilities of any human construct that can then be used, going beyond Derrida, to alter the central or core idea, leading to a conclusion opposite to that of the original intent. This particular use of deconstruction enables some movie-makers to relate deconstruction to our daily lives. A good cinematic illustration in the context of political power is Christopher Nolan’s “The Dark Knight” (2008), starring Christian Bale as Batman and Heath Ledger as the “Joker.” In this sequel to “Batman Begins,” the “Joker” is one of many fascinated with Batman. But unlike the others who try to imitate Batman, the “Joker” deconstructs him, a point made clear in the opening scene of the film. Leading a bank robbery, the “Joker” kills all of his accomplices, so that like Batman he is ridding Gotham City of the bad guys, but not for the good of the city. Rather he is demonstrating his own playful prowess—his shooting of his accomplices is not unlike that of a child wielding a toy gun—and precluding the possibility of being turned in by any member of the gang. Although Batman can easily unmask his other imitators by anticipating their actions, the “Joker” presents a greater challenge, for he neither wishes to displace Batman nor to reconstruct him in his own image. In fact, the “Joker” explains in a confrontation with Batman that he does not kill him because he needs him, for the “free play” of a binary relationship, which is, as we have seen, a key idea for deconstruction.

但《黑暗骑士》尤其有趣，因为它以权力等级的逆转收尾。蝙蝠侠培养了哈维·丹特，让他接管哥谭市的犯罪控制工作。但当“小丑”安排抓捕丹特的情人、助理检察官雷切尔·道斯时，丹特却背叛了蝙蝠侠和执法人员，因为“小丑”透露，如果雷切尔没有被腐败的警察部队背叛，她本可以得救。最后，蝙蝠侠阻止了丹特杀死警察局长的家人。然而，蝙蝠侠和警察局长认识到，蝙蝠侠必须为丹特的所有罪行负责，这样哥谭市的人民才不会失去希望。“小丑”就这样解构了蝙蝠侠白天的形象——布鲁斯·韦恩，他一开始是社会的顶层人物，一个成功而有影响力的商人。韦恩现在成了被抛弃的人，成了黑暗骑士。

But “The Dark Knight” is particularly interesting because it concludes with a reversal of the power hierarchy. Batman grooms Harvey Dent, the DA, to take over the job of controlling crime in Gotham City. But when the “Joker” arranges for the capture of Dent’s lover, Rachel Dawes, the assistant DA, Dent turns on Batman and the law enforcers because the “Joker” reveals that Rachel could have been saved if she had not been betrayed by a corrupt police force. In the end, Batman prevents Dent from killing the family of the police commissioner. However, Batman and the commissioner recognize that Batman will have to take responsibility for all of Dent’s crimes so that the people of Gotham City will not lose hope. The “Joker” has thus deconstructed Batman’s daytime persona, Bruce Wayne, who at the beginning was at the top of society, a successful and influential businessman. Wayne is now the outcast, the dark knight.

“小丑”通过坚持要求蝙蝠侠摘下面具，揭露他的出身，实现了这一壮举。然而，即使“小丑”要求的代价是放逐到黑暗中，失去白天的地位，成为黑夜的居民，蝙蝠侠也拒绝露出真面目。为什么？蝙蝠侠不能让自己被看成是权势集团的一员、富商和花花公子单身汉。他会在哥谭市失去信誉，他为拯救社会及其个人而做出的所有利他行为都可以看作是最终自私地保护蝙蝠侠是世界的最高人物之一。当然，这种权力等级的颠倒本身也容易被解构：我们确信蝙蝠侠将利用他新的边缘地位做他一直在做的事情，用黑色面具保护哥谭市的人民。从这个意义上来说，“小丑”这个解构者并没有占上风，所以蝙蝠侠可以继续他的出色工作，尽管他因为“小丑”而必须保持低调。

The “Joker” achieves this feat by insisting that Batman unmask himself, reveal his origin. Batman, however, refuses to show his true face even if the price exacted by the “Joker” is exile to darkness, loss of daytime status, becoming a denizen of the night. Why? Batman cannot allow himself to be seen for what he is, a member of the establishment, a wealthy businessman and playboy-bachelor. He would lose credibility in Gotham City, and all of his acts of altruism to save his society and its individuals could be seen as the ultimately self-serving preservation of the world in which Batman is one of the top men. Of course, this inversion of the power hierarchy is itself subject to deconstruction: we are assured that Batman will exploit his new marginalized position to do what he has always done, to use the black mask to protect the people of Gotham City. In this sense, the “Joker,” the deconstructor, does not prevail, so Batman can carry on with his good work even if he must, because of the “Joker,” maintain a lower profile.

但这部电影的名字是《黑暗骑士》，而不是《蝙蝠侠 2》，因为“小丑”彻底改变了蝙蝠侠的风格；他不得不结束白天的生活。布鲁斯·韦恩退出了荧幕。我想知道这种变化是否代表了当今社会的深刻怀疑，相信任何形式的正派、任何利他行为都可能被解构，可能会变成表面上的对立面。也许这就是为什么“小丑”也戴着他的面具，好像解构主义威胁着要向我们展示善与恶都是太普通的东西，它们存在于我们之中，蝙蝠侠担心的知识会导致普遍的绝望。然而，蝙蝠侠在边缘的新存在表明他现在将成为一名专业的解构主义者。尽管如此，《黑暗骑士》的结局是超越解构主义的道德立场：帮助拯救社会的代价可能意味着被社会疏远，因为大多数人已经完全不相信任何当权派成员的利他主义。

But the film is entitled “The Dark Knight” and not “Batman II” because the “Joker” has radically altered Batman’s style; he has to close down his daytime existence. Bruce Wayne is out of business. I wonder if this change represents the deep skepticism of present-day society, the belief that any form of decency, any act of altruism, may be subject to deconstruction, may become the opposite of what it seems. Perhaps that is why the “Joker” also maintains his mask, as if deconstruction threatens to show us that good and evil are all too ordinary, living in and amongst us, knowledge Batman fears will lead to general despair. Yet Batman’s new existence on the margins suggests that he will now become a deconstructor by profession. Nonetheless, “The Dark Knight” concludes with an ethical position beyond deconstruction: the price of helping to save society may entail being alienated from it because most people have lost all faith in the altruism of any member of the establishment.

“无耻混蛋”的历史目标

The historical goals of the “Inglourious Basterds”

关于解构主义，人们经常提出的一个问题是，虽然它破坏了传统目标，但似乎并没有推进自己的任何目标；从哲学角度来说，它质疑任何目的，但本身却没有目的。虽然这通常是正确的，而且正是出于这个原因，我之前提到解构主义是一种策略而不是一种理论，但最近的塔伦蒂诺电影确实比《杀死比尔 2》更明确地表明了如何利用解构主义来实现新的目标。

One of the questions often raised about deconstruction is that, while undermining traditional goals, it does not seem to forward any of its own; in philosophical terms it questions any telos but has itself no telos. While that is generally true, and indeed it is for that reason that I referred earlier to deconstruction as a strategy rather than a theory, the most recent Tarantino movie does suggest more overtly than “Kill Bill, Vol. 2” how deconstruction can be employed toward a new goal.

正如我们所见，《无耻混蛋》的开场就是解构主义的典型例子。但我现在想分离出这部电影的道德元素，塔伦蒂诺的结局如何超越解构主义并与我们的生活相关。具体来说，汉斯·兰德代表了一个新的目的。饰演兰德的奥地利演员克里斯托弗·瓦尔兹凭借在这部电影中的出色表现获得了戛纳电影节最佳男主角奖和奥斯卡奖。这里最伟大的表演壮举在于向我们展示了纳粹如何通过解构自己在战争和德国战败中幸存下来。兰德不仅解构了自己，还向电影观众展示了他正在解构自己。

The opening scene of “Inglourious Basterds,” as we have seen, exemplifies deconstruction. But I now wish to isolate the ethical element of this film, how Tarantino’s conclusion moves beyond deconstruction and relates to our lives. Specifically, Hans Lander represents a new telos. Christoph Waltz, the Austrian actor playing Lander, received the Best Actor Award at the Cannes film festival and an Academy Award for his role in this film. The great acting feat here lies in showing us how a Nazi can survive the war and the defeat of Germany by deconstructing himself. Lander not only deconstructs himself but also shows viewers of the film that he is deconstructing himself.

让我们再次回到开场。兰德解释说，他之所以能获得这个绰号，是因为他做了其他纳粹分子做不到的事情，即将自己置于犹太人的位置。在解释的过程中，他像一个有条不紊的纳粹分子一样写着东西，从而向观众展示了他正在解构的刻板印象。他为法国人和他手下的德国人扮演纳粹官僚的角色，同时又扮演相反的角色来抓捕犹太人，从而保持了他“犹太猎人”的声誉。

Let us return again to the opening scene. Lander explains that he earned his nickname by doing what other Nazis are incapable of, namely putting himself in the position of the Jew. During this explanation he is filling his pen like an obsessively methodical Nazi, thus epitomizing to the audience the stereotype that he is deconstructing. He maintains the role of Nazi bureaucrat for the Frenchman and the Germans under his command while at the same time adopting the opposite role to capture the Jews, thereby maintaining his reputation as the “Jew Hunter.”

这一幕的另一个元素现在需要评论。犹太家庭的所有成员都被杀了，只有青春期的女儿 Shoshanna 逃了出来。电影中并不清楚兰德为什么允许她逃跑，因为我们看到他已经把她瞄准了。也许逃亡的索珊娜对兰德来说是一种挑战，正如他在场景结束时说的“再见，索珊娜”所表明的那样。无论如何，纳粹的普遍特征——彻底性在这里（开玩笑地）得到了体现，因为兰德放走了她，但从未放弃对她的追捕：用德里达的话来说，就是彻底的不彻底。

One further element of this scene now requires comment. All the members of the Jewish family are killed except for the adolescent daughter Shoshanna, who escapes. It is not clear in the movie why Lander allows her to escape, since we see that he has her clearly in the sights of his gun. Perhaps Shoshanna on the run is a challenge for Lander, indicated by his remark at the end of the scene, “Au revoir, Shoshanna.” In any event, thoroughness, a common Nazi trait, is here (playfully) put into play, for Lander lets her go but never gives up the pursuit of her: in Derridean terms, being thoroughly unthorough.

四年后，我们再次看到他们一起出现在巴黎，此时，索珊娜已经长大成人，只是换了个名字，她管理着一家电影院，这家电影院将由包括希特勒本人在内的高级纳粹官员使用。兰德负责安全事务。在我看来，两位主角之间的对话是他们两人精彩的表演，因为他们都扮演着双重身份——兰德是安全主管和德雷福斯家族的凶手，而索珊娜是他可能认识的年轻犹太女孩，也是被德国军官迷住的法国电影院老板。这里的解构杰作是让观众看到每个角色身份之间的自由发挥。首先，兰德扮演了迷人的军官，用一口流利、礼貌的法语与电影院老板交谈。然后，他点了一杯牛奶，就像他过去在农舍做的那样，向索珊娜表示他认识她，她已经在他的掌控之中。肖珊娜起初以正直的尊严回应警官的礼貌和正确性，然后在警官点牛奶时，她采取了更为谨慎的态度。双方都在回应并试图操纵对方，但谁也不知道对方到底想做什么。我们永远不知道兰德为什么不逮捕肖珊娜。他是否仍然对跟踪她的进展这一挑战着迷，还是他现在开始觉得形势正在向她有利的方向转变？人们不禁想知道这位“犹太猎人”是否怀疑她和她的同类有朝一日可能会颠覆纳粹的等级制度。

We next see them together four years later in Paris where Shoshanna, now a grown woman with a different name, is managing a movie theatre that is to be used by high-ranking Nazi officials, including Hitler himself. Lander is in charge of security. The conversation between the two protagonists is in my view a brilliant acting performance on both their parts because each is playing with dual identities—Lander, chief of security and murderer of the Dreyfus family, and Shoshanna, the young Jewish girl he may recognize and the French owner of the cinema charmed by the German officer. The deconstructive tour de force here is that the audience sees the free play between the identities of each character. First Lander adopts the part of the charming officer speaking immaculate, polite French to the owner of the cinema. He then orders a glass of milk, as he had done at the farmhouse in the past, indicating to Shoshanna that he recognizes her and has her in his power. Shoshanna first responds with upright dignity to the polite correctness of the officer and then, when the milk is ordered, adopts a more circumspect attitude. Each is responding to and attempting to manipulate the other, neither knowing for certain what the other is planning to do. We never know why Lander does not arrest Shoshanna. Is he still fascinated with the challenge of following her progress or does he now begin to feel that the tide is turning in her favor? One is tempted to wonder whether the “Jew Hunter” suspects that she and her kind may one day reverse the hierarchy on the Nazis.

影片的后半段，兰德发现英国和美国士兵在当地一些抵抗力量成员的帮助下设下陷阱，将杀死电影院内所有的人。他没有挫败阴谋，而是决定利用自己对阴谋的了解作为筹码，以避免在战争结束后被当作战犯审判。影片的结尾是兰德与盟军达成协议，允许盟军炸毁电影院。尽管兰德幸存了下来，但当美国纳粹黄牛队头目阿尔多·雷恩在他的额头上刻上纳粹十字记号，让他终生难忘纳粹历史时，兰德感到震惊和愤慨。解构主义者兰德被标记为终身党卫军上校。

Later on in the movie Lander discovers that British and American soldiers, with the help of some of the local resistance members, have set up a trap that will kill all the people inside the cinema. Instead of foiling the plot, he decides to use his knowledge of it as a bargaining chip to avoid being tried as a war criminal after the end of hostilities. And the movie concludes with Lander making his deal allowing the allies to blow up the theater. But, although he survives, Lander is shocked and scandalized when Aldo Raine, the head of the American squad of Nazi scalpers, carves a swastika in his forehead, leaving a lifelong reminder of his Nazi past. Lander, the deconstructor, is marked for life as an SS Colonel.

这部电影对大屠杀这一神圣主题的戏谑，尤其是当希特勒和他的高层被一场由旧电影胶片点燃的大火摧毁时——这是导演的解构行为，从中我们能得出什么结论呢？据报道，塔伦蒂诺将这部电影描述为“带有二战图像的意大利式西部片”，但二战战争电影类型不仅仅是戏仿。兰德逃走了，但他没有；他活了下来，但额头上烙着纳粹十字记号。这让我们不禁想知道如果那些战后真正幸存下来的纳粹分子，尤其是在南美洲——比如臭名昭著的门格勒——因为他们也像兰德一样聪明和机灵，能够预料到我们会期望纳粹分子做什么，从而利用兰德的自我解构策略逃脱。

What is one to conclude from this playfulness concerning the sacred subject of the Holocaust, particularly as Hitler and his top brass are destroyed in a fire ignited by old movie reels—a directorial act of deconstruction? Tarantino is reported to have characterized the film as a “spaghetti western with a WWII iconography,” but the WWII war movie genre is not merely parodied. Lander escapes and he does not; he survives but with a swastika branded on his forehead. And we are left to wonder if those Nazis who actually survived after the war, most notably in South America—like the infamous Mengele—slipped through the net because they too were clever and adroit like Lander, able to anticipate what we would expect Nazis to do, and thus escape by using Lander’s strategy of deconstructing themselves.

因为当当局最终抓到逃避起诉的纳粹分子时，我们通常会发现他们并没有从根本上改变。想想阿道夫·艾希曼。在这方面，克里斯托弗·瓦尔兹不仅赢得了最佳男演员奖，因为尽管他扮演了许多不同的角色，在履行党卫军上校职责时说着一口流利的德语、英语、法语和意大利语，然后又变成了刺杀希特勒阴谋的同谋，但他仍然是同一个角色。对于瓦尔兹来说，成就在于演员扮演演员，而对于兰德来说，成就在于巧妙地将解构主义运用到自己身上。此外，电影标题的故意拼写错误让人想起德里达创造的关键术语，如解构和“延异”。德里达发明了跨越二元边界的术语，因为解构在破坏和重建之间摇摆不定，“延异”在差异和延迟之间发挥作用。塔伦蒂诺的片名暗示，虽然主角们的行为确实像“无耻混蛋”，但他们绝不是那样。尽管这些混蛋目不识丁，也不像“犹太猎人”兰德那样精明，但他们仍然占了上风。正如我们所见，塔伦蒂诺的片名采用了一种常见的二元论：欧洲老练的外交（克里斯托弗·沃尔兹饰演）与美国的傲慢权力（布拉德·皮特饰演）。塔伦蒂诺的结论是，兰德的伤疤阻碍了他逃到楠塔基特岛过上平静的生活。他必须忍受过去，这是他永远无法解构的东西。在影片的结尾，阿尔多·雷恩（布拉德·皮特饰演）永远标记了兰德在历史中的位置，这是门格勒和许多其他纳粹分子所逃避的命运。在这里，塔伦蒂诺使用解构主义来超越它，以提出一个道德观点，这一立场在德里达早期和最有影响力的著作中肯定不突出，但电影制作人使用解构主义策略却追求了这一点。塔伦蒂诺认为，历史是无法通过解构来逃避的；电影中纳粹的毁灭是虚构的，但大屠杀历史留下的不可磨灭的印记却萦绕在我们的脑海中。

For when the authorities eventually catch up with Nazis who have evaded prosecution, we usually find they are not fundamentally changed people. Think of Adolph Eichmann. In this respect, Christoph Waltz more than earns his best actor awards because, while adopting many different roles, speaking immaculate German, English, French, and Italian in pursuit of his duties as an SS Colonel and then changing to become an accomplice in the plot to kill Hitler, he remains the same character. For Waltz, the achievement is the actor acting the actor, and for Lander the adroit use of deconstruction applied to himself. Moreover, the deliberate misspelling of the movie’s title is reminiscent of Derrida’s coinage of key terms like deconstruction and “Differance.” Derrida invents terms that cross binary borders, as deconstruction oscillates between destruction and reconstruction, and “Differance” plays between difference and deferral. Tarantino’s title suggests that, while the main characters do behave like “Inglourious Basterds,” they are anything but that. Although illiterate and lacking the finesse of Lander, the “Jew Hunter,” the basterds nevertheless prevail. As we have seen, Tarantino’s title plays on a familiar binarism: European sophisticated diplomacy (Christoph Waltz) versus American brash power (Brad Pitt). Tarantino concludes that Lander’s scar prevents his escape to a quiet life on Nantucket Island. He must live with his past, something he can never deconstruct. At the end of the film Aldo Raine (Brad Pitt) permanently marks Lander’s place in history, a fate Mengele and many other Nazis evaded. Here Tarantino uses deconstruction to go beyond it to make an ethical point, a position that is certainly not prominent in the early and most influential writings of Derrida, but is pursued by film-makers using deconstructive strategies. History, Tarantino suggests, cannot be evaded by deconstruction; the destruction of the Nazis in the film is fanciful, but the indelible mark of the history of the Holocaust haunts our imagination.

《谍影重重 2》中的个人诚信

Personal integrity in “The Bourne Supremacy”

在保罗·格林格拉斯执导、马特·达蒙主演的惊悚片《谍影重重 2》（2004）中，道德以个人正直的形式出现。在这里，我们看到去中心化不仅涉及改变中心，改变焦点，还将中心的东西移到边缘。被陷害的伯恩只能在政府试图通过躲避中情局、从显赫地位退居默默无闻来“除掉他”。因此，影片的关键时刻就是伯恩看着中情局看着他的时候。有两次，伯恩站在柏林中情局总部对面的屋顶上，看着帕梅拉·兰迪和她的工作人员通过无数的电脑显示器搜寻伯恩，却不知道伯恩离他们很近，可以用步枪瞄准镜观察他们。伯恩的计划——这也是他“至高无上”的关键，也是影片的主线——是将中情局调查的中心从伯恩转移到中情局本身。伯恩希望通过这种方式，揭露中情局的腐败，并将自己边缘化，这样他就可以悄悄地过上平静的私生活。

Ethics takes the form of personal integrity in the thriller, directed by Paul Greengrass and starring Matt Damon, entitled “The Bourne Supremacy” (2004). Here we see that decentering involves not only changing the center, altering who or what is the focal point, but also moving what was in the center to the margins. Having been framed, Bourne can only survive the government attempts “to take him out” by evading the CIA, retreating from prominence to obscurity. Accordingly, the key moments in the film are when Bourne is looking at the CIA looking at him.
