在第二部分“BJ单身日记：理性边缘”的开始，布里奇特和马克是一对，他们关系的发展涉及到布里奇特从泰国监狱获释，这也让人联想到福柯的《规训与惩罚》。在这方面，重要的是要记住两部电影都包含丹尼尔和马克之间的拳击比赛，其中第二场拳击以电影中最精彩的台词之一结束。丹尼尔嘲讽马克说：“如果你这么关心布里奇特，你就应该娶她，然后她肯定会跟我上床。”这个无赖说了最后一句俏皮话，但马克最终赢得了布里奇特，因为他没有藐视礼仪和求爱的惯例。当然，布里奇特因违反规则而受到惩罚。虽然以喜剧的形式呈现，但布里奇特在监狱里的日子很艰难，特别是因为似乎没有提前获释的希望。此外，布里奇特从她的狱友——那些遭到男性性虐待的女性——那里了解到，英国求爱过程中的限制只是泰国被剥削女性所面临的严酷现实的温和版本。

By the beginning of Part Two, “Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason,” Bridget and Mark are an item, and the development of their relationship concerns Bridget’s release from prison in Thailand, again suggestive of Foucault’s Discipline and Punish. In this regard it is important to remember that both films contain a fistfight between Daniel and Mark, the second of which ends with one of the great lines of the movies. Taunting Mark, Daniel quips “if you are so concerned about Bridget you should marry her and then certainly ‘she’ll shag me’.” The cad has the last witty word, but Mark wins Bridget in the end because he does not flout the conventions of decency and courtship. Of course, Bridget is punished for breaking the rules. Although comically presented, Bridget’s time in prison is difficult, particularly as there seems to be no hope of early release. Moreover, what Bridget learns from her fellow prisoners—women abused by men for sexual purposes—is that the constrictions of courtship in England are a mild version of the harsh realities faced by exploited women in Thailand.

甚至在入狱之前，布里奇特就不断违反求爱规则，要么是因为她的谈话对马克来说太无聊，要么是因为她太直接地认为丹尼尔和她是情侣。而且，为了避免我们将这些问题视为拘谨、仅仅是礼节问题而置之不理，它们是丹尼尔和马克两次打架的部分原因。第一次打架的主要问题是丹尼尔与当时是马克妻子的女人上床，并对布里奇特撒谎，告诉她马克和丹尼尔的未婚妻有染。在后续故事中，马克指责丹尼尔让布里奇特独自应对泰国警方，而她只是在丹尼尔的坚持邀请下才到泰国的。

Even before prison, Bridget is continually breaking the rules of courtship, either because her conversation is too inane for Mark or because she is too forward with Daniel in assuming they are an item. And, lest we dismiss these issues as punctilio, mere manners, they are part of the reason for the two fistfights between Daniel and Mark. The main issue in the first fight is that Daniel went to bed with the woman who was at that time Mark’s wife and lied to Bridget, telling her instead that Mark had an affair with Daniel’s fiancée. In the sequel Mark attacks Daniel for leaving Bridget on her own to cope with the Thai police when she only visited the country at Daniel’s insistent invitation.

求爱规则或习俗的重要性在续集中最为突出，当时布里奇特受马克邀请参加律师学院的正式聚会。她费了好大劲才找到合适的衣服和化妆品，但到场时，她浑身湿透，穿着不合适的衣服，脸色狼狈。她开始与客人交谈——投资者、律师和法官——他们是马克的同事和客户。话题是慈善。这两位法律专业人士显然是成功和富裕的，他们认为没有必要施舍，因为那些失去家园和资产的人自己有责任，不应该指望别人的帮助。布里奇特不同意，在争论中没有取得任何进展，并大发脾气，最后称他们为“愚蠢的保守党混蛋”。侮辱了马克的商业伙伴后，她向马克道歉，尽管她仍然相信自己说的是对的。因此，惯例和习俗职场道德与性与婚姻道德直接相关。尽管马克同意布里奇特对慈善的看法，但他觉得，出于对他的尊重，布里奇特应该对他的同事保持沉默。

The significance of the rules or mores of courtship is most prominent in the scene in the sequel when Bridget is invited by Mark to attend a formal party at the Inns of Court. Having gone to a great deal of trouble to find the appropriate dress and cosmetics she arrives soaking wet in unsuitable attire, her face a mess. She begins a conversation with the guests—investors, lawyers and judges—who are Mark’s associates and clients. The topic is charity. The two legal professionals, clearly successful and well off, hold the view that there is no need for charity because those who have lost their home and assets are themselves responsible and should not expect help from others. Bridget disagrees, gains no ground in the argument, and loses her temper, finally calling them “stupid Tory cunts.” Having insulted Mark’s business associates, she apologizes to Mark even though continuing to believe what she said is right. So the conventions and mores of the work-a-day world are directly related to those of sexuality and marriage. Even though Mark agrees with Bridget’s views on charity, he feels that as an act of respect to him she should have held her tongue with his colleagues.

此外，马克对布里奇特社交失态的反应与他的性表达和个人发展直接相关，这是福柯论证的一个关键因素。马克·达西的名字明显指的是达西先生，科林·菲尔斯在英国广播公司改编的简·奥斯汀的《傲慢与偏见》中扮演这个角色。这两个角色都拥有一种隐藏着炽热激情的外表，这一元素在《理性的边缘》的结局中变得清晰起来，这个标题可能间接指的是简·奥斯汀，她的小说首次出版是在通常被称为“理性时代”的时期末期。再一次，这种关系的矛盾性显而易见：马克既被布里奇特的直率所吸引，又被她排斥，而她对他冷酷的自我控制也有同样矛盾的看法。第二部分提出的问题是一个福柯式的问题：性的限制是否会给这两个人足够的个人自由，让他们幸福地结婚？

Moreover, Mark’s response to Bridget’s social gaffes is directly related to his expression of sexuality and to his personal development, a key factor in Foucault’s argument. Mark Darcy’s name is a clear reference to Mr. Darcy, a part Colin Firth played in the BBC adaptation of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice. Both characters share an external reserve that covers a smoldering passion, an element that becomes clear at the resolution of “The Edge of Reason,” a title which is perhaps an indirect reference to Jane Austen, whose novels first appeared in print at the end of a period often referred to as “The Age of Reason.” Once again, the paradoxical nature of the relationship is manifest: Mark is simultaneously drawn to and repelled by the blunt tactlessness of Bridget, and she has similarly conflicted views of his cold self-control. The question posed by Part Two is a Foucauldian one: will the constraints of sexuality permit sufficient personal freedom for these two people to be happily married to one another?

当马克来到监狱向布里奇特宣布她将被释放时，他表现得像一个冷漠的专业人士。当布里奇特感谢他时，他声称自己只是上级的使者，对她的处境，尤其是她与丹尼尔的关系不感兴趣。我们不得不同意布里奇特的想法，认为他不再关心她。但布里奇特的朋友后来向她解释说，马克付出了巨大的努力，利用了巨大的影响力和专业知识、金钱和时间来促成她的释放。具有讽刺意味的是，马克保守的保守党背景在这种情况下对他很有帮助，因为它为她获释提供了必要的联系。此外，他不仅表现出对释放她的全心全意，而且还对丹尼尔在她最需要的时候抛弃她而怀恨在心。马克严格的道德准则使他成为一个忠诚的朋友，但却是一个缺乏想象力的情人。事实上，电影的结尾是布里奇特教马克如何向她求婚，也就是说，一旦她明白他爱她“本来的样子”，她就会向他提出求婚的话语。这个场景简直让人一惊一乍。在第一次拍摄中，布里奇特打断了马克，马克因此被耽搁了，无法继续下去，并解释说时机已经过去了。但布里奇特坚持要重拍，这次没有打断。当她指导马克表达自己的情感时，她自己也在学习谨慎，甚至在关键时刻如何保持沉默。我们回到“作者功能”，特别是“日记作者功能”，因为布里奇特作为日记作者学习谨慎，而马克在第二次拍摄的场景中可能被描述为学习他的“情人功能”。对福柯来说，性成为一种自我表达的手段，尽管在话语控制的社会功能范围内是有限的。

When Mark arrives at the prison to announce to Bridget that she is to be released, he presents himself as a distant professional. When Bridget thanks him, he professes to be the mere messenger of higher authorities and to have no interest in her circumstances, particularly her relationship with Daniel. We are led to share Bridget’s assumption that he no longer cares for her. But Bridget’s friends subsequently explain to her that Mark has gone to immense effort and used great influence and expertise, money, and time to effect her release. Ironically, Mark’s uptight Tory background serves him well in this context because it provides the contacts necessary for her release. Moreover, not only has he exhibited total dedication to freeing her, but he also bears a personal grudge against Daniel for deserting her at a time of urgent need. Mark’s rigid code of ethics makes him a loyal friend but an unimaginative lover. Indeed, the movie ends with Bridget teaching Mark how to propose to her, that is, once she understands that he loves her “just as she is,” she provides him with the discourse of a marriage proposal. This scene is literally a double-take. During the first take, Bridget interrupts Mark who is thereby put off, unable to proceed, explaining that the moment is gone. But Bridget insists on a retake, this time without interruption. While she is coaching Mark into expressing his emotion, she is herself learning discretion, even how at key moments to be silent. We return to the “author-function,” specifically a “diarist-function” since Bridget learns discretion as a diarist while Mark might be described as learning his “lover-function” in the double-take scene. Sexuality becomes for Foucault a means of self-expression, albeit limited, within the confines of discourse-controlled social functions.

第二部分中关于布里奇特父母暂时分手的次要情节强化了这一点。布里奇特的母亲在电视旅游节目中找到了一位与丹尼尔相当的“圆滑导游”。朱利安是一位温文尔雅的电视节目主持人，结果却心胸狭隘、不近人情。最终，布里奇特的母亲回到了丈夫身边，他与马克很像，不那么华丽和多姿多彩（字面意思），但他纪律严明、值得信赖。我们在圣诞派对上看到了这种性格特征，布里奇特的父亲坚忍不拔，尽管他向女儿承认，对他来说，他们就像生不如死。现在，布里奇特的母亲要求丈夫，就像女儿要求马克那样，更明显地表达对她的爱。电影结尾的婚姻不是布里奇特和马克的婚姻，而是她父母的再婚，这表明性是当今社会所有年龄段的人都关心的问题。正如布里奇特用她一贯轻率的措辞所说，“我还没有结婚，而我的‘该死的父母’却要再婚。”在一个充斥着如此多限制我们“功能”的约束性学科的社会中，性提供了一种部分自我表达的手段。在这方面，与此相关的是第二部分结尾处揭示的丽贝卡，布里奇特认为她是马克的爱慕对象，其实是个女同性恋。福柯对同性恋的评论如下：

The subplot in Part Two concerning Bridget’s parents’ temporary breakup reinforces this point. Bridget’s mother finds an equivalent of Daniel in his capacity as the “smooth guide” on a television travel show. Julian, a suave television presenter, turns out to be petty and unkind. Eventually, Bridget’s mother returns to her husband, who resembles Mark in being less flamboyant and colorful (literally) but who is disciplined and reliable. This character element we have seen at the Christmas parties that Bridget’s father endures stoically, even though, as he admits to his daughter, for him they are living death. Now Bridget’s mother asks of her husband, as her daughter does of Mark, that he be more demonstrative in his affection for her. The marriage at the end of the movie is not that of Bridget and Mark but the remarriage of her parents, suggesting that sexuality is a concern throughout present-day society involving people of all ages. As Bridget remarks, in her characteristically indiscreet terms, “I am still not married and my ‘fucking parents’ are marrying one another a second time.” In a society fraught with so many constricting disciplines that define our “functions,” sexuality provides a partial means of self-expression. Pertinent in this respect is the revelation near the end of Part Two that Rebecca, the woman Bridget took to be her rival for Mark’s affection, is in fact a lesbian. Foucault comments on homosexuality in the following terms:

十九世纪的“资产阶级”社会——毫无疑问，我们现在的资产阶级社会还没有那么严重——是一个赤裸裸、支离破碎的堕落社会。这并不是伪善，因为没有什么比这更明显、更冗长，或者更明显地被话语和制度所取代。[…] 问题在于，它对身体和性施加了何种权力[…] 它通过增加单一的性行为来发挥作用。它没有为性行为设定界限，而是将其纳入身体，作为个人规范的一种方式。[…] 它产生并决定了性别马赛克。现代社会是堕落的，并不是因为它有清教主义，也不是因为它的伪善引起了强烈反应；事实上，它是堕落的（《历史》，1，47）。

Nineteenth century “bourgeois” society—and it is less doubtless still with us—was a society of blatant and fragmented perversion. And this was not by way of hypocrisy, for nothing was more manifest and more prolix, or more manifestly taken over by discourses and institutions. […] At issue, rather, is the type of power it brought to bear upon the body and on sex […] it acted by multiplication of singular sexualities. It did not set boundaries for sexuality, but included it in the body as a mode of specification for individuals. […] It produced and determined the sexual mosaic. Modern society is perverse, not in spite of its Puritanism or as if from a backlash provoked by its hypocrisy; it is in actual fact, perverse (History, 1, 47).

这里的反常指的是我们对性的痴迷，将其作为区分我们自己的一种手段，一种走向个性化的手段。最近人们对同性婚姻话题的关注，以及它进入法律讨论，再次表明性正迅速成为一种主要的自我表达形式。

Perversity here refers to our obsession with sexuality as a means of differentiating among ourselves, a means toward individuation. The recent focus on the topic of homosexual marriage, its entry into legal discourse, is another indication that sexuality is fast becoming a major form of self-expression.

对于文学理论来说，这个信息是明确的。文学评论家必须了解学科规则，即“批评功能”，才能传播有关文学的知识。这些限制将不同于其他学科的限制，并将受到历史变化的影响。但除了对批评家和批评的应用之外，还可以提出一个更普遍的观点。在一个纪律和惩罚领域不断增加的社会中，性是自我表达的一个领域：无论分配给性多少有限的自由，我们能否自由取决于我们对约束的理解，这些约束限制了我们的选择，甚至包括性等个人问题。福柯在生命的尽头转向了个人治理的伦理，他指的是国家对个人自由的管制。

For literary theory the message is clear. The literary critic must understand the rules of the discipline, the “critic function,” in order to communicate knowledge about literature. These constraints will be different from those of other disciplines and will be subject to historical change. But beyond the application to critics and criticism, a more general point can be made. Sexuality is an area of self-expression in a society marked by ever-increasing areas of discipline and punishment: whatever limited freedom is allotted to us is dependent upon our understanding of the constraints imposed upon us by disciplines which limit our choices, even those concerning such personal matters as sexuality. And here Foucault is led, near the end of his life, to turn to the ethics of the government of the individual, by which he means the state regulation of individual liberty.

福柯论个体政府的伦理

Foucault on the ethics of individual government

福柯在 1983 年（即他去世前一年）首次发表的一篇文章中总结了他过去 20 年的工作。这篇文章的标题是“为什么要研究权力：主体的问题”。福柯首先对他的著作进行了如下的叙述：

In an essay first published in 1983, a year before his death, Foucault summarized his work for the past 20 years. The title of this essay is “Why Study Power: the Question of the Subject.” Foucault begins with the following account of his writings:

首先我想说一下我过去二十年工作的目的。我的工作目的并不是分析权力现象，也不是阐述这种分析的基础。

I would like to say, first of all, what was the goal of my work during the last twenty years. It was not to analyze the phenomenon of power, nor to elaborate the foundations of such an analysis.

相反，我的目标是创造一部关于我们文化中人类成为主体的不同模式的历史。我的作品探讨了将人类转变为主体的三种客体化模式（《超越》，208）。

My objective, instead, has been to create a history of the different modes by which, in our culture, human beings are made subjects. My work has dealt with three modes of objectification which transform human beings into subjects (Beyond, 208).

我们在本章中讨论的电影都是围绕权力构成背景下的主观性展开的：莎士比亚、珍妮、贫民窟的百万富翁、妮娜和布里奇特都在努力实现自己的主观性，并将性作为发现和表达自己的一种手段。福柯对权力的本质并不感兴趣，他更感兴趣的是人类在权力结构中学会表达自己的方式：

The movies that we have been considering in this chapter all revolve around subjectivity in a context of the constituents of power: Shakespeare, Jenny, Slumdog, Nina, and Bridget all struggle to realize their subjectivity, and use sexuality as a means of discovering and expressing themselves. Foucault is not so much interested in the nature of power as in the way in which human beings learn to express themselves within the structures of power:

结论是，我们这个时代的政治、伦理、社会和哲学问题不是试图将个人从国家和国家机构中解放出来，而是将我们从国家和与国家相关的个体化类型中解放出来。我们必须通过拒绝这种强加给我们几个世纪的个性来促进新形式的主观性（Beyond，216）。

The conclusion would be that the political, ethical, social, philosophical problem of our days is not to try to liberate the individual from the state, and from the state’s institutions, but to liberate us both from the state and from the type of individualization that is linked to the state. We have to promote new forms of subjectivity through the refusal of this kind of individuality which has been imposed on us for several centuries (Beyond, 216).

福柯解释说，争取新主体性的斗争“并不完全是支持或反对个人，而是反对‘个体化统治’”（《超越》，212）。根据福柯的说法，当今政府的个体化权力相当于过去的教会权力，即对个人的牧师控制。自十八世纪以来，教会的牧师权力一直取而代之的是世俗的政府束缚，在大多数民主国家，这种束缚是通过控制来赋予的，或者福柯所说的纪律阻碍，也就是约束或规则：“这些阻碍，其中技术能力的运行、沟通游戏和权力关系按照经过深思熟虑的公式相互调整，构成了我们所说的（稍微扩大了这个词的含义）纪律”（《超越》，219）。

Foucault explains that the struggles for new kinds of subjectivity are “not exactly for or against the individual but rather they are struggles against the ‘government of individuation’” (Beyond, 212). Present-day governmental powers of individuation are the equivalent of what in the past, according to Foucault, was the power of the church, the pastoral control of individuals. Since the eighteenth century, the pastoral power of the church has been replaced by the secular reins of government, which is empowered in most democracies by the controls, or what Foucault calls the blocking of discipline, that is, the constraints or rules: “These blocks, in which the putting into operation of technical capacities, the game of communications and relationships of power are adjusted to one another according to considered formulae constitute what one might call, enlarging a little the sense of the word, disciplines” (Beyond, 219).

福柯继续说，权力对我们的作用是：

How power operates upon us, Foucault continues, is:

[…] 与其说这是两个对手之间的对抗或将一方与另一方联系起来，不如说这是一个治理问题。必须承认这个词在 16 世纪具有非常广泛的含义。“治理”不仅指政治结构或国家管理，更指指导个人或团体行为的方式，即对儿童、灵魂、社区、家庭和病人的治理。它不仅涵盖合法构成的政治或经济主体行动形式，还包括或多或少经过深思熟虑和计算的行动方式，这些行动方式注定要影响其他人的行动可能性。从这个意义上讲，治理就是构造他人可能的行动领域（《超越》，221）。

[…] less a confrontation between two adversaries or the linking of one to the other than a question of government. This word must be allowed the very broad meaning it had in the sixteenth century. “Government” did not refer only to political structures or to the management of states; rather it designated the way in which the conduct of individuals or groups might be directed, the government of children, of souls, of communities, of families, of the sick. It did not only cover the legitimately constituted forms of political or economic subject action, but also modes of action, more or less considered and calculated, which are destined to act upon the possibilities of action of other people. To govern, in this sense, is to structure the possible field of action of others (Beyond, 221).

福柯所指的权力是“开放”社会对“自由”公民所行使的权力。个人通过战略行动来协商这种权力。

The power Foucault has in mind is that exercised in an “open” society over citizens who are “free.” The individual negotiates this kind of power by way of strategic action.

“策略”一词目前有三种用法。首先，它是指为达到某一目的而采用的手段；这是一个理性为达到某一目标而发挥作用的问题。其次，它是指某一博弈中的一方在他认为其他人应该采取的行动以及他认为其他人认为他应该采取的行动方面所采取的行动方式；这是一个人寻求比其他人占优势的方式。第三，它是指在这种对抗情况下用来剥夺对手的作战手段并迫使他放弃斗争的程序；因此，这是一个注定要取得胜利的手段问题（《超越》，第 224-5 页）。

The word “strategy” is currently employed in three ways. First, to designate the means employed to obtain a certain end; it is a question of rationality functioning to arrive at an objective. Second, to designate the manner in which a partner in a certain game acts with regard to what he thinks should be the action of others and what he considers the others think to be his own; it is the way in which one seeks to have the advantage over others. Third, to designate the procedures used in this situation of confrontation to deprive the opponent of his means of combat and to reduce him to giving up the struggle; it is a question therefore of the means destined to obtain the victory (Beyond, 224–5).

暴力很少是我们日常关注的焦点。相反，我们的生活充满了在纪律力量的约束下，我们个人策略的日常交织：文学评论家在文学作品和他或她的评论的每一句话中都在挣扎什么；我在这句话中也在挣扎什么。福柯认为，策略是通过求爱或性游戏来学习的。他总结道，“是什么让一个群体、一个种姓或一个阶级的统治，以及这种统治所遭遇的抵抗和反抗，成为一个中心现象在社会历史中，其一个显著特点是，在整个社会机体的层面上，以大规模的、普遍的形式表现出权力关系和策略关系的紧密结合，以及它们相互作用所产生的结果”(《超越》，226)。

Brute power is seldom our daily concern. Rather our life is filled with the quotidian intermingling of our individual strategies within the constraints of the power of discipline: what the literary critic struggles with in every sentence of the literature and of his or her commentary; what I am struggling with in this sentence. Strategy is learned, Foucault suggests, by courtship or the games of sexuality And he concludes that “what makes the domination of a group, a caste, or a class, together with the resistance and revolt which that domination comes up against, a central phenomenon in the history of societies is that they manifest in a massive and universal form, at the level of the whole social body, the locking together of power relations with relations of strategy and the results proceeding from their interaction” (Beyond, 226).

对于文学评论家来说，其含义与其他知识学科或受政府权力约束的普通人的含义并无不同。所有人都需要了解各种学科对他们施加的限制的性质，或者他们选择对自己施加的限制，以改变“个体化政府”。然后，我们所有人都有义务解构权力，以达到“权力知识”，不仅在我们不同的职业或学科中，而且作为寻求自我表达基本形式的个人。无论是剧作家、贫民窟的流浪汉、舞蹈家、学生还是日记作者，如果我们要享受有限的自由，就必须理解“权力知识”并协商学科的限制：

The implications for the literary critic are not different in kind from those in other intellectual disciplines or from those of the man in the street who is subject to the powers of government. All need to understand the nature of the constraints of the various disciplines imposed upon them or that they choose to impose upon themselves for the purpose of altering the “government of individuation.” We are all then obliged to deconstruct power to arrive at “power-knowledge,” not only in our various professions or disciplines, but as individuals seeking basic forms of self-expression. Whether a playwright, slumdog, dancer, student, or diarist, we must understand “power-knowledge” and negotiate the constraints of disciplines if we are to enjoy our limited freedoms:

因此，权力特有的关系不应在暴力或斗争方面寻求，而应在单一的行动模式领域中寻求，既非战争的也非法律的，即政府（《超越》，221）。

The relationship proper to power would not therefore be sought on the side of violence or of struggle […] but rather in the area of the singular mode of action, neither warlike nor juridical, which is government (Beyond, 221).

福柯将作者修改为“作者—功能”，将知识修改为“权力—知识”，这引出了下一章的问题：在“权力—知识”话语中，“作者—功能”如何与受众进行沟通？

Foucault’s modification of author to “author-function” and of knowledge to “power-knowledge” leads to the question of the next chapter: within the discourse of “power-knowledge,” how does the “author-function” communicate to the audience?

第三章

CHAPTER THREE

接受理论：Wolfgang Iser

Reception theory: Wolfgang Iser

摘要：在介绍了接受理论的前身的一些背景信息之后，我首先从有助于解读《达芬奇密码》的解释循环开始。在《天使爱美丽》的背景下，我阐明了这一过程中的两个要素，即他性和想象力，《天使爱美丽》讲述了一位年轻女性利用想象力帮助他人的故事。对于伊瑟尔来说，解释或解释过程涉及填补《罗拉快跑》主题的空白或空白。解释被视为受历史变化的影响，这导致伊瑟尔使用了“期望范围”的概念，《单身男子》就是一个例子，这部电影讲述了过去 50 年来我们对男同性恋态度的变化。在这里，我们面对的是意向性和伦理，因为解释寻求的最终艺术目标以不同的伦理问题为标志。例如，在《教父：第三部》的结尾，我们问为什么我们应该对罪犯感兴趣，这部黑手党史诗服务于什么伦理目标。本次讨论提出了《午夜巴塞罗那》和《国王的演讲》中新视角的文化功能的问题。

Summary: After some background information on the forebears of reception theory, I begin with the hermeneutic circle that helps to decode “The Da Vinci Code.” Two elements in this process, otherness and imagination, are clarified in the context of “Amélie,” the story of a young woman who uses her imagination to help others. The interpretive or hermeneutic process involves, for Iser, filling in blanks or gaps, the subject of “Run Lola Run.” Interpretation is seen as subject to historical change, which leads to Iser’s use of the concept of “horizons of expectation,” illustrated by “A Single Man,” a film about the change during the past 50 years in our attitudes to male homosexuality. Here we confront intentionality and ethics because interpretation seeks ultimate artistic goals that are marked by distinct ethical questions. For instance, at the end of “The Godfather: Part III” we ask why we should be interested in criminals, what ethical goal is served by this mafia epic. This discussion raises the question of the cultural function of new perspectives, in “Vicky Cristina Barcelona” and “The King’s Speech.”

读者可能会觉得，我对电影的解读有些过了，我制作的电影数量超出了应有的范围，尤其是考虑到这些电影都是商业电影，主要是为了获得最大的票房利润。在本科阶段，这种技术得到了发展，学生们开始对我的一般方法提出问题，特别是关于他们所看的电影。因为商业上的成功，所以被认为没有艺术价值。我指出，莎士比亚在伦敦舞台上发了大财，回到斯特拉特福，买了一件家徽，对保存他的剧作毫无兴趣。塞缪尔·约翰逊说：“除了傻瓜，没有人会为了钱而写作。”简而言之，我们大多数最伟大的文学和艺术珍品都是商业投资的结果。和其他任何职业一样，艺术可能会被金钱和成功所腐蚀，但不一定。至于解读，学生们认为这完全是个人反应的问题；换句话说，完全是主观的。

At this point the reader may feel that my interpretation of the movies goes too far, making more of them than is warranted, particularly considering that they are all commercial ventures designed primarily for maximum box office profit. At about this stage of the undergraduate class in which this technique developed, the students began to ask questions about my approach in general, and in particular with regard to the movies that they considered of no artistic value because commercially successful. I pointed out that Shakespeare, having made his fortune on the London stage, went home to Stratford, bought a coat of arms, and had no interest in preserving his plays. And Samuel Johnson said that “no one but a blockhead ever wrote except for money.” In short, most of our greatest literary and artistic treasures are the result of commercial ventures. Like any other profession, art may be corrupted by money and success but not necessarily. As for interpretation, the students suggested that this was all a matter of individual response; in other words, completely subjective.

本章的主题是接受理论的核心——解释问题。沃尔夫冈·伊瑟尔解构了传统观念，即除了公认立场之外，唯一的替代方案就是打开完全主观性的大门。伊瑟尔指出了这两个极端之间的中间立场，提出了一种排除部分但并非消除所有创新解释的方法。接受理论之所以重要，是因为它提供了一种调解终极差异的方法，不仅适用于文学解释者，也适用于一般人。没有一种观点可以适用于所有人或经得起时间的考验。相反，对于接受理论家来说，对艺术的回应涉及艺术作品和回应者之间的对话，在对话中，双方都倾听对方的声音，对方也听到了他们的声音。显然，跨越真正差异（尤其是意识形态差异）的真诚对话对我们所有人来说都至关重要。

The entire issue of interpretation central to reception theory is the topic of this chapter. Wolfgang Iser deconstructs the traditional notion that the only alternative to the accepted position opens the door to complete subjectivity. Iser points to a middle ground between these two extremes, presenting a method for excluding some but not eliminating all innovative interpretations. Reception theory is important because it provides a means of mediating between ultimate differences, not only for literary interpreters but also for people in general. No single view can be valid for everyone or withstand the test of time. Rather, for the reception theorist, responding to art involves a conversation between the work of art and the responder, in which each listens to and is heard by the other. And clearly, genuine conversation across real differences, particularly ideological ones, is of crucial concern to all of us.

接受理论起源于二十世纪初一群德国学者的立场，他们认为《圣经》需要解释，而不是从字面上理解，也起源于被称为现象学的哲学流派。从两者的结合中发展出的关键概念是解释学循环，即解释的循环，即相信在艺术和其他独特的人类活动中，解释分析的结果与提出的问题密不可分。我们个人对艺术的态度限制了我们从中得到的东西：问题和答案共同构成了解释学循环。解释在历史中不断变化，人们的反应各不相同，也各不相同，也就是说，他们改变了自己的方法。但对解释过程的理解需要分析开头和结尾、问题和答案之间的关系。

Reception theory evolves from the position of a group of early twentieth-century German scholars who believed that the Bible needed to be interpreted rather than taken in literal terms, and also from the school of philosophy known as phenomenology. The key notion that developed from the combination was the hermeneutic circle, the circle of interpretation, the belief that in the arts and other distinctly human endeavors the results of interpretive analyses are inextricably bound up with the questions posed. Our individual approach to art limits what we take away from it: questions and answers together form the hermeneutic circle. Interpretations change in history and people vary in their responses from one another and from themselves, that is, they change their own approach. But an understanding of the interpretive process involves analysis of the relationship between beginnings and endings, questions and answers.

伊瑟尔坚持认为接受理论回答了一个较新出现的问题：

Iser insists that reception theory responds to a more recent problem:

[接受理论] 的产生源于 20 世纪 50 年代末和 60 年代文学研究所面临的困境：即解释冲突。文化遗产不再是促进所谓教育的毫无疑问的手段；它之所以成为一个问题，是因为不再有过去那样的统一的教育指导方针。在现代艺术出现之前，人们理所当然地认为文本有内容，而内容是文本被视为意义的载体。解释必须揭示文本的意义，这让整个过程合法化，因为意义被认为代表了可用于教育目的的价值观 […] 最终，这种情况使人们意识到，支配解释的预设在很大程度上决定了文本的意义。因此，声称已经找到意义意味着对自己假设和预设的辩护，这引发了后来被称为解释冲突的现象（如何做，58）。

[Reception theory] was engendered by the dilemma in which the study of literature found itself in the late 1950s and 1960s: namely, the conflict of interpretation. The cultural heritage no longer served as an unquestioned means of promoting what used to be called Bildung [education]; it became a problem because there were no longer uniform guidelines for such education, as had been the case in the past. Until the advent of modern art it was taken for granted that texts had a content, which was considered as a carrier of meaning. Interpretation had to uncover the text’s meaning, which legitimized the whole process because meanings were considered to represent values that could be employed for the purpose of education […] Eventually, this situation created an awareness of the fact that the presuppositions governing interpretation were to a large extent responsible for what the text was supposed to mean. Therefore the claim to have found the meaning implied justification of one’s own assumptions and presuppositions, and this triggered what has since become known as the conflict of interpretation (How to do, 58).

解决解释冲突的尝试假设了解释的必要性。但在这一点上，学生们经常问我们为什么需要解释，为什么不简单地欣赏和享受，特别是因为电影似乎就是为此而制作的。为了回答这个问题并介绍接受理论，我转向另一部非常著名且商业上成功的电影《达芬奇密码》（2006 年），由罗恩·霍华德执导，汤姆·汉克斯、奥黛丽·塔图和伊恩·麦克莱恩主演。虽然伊瑟尔将他的理论应用于文学小说，但我用电影来解释他的某些想法，因为除纪录片外，大多数电影都是虚构的、讲述故事或暗示某种叙事进展。

The attempt to resolve the conflict of interpretation assumes the need for interpretation. But at this point, students often asked why do we need to interpret at all, why not simply appreciate and enjoy, particularly since films seem to be made for that purpose. To respond to this question and to introduce reception theory, I turn to another very famous and commercially successful film, “The Da Vinci Code” (2006), directed by Ron Howard, starring Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, and Ian McKellen. Although Iser applies his theory to literary fiction, I use film to explain certain of his ideas because most films, other than documentaries, are fictional, tell stories, or imply some narrative progression.

诠释学解读：《达芬奇密码》

Hermeneutic interpretation: “The Da Vinci Code”

这部电影的开场和结尾都在卢浮宫，重点放在了贝聿铭金字塔中心的微型双“V”字上。要理解《达芬奇密码》的解释学循环，请考虑一下兰登教授（汤姆·汉克斯饰）和利·提宾爵士（伊恩·麦克莱恩饰）之间的对话，关于耶稣基督是人神还是结过婚并生过孩子。天主教会的两个派别在这个问题上持相反立场。锡安会致力于保护抹大拉的玛利亚和耶稣基督婚姻的后代，而主业会则坚持认为基督从未结过婚，并着手阻止任何相反的证据浮出水面。

This film begins and ends in the Louvre and focuses upon the miniature double “V” at the heart of the Pei pyramid. To understand the hermeneutic circle of “The Da Vinci Code,” consider the conversation between Professor Langdon (Tom Hanks) and Sir Leigh Teabing (Ian McKellen) about whether Jesus Christ is a man-god or was married and had a child. Two factions of the Catholic Church take opposing positions on this issue. The Priory of Sion is devoted to protecting the descendant of the marriage of Mary Magdalene and Jesus Christ, while Opus Dei insists that Christ never married and sets about preventing any evidence to the contrary from surfacing.

这场看似枯燥乏味、充满智慧的神学争论，却对人类产生了可怕的后果：影片以锡安隐修会成员雅克·索尼埃被主业会的忠实信徒西拉斯谋杀开始。罗伯特·兰登是一位来巴黎讲授古代符号的美国学者，法国警探认为他就是杀害索尼埃的凶手。索尼埃的侄女索菲·奈芙帮助兰登逃脱警方追捕，以便两人能一起找出谁才是谋杀的真正凶手。但《达芬奇密码》与典型的谋杀悬疑不同，该悬疑故事的解决不仅涉及确定和找到凶手，还涉及破解索尼埃留下的密码。该密码包含文件和证据，表明基督是人，而不是人神，他与抹大拉的玛利亚生了一个孩子。谋杀是吸引我们兴趣并引导我们追寻达芬奇密码的一种手段，即解释符号并遵循它们的指示。只有通过解决密码问题，兰登教授才能找到真正的凶手，并理解为什么他被列为主要嫌疑人。

This seemingly dry and intellectual theological controversy has terrible human consequences: the film begins with the murder of Jacques Saunière, a member of the Priory of Sion, by Silas, a monk who is a loyal follower of Opus Dei. Robert Langdon, an American academic who has come to Paris to give a lecture on ancient symbols, is believed by the French police inspector to be the murderer of Saunière. Sophie Neveu, the niece of Saunière, helps Langdon escape from the police so that together they can find out who is really responsible for the murder. But “The Da Vinci Code” is to be distinguished from a typical murder mystery in that the resolution involves not merely identifying and finding the killer but also breaking the code left by Saunière. That code involves documentation and evidence of Christ as a man, not a man-god, who fathered a child with Mary Magdalene. The murder is a means of capturing our interest and drawing us into the pursuit of the Da Vinci code, that is, into interpreting symbols and following their directions. Only by solving this problem of the code can Professor Langdon find the real murderer and understand why he has been set up as the main suspect.

观众和苏菲和罗伯特一样困惑；对于我们来说，顺着电影情节线索，从最基本的层面理解它，也意味着解开达芬奇密码。事实上，雅克·索尼埃在临死前留下的线索体现了接受理论：他临死前的最后一件事是向苏菲和罗伯特提供别人无法理解的符号和标志，但会引起他们的反应，他希望这能导致发现刺客，并找到锡安隐修会的证据和文件。为了回应那些认为解读对于娱乐和欣赏来说不是必要的学生，这部电影要求观众，即使只是为了享受，也要参与解开密码的过程，这是一种解读行为。

The audience is as puzzled as Sophie and Robert; for us, following the plot line of the film, understanding it at the most basic level, also involves unraveling the Da Vinci code. In fact, Jacques Saunière leaves clues at his death that exemplify reception theory: his last act before dying is to provide Sophie and Robert with symbols and signs incomprehensible to others but evoking a response in them that, he hopes, will lead to the discovery of his assassin and to the evidence and documents of The Priory of Sion. In response to students who believe interpretation is not necessary for pleasure and appreciation, this film requires the audience, if only for purposes of enjoyment, to engage in the process of unraveling the code, an act of interpretation.

苏菲和罗伯特解开谜团并拯救自己的过程也是我们理解这部电影的手段。这个过程涉及接受理论的许多要素。首先，索尼埃必须为罗伯特和苏菲提供足够的线索来破解密码，但又不能给其他人，尤其是刺客提供足够的信息来抢先一步。因此，他故意设置了伊瑟尔所说的“空白”或“缺口”，他希望只有罗伯特和苏菲才能正确填写。伊瑟尔在阅读文本的背景下描述了这个过程，但它同样适用于回应一部电影：

The process by which Sophie and Robert unravel the mystery and save themselves is also the means by which we understand the film. This procedure involves many of the elements of reception theory. First, Saunière must provide sufficient clues for Robert and Sophie to solve the code and yet not enough information for anyone else, particularly his assassins, to beat them to it. So he deliberately provides what Iser calls “gaps” or “blanks,” ones that he hopes only Robert and Sophie will be able fill in correctly. Iser describes this procedure in the context of reading a text, but it applies equally to responding to a film:

由于没有一个故事可以完整地讲述，文本本身充满了空白和间隙，阅读时必须处理这些空白和间隙。每当读者填补空白时，交流就开始了。间隙或结构化空白 […] 充当着整个文本与读者关系的枢纽，因为它们刺激读者按照文本设定的条件进行构思过程 [ 如何做， 64]。

As no story can ever be told in its entirety, the text itself is punctuated by blanks and gaps that have to be negotiated in the act of reading. Whenever the reader bridges a gap, communication begins. The gaps or structured blanks […] function as a kind of pivot on which the whole text–reader relationship revolves, because they stimulate the process of ideation to be performed by the reader on terms set by the text [How to do, 64].

例如，当罗伯特第一次看到索尼埃的尸体时，他意识到警官认为尸体上的痕迹是魔鬼崇拜的象征是错误的。相反，罗伯特意识到尸体上的痕迹是为了引导他找到卢浮宫里的其他线索，从而开始了死者和教授之间的交流。此外，索尼埃还很聪明地引导罗伯特并误导了警督，我们后来得知，他是反对派组织 Opus Dei 的成员，对此次暗杀事件负责。

For instance, when Robert is first shown the dead body of Saunière, he realizes that the police inspector is wrong in believing that the marks on the corpse are symbols of devil-worship. On the contrary, Robert recognizes that the marks on the body are designed to lead him to other clues in the Louvre, and thus begins the communication between the dead man and the professor. Moreover, Saunière has been clever enough to lead Robert and mislead the police inspector who, we later learn, is a member of the opposition group, Opus Dei, responsible for the assassination.

接受理论的另一个元素与这部电影有关，即解释学循环的手段和目的之间的关系。事实上，这部电影是一系列同心圆。最里面的圆涉及警探，他被主教（主业会的高级成员）误导，相信罗伯特是凶手。最后，警探意识到自己被骗了。伊瑟尔将解释学循环证明是错误的手段称为“否定”：

Another element of reception theory pertaining to this film is the relation between the means and ends of the hermeneutic circle. In fact, the movie is a series of concentric circles. The innermost circle concerns the police inspector who is led to believe by the bishop, a high-ranking member of Opus Dei, that Robert is the murderer. In the end the inspector realizes he has been duped. The means by which hermeneutic circles are shown to be erroneous are called by Iser “negation”:

然而，在文本系统中，还有另一个地方是文本和读者的交汇点，那里以各种类型的否定为标志。空白和否定都以不同的方式控制意义的组装过程。空白使文本视角之间的联系保持开放。[…] 各种类型的否定都会调用熟悉和确定的知识元素，只是为了将它们取消。然而，被取消的内容仍然存在，从而导致读者对熟悉或确定内容的态度发生变化 [如何做，64-5]。

There is, however, another place in the textual system where text and reader converge, and that is marked by various types of negation. Blanks and negations both control the process of meaning assembly in different ways. The blanks leave open the connections between textual perspectives. […] The various types of negation invoke familiar and determinate elements of knowledge only to cancel them out. What is cancelled, however, remains in view, and thus brings about modifications in the reader’s attitudes to what is familiar or determinate [How to do, 64–5].

警官声称尸体上的符号是崇拜魔鬼的象征，这一说法被罗伯特“推翻”了，但不变的事实是，索尼埃故意使用了一个在大多数人看来是魔鬼的符号，但对罗伯特来说，它却是破解达芬奇密码的线索。

The police inspector’s assertion that the symbol on the dead body is one of devil worship is “cancelled” out by Robert, but what remains is the fact that Saunière deliberately used a sign that would appear to most as that of the devil but to Robert as a clue toward resolving the Da Vinci code.

下一个循环涉及富有的英国历史学家雷·提彬爵士。罗伯特和索菲向他求助，因为他是圣杯传说的专家，他认为圣杯传说指的不是传统的亚瑟王容器，而是基督之子的容器——抹大拉的玛利亚。但提彬原来是索尼埃谋杀案的幕后主谋。因此，第二个循环与第一个循环一样，涉及欺骗，迫使索菲和罗伯特重新开始，形成一个新的解释循环。最后，最后一个也是最大的一个循环，包括另外两个循环，是罗伯特最终视为血统的“玫瑰线”，即索菲·奈芙是基督最后一位幸存的祖先。她的祖先的这个元素一直被保密，以保护她免受主业会的侵害。请注意，解释循环并不总是以解决方案结束；正如我们所见，它可能被“取消”或“否定”，这表明另一种方法可能更有成效。驱使我们去寻找另一个更合适的解释学循环的力量是解释性的探索，这种探索包罗万象，将所有空白连接到一个连贯的结局或目标：“读者徘徊的视角[…]在所有这些片段之间穿梭，在时间流逝中不断切换[…]将它们交织在一起[…][从而]形成了一个网络”[如何做，65]。

The next circle involves Sir Leigh Teabing, the rich British historian. Robert and Sophie turn to him because he is an expert in the Holy Grail legend that he believes refers not to the traditional Arthurian vessel but to Mary Magdalene as the vessel of the child of Christ. But Teabing turns out to be the mastermind behind the murder of Saunière. Thus, this second circle, like the first, involves deception, forcing Sophie and Robert to begin again, to form a new interpretive circle. And finally, the last and largest circle, encompassing the other two, is the “rose line” that Robert finally sees as the bloodline, the realization that Sophie Neveu is the last surviving ancestor of Christ. This element of her ancestry has been kept secret to protect her from Opus Dei. Notice that the hermeneutic circle does not always end in resolution; as we have seen, it may be “cancelled” or “negated,” suggesting that an alternative approach is likely to be more fruitful. The force that drives us to search for another more appropriate hermeneutic circle is the interpretive quest, one that is all-encompassing, connecting all of the blanks toward a coherent end or goal: “the reader’s wandering viewpoint […] travels between all these segments, its constant switching during the time flow […] intertwines them […] [thus] bringing forth a network” [How to do, 65].

然而，《达芬奇密码》的最后一个圈子与其中的圈子不同。因为苏菲对自己作为救世主的女儿。她向罗伯特指出她不能在水上行走，罗伯特则向她暗示，字面上的真相不如她所相信的那么重要。因此，虽然较小的圆圈导致了错误的字面答案，罗伯特是凶手，利是公正的学者，但最后一个较大的圆圈是真正的诠释学，它基于信仰和文献，而不是像其他两个圆圈那样，基于经验证据的欺骗性表象。这个圆圈开头和结尾的双“v”代表男性和女性的混合，相信上帝不能被任何单一性别所表征或限制。可以理解的是，《达芬奇密码》虽然很受欢迎，票房也很好，但却极具争议性，一些人认为它是一部无害的小说，而另一些人则认为它是破坏“真相”的手段。接受理论认为，无害的小说和“真相”是两个截然不同但不是同心的诠释学圆圈，每个圆圈都会导致不同的解释后果。 《达芬奇密码》表明，对于接受理论来说，解释是一种目的论行为，即它涉及与开端相关的最终目的，并且解释学循环会随着历史而变化，并随着个人信仰而变化。

The final circle of “The Da Vinci Code,” however, is different from those within it. For Sophie is diffident and skeptical about her role as the daughter of the Savior. She points out to Robert that she cannot walk on water, and Robert suggests to her that the literal truth is less important than what she believes. So while the smaller circles led to false literal answers, Robert as the murderer, Leigh as the disinterested scholar, the final larger circle is the genuine hermeneutic, one based upon belief and documents, not, as in the other two circles, the deceptive appearance of empirical evidence. And the double “v” at the beginning and end of this circle represents the commingling of male and female, the belief that God cannot be characterized by or limited to any single gender. Understandably, “The Da Vinci Code,” although popular and successful in box office terms, is highly controversial, some seeing it as a harmless fiction and others as a means to undermine “the truth.” And reception theory suggests that harmless fiction and “the truth” are two distinct but not concentric hermeneutic circles, each leading to different interpretive consequences. “The Da Vinci Code” demonstrates that for reception theory interpretation is a teleological act, that is, it involves ultimate ends related to beginnings, and that hermeneutic circles change in history and vary with personal beliefs.

电影中，否定在解释学循环中如何运作的最生动的例子可能涉及线索“教皇亚历山大”。像罗伯特和索菲一样，我们假设这个线索指的是一位名叫亚历山大的教皇，并寻找这位教皇的埋葬地。这种期望落空了，这再次表明解释学循环可能会导致僵局，迫使我们从新的出发点重新开始。罗伯特最终意识到这个线索指的是英国诗人亚历山大·蒲柏，电影错误地将他放在了威斯敏斯特大教堂艾萨克·牛顿爵士的葬礼上。改变最初的假设或第一个问题会导致不同的结论，不是罗马的教堂，而是伦敦的修道院。同样，否定或取消仍然存在，因为教皇亚历山大是为了误导敌人而设计的。对于学生们关于是否需要解读的问题，答案是，解读并不总是能救你的命，就像它救了索菲和罗伯特一样，但它会丰富你的生活：《达芬奇密码》可以作为一部有着深奥参考和美丽欧洲背景的“谁干的”谜题来欣赏，也可以作为一部关于基督是人神这一传统观点的替代性质的电影。

Perhaps the most vivid example of how negation operates within the hermeneutic circle in the film involves the clue, “Pope Alexander.” Like Robert and Sophie, we assume that the reference is to a Pope called Alexander and seek out the burial place of this Pope. That expectation is thwarted, another indication that hermeneutic circles may lead to impasses requiring us to begin again from a new point of departure. Robert eventually realizes that the reference is to Alexander Pope, the British poet who the movie erroneously places at the funeral of Sir Isaac Newton at Westminster Abbey. Changed initial assumptions or first questions lead to different conclusions, not to a church in Rome but an abbey in London. Again, the negative or cancelled remains in that Pope Alexander is designed to mislead the enemy. And the answer to the students’ questions about the need for interpretation is that it may not always save your life, as it does for Sophie and Robert, but it will enrich your life: “The Da Vinci Code” can be enjoyed as a “who done it” with esoteric references and lovely European setting, or as a film about the nature of an alternative to the traditional view of Christ as a man-god.

在这里，接受理论与解构主义之间的关系变得明显起来，因为伊瑟尔对《达芬奇密码》的这种解读最终揭示了传统观点，即基督是起源神话。伊瑟尔用文学术语解释了我认为也适用于电影的内容：“文学通过关注系统的缺陷来努力应对系统所产生的问题，从而使我们能够构建当时主流系统所隐藏或忽略的东西。同时，文本必须隐含地包含相关系统的基本框架，因为这就是文学所要应对的问题的原因”[《如何做》，63]。

Here the relationship between reception theory and deconstruction becomes overt, since this Iserian reading of “The Da Vinci Code” concludes by exposing the traditional position on Christ as an originary myth. Iser explains in literary terms what I believe also applies to film: “Literature endeavors to counter the problem produced by systems through focusing on their deficiencies, thus enabling us to construct whatever was concealed or ignored by the dominant systems of the day At the same time the text must implicitly contain the basic framework of the systems concerned, as this is what causes the problems that literature reacts to” [How to do, 63].

异质性与想象力：《天使爱美丽》

Otherness and imagination: “Amélie”

另一部商业上成功的电影是《天使爱美丽》（2001），但其重点是主角以喜剧方式选择退出体制。该片由让-皮埃尔·热内执导，奥黛丽·塔图主演。这部电影讲述了一个年轻女孩的故事，她由两个古怪的父母抚养长大，由于成长环境，她变得非常内向，有点古怪。第一部分关注的是个人差异和品味特质，这些差异和特质使人们彼此不同。艾米莉喜欢用手指吃覆盆子；她的母亲喜欢清洁手提包，不能容忍杂货店的人碰她的手；她的父亲喜欢清洁他的工具箱，当人们盯着他的凉鞋看时会感到不舒服。这些个性差异将我们作为个体区分开来，并与我们对艺术的不同反应有关。但问题是，如果允许这些个人差异成为解释的决定因素，结果就是完全主观的。对于接受理论来说，问题是我们如何接受个人的反应，但又能达成某种解释共识。从影片的角度来说，问题在于艾米莉如何走出自己的小圈子，同时又不失她独特的魅力和迷人的个性。

Another commercially successful movie but one that focuses upon a protagonist who opts out of the system in a comic mode, “Amélie” (2001) is directed by Jean-Pierre Jeunet and stars Audrey Tautou. This film is about a young girl, raised by two eccentric parents, who as a result of her upbringing becomes herself very introverted and somewhat eccentric. The first section focuses on the individual differences and idiosyncrasies of taste that distinguish people from one another. Amélie likes to eat raspberries on her fingers; her mother adores cleaning her handbag and cannot abide grocers who touch her hands; her father loves to clean his tool-box and is uncomfortable when people stare at his sandals. These personality differences separate us as individuals and are related to our different responses to art. But the problem is that if these personal distinctions are permitted to become determinants in interpretation, the result is total subjectivity. For reception theory the question is how we accept individual responses and yet arrive at some interpretive consensus. In the terms of the film, the question is how Amélie will come out of her shell and yet maintain her special charm, her winning individuality.

艾米莉走出自我、走向外部世界的过程始于她发现公寓的装饰线条后面藏着一个装满童年珍宝的盒子。她立即意识到这个盒子里“毫无价值”的东西对某人意义重大，于是开始寻找那个人。但是，为了保持她内向的性格，她设法将盒子归还给了主人，而没有亲自出现，主人也不知道谁应该归还盒子。然而，在距离归还盒子的那一刻很远的地方，她能够观察到，归还盒子给主人带来了多大的快乐，他细细品味着这些童年的纪念品。艾米莉现在发现，她可以通过利用自己对他人内心深处需求的敏感来给人带来快乐。她安排她工作的咖啡馆的一位常客与一位女同事建立关系。她帮助了当地杂货店里被老板欺负的年轻人。她意识到老板的权力感源自他对日常事务的确定性，于是她削弱了他的自信。但也许她最大的成就与她的父亲有关。雷蒙德独自生活，哀悼妻子的去世，几乎从不离开家，而是致力于为已故的妻子建造一座花园纪念碑。这个圣物箱中的物品中就有他最珍贵的地精。阿梅丽想出了一个绝妙的主意，偷走地精，然后让她的朋友——一名空姐——给她父亲寄去地精在各种异国他乡拍摄的照片明信片。起初，她的父亲感到困惑和不安，但最终他被迷住了，去明信片上的各个地方旅行。就这样，阿梅丽让她的父亲走出自我，进入世界。在每一个例子中，艾米莉都通过同理心的行为与个人建立了融洽的关系。从外表看，她仍然是一个内向的人，但内心里她已经变得面向他人。她已经成为一个接受理论家，能够预测别人会以与她截然不同的方式做出反应。在这一点上，“艾米莉”表明，个人的反应不一定会导致最终的差异，而可以成为一种沟通手段，一座理解他人的桥梁。

The process by which Amélie moves out of herself and toward the outside world begins when she discovers a box of childhood treasures hidden behind the molding in her apartment. She immediately realizes that the “worthless” contents of this box mean a great deal to someone and sets out to discover who it is. But, in keeping with her introverted personality, she manages to return the property to its owner without appearing herself and without the owner knowing who is responsible for returning the box. However, in being at one remove from the moment of repossession she is able to observe how much happiness the retrieval has given to the owner who savors the souvenirs of his childhood. Amélie now finds that she can give pleasure by exploiting her sensitivity to the deep inner needs of others. She arranges for one of the habitués of the café where she works to have a relationship with the woman who is a fellow worker. She helps the young man at the local grocery who is bullied by his boss. Recognizing that the boss’s sense of power derives from his certainty of his routine, she undermines his self-assurance. But perhaps her greatest accomplishment concerns her father. Living alone, mourning the loss of his wife, Raymond almost never leaves home, devoting himself instead to building a garden memorial to his late wife. Among the objects in this reliquary is his prize gnome. Amélie has the ingenious idea of stealing the gnome, then asking her friend, an airline stewardess, to send her father picture postcards of the gnome photographed in various exotic destinations. At first, her father is puzzled and troubled, but eventually he is intrigued, traveling to the various places on the postcards. Thus Amélie brings her father out of himself and into the world. In each of these instances, Amélie has established rapport with individuals by acts of empathy. Outwardly, she remains an introvert but inwardly she has become directed toward others. She has become a reception theorist, able to anticipate how others will respond in ways quite different from her own. At this point, “Amélie” has shown that individual responses need not necessarily lead to ultimate differences but can be a means of communication, a bridge to understanding otherness.

但艾米丽依然孤身一人，而玻璃人在这里至关重要。他是艾米丽公寓楼里那个骨瘦如柴的艺术家，从不敢外出。他的身体困境是艾米丽心理困境的镜像。他首先出现在故事​​中，帮助艾米丽找到盒子的主人。然后，他邀请艾米丽到他的公寓，向她展示他的画作，都是雷诺阿的《船上午餐》的复制品。但有一个人物让他很为难，因为他无法重现她的表情。看着原画，艾米丽认为这个女人可能专注于自己的思绪，在一个与画中其他人不同的世界里，一个想象的世界里。

But Amélie remains alone, and here the Glassman is crucial. He is the brittle-boned artist in her apartment building who can never venture outside. His physical dilemma is a mirror of Amélie’s psychological one. He first comes into the story by helping Amélie find the owner of the box. Then he invites Amélie into his apartment and shows her his paintings, all copies of Renoir’s “Luncheon of the Boating Party.” But one figure is causing him great difficulty because he cannot reproduce her expression. Looking at the original, Amélie suggests that the woman is probably preoccupied with her own thoughts, in a world not the same as that of the others in the picture, an imaginary realm.

想象力是伊瑟尔理论的重要组成部分。“长久以来，想象一直被认为是完美的有形体现，人们认为艺术只允许人类参与其中”[未来，220]。但伊瑟尔坚持认为，想象必须联系现实来理解。例如，格拉斯曼意识到，在分析画作《艾米丽》中的女人时，她无意识地描述了自己。通过这种方式，格拉斯曼发现了艾米丽深刻而敏感的想象力，我们在整个影片中都可以看到这一点。艾米丽的生活充满了想象的时刻，她会沉思有多少人达到了性高潮，或者她的同事们如何会彼此相爱。事实上，她的生活充满了想象力，她最好的朋友。

Imagination is an important element of Iser’s theory. “The imaginary has long been considered as a tangible manifestation of perfection, and it was assumed that art only allowed man’s participation in it” [Future, 220]. But Iser insists that imagination must be understood in relation to reality. For instance, the Glassman realizes that in analyzing the woman in the painting Amélie is unconsciously describing herself. By this means the Glassman discovers the deeply sensitive imagination of Amélie, which we see throughout the film. Amélie’s life is full of imaginary moments when she muses about how many people are having an orgasm or how her various co-workers could fall in love with one another. In fact her life is inhabited by the imagination, her best friend.

伊瑟尔解释说，想象力在我们的日常感知中发挥着重要作用：

Iser explains that the imagination has an important function in our everyday perceptions:

不管想象的潜力被视为完美、他性、认知的组织能力、无意识的幻想还是欲望，这些以本体论为导向的定义中的每一个都表明，它只有通过其功能才能被把握，因此与背景相关，这些背景可能是现有现实的反面形象，可能是被灵感震撼的世界，可能是认知能力的有组织的相互作用，可能是意识和无意识相互渗透的解释图式，也可能是一种迫切需要表达的缺失[未来，221]。

Whether the imaginary potential is viewed as perfection, otherness, the organizing faculty of cognition, unconscious fantasy, or desire, every one of these ontologically oriented definitions shows that it can only be grasped by way of its function and so in relation to contexts, which may be a counter-image to existing realities, a world shaken by inspiration, an organized interplay of cognitive faculties, an explanatory schema for the interpenetration of the conscious and unconscious, or a deprivation that cries out for expression [Future, 221].

通过望远镜，玻璃人看到艾米莉以所有这些方式运用她的想象力，尤其是最后一种，“一种迫切需要表达的匮乏”。他设计了一种巧妙的“表达”方式，就像艾米莉自己的诡计一样，他建议艾米莉不仅要参加满足他人的需要，也满足自己的需要。他通过一段视频向艾米丽传达了这个信息，视频中他解释说，如果艾米丽不出去寻求爱情和陪伴，她最终会像他一样，成为一个从不走出公寓的隐士。格拉斯曼之所以使用视频，是因为艾米丽发给他一段视频，因此他意识到，就像我们在看电影时一样，艾米丽不愿直接与人对抗，而是用视觉媒体来代替谈话。从这个意义上说，艾米丽是后现代话语的产物，特别是视觉媒体，我们不应该惊讶地发现，她与一个男人的第一次成功的关系是通过照片建立起来的。

Through his telescope, the Glassman sees Amélie using her imagination in all of these ways, most particularly the last, “a deprivation that cries out for expression.” And he devises a clever means of “expression,” rather like Amélie’s own ploys, by suggesting that Amélie must not only attend to the needs of others but also to her own. He communicates this message to Amélie by way of a video in which he explains that if Amélie does not go out in quest of love and companionship she will end up like himself, a recluse never venturing out of his apartment. The Glassman resorts to a video because Amélie has sent him one, and he thus comes to realize, as we do watching the film, that Amélie is reticent about confronting people directly, resorting instead to visual media as a surrogate for conversation. In that sense, Amélie is a child of post-modern discourse, in particular, visual media, and we should not be surprised to find that her first successful relationship with a man is accomplished by way of pictures.

事实上，艾米莉进入这个世界的最后阶段是通过一本相册完成的。相册的主人匆忙中丢下了相册，艾米莉通过猫捉老鼠的游戏找到了他，这种游戏让两人可以看到对方，但对方却看不到他。通过这种方式，两人可以在不做出任何事先承诺的情况下决定自己是否被对方吸引和感兴趣。在这里，我们看到了伊瑟尔接受理论的另一个要素：游戏或玩耍的功能。

In fact, the final stage in Amélie’s emergence into the world is accomplished by way of a photo album. The owner dropped the album in haste and Amélie tracked him down by way of a cat and mouse game that enabled each to see the other without being seen. In this way, each could decide if they were attracted to and interested in the other without making any prior commitment. Here we see another element of Iser’s reception theory: the function of games or play.

游戏还构建了虚构与想象之间的相互渗透，但并未确定二者之间的关系，而是在真正的游戏中展开。游戏同时允许我们逆转所玩的游戏，从而抹去在关系上留下的明确印记，以不同的方式体现想象。随着游戏的进行，任何由思考进行的控制、意识与想象之间的相互作用都突显出一个事实，即两者都不能独立于对方而存在。这种相互作用没有正式的界限，尽管每部特定作品都以自己的方式进行游戏。事实上，游戏本身成为了一种呈现无法定义之物的方式，而那些通过文学作品观察到的想象元素只能通过游戏来反映出来[未来，224]。

Play also structures the interpenetration of the fictional and the imaginary, without determining the relationship, which unfolds itself in a veritable welter of games. It simultaneously allows us to reverse the games we play, and thus erase the definite imprint made on the relationship in order to manifest the imaginary differently. As play proceeds, any control exercised by thinking, the interplay between the conscious and the imaginary highlights the fact that neither exists independently of the other. There are no formal boundaries to this interplay, even though every particular work plays the game in its own way. Indeed, the game itself becomes a means of making present that which defies definition, while those elements of the imaginary that are to be observed through the literary work can only be mirrored forth by way of the game [Future, 224].

当然，艾米丽和尼诺玩游戏是因为她对相册很感兴趣。在这里，我们看到了想象与现实相互作用的另一个例子。尼诺将丢弃的护照照片碎片拼凑在一起，就像艾米丽试图使她的朋友和熟人支离破碎的情感生活连贯起来一样。这些以与众不同的方式让她着迷的人就像尼诺相册中被撕碎的照片一样呈现在她面前，是那些抛弃自己碎片的人的心理快照，他们已经失去了在世界上留下印记或实现完全个性的希望。

Of course, Amélie plays games with Nino because she is intrigued by the photo album. Here we see another instance of the interplay between the imagination and reality. Nino pieces together fragments of discarded passport photos much as Amélie attempts to give coherence to the fragmented emotional lives of her friends and acquaintances. And these others who fascinate her by way of their otherness present themselves to her like the torn photos in Nino’s album, psychological snapshots of those who throw away the scraps of themselves, having lost hope in making their mark in the world or achieving full individuality.

艾米莉和尼诺玩游戏的结果，正如伊塞尔所说，是一个可能无法预见的结果，就是他们坠入爱河，发现他们有相似的兴趣，喜欢玩类似的游戏。伊瑟尔解释说，接受理论的功能之一是它能“使人类自我启蒙——不是通过以前被认为是教育先决条件的百科全书式的知识积累来实现的，而是通过阐明我们的潜意识准则，从而引发一种长期的反思过程，这种反思不再寻求某种理想的实现。相反，这个过程将使我们能够看透日常生活世界向我们提供的态度，即使不是强加给我们的态度”[未来，226]。

The result of the games played by Amélie and Nino, a result that, as Iser might have put it, may not have been foreseen, is that they fall in love, discovering that they have similar interests, enjoy playing similar games. Iser explains that one of the functions of reception theory is that it produces “self-enlightenment of the human being—not to be brought about by the erstwhile encyclopedic accumulation of knowledge considered to be a prerequisite for education, but by elucidating our unconscious guidelines, thereby triggering a chronic process of reflection which no longer seeks its fulfillment in some kind of ideal. Rather, this process will enable us to see through the attitudes offered to us, if not imposed upon us by our everyday world” [Future, 226].

艾米莉已经接受了自己是一个促进他人爱的自我形象，现在她惊讶地发现自己的爱也得到了回报，因为尼诺也有类似的自我形象。但影片的结局使这种关系象征着某种更大的东西，即伊瑟尔所说的文学人类学，或者，更广泛地说，我称之为艺术人类学。我们看到艾米莉的生活与蒙马特文化有何关联，蒙马特是整部影片生动呈现的巴黎地区。在这方面，有趣的是，影片的编剧兼导演热内住在蒙马特，对面就是咖啡店“两座风车”，这部电影的拍摄让这家咖啡店成为了一个旅游景点，拐角处的科利尼翁市场也是如此。

Amélie has reconciled herself to the self-image of one who facilitates the love of others and now is surprised to find her own love reciprocated because Nino has a similar self-image. But the conclusion of the film makes this relationship emblematic of something larger, what Iser calls literary anthropology, or, by extension, what I would call artistic anthropology. We are led to see how the life of Amélie is related to the culture of Montmartre, the section of Paris so vividly presented throughout the film. In this regard, it is interesting that Jeunet, the writer and director of the film, lives in Montmartre across the street from the coffee shop, “The Two Windmills,” that as a result of the film has become a tourist attraction, as has Collignon’s market around the corner.

影片最终以文化现实为基础，解释了相册中反复出现的人，阿梅莉认为这个人一定是相册的创造者。最后我们得知，他是照相机器的修理工，而他拍摄的许多照片只是他测试机器的结果。我们和阿梅莉一起想象了各种复杂的心理原因，以解释这个男人似乎对自己形象的痴迷，当一个更平凡的答案出现时，我们也和她一样感到惊讶。伊瑟尔对这一过程的解释如下：

The film finally grounds itself in cultural reality with the explanation of the person who appears repeatedly in the photo album, whom Amélie thinks must be its creator. In the end we learn that he is the repairman of the photo machines and that the many photos of him are merely products of his tests of the machines. We joined with Amélie in imagining all sorts of complex psychological explanations for this man’s seeming obsession with his own image, and share her surprise when a more mundane solution presents itself. Iser accounts for this procedure as follows:

最初看似对我们假设的肯定，最终却导致我们自己拒绝这些假设，从而倾向于让我们为重新定位做好准备。只有当我们超越先入之见，离开熟悉的庇护所时，我们才有能力获得新的经验 [...] [我们参与] 幻觉的形成，同时也参与了打破幻觉的手段的形成 [ NLH，141]。

What at first seemed to be an affirmation of our assumptions leads to our own rejection of them, thus tending to prepare us for a re-orientation. And it is only when we have outstripped our preconceptions and left the shelter of the familiar that we are in a position to gather new experiences […] [we are involved] in the formation of illusion and the simultaneous formation of the means whereby the illusion is punctured [NLH, 141].

这位男子的许多照片碎片可以看作是不幸的人支离破碎的生存的象征，他们像艾米莉一样，因为这样或那样的原因而孤立和自我陶醉。现在我们知道了照片修复工是社区的普通成员，我们就可以理解现代城市生活本身就是支离破碎的，这是大多数居民以某种方式感受到的体验，这种意识将艾米莉和尼诺联系在一起。我们对艾米莉和尼诺关系的出现及其发生背景的反应，使我们对蒙马特的文化、城市的文化有所了解文化，或者说我们自己的文化：“[艺术] 介入现实环境，通过强调与制约它的环境之间的差异性来确立其独特性。通过这种方式，它勾勒出新的领域，并将其铭刻在已经形成的文化地形中。因为如果存在的事物不是一切，那么存在的事物就必须是可以改变的”[未来，227]。艾米莉的变化在于，她不再为他人寻找爱，而是为自己寻找爱。我们发现，自我和日常生活的碎片化并不是艾米莉独有的，而是城市生活和我们文化的一部分。

The scraps of the many pictures of this man could be seen as a symbol of the fragmented existence of unfortunate people who, like Amélie, are for one reason or another isolated and self-absorbed. Now that we know that the photo repairman is a normal member of the community, we are led to understand that modern urban existence is itself fragmented, an experience that most inhabitants feel in one way or another, an awareness that brings together Amélie and Nino. Our response to the emergence of the relationship of Amélie and Nino and the context in which it occurs leads us to understand something about the culture of Montmartre, of urban culture, or our own culture: “[art] intervenes in its real environment and establishes its uniqueness not least by highlighting its otherness in relation to the situations that have conditioned it. In this manner it adumbrates new regions which it inscribes into the already chartered topography of culture. For if what is, is not everything, what is must be changeable” [Future, 227]. What changes for Amélie is that instead of finding love for others she finds it for herself. And we discover that fragmentation of self and of daily life is not exclusive to Amélie but a part of urban life, our culture.

差距或空白和想象：“罗拉快跑”

Gaps or blanks and imagination: “Run Lola Run”

现在，我来谈谈读者的想象力如何在解读过程中发挥作用，填补“空白”或“空白”。伊瑟尔再次从阅读文学的角度来阐述空白，但从最广泛的意义上讲，大多数人类问题都受制于与阅读类似的过程：成功的对话，两个人利用想象力相互理解，涉及类似的过程：

I turn now to how the reader’s imagination functions in the interpretive process to fill in the “gaps” or “blanks.” Again, Iser formulates blanks in terms of reading literature, but in the largest sense most human problems are subject to a process analogous to reading: successful conversation, two people using their imagination to understand one another, involves a similar process:

空白表示文本的不同部分和模式需要连接，尽管文本本身没有这样说。它们是文本中看不见的关节，因为它们将模式和文本视角彼此区分开来，同时促使读者进行思考。因此，当模式和视角连接在一起时，空白就“消失”了（如何做，65）。

Blanks indicate that the different segments and patterns of the text are to be connected even though the text itself does not say so. They are the unseen joints of the text, as they mark off patterns and textual perspectives from one another, and simultaneously prompt acts of ideation on the reader’s part. Consequently, when the patterns and perspectives have been linked together, the blanks “disappear” (How to do, 65).

电影《罗拉快跑》阐述了空白的概念。该片由汤姆·提克弗编剧兼导演，于 1998 年首次上映，弗兰卡·波坦特饰演罗拉，莫里兹·布雷多饰演曼尼。这部电影与接受理论特别相关，因为它分为三个部分，每个部分都是同一故事的不同版本。三个版本之间的差异在于如何填补空白。空白很重要，因为它们不仅是达到同一目的的不同手段，也是达到不同目的的不同方式，即故事的结局。三个版本都面临着同样的问题，罗拉逃跑的原因是她的男朋友曼尼需要筹集 10 万德国马克，否则将面临可怕的惩罚，甚至是死亡。所有版本的另一个共同点是，当洛拉接到曼尼的求救电话时，她从公寓里跑出来，当时她的母亲正在打电话讨论每日星座运势，她走下楼梯，遇到了一个男孩和他的狗。螺旋楼梯场景让人想起希区柯克的《迷魂记》中的一个著名场景，这是一个典型的象征，象征着一段旅程的开始和神秘的结局。

The notion of gaps, or blanks, is illustrated by a movie entitled “Run Lola Run.” Written and directed by Tom Tykver, the film first appeared in 1998, starring Franka Potente as Lola and Moritz Bleibtreu as Manni. This movie is particularly pertinent to reception theory because it is divided up into three parts, each of which is a different version of essentially the same story. The differences between the three versions have to do with how the blanks or gaps are filled in. And blanks or gaps are important because they are not merely different means to the same end but also to different ends, to how the story (stories) concludes. All three versions share the same problem, the reason Lola runs is that her boyfriend Manni needs to raise 100,000 Deutschmarks or face terrible punishment, perhaps even death. Another common thread in all versions is that, once Lola receives the call for help from Manni, she runs out of an apartment where her mother is on the phone discussing the daily horoscope and descends the stairway to be confronted by a boy and his dog. The spiral staircase scene is reminiscent of a famous scene in Hitchcock’s “Vertigo,” an archetypal symbol of the beginning of a journey with a mysterious end.

因为洛拉只有 20 分钟的时间来取钱，所以在男孩和他的狗周围浪费的时间对结果至关重要。在第一个版本中，狗对着洛拉狂吠，吓得她跑得更快。在第二个版本中，狗绊倒了她，耽误了她的时间，而在第三个版本中，洛拉跳过了狗，比前两个版本快了几秒钟。乍一看，下楼梯所用时间的最初差异似乎足以解释这三种不同的结果。但也有涉及反应和接受的心理因素。例如，在第一个版本中，洛拉跑到一辆汽车前面，造成了事故，因此她到达银行时，父亲的谈话清楚地表明他与同事有染。现在洛拉知道了他的外遇，当她向父亲要钱时，他不仅拒绝了，还告诉她她不是他的女儿。萝拉的反应是跑去求助曼尼，结果却发现他正忙于抢劫，最终导致萝拉死亡。我们可以推断，她的失望或绝望导致了她的死亡。

Because Lola has only 20 minutes to get the money, the amount of time lost in getting around the boy and his dog is crucial to the outcome. In the first version, the dog barks at Lola, frightening her into running faster. In the second version the dog trips her up, delaying her, and in the third version Lola jumps over the dog, gaining a few seconds on the first two versions. At first viewing, it might appear that this initial difference in the time taken descending the staircase is sufficient to account for the three different outcomes. But there are also psychological factors involving response and reception. For instance, in version one, Lola runs in front of a car, causing an accident, and therefore arrives at the bank at the moment when it becomes clear from her father’s conversation that he is having an affair with a colleague. Now that Lola knows about his affair, when she asks her father for money he not only refuses but also tells her that she is not his daughter. Lola’s response is to run to the aid of Manni, only to find him in the midst of the holdup that results in her death. We may infer that her disappointment or despair have contributed to her death.

在第二个版本中，我们开始明白漏洞是什么，因为它们以不同的方式被填补。这一次，洛拉晚了一点才到，得知她父亲的情妇，银行董事会成员，怀上了另一个男人的孩子。洛拉不仅对她父亲感到愤怒，也对他的情妇感到愤怒，她决定抢劫银行，把钱带给曼尼。不幸的是，在她赶到他身边之前，他被救护车撞倒了。由于抢劫银行，她来不及救曼尼。我们可以推断，洛拉对银行经理的厌恶导致她来不及帮助曼尼。

By the second version we begin to understand what the gaps are because they are filled in a different way. On this occasion, Lola, arriving a bit later, learns that her father’s mistress, a member of the board of directors of the bank, is pregnant by another man. Angry now not just at her father but also at his mistress, Lola decides to rob the bank, taking the money to Manni. Unfortunately, he is run over by an ambulance before she can get to him. As a result of robbing the bank she arrives too late to rescue Manni. We may infer that Lola’s disgust at the bank’s managers has contributed to her being too late to help Manni.

第三个版本以另一种方式填补了空白。洛拉跳过了那只狗，从而避免了前两个版本中发生的车祸。我们现在知道，其中一辆车是用来接洛拉的父亲去吃午饭的。当洛拉到达银行时，她的父亲已经走了。因此，她去了赌场，赢了足够多的钱来偿还曼尼的债务。与此同时，曼尼找到了拿走钱的流浪汉，用枪换了钱。我们再次需要决定或通过解释来填补空白：是什么驱使洛拉冒着在赌场输掉所有奖金的风险，是什么让曼尼相信流浪汉仍然拿着他的钱。而心理元素在三个版本的萝拉和曼尼同床共枕的场景中得到强调，他们互相询问关于爱情和死亡的问题，表明两人最基本的动力就是想要拯救对方，这一点在影片结尾得到了强化，他们高兴地离开，因为自己很安全，而且能和对方在一起，而曼尼并不知道萝拉可能中了彩票。

The third version fills in the blanks in still another way. Lola jumps over the dog, thereby avoiding the car accident that happened in the two earlier versions. One of these cars, we now learn, is meant to pick up Lola’s father for a luncheon appointment. When Lola gets to the bank her father is gone. She therefore goes to a casino, winning more than enough money to cover Manni’s debt. Meanwhile, finding the homeless man who has taken his money, Manni trades his gun for the money. We are again left to decide or fill in the blanks by way of interpretation: what drove Lola to risk all of her winnings at the casino and what led Manni to believe that the homeless man still had his money. And the psychological element is emphasized by the scenes between the three versions of Lola and Manni in bed together asking one another questions about love and death, establishing that the basic drive for both is their desire to save one another, a point reinforced at the end of the film when they walk away delighted simply to be safe and with one another, Manni unaware that Lola has won possibly the equivalent of the lottery.

这部电影清楚地表明，人类处境中的差距或空白是复杂的，因为它们不仅涉及反应，还涉及对反应的反应，就像 Lola 和她父亲之间或 Lola 和 Manni 之间的反应一样。在生活中，尽管空间和时间有限，但人类互动的结果往往会改变最终结果。在接受理论中，空间和时间的局限性体现在艺术作品上，最明显的是故事，我们对艺术的反应不是改变实际的结局，而是改变我们对结局的解读。

This movie makes clear that gaps or blanks in human situations are complex because they involve not just responses but responses to responses, like that between Lola and her father or between Lola and Manni. In life, the result of human interaction often changes the end results in spite of limitations of space and time. In reception theory, the limitations of space and time are represented by a work of art, most notably a story, and our response to art changes not the actual end but our interpretation of the end.

接受理论认为解释很重要。人们可能认为《罗拉快跑》不过是空间和时间偶然性如何影响我们生活的三个版本。但这无法解释这样一个事实：曼尼和罗拉是资产阶级社会中的边缘人，这个社会由像罗拉的母亲一样的人组成，她自满地沉浸在自己的世界中，而她的父亲在商业上取得了成功，但对妻子和“古怪”的女儿深感不满。此外，我们无法解释为什么曼尼把枪给了拿走他钱的流浪汉。电影的解读者可能会推测，曼尼对乞丐有一种亲切感，乞丐是资产阶级繁荣和中产阶级舒适主导的社会中的另一个边缘人。接受理论鼓励我们推断是什么让罗拉奔跑，即对曼尼的爱使她与家人区分开来，这一因素可能导致悲剧或喜剧后果。

Reception theory assumes the importance of interpretation. One may view “Run Lola Run” as no more than three versions of how the contingencies of space and time affect our lives. But that would fail to account for the fact that Manni and Lola are marginals in a bourgeois society comprised of people like Lola’s mother, complacently encapsulated in her own world, and her father, successful in commercial terms but deeply unhappy with his wife and “weird” daughter. Furthermore, we are left with no explanation of why Manni gives the gun to the homeless man who has taken his money. An interpreter of the film might surmise that Manni feels an affinity with the beggar, another marginal in a society dominated by bourgeois prosperity and middle-class comfort. Reception theory encourages us to draw inferences about what makes Lola run, namely, that love for Manni distinguishes her from her family, a factor that can lead to tragic or comic consequences.

电影中，洛拉在奔跑时遇到的人们，其不同的插入场景说明了解读不仅是我们对待艺术的关键因素，也是我们生活中的关键因素。例如，在每个版本中，洛拉都快速地从一位推着婴儿车的女人身边走过。电影为我们提供了一个带括号的想象序列，展示了她未来会发生什么，每个版本都与她对洛拉的反应有关。在第一个版本中，社会服务机构带走了她的孩子后，她绑架了一个婴儿。在第二个版本中，她中了彩票，在第三个版本中，她皈依了宗教。每个插入场景都与洛拉对女人不同反应的反应有关。我们从人类互动中得出的推论是艺术解读的关键，也是我们与他人日常对话的一部分。

The manner in which interpretation is a key factor in our lives, not just in our approach to art, is illustrated in the movie by the different inset scenarios for the people Lola sees on her run. For instance, in each version Lola passes quickly by a woman pushing a baby stroller. The film gives us a parenthesized imaginary sequence of what happens to her in the future, each version related to how she responds to Lola. In version one, she kidnaps a baby after social services has taken away her child. In version two, she wins the lottery, and in version three, she has a religious conversion. Each inset scenario is related to Lola’s response to the woman’s different responses. Inferences we draw from human interaction are key to artistic interpretation and are a part of our daily conversations with others.

这些插入场景强调了想象力在解释行为中的作用。对于伊瑟尔来说，解释是对“意向性”的追求，这个术语源自现象学，其含义与其说是艺术家的意图，不如说是艺术作品的最终目标。当应用于日常生活时，这种区别就不那么模糊了：在谈话中，我们经常会遇到有人宣布的意图与他或她的话所传达的完全不同——比如当人们说“对不起”时，其实是想说“请让开”。意向性，即某人真正想要表达的意思，通常与说话者断言的意图不同。对于伊瑟尔来说，寻求意向性的过程需要想象力。

These inset scenarios make emphatic the role of the imagination in the act of interpretation. For Iser, interpretation is a quest for “intentionality,” a term derived from phenomenology that means not so much the intention of the artist but the ultimate goal of the work of art. This distinction becomes less obscure when applied to everyday life: in conversation we often experience someone announcing an intention quite different from what his or her words communicate—as when people say “sorry” but mean “please move out of my way.” Intentionality, what someone is really getting at, is often different from that expressed by the speaker’s assertion of intention. The process of seeking intentionality requires, for Iser, the imagination.

想象与故事或“虚构”的解读之间的关系涉及伊瑟尔所说的“游戏”。在这方面，重要的是要记住，在简短的介绍之后，《罗拉快跑》以裁判将足球抛向空中，宣布“比赛开始”开始。保持考虑到插图中的场景似乎是 Lola 对她在跑步时见到的人的想象，以下描述是恰当的：

The relationship between the imagination and interpretation of the story or “fiction” involves what Iser calls “play.” In this regard, it is important to recall that after a brief introduction, “Run Lola Run” begins with a referee throwing a soccer ball into the air, announcing, “Let play begin.” Keeping in mind that the inset scenarios seem to be imaginings of Lola concerning people she sees on her run, the following description is apt:

[…] 想象本身没有意向性，但其激活者要求它具有意向。正因为没有意向性，它才似乎对所有意向都持开放态度，这些意向总是与它们所引发的事物联系在一起，因此激活者会“发生”一些事情。因此，想象永远不可能与它的意向引导的动员完全相同 […] 相反，想象在与不同激活者的相互作用中暴露自己。这种相互作用既不等同于意向，也不等同于它所带来的想象的格式塔，尽管这种格式塔不可能在没有想象的意向引导的动员的情况下形成 [ 《虚构》，223]。

[…] the imaginary has no intentionality of its own but has intentions imposed on it by the demands of its activator. And precisely because it is without intentionality, it appears to be open to all intentions that will always be tied to what they trigger, so that something will “happen” to the activator. Thus the imaginary can never be identical to its intention-led mobilization […] Instead the imagination exposes itself in interplay with its different activators. This interplay is identical neither to the intentions nor to the imaginary gestalt that it brings about, although this gestalt could not come into being without the intention-led mobilization of the imaginary [The Fictive, 223].

再想想那个推着婴儿车的女人。洛拉显然是这些想象离题的激活者；只有她才有故事的意图，即按时把钱带给曼尼。从洛拉的角度来看，这个女人只是一个障碍，尽管没有迹象表明这是这个女人的“意图”。这个女人的每一个不同场景都由洛拉对这个女人对她的看法的想象性解读决定。因此，想象力充当了解读的工具，它涉及到对最终目标的概念，从女人成为罪犯到她经历宗教皈依。因此，我们被鼓励用我们的想象力来解读《罗拉快跑》，把这部电影的意图看作不仅仅是按时把钱带给曼尼。

Consider again the woman with the pram. Lola is clearly the activator of these imaginary digressions; she alone has the intentionality of the story, to bring Manni the money on time. From Lola’s point of view, the woman is merely an obstruction, although there is no indication that such is the woman’s “intention.” Each different scenario of this woman is determined by Lola’s imaginative interpretation of the woman’s view of her. Imagination thus serves as the tool of interpretation, which involves a conception of an end-goal, from the woman becoming a criminal to her experiencing a religious conversion. We are thus encouraged to use our imagination to interpret “Run Lola Run,” to see the intentionality of the film as beyond that of getting the money to Manni on time.

对于伊瑟尔来说，想象力是诠释过程的一个关键要素，因此它并不被视为一种脱离现实、服务于幻想目的的思维能力。相反，想象力与现实或故事中看似真实的东西交织在一起，帮助我们发现艺术目标。电影为这一概念提供了一个生动的例子。在前两个版本中，一个男人想把他的自行车卖给萝拉；他是边缘人物，是萝拉想象的主体。然而，在最后一个版本中，无家可归的人买下了自行车，自行车成为了故事的主要部分，这说明边缘和想象力可以进入现实或虚构的表面现实，因为自行车显然有其用途，在本例中，是无家可归的人的交通工具。伊瑟尔解释道：“由于普通世界中游戏的短暂性与可以实现的目标相适应，因此游戏哲学需要假定目的”[ 《虚构》，224]。发现目的需要选择性，即决定在推进叙事到结尾时什么更重要或更不重要。通常，就像在《罗拉快跑》中一样，选择涉及多个文本、不同的跑步和各种插入场景，或者伊瑟尔所说的文本集群或“互文性”：“集群增加了游戏空间的复杂性，因为典故和引语在与旧背景和新背景的关系中呈现出新的维度。“由于新旧都潜在地存在，不同的话语共存，以淡入淡出的方式揭示各自的语境”[《虚构》，227]。最后，当罗拉和曼尼开心地走在街上时，之前的两次奔跑并没有被抹去。相反，我们推断，在早期版本中导致罗拉和曼尼死亡的力量和因素在最后一个版本中也发挥了作用。他们的生死与他们各自的目标和意向性关系不大；事实上，他们是一个矩阵中的棋子，被更强大的力量控制着，而这些力量超出了他们的控制范围。也许这部电影的“意向性”在于，我们坚持将解读作为我们唯一最终控制的元素，不确定这是否也是我们最终的幻觉，我们一边接近它，一边又远离它。

Since for Iser imagination is a key element of the interpretive process, it is not seen as a faculty of mind apart from reality that serves the purposes of fantasy. Rather it intermingles with the reality or the seemingly real of a story to help us discover an artistic goal. In the film, we have a vivid example of this notion. In the first two versions, a man tries to sell Lola his bike; he is marginal, a subject of Lola’s imagination. In the final version, however, the homeless man buys the bike and it now becomes a part of the main story, suggesting how the marginal and imaginative can enter into reality or the seeming reality of fiction, because the bike clearly serves a purpose, in this case, a means of transport for the homeless man. Iser explains as follows: “Since the transitory nature of play in the ordinary world is geared to goals that may be achieved a philosophy of play needs to postulate purposes” [The Fictive, 224]. And discovering purpose involves selectivity, decisions about what is more or less important in advancing a narrative to its conclusion. Often, as in “Run Lola Run,” the selection involves multiple texts, the different runs and the various inset scenarios, or what Iser calls clusters of texts or “intertextuality”: “The clustering adds to the complexity of play space, for the allusions and quotations take on new dimensions in relation to both their old and their new contexts. Since both old and new remain potentially present, there is a coexistence of different discourses that reveal their respective contexts as a play of alternating fade-ins and fade-outs” [The Fictive, 227]. In the end, when Lola and Manni walk down the street happily, the previous two runs are not erased. Rather, we infer that the same forces and factors that resulted in the deaths of Lola and Manni in the earlier versions have played a part in the last version. Whether they live or die has little to do with their individual goals, their intentionality; they are in fact pawns in a matrix, controlled by larger forces beyond their control. Perhaps the “intentionality” of this film is that we hold tenaciously to interpretation as our only element of ultimate control, uncertain whether or not that is also our ultimate illusion, simultaneously running toward and away from it.

然而，解释学循环，即解释行为，本身受到空间和时间的限制，即回应者相对于艺术作品的历史/文化状况。在这里，我们遇到了接受理论的另一个主要思想，即期望视野。为了解释这个概念，伊瑟尔利用了他的同事汉斯·罗伯特·姚斯的表述。

Nevertheless, the hermeneutic circle, the act of interpretation, is itself bound by the limitations of space and time, that is, by the responder’s historical/cultural situation vis à vis that of the work of art. Here we encounter another major idea of reception theory, horizons of expectation. To explain this notion Iser makes use of the formulation of his colleague, Hans Robert Jauss.

[接受理论] 试图把握在特定时期塑造对文学作品理解的主流态度 [...] 它试图重建读者的“期望视野”，在确定什么是艺术时，这种期望视野揭示了读者自己的标准。在这方面，接受就像一根占卜杖，可以追踪特定历史时刻接受者的品味。[...] 通过描绘读者反应的历史条件性，接受美学将文学变成了重构过去的工具（如何做，57）。

[Reception theory] tries to grasp prevailing attitudes that have shaped the understanding of a literary work in a given period of time […] it seeks to reconstruct the “horizons of expectation” entertained by the reading public which, in determining what is considered artistic, revealed its own standards. In this respect reception functions as a divining rod for tracing the recipients’ taste at a particular historical moment. […] By delineating the historical conditionality of readers’ reactions, an aesthetics of reception turns literature into a tool for reconstituting the past (How to do, 57).

期待的地平线：《单身男子》

Horizons of expectation: “A Single Man”

最近的一部名为《单身男子》（2009）的电影提供了一个关于“期望视野”的极好例子，该片由汤姆·福特执导，科林·菲尔斯饰演同性恋大学教授乔治·福尔科纳。这部电影发生在 1962 年的南加州，这一历史参考几乎立刻就说明了为什么接受理论家使用复数“视野”而不是单数“视野”：假设解释涉及过去和现在视野之间的相互作用，或回应者的视野与艺术作品中隐含的视野之间的相互作用。在这部电影中，2009 年（电影首次上映时）与 1962 年相比，男同性恋的惯例之间存在明显的关系。情节非常简单。乔治最近失去了他的长期伴侣乔治在车祸中丧生。但他的哀悼之情无论多么强烈，都因两个原因而被压抑。首先，他的长期伴侣的家人从未承认乔治是他们儿子的伴侣，并拒绝让他参加葬礼。其次，在 20 世纪 60 年代加州的中产阶级文化中，同性恋男子，尤其是教授，经常与年轻人接触的人，公开哀悼失去爱人是不合适的。

An excellent example of “horizons of expectation” is provided by the recent movie entitled “A Single Man” (2009), directed by Tom Ford and starring Colin Firth as George Falconer, a gay university professor. This movie takes place in Southern California in 1962, a historical reference that makes clear almost immediately why reception theorists use the plural “horizons” rather than the singular “horizon”: the assumption is that interpretation involves an interplay between the horizons of the past and present, or between that of the responder and that implicit in the work of art. In this particular film, there is a clear relationship between the conventions of being a male homosexual in 2009, when the film first appeared, as opposed to 1962. The plot is very straightforward. George has recently lost his long-term partner in an automobile accident. But his mourning, however intense, is repressed for two reasons. First, the family of his long-term partner never acknowledged George as the partner of their son and refused to allow him to attend the funeral. Second, in the middle-class culture of California of the 1960s, it was not considered seemly for a gay man, particularly a professor, someone with regular access to young people, overtly to mourn the loss of his lover.

然而，电影本身对我们观众来说是一种强烈的悲伤表达，同时，电影也非常微妙和克制地向他的同时代人（除了他的一位亲密朋友）展示了乔治的悲伤。我们看到了两种形式的悲伤，因为乔治知道了一件他从未告诉过任何人的事情，即他绝望地准备自杀。从这个意义上说，这部电影讲述了现在和当时两种截然不同的“期望视野”。一方面，乔治只能谨慎地向最亲密的朋友表达他的深切悲伤，但另一方面，对我们来说，他的哀悼之深是显而易见的。在我看来，科林·费尔斯巧妙地融合了两种“期望视野”：他对同时代人的克制、安静的悲伤同时向当今的观众暗示了无法安慰的损失；事实上，他因对乔治的演绎而获得了英国电影学院奖。正如伊瑟尔的同事 H.R. 乔斯所说，视野的对比往往具有历史意义。自 1962 年以来，人们对男同性恋伴侣的态度发生了显著变化。

Yet the movie itself is an intense expression of grief to us, the audience, while a very delicate and restrained display of George’s sadness to his contemporaries, except for his one close friend. We witness both forms of grief as a result of knowing something George tells no one, namely, that he, in despair, is preparing to commit suicide. In this sense the film is about the two contrasting “horizons of expectation” between now and then. On the one hand, George can only discreetly indicate his deep sadness to his closest friends, but, on the other hand, to us the depth of his mourning is palpable. In my view, Colin Firth deftly intermingles the two “horizons of expectation”: his controlled, quiet sadness with his contemporaries simultaneously suggests to the present-day audience an inconsolable loss; and indeed he received a BAFTA award for his portrayal of George. As Iser’s colleague, H. R. Jauss, suggested, the contrast of horizons is often of historical significance. Attitudes toward gay male couples have changed markedly since 1962.

事实上，同性恋者的世界已经发生了变化。汤姆·福特本人就是同性恋者，而且和电影中的角色一样，他与伴侣同居多年。此外，作为著名服装设计师的福特为乔治和整部电影设计了无可挑剔、朴实无华、昂贵的服装。正如电影中的乔治通过对着装和行为的细致控制自己的存在并限制自己的情感表达一样，导演福特在某种意义上也在他的场面调度中显得过于低调。有趣的是，一些评论家反对过度控制的布景和装饰设计，理由是这更像是在设计师的沙龙里，但我不知道福特是否故意选择让人们注意到这部电影是一部“同性恋”作品，这或许表明目前的同性恋“场景”仍然需要谨慎的品味。无论如何，评论家的反对具有历史意义，表明同性恋导演尚未在我们的社会中获得完全接受。

In fact, the world of the gay man has changed. Tom Ford is himself gay and, like the character in the movie, has lived with a partner for many years. Moreover Ford, a well-known clothes designer, dresses George and indeed the entire movie with impeccable, unpretentious, expensive taste. As George in the movie controls his existence and restricts his emotional expression by being meticulous in dress and behavior, so Ford the director is, in a sense, ostentatiously understated in his mise en scène. Interestingly, some reviewers have objected to the overly controlled design of the sets and décor on the ground that it is rather like being in a designer’s salon, but I wonder if Ford deliberately chose to call attention to the film as a “gay” production, suggesting perhaps that the present gay “scene” still requires discreet taste. In any event, the critics’ objections are of historical significance, suggesting that gay directors have not yet achieved total acceptance in our society.

尽管如此，这部电影清楚地表明，文化发生了重大变化。我最喜欢的场景之一是乔治和他的女性朋友查理（由朱丽安·摩尔饰演）共度的夜晚，查理是一个异性恋离婚者。查理知道乔治对他已故伴侣的爱，因此同情他的悲伤，但随后又对他进行挑逗，表明了一种矛盾的态度。作为一个同性恋者，乔治是一个值得信赖的朋友和知己，但作为一个有魅力的男人，她希望他能恢复“正常”并回应她的性挑逗。同样，邻居，一个有丈夫和两个孩子的女人，邀请乔治参加她的鸡尾酒会，但她的女儿告诉乔治她的父亲形容他“轻浮地穿着便鞋”。1962 年同性恋的边缘化解释了乔治的自杀倾向。然而，在决定不自杀后不久，他就因心脏病发作去世了。

Nonetheless, the movie makes clear that major cultural changes have occurred. One of my favorite scenes involves George’s evening with his female friend, a heterosexual divorcée, Charlie, played by Julianne Moore. Aware of George’s love for his late partner, Charlie empathizes with his grief but then makes a pass at him, suggesting a conflicted attitude. As a homosexual George is a trusted friend and confidant, but as an attractive man she hopes he will recover “normalcy” and respond to her sexual advances.
