Similarly, the neighbor, a woman with a husband and two children, invites George to her cocktail party, yet her daughter tells George that her father describes him as “light in his loafers.” The marginality of homosexuals in 1962 explains George’s suicidal tendencies. Yet he dies of a heart attack shortly after deciding not to commit suicide.

对于这一结论，我们只能做出多种解释。由于心脏病是在他与已故情人的关系之前出现的，因此，对他来说，最根深蒂固的问题可能不是失去伴侣，而是同性恋的疏离，最终导致心碎。或者，乔治的心脏病发作可能是由于他对那个一直追求甚至诱惑他的年轻男学生感到不安而引起的。乔治对已故的伴侣不忠，还是他害怕因引诱一个年轻人而失去“尊严”？他是否觉得追求他的年轻人几乎不理解他对已故伴侣的忠诚？还有第三种可能，重点是乔治发现年轻人找到了枪并拿走了枪，以防止乔治自杀。有那么一刻，也许是电影中唯一这样的时刻，乔治显得高兴和快乐，他说这对他来说是难得的“清醒”时刻之一。这种清醒是否意味着要找到一个新的爱人，一个真正关心他的人，还是他最终接受了自己在一个拼命坚持大男子主义世界观的社会中，作为一个默默谨慎的不合群者的地位？

We are left with a number of possible interpretations of this conclusion. Since the heart condition precedes his relationship with his late lover, perhaps the most deep-seated problem for him is not the loss of his partner but the alienation of the homosexual, resulting finally in a broken heart. Alternatively, George’s heart attack could be brought on by his uneasy feeling about the young male student who is persistently pursuing and perhaps tempting him. Does George feel disloyal to his late partner, or is he afraid of losing his “respectability” by debauching a young man? Does he feel that the young man pursuing him has little understanding of his deep loyalty to his late partner? Still a third alternative might focus upon George’s discovery that the young man has found the gun and taken it to prevent George’s suicide. For a moment, and it is perhaps the only such moment in the film, George appears pleased and happy, stating that it is for him one of the rare glimpses of “clarity.” Is the clarity about finding a new lover, someone who genuinely cares about him, or is he finally reconciled to his position as a quietly discreet misfit in a society desperately holding on to a male machismo worldview?

结论对这些可能性持开放态度，正是为了容纳许多不同类型的反应。因为所有这些都涉及到 1962 年的期望视野与现在关于男同性恋的期望视野之间的相互作用。正如 Jauss 所指出的，我们因此意识到了我们对这种现象及其历史的态度的变化。《单身男子》告诉我们，自 1962 年以来我们已经走了很长一段路，但还有很长的路要走。在这里，我们开始看到，接受理论的人类学元素不仅仅是对我们的文化的描述；它达到了道德要求。我们在这部电影结束时感到悲伤，不仅是因为乔治的英年早逝，还因为他一生的压抑，甚至被爱人家人拒绝，这引出了一个问题。即使是现在，我们是否已经为改善我们这个世界上同性恋者的生活做了足够的努力？

The conclusion is open to these many possibilities precisely so that many different kinds of responses can be accommodated. For all involve interplay between the horizons of expectation of 1962 and those now current concerning male homosexuality. As Jauss indicated, we are thereby made aware of the change in our attitude to this phenomenon, to its history. “A Single Man” tells us that we have come a long way since 1962 but still have a long way to go. Here we begin to see that the anthropological element of reception theory is more than merely descriptive of our culture; it arrives at an ethical imperative. Our feeling of sadness at the end of this film, not only for the untimely death of George but also for his entire life of repression, even rejection by the family of his lover, leads to a question. Even now, have we done enough to improve the life of homosexuals in our world?

伦理与意向性：《教父 3》

Ethics and intentionality: “The Godfather: Part III”

虽然接受理论为解读提供了多种可能性，但它也设定了明确的限制。正如我们所见，伊瑟尔坚持认为文本必须提供空白和空白，从而限制了可能的解读范围。但接受理论也致力于文本的目的论概念，即艺术家通常会明确说明他们的最终目标，即他们想要得出的结论。伊瑟尔在他的批评中提出了这一点模仿论，即艺术模仿自然的信念。“形式似乎不是自然的构成条件，而是艺术家记忆中的图像，艺术家将这些图像投射到给定的事物上，使观看者也以艺术家意图的方式看到自然”[虚构，285]。艺术家的意图通常可以在艺术作品结论的伦理影响中找到。

While reception theory opens up interpretation to more than one possibility, it establishes clear limitations. As we have seen, Iser insists that the gaps and blanks must be provided by the text, limiting the range of possible readings. But also, reception theory is committed to the concept of the teleology of the text, namely, that artists usually make clear what is their ultimate goal, their intended conclusion. Iser makes this point in his critique of mimesis, the belief that art imitates nature. “Forms, it appears, are not so much constitutive conditions of Nature as images remembered by the artist, who projects these onto what is given in such a way that the beholder also sees Nature in a manner intended by the artist” [The Fictive, 285]. And the intention of the artist is usually to be found in the ethical ramifications of the conclusion of the work of art.

例如，弗朗西斯·福特·科波拉 (Francis Ford Coppola) 的《教父 (第三部)》(1990) 包含一个高潮场景，为影片的结尾做好了准备，影片的结尾是年迈的迈克尔·科里昂 (Michael Corleone) 坐在扶手椅上孤独地死去。歌剧《乡村骑士》是经过精心挑选的，我们也已经为它的意义做好了准备。迈克尔自豪地宣布儿子安东尼将在歌剧中担任主角，儿子打断了他的话，纠正了父亲对歌剧标题的发音。教父一反常态地接受了儿子的纠正，并说道：“我在纽约住得太久了。”科波拉之所以让我们关注这部歌剧，是因为它是他关于黑手党的三部曲史诗的一个恰当的结局。

For instance, Francis Ford Coppola’s “The Godfather: Part III” (1990) contains a climactic scene that prepares us for the conclusion, a kind of coda in which an elderly Michael Corleone in an armchair dies all alone. The opera “Cavalleria Rusticana” has been carefully chosen. And we have been prepared for its significance. Announcing proudly that his son Anthony will sing the lead in the opera, Michael is interrupted by his son, who corrects his father’s pronunciation of the title. Uncharacteristically, the godfather accepts his son’s correction, remarking that “I have been living in New York for too long.” Coppola calls our attention to this opera because it is a fitting conclusion to his three-part epic about the Mafia.

我们观看了这部歌剧的舞台表演，以便了解它如何适用于科里昂家族的故事。与大多数歌剧不同，《乡村骑士》完全是关于农民的，最恰当地说，是西西里农民。从电影中展示的内容中，我们可以得出，该剧讲述了两个家族之间关于爱情的竞争，最终以其中一个敌对家族谋杀主角而告终。在电影的舞台表演中，我们在观众中看到了与歌剧类似的行为，形式是受挫的爱情和谋杀。迈克尔禁止玛丽和文森特交往，敌对的黑手党团伙试图杀死迈克尔和安东尼，最终谋杀了玛丽。尽管影片的最后情节与歌剧的类比并不完美或完整，但科波拉还是表明了这种类比的重要性。在谋杀案发生后的歌剧院台阶上，镜头从屠杀现场（包括凶手的尸体）后退，而其余演员则围绕受害者形成一个对称的图案，就像悲歌剧的最后一刻。

We are shown the staging of this opera so that we can understand how it applies to the story of the Corleone family. Unlike most operas, “Cavalleria Rusticana” is exclusively about peasants and, most appropriately, Sicilian peasants. The action, we can gather from what we are shown in the film, concerns a rivalry between two families about love and concludes with the murder of the protagonist by one of the rival families. During the staging of the film we see in the audience action analogous to that of the opera in the form of thwarted love and murder. Michael has forbidden a relationship between Mary and Vincent, and the rival mafia gang tries to kill Michael and Anthony, eventually murdering Mary. Although the analogy between the final action of the film and the opera is by no means perfect or complete, Coppola signals the significance of the analogy when on the steps of the opera house after the murder the camera draws back from the carnage that includes the bodies of the assassins while the remainder of the cast form themselves into a symmetrical pattern around the victims, rather like the final moment in a tragic opera.

接受理论认为，科波拉以这种方式表明，他的整个三部黑手党史诗都是一部为观众而作的歌剧。因此，重点不再是黑手党本身，而是我们对黑手党故事的兴趣和反应，这些故事可以像歌剧一样，既荒诞又戏剧化，也是对现实的夸张。因为伊瑟尔已经警告我们，想象和现实永远不会完全分离。

Reception theory suggests that in this manner Coppola is indicating that his entire three-part epic on the Mafia is a sort of opera for the audience. The point then becomes less about the Mafia itself and more about our interest in and response to tales of the Mafia, which can be taken, like opera itself, as at once fantastical and melodramatic and as an exaggerated version of reality. For Iser has already warned us that the imaginary and the real are never completely separated.

科波拉在这里采用的技术受到了伊瑟尔的“分期”概念的启发。

The technique employed here by Coppola is suggested by Iser’s concept of “staging.”

文学中的舞台表演使人们能够想象人类非凡的可塑性，正是因为他们似乎没有可确定的性质，可以扩展到几乎无限范围的文化模式。[…] [因此]文学成为可能事物的全景，因为它不受限制或考虑因素的束缚，而这些限制或考虑因素决定了人类生活在其中进行的过程[虚构，297]。

Staging in literature makes conceivable the extraordinary plasticity of human beings, who, precisely because they do not seem to have a determinable nature, can expand into an almost unlimited range of culture-bound patternings. […] [Thus] literature becomes a panorama of what is possible because it is not hedged in either by the limitations or the considerations that determine the institutional organizations within which human life otherwise takes it course [The Fictive, 297].

我们目睹了科里昂家族上演的黑手党起源。在我看来，这种做法的目的是让我们思考为什么我们对黑手党感兴趣。我们是否相信“合法”机构以类似的方式运作？或者我们是否希望政府能够诉诸黑手党的方法——正如一些人认为在关塔那摩发生的那样？无论哪种情况，接受理论都将解释的焦点从黑手党本身转移到我们对黑手党的反应。这种解释转变特别有用，因为许多艺术家，特别是当代艺术家，上演事件的目的是唤起并让我们意识到我们对艺术的反应，而不仅仅是出于对艺术品内在性质的兴趣。

We witness the staging for the Corleones of the origins of the Mafia. The purpose of such an exercise, it seems to me, is to lead us to ask why we are interested in the Mafia. Do we perhaps believe that the “legal” establishment operates in a similar way? Or do we maybe wish that the government could resort to Mafia methods—as some assume has happened at Guantanamo? In either case, reception theory changes the focal point of interpretation from the Mafia itself to our response to the Mafia. This sort of interpretive turn is particularly useful as many artists, particularly contemporary ones, stage events for the purpose of evoking and making us aware of our response to art rather than merely from an interest in the intrinsic nature of the artifact.

这一结论的伦理影响是显而易见的。我们是否愿意接受一个在某些方面与黑手党相似的“合法”社会？我们是否愿意让自己的孩子遭受玛丽·科里昂所经历的危险？还是我们只是自满地认为这种类比是牵强的？通过这种方式，接受理论指出了“人类的可塑性”，使我们能够把自己置于黑手党的位置并提出这样的伦理问题。解释的解释循环不仅仅是循环的，引导我们回到我们自己或自我意识，而且在艺术的背景下，引导我们从一个新的视角看待我们自己和我们的文化。

The ethical impact of this conclusion is unmistakable. Are we content to accept a “legal” society that in some respects resembles that of the Mafia? Are we willing to subject our children to dangers like that experienced by Mary Corleone? Or are we merely being complacent in assuming that such an analogy is far-fetched? In this way, reception theory points to the “plasticity of human beings” that permits us to put ourselves in the place of the Mafia and ask such ethical questions. The hermeneutic circle of interpretation is not merely circular, leading us back to ourselves, or self-consciousness, but, in the context of art, leads us to see ourselves and our culture from a new perspective.

视角的作用：“午夜巴塞罗那”

The function of perspectives: “Vicky Cristina Barcelona”

《午夜巴塞罗那》 (2008) 是同一情境中两个可接受的解释学循环的一个很好的例子，该片由伍迪·艾伦编剧和导演，斯嘉丽·约翰逊、丽贝卡·豪尔、哈维尔·巴登和佩内洛普·克鲁兹主演。这部电影讲述了两个年轻的美国女性在巴塞罗那共度暑假的故事。尽管她们在国外大部分时间都在一起，并且对同一个男人有共同的吸引力，但她们对这段经历的看法却截然不同。造成这种差异的一个重要原因是，虽然她们是多年的亲密朋友，但他们从不同的开始以不同的方式对待这个暑假。维姬与家乡的美国人道格订婚后，来到巴塞罗那研究加泰罗尼亚文化，这是她的研究项目的主题。相比之下，她的朋友克里斯蒂娜没有固定伴侣，因此对社交和性生活更加开放。她们抵达后不久，加泰罗尼亚年轻画家胡安·安东尼奥就接近了这两位美丽的女士，并邀请她们到附近的一个小镇进行短途旅行。最终，两位女士都与胡安·安东尼奥建立了亲密关系，但经历本身和结果却截然不同

An excellent example of two acceptable hermeneutic circles within the same situation is provided by “Vicky Cristina Barcelona” (2008), written and directed by Woody Allen, starring Scarlett Johansson, Rebecca Hall, Javier Bardem and Penelope Cruz. This movie is about two young American women who spend a summer vacation together in Barcelona. Although together for most of their time abroad and sharing an attraction to the same man, they end with very different views of the experience. One important reason for this difference is that, although long-time, close friends, they approach this summer holiday in different ways, from different beginnings. Engaged to be married to Doug, an American back at home, Vicky comes to Barcelona to study Catalan culture, the subject of her research project. By contrast, her friend Cristina is unattached and therefore more open to the social and sexual scene. Shortly after their arrival, the two beautiful women are approached by Juan Antonio, a young Catalan painter, who invites them on a short jaunt to a nearby small town. Eventually each of the women has an intimate relationship with Juan Antonio, but the experience itself and the results are quite different

从接受理论的角度来看，这部电影的有趣之处在于，尽管两个女人有着相同的经历，一起度过夏天并与同一个男人发生性关系，但她们的生活却因为这次假期而发生了截然不同的变化，也就是说，每个女人对这段经历的解读都是独特的。克里斯蒂娜与胡安·安东尼奥以及他前女友玛丽亚·埃琳娜陷入了“三人行”。虽然她对这种安排很满意，但她最终觉得这种情况不适合她，于是离开了。维姬虽然仍然被胡安·安东尼奥吸引，但还是嫁给了道格，但她无法接受与道格离婚。尽管这两个女人在巴塞罗那的夏天经历在很多方面都很相似，但她们对此的看法却截然不同。

What is interesting about this movie from the point of view of reception theory is that, although both women share the same experience, living together for the summer and having sex with the same man, their lives take very different turns as a result of this holiday, that is, each woman interprets the experience in unique terms. Cristina becomes involved in a “ménage à trois” with Juan Antonio and his previous girlfriend, Maria Elena. Although happy with this arrangement for a while, she eventually comes to feel that it is not the right situation for her and leaves. Vicky marries Doug even though still attracted to Juan Antonio, but cannot then reconcile herself to divorcing Doug. Although the Barcelona summer experience is similar in many ways for the two women, they come away from it with very different views.

克里斯蒂娜发现她为玛丽亚·埃琳娜和胡安·安东尼奥的关系提供了稳定，但她却觉得他们对她的需要太过局限。因此，与美国相比，加泰罗尼亚文化最初被社会和性自由所吸引，但现在她感到局限和压抑。另一方面，维基现在已经嫁给了一个美国人，她仍然深深地被加泰罗尼亚文化和胡安·安东尼奥所感动和吸引，但发现他太反复无常和不可靠。

Cristina discovers that she provides the stability for the relationship of Maria Elena and Juan Antonio but feels too confined by their need of her. So, having initially been attracted by the social and sexual freedom of Catalan culture compared to that of the States, she now feels confined and constricted. Vicky, on the other hand, now married to an American, is still deeply moved and attracted to Catalan culture and to Juan Antonio but finds him too erratic and unreliable.

电影片名表明伍迪·艾伦对同一情况的两种观点感兴趣。片名中没有“和”和“在”，这表明这两个女人是显微镜的两个目镜，从略微不同的角度观察同一个物体，观众将两者结合起来形成一个图像。我们得出了两个女人观点的结合：加泰罗尼亚文化在某些方面比美国文化更自由，在其他方面则更局限。克里斯蒂娜和维姬对她们喜欢哪种生活方式的决定取决于个人价值观。克里斯蒂娜的决定是消极的：这种生活方式不适合她，所以她继续寻找。维姬更矛盾：她渴望更多的浪漫，但又害怕不安全感。艾伦巧妙地通过两个解释循环向我们展示了加泰罗尼亚文化的两个关键方面：我们的解释循环结合了维基和克里斯蒂娜的观点，揭示了更大的性自由涉及更深层次的个人和心理纠葛，就像胡安·安东尼奥和玛丽亚·埃琳娜之间的关系一样。维基和克里斯蒂娜虽然不同但又相互关联，他们对加泰罗尼亚文化的一个方面都有切实可行的把握。她们的解释循环有不同的开始和结束，但就像手牵手走的好朋友一样相互影响。相比之下，观众的观点，虽然包括维基和克里斯蒂娜的观点，却有旁观者而非参与者的局限性。因为我们看到的是巴塞罗那的电影，但维姬和克里斯蒂娜却去了那里，体验了那里的文化。解释的范围从来都不是确定的；它受到开端、最初的问题或探索以及解释者的知识和预设的限制。接受理论坚持认为，解释是艺术作品与试图理解它的人之间的对话，结果将根据回应者的局限性、提出的问题和历史时代的不同而有所不同。对于伊瑟尔来说，我们看到自己的“模拟”——我们可以做什么或可能成为什么的投影形象——“上演”是我们人性的关键要素：

The title of the movie suggests that Woody Allen is interested in two perspectives on the same situation. The absence of “and” and “in” in the title indicates that the two women are the two eye-pieces of a microscope, looking at the same object but from a slightly different angle that combines for the audience to form a single image. We come away with a combination of the two women’s perspectives: Catalan culture is in some respects freer and in others more confining than that of the United States. Cristina’s and Vicky’s decisions about which way of life they prefer is a function of individual values. Cristina’s decision is negative: this way of life is not for her, so her search continues. Vicky is more conflicted: she longs for more romance but fears insecurity. Allen cleverly shows us two key aspects of Catalan culture by way of two hermeneutic circles: our hermeneutic circle, incorporating Vicky’s and Cristina’s, reveals that greater sexual freedom involves deeper personal and psychological entanglements, as in the relationship between Juan Antonio and Maria Elena. Different but related, Vicky and Cristina each have a viable grasp of an aspect of Catalan culture. Their hermeneutic circles have different beginnings and ends but touch upon one another like good friends walking hand in hand. By contrast, the audience’s view, although including those of Vicky and Cristina, has the limitation of being that of onlookers, not participants. For we see moving pictures of Barcelona, but Vicki and Cristina go there and experience the culture. The circle of interpretation is never definitive; it is limited by beginnings, initial questions or quests and by the interpreter’s knowledge and presuppositions. Reception theory insists that interpretation is a conversation between the work of art and she or he who seeks to understand it, and that the results will vary according to the limitations of the responder, the questions posed, and the historical era. For Iser this procedure whereby we see a “simulacrum” of ourselves—a projected image of what we could do or might be—“staged” is a key element of our humanity:

舞台表演是一种不懈地尝试，让我们面对自己，而这只能通过扮演自己来实现。它允许我们通过拟像将转瞬即逝的可能性引入其中，并监控我们自己不断向可能的他者展开的过程。我们被转移到我们自己身上，尽管这种转换并不能使我们与我们能够观察到的东西相一致；它只是为我们打开了这种转换的可能性。[ 《虚构》，303]

Staging is the indefatigable attempt to confront ourselves with ourselves, which can be done only by playing ourselves. It allows us, by means of simulacra, to lure into shape the fleetingness of the possible and to monitor the continual unfolding of ourselves into possible otherness. We are shifted into ourselves, though this transposition does not make us able to coincide with what we are able to observe; it simply opens us up to the possibility of such transposing [The Fictive, 303].

Vicky 和 ​​Cristina 代表了加泰罗尼亚文化中向我们敞开的可能性，而这些可能性我们可能永远不想或无法实现。因此，Iser 接受理论的最终目的是实现一个道德目标：通过艺术作品所唤起的同理心，我们可以培养对差异的宽容，无论是文化、历史时期还是个人。接受理论的贡献在于开放的解读、人类对话的最佳状态、对他人的解读以及我们自己和我们文化的历史变革。

Vicky and Cristina represent possibilities in Catalan culture open to us and for us that we may never wish or be able to pursue. Thus the final thrust of Iser’s reception theory arrives at an ethical goal: by way of the empathy evoked by works of art we develop a tolerance for difference, whether of cultures, historical periods, or individuals. The contribution of reception theory is to open interpretation, human conversation at its best, to others and to historical change in ourselves and our culture.

现在已经阐明了伊瑟尔如何解构解释过程，并将其向个体差异开放，我们将在下一章讨论个体性概念的修改，以及拉康对弗洛伊德自我的重新评估。

Having now clarified how Iser deconstructs the interpretative process, opening it to individual differences, we turn in the next chapter to a modification of the concept of individuality, to Lacan’s reassessment of the Freudian ego.

第四章

CHAPTER FOUR

雅克·拉康与后弗洛伊德主义

Jacques Lacan and post-Freudianism

摘要：拉康认为弗洛伊德的本能自我是一种话语功能。这种解构的自我起源于“镜像阶段”，即一个 6 个月到 18 个月大的孩子被父母抱到镜子前并被赋予名字。这个想法延伸到成人世界，并通过《女王》得到解释。这个阶段产生了三个重要的后果：1）《朗读者》中体现的无意识作为语言；2）《弗罗斯特/尼克松》中体现的移情；3）《迷失东京》中体现的意象。最后一部分展示了这三个概念在《西班牙旅馆》（“Pot Luck”）和《国王的演讲》的背景下如何相互关联。

Summary: Lacan believes the instinctive ego of Freud is a function of discourse. This deconstructed ego originates with the “mirror stage,” when a child, aged between six months and 18 months, is held up by his or her parent to a mirror and given a name. This idea is extended to the adult world and explained by way of “The Queen.” Three important consequences follow from this stage: 1) the unconscious as language, illustrated in “The Reader”; 2) transference as seen in “Frost/Nixon”; 3) imago as evidenced in “Lost in Translation.” The final section shows how these three concepts relate to each other in the context of “L’Auberge espagnole” (“Pot Luck”) and “The King’s Speech.”

拉康通过断言弗洛伊德的自我（本我、自我和超我）来解构弗洛伊德，他认为，对于弗洛伊德来说，自我由本能、理性和道德组成，实际上是语言或话语的功能，正如我们所见，这个术语用于所有形式的交流。这一重要创新源于“镜像阶段”，它描述了一个孩子在生命的早期阶段（从 6 个月到 18 个月大）如何发展自我意识或个人身份。在介绍了“镜像阶段”和“女王”之后，我将重点介绍三个源自镜像阶段的拉康概念：《朗读者》中的无意识作为语言、《弗罗斯特/尼克松》中的移情以及《迷失东京》中的意象。我的结论涉及对两部电影的分析，《西班牙客栈》（“Pot Luck”）和《国王的演讲》，它们表明这三个想法之间存在联系。但首先，了解所有这些想法都源自镜像阶段是有帮助的。关键关于镜像阶段的要点是，孩子不仅在镜子中认识了自己的形象，更重要的是，还认识了自己的名字，从而认识了自己文化的语言系统。对于拉康来说，孩子最初的自我意识或个人身份是通过话语形成的，这一事实至关重要，本章讨论的拉康的所有其他概念都源于这一见解。由于语言是话语的主要元素，我们可以预期，拉康的心理语言学观点将导致重新评估文学人物与“真实”人物之间的关系，并影响我们对自我、自我或个人身份的概念。

Lacan deconstructs Freud by asserting that for Freud the ego, comprised of instincts, reason, and morality—the id, ego, and super-ego—is in fact a function of language or discourse, a term used, as we have seen, for all forms of communication. This important innovation stems from “the mirror stage,” an account of how a child at a very early period of its life, from six months to 18 months of age, develops a sense of self or personal identity. After an introduction to the “mirror stage” and “The Queen,” I focus on three Lacanian notions that stem from the mirror stage: the unconscious as language in “The Reader,” transference in “Frost/Nixon,” and imago in “Lost in Translation.” My conclusion involves an analysis of two films, “L’Auberge espagnole” (“Pot Luck”) and “The King’s Speech,” that suggest a connection between these three ideas. But at the outset it is helpful to understand that all of the ideas stem from the mirror stage. The crucial point about the mirror stage is that the child is introduced not merely to his or her own image in the mirror but also, and more importantly, to his or her name and thereby to the language system of his or her culture. For Lacan, the fact that a child’s first sense of selfhood or personal identity is by way of discourse is crucial, and all Lacan’s other notions discussed in this chapter derive from that insight. Since language is the predominant element of discourse, we can expect that Lacan’s psycholinguistic views will entail a reassessment of the relationship between literary characters and “real” people as well as affecting our concept of the self, that of the ego or personal identity.

话语与“镜像舞台”：“女王”

Discourse and “the mirror stage”: “The Queen”

斯蒂芬·弗雷斯执导的电影《女王》（2006 年）由海伦·米伦饰演伊丽莎白二世女王，迈克尔·辛饰演首相托尼·布莱尔，该片聚焦于媒体事件形式的话语。影片以托尼·布莱尔的选举胜利游行队伍沿着林荫大道向白金汉宫行进开始，紧接着——影片跨越了两次选举之间的三个月间隔——在同一地点举行了戴安娜王妃的葬礼游行。这些媒体事件表明话语领域无处不在，不仅涉及有关主要人物的文字和图片，而且非常重要的是，还包括公众对事件的反应。布莱尔和戴安娜之间的对比非常鲜明，人们的照片更加突出了这种对比，人们欢呼雀跃，随后又哀悼，许多人流下了眼泪。首相指挥着一支团队，使他能够利用媒体获得压倒性胜利。相比之下，戴安娜死于一场至少部分由狗仔队造成的事故，她死后听到（和看到）的第一个公众评论是戴安娜的哥哥斯宾塞伯爵指责媒体对她进行跟踪，导致她过早死亡。因此，我们进入了公众话语的世界，这是一个危险的领域，公众人物必须善于“旋转”，否则就有成为受害者的风险。我们本以为女王已经习惯了这个世界，但她面临着公众行为的深刻变化，她和她的顾问们一开始无法理解。简而言之，公众话语为女王提供了一面镜子，她起初抗拒，后来才逐渐接受。

Stephen Frears’s film “The Queen” (2006), starring Helen Mirren as Queen Elizabeth II and Michael Sheen as Prime Minister Tony Blair, focuses upon discourse in the form of media events. The movie begins with the election victory procession of Tony Blair moving down The Mall towards Buckingham Palace, to be followed shortly—the film passes over the three-month interval between the two events—at the same location by the funeral procession of Princess Diana. These media events show how all-pervasive is the realm of discourse, involving words and pictures about the main figures but also and very importantly including within the event the public response to the event. The contrast between Blair and Diana is stark, made emphatic by the pictures of the people, applauding jubilantly and then, shortly thereafter, mourning, many in tears. The Prime Minister commands a staff that enables him to employ the media to gain a landslide victory. Diana, by contrast, dies in an accident caused at least in part by the paparazzi, and the first public comment heard (and seen) after her death is that of Diana’s brother Earl Spencer blaming the media for hounding her to a premature death. We are thus introduced to the world of public discourse, a perilous realm where public figures must be adept at “spin” or risk being the victims of it. We would expect the Queen to be well used to this world, but she is confronted with a profound change of public behavior that she and her advisers are unable at first to understand. In short, public discourse presents the Queen with a mirror that she at first resists and then only gradually accepts.

海伦·米伦因饰演伊丽莎白二世女王而获得奥斯卡最佳女主角奖。我首先从这部电影开始，因为它展示了“镜像阶段”的原理不仅适用于婴儿，也适用于成年人。英国女王在位近 50 年后发生了身份的根本性变化。虽然这部电影的标题指的是在位的君主，但中心情节涉及女王对戴安娜王妃去世的反应。托尼·布莱尔的工作人员立即将全部注意力转向这一事件。然而，女王起初坚持认为，由于戴安娜与查尔斯王子离婚，她的葬礼应被视为私人事务，而不是公共事务。布莱尔和他的工作人员认识到，公众并不认为戴安娜完全脱离了王室。因此，布莱尔就戴安娜的死发表了重要讲话，在讲话中，他引用了他最信任的助手阿利斯泰尔·坎贝尔的话，称她为“人民的王妃”，这些话成为重塑英国君主制的关键话语元素。

Helen Mirren received an Academy Award for Best Actress for her performance as Queen Elizabeth II. I begin with this film because it demonstrates how the principle of the “mirror stage” pertains not only to infants but also to adults. A radical change of identity for the Queen of England occurs when she has been on the throne for nearly 50 years. Although the title of the film refers to the reigning monarch, the central action concerns how the Queen responds to the death of Princess Diana. Tony Blair’s staff immediately turn their full attention to this event. However, the Queen at first insists that since Diana is divorced from Prince Charles her funeral should be considered a private, not a public matter. Blair and his staff recognize that the general public does not consider Diana to be completely separated from the royal family. Accordingly, Blair makes a major speech on Diana’s death in which he refers to her, using the phrase of his trusted aide, Alistair Campbell, as “the people’s princess,” words that become the key element of discourse that reshapes the British monarchy.

事实上，影片中穿插着影响个人身份认同的话语事件。影片开头，新当选首相的布莱尔被引见给女王，女王的礼宾官解释说，在“女王面前”，也就是与女王在一起时，人们绝不能背对女王。布莱尔深受“女王面前”的影响，有时觉得有必要拯救女王，有时又觉得有必要为她长期无私地为国家服务辩护。影片结尾，切丽·布莱尔半开玩笑地暗示，女王对首相来说就像母亲一样，为女王对布莱尔的预言性言论做准备，稍后将讨论这一预言。话语事件的另一个例子是宫务大臣将“先例”一词发音为“ pree cedent”，布莱尔不禁评论道：“他们在哪里找到这些人的？”阿利斯泰尔·坎贝尔也认为宫务大臣的语言和举止浮夸而自命不凡。这里的话语强调了贵族宫廷与民选政治家的工作人员之间的阶级差异。另一个进一步强调阶级差异的话语事件发生在葬礼上，在戴安娜的兄弟致辞后，教堂内外的观众爆发出掌声，而王室成员则避免在公共场合表露情绪。虽然所有这些例子都可以用来说明话语的镜像元素，但我关注的是“人民的王妃”，因为它涉及个人身份的彻底改变，当报纸——电影中大量使用的话语媒体——赋予它头条意义时，它就变成了公共话语。

In fact, the film is punctuated with discursive events that affect personal identity. Near the beginning of the film, Blair, newly elected as Prime Minister, is presented to the Queen, whose chief of protocol explains that one never turns one’s back in “the presence,” that is, when one is with the Queen. Blair is profoundly affected by “the presence,” feeling at times the need to save her from herself and at others to defend her for her lengthy, selfless service to the country. Near the end of the movie, Cherie Blaire only half jestingly suggests that the Queen is for the Prime Minister a mother figure, preparation for the Queen’s prophetic remarks to Blair, to be discussed later. Still another instance of a discourse event involves the Lord Chamberlain pronouncing the word precedent as “preecedent,” occasioning Blair to remark, “where do they find these people?” Alistair Campbell also finds the Lord Chamberlain’s language and manner pompous and pretentious. Here the discourse serves to point up the class divide between the aristocratic court and the staff of a democratically elected politician. Another discourse event further emphasizing the distinction between classes occurs at the funeral when, after Diana’s brother’s speech, the audience inside and outside the church erupts into applause while the royal party refrains from any public display of emotion. Although all of these instances can serve to illustrate the mirror element of discourse, I focus on the “people’s princess” because it involves a radical change of personal identity and becomes public discourse when the newspapers—a discursive medium made much of in the film—give it headline significance.

这句话冒犯了大多数皇室成员。事实上，决定将葬礼变成一场公众活动，并邀请埃尔顿·约翰等“人民”流行偶像来娱乐，这一决定被女王、爱丁堡公爵和王太后视为粗俗和低俗。在他们看来，葬礼安排应该由戴安娜的家人斯宾塞家族来做。因此，皇室家族没有改变他们的夏季惯例，而是留在了苏格兰巴尔莫勒尔城堡的度假胜地。在伦敦和世界其他许多地方，公众对戴安娜的去世深表哀悼。大批哀悼者聚集在白金汉宫，等待女王的消息。但几天来她都没有出现，小报开始严厉批评她。最后，在布莱尔打来几次电话和查尔斯王子的恳求下，女王决定返回伦敦。

This phrase offends most members of the royal family. Indeed, the decision to make the funeral a public event with entertainment from such pop idols of the “people” as Elton John is regarded by the Queen, the Duke of Edinburgh, and the Queen Mother as vulgar and in poor taste. In their view, the funeral arrangements should be made by Diana’s family, the Spencers. The royal family, therefore, do not alter their summer routine, remaining at their holiday retreat at Balmoral Castle in Scotland. In London and in many other parts of the world there is a huge outpouring of public grief for Diana. Masses of mourners gather at Buckingham Palace awaiting some word from the Queen. But for days she does not appear, and the tabloids begin to criticize her severely. Finally after a number of phone calls from Blair and the pleading of Prince Charles, the Queen decides to return to London.

在离开巴尔莫勒尔宫之前，女王独自驾车穿过庄园的树林，突然看到一只雄伟的老鹿正在被猎杀。公爵跟踪这只动物时，女王被雄鹿的美丽所吸引，把它从猎人手中赶走，但在她返回伦敦之前，她被告知这只雄鹿已被邻近庄园的一名商业猎人杀死。然后，女王去看望了这只被后脚吊起来的雄鹿。她注意到这只雄鹿在死前受了伤，希望它没有受太多的苦。显然，女王对这只被爱丁堡公爵身边的守旧派和以猎人为代表的新富阶层猎杀的老鹿有一种亲切感。我们感觉到女王和她的君主制的一部分正受到威胁，一种激进的变革即将来临。

Just before leaving Balmoral, she goes for a drive on her own through the woodlands of the estate, suddenly coming into sight of a majestic old stag that is being hunted. While the Duke stalks the animal, the Queen, struck by the beauty of the stag, drives it away from the hunters, but before her return to London she is told the stag has been killed by a commercial hunter on a neighboring estate. She then makes a visit to the magnificent dead animal suspended headless by its hind feet. Noticing that the stag has been wounded before dying, she expresses the hope that it did not suffer too much. Clearly, the Queen feels an affinity with the old deer hunted out of existence by, on the one hand, the old guard associated with the Duke of Edinburgh, and, on the other hand, the new moneyed class epitomized by the hunter. We are left with a sense that a part of her and of her monarchy is under threat and that change of a radical sort is in the wind.

回到伦敦后，女王在白金汉宫的哀悼者中间徘徊，为人民在公众面前流露的情感而感动和惊讶，她以前曾认为人民不会轻易表露感情。但值得赞扬的是，女王适应了“人民的王妃”这一新概念，海伦·米伦的精彩演技在这里脱颖而出。影片结尾处，托尼·布莱尔再次出现在女王面前，这次他以首相的身份自信满满地呼吁女王适应时代的变化，从而挽救了君主制。但女王冷漠而庄重地指出，发生在她身上的事情也会发生在布莱尔身上。当然，观众在 2006 年影片首次上映时就知道，事实确实如此，布莱尔失宠，被戈登·布朗取代。

Upon returning to London, the Queen wanders among the mourners at Buckingham Palace and is moved and surprised by the public display of emotion by her people, whom she had previously characterized as not prone to wearing their hearts on their sleeves. But to her credit, and here the great acting of Helen Mirren comes to the fore, the Queen adapts to this new concept of “the people’s princess.” Near the end of the film Tony Blair appears again before the Queen, now with a confident demeanor as the prime minister who has helped save the monarchy by insisting that the Queen adapt to the changing times. But the Queen, aloof and dignified, points out that what happened to her will also happen to Blair. And of course the audience knows by 2006, when the film was first released, that this is precisely what has happened, Blair having fallen out of favor and been replaced by Gordon Brown.

电影的结尾表明，虽然女王已经适应了，在某种意义上有所改变，但从根本上讲，她仍然是女王，能够保持独立于政治建制。但对拉康主义者来说，重要的问题是，女王的改变或适应源于一种文化危机，这种危机由“人民的公主”这一话语所表明。女王和大多数王室成员最初认为这个词不合适，甚至难以理解。镜像阶段的重要原则之一是疏离感和缺乏控制感：婴儿无法选择自己的名字，父母选择的名字对孩子来说可能就像“人民的公主”这个词对女王的感觉一样陌生和神秘。阿利斯泰尔·坎贝尔选择这个词来描述戴安娜不仅仅是一个幸运的俏皮话，而是一个洞察力的时刻，有助于激发和表达历史时刻的情绪。女王意识到，她必须接受臣民态度的这种变化，而她自己却对此感到一点也不舒服。从这个意义上来说，《女王》可以看作是话语权力改变个人身份的一个例子。拉康对这一过程进行了如下描述：

The conclusion of the movie demonstrates that while the Queen has adapted, and in some sense changed, there is also a fundamental sense in which she is still the Queen, able to maintain her independence from the political establishment. But for Lacanians the important issue is that the change or adaptation on the part of the Queen resulted from a cultural crisis signaled by discourse: “the people’s princess,” a phrase that was initially seen by the Queen and most members of the royal family as inappropriate, if not incomprehensible. One of the important principles of the mirror stage is a feeling of alienation and lack of control: the infant does not choose its name, and that chosen by its parents may feel as strange and mysterious to the child as the phrase “the people’s princess” felt to the Queen. Alistair Campbell’s choice of phrase to characterize Diana is not merely a lucky quip but a moment of insight that helps galvanize and articulate the mood of the historical moment. And the Queen comes to realize that she must accept this change in her subjects’ attitude while herself feeling not at all comfortable with it. In this respect “The Queen” can be seen as an instance of the power of discourse to alter personal identity. Lacan describes this process as follows:

镜像阶段是一出戏剧，其内在推力源于不足到预期——它为陷入空间认同诱惑的主体制造了一系列幻觉，从支离破碎的身体形象延伸到我称之为矫形术的整体形式——最后，承担起异化身份的盔甲，其僵化的结构将标志着主体的整个精神发展（Ecrits，5）。

The mirror stage is a drama whose internal thrust is precipitated from insufficiency to anticipation—and which manufactures for the subject, caught up in the lure of spatial identification, the succession of phantasms that extends from a fragmented body-image to a form of its totality that I shall call orthopaedic—and, lastly, to the assumption of the armour of an alienating identity, which will mark with its rigid structure the subject’s entire mental development (Ecrits, 5).

拉康在这里描述的是一个小孩的经历，但我相信成年人在所谓的“身份危机”期间也会有类似的经历。女王向布莱尔解释说，媒体报道 25% 的臣民讨厌她，这让她深受伤害。此外，女王逐渐理解公众如何看待自己的过程让人想起拉康对儿童对镜像阶段反应的描述：

Lacan is here describing the experience of a young child, but I believe that a similar experience can be had by adults during what has been called an “identity crisis.” The Queen explains to Blair that she was deeply wounded by the media’s report that 25 percent of her subjects hated her. Moreover, the process by which the Queen comes to understand how she is perceived by the public is reminiscent of Lacan’s description of the child’s response to the mirror stage:

我们只需将镜像阶段理解为一种认同，即分析赋予该术语的完整含义；即，当主体呈现出一个图像时，主体中发生的转变——该图像的预定性 […] 可通过分析理论中古老的术语“意象” （Imago）的使用充分表明（Ecrits，2）。

We have only to understand the mirror stage as an identification, in the full sense that analysis gives to that term; namely, the transformation that takes place in the subject when he assumes an image—whose predestination […] is sufficiently indicated by the use, in analytic theory, of the ancient term imago (Ecrits, 2).

就像成虫离开茧一样，女王从封闭的车厢中走出来，据说这是史无前例的举动，女王与白金汉宫门外的哀悼者们混在一起。她发现了一个公开表达丧亲之痛的新世界，即使她在惊奇的人群中穿梭，这种情绪也包围着她。花堆上的一张纸条明显让她震惊，纸条上写着：“你手上沾满了鲜血。”在高潮时刻，一个孩子向女王献上一束花，女王以为是给戴安娜的，但孩子说：“这是给你的。”拉康解释说，发现身份的时刻，或者在这种情况下，女王第一次感受到新的身份，既让人感到安慰，又让人感到奇怪或疏远。

Like the imago, the larva leaving the cocoon, the Queen emerges from her closed car, an unprecedented act, we are told, to mingle among the mourners outside the gate of Buckingham Palace. She discovers a new world of public expression of bereavement, a mood that encompasses her even as she moves among the people in wonderment. She is visibly shaken by a note placed on a bank of flowers, which reads: “You have blood on your hands.” And at that climactic moment, a child presents the Queen with a bouquet that she assumes is for Diana, but the child says, “They are for you.” Lacan explains that the moment of discovery of identity, or, in this instance, the Queen’s first sense of a new identity, is at once comforting and strange or alienating.

事实上，主体在幻象中预期其力量成熟的身体总体形式只是作为格式塔而被赋予的，也就是说，在一种外在性中，这种形式肯定更多的是构成性的而不是被构成的[...]，它象征着“我”的精神永恒性，同时预示着它的异化目的地（Ecrits，3）。

The fact is that the total form of the body by which the subject anticipates in a mirage the maturation of his power is given to him only as Gestalt, that is to say, in an exteriority in which this form is certainly more constituent than constituted […] symbolizing the mental permanence of the I, at the same time as it prefigures its alienating destination (Ecrits, 3).

女王对孩子的举动感到欣慰，但对她所期望的新角色感到吃惊。她已成为戴安娜哀悼者的“组成部分”，而她的内心或“构成”思想可能更多的是关于英国君主制历史的传承。

The Queen is gratified by the child’s gesture but taken aback at the new kind of role that is expected of her. She has become a “constituent” of the mourners of Diana, while her inner or “constituted” thoughts are probably more on the passing out of history of an element of the British monarchy.

影片的结尾是女王向布莱尔坦白，她因令众多臣民失望而深感苦恼。影片的重点在于适应新形势的痛苦过程，这一过程留下了永久的伤疤。拉康将这一过程描述如下：“梦境中，‘自我’的形成象征着一座堡垒或一个体育场——它的内部竞技场和围场被沼泽和垃圾场包围，将其分成两个对立的战场，臣民在其中挣扎着寻找高耸、遥远的内部城堡”（《文字》，第 5 页）。女王拒绝了城堡和豪华轿车的保护，决定到外面的臣民中间游荡，在那里她发现了一个陌生的世界：她的人民已经改变，她被期望适应这种变化。简而言之，她发现了自己身份的无常性，后来警告首相，他也将受到同样力量的支配，正如我们所见，历史证实了这一观点。因为，按照拉康的说法，女王和首相和我们其他人一样，都是讨论的主体。任何人都不可能拥有永久的身份。

The film concludes with a scene in which the Queen confesses to Blair her deep distress at having disappointed many of her people. The emphasis here is on the painful process of adapting to the new situation that has left a lasting scar. Lacan describes this process as follows: “the formation of the I is symbolized in dreams by a fortress, or a stadium—its inner arena and enclosure, surrounded by marshes and rubbish-tips, dividing it into two opposed fields of contest where the subject flounders in quest of the lofty, remote inner castle” (Ecrits, 5). Refusing the protection of the castle and the limousine, the Queen decides to wander among her subjects outside, where she discovers an alien world: her people have changed and she is expected to adapt to that change. In short, she has discovered the impermanence of her own identity and later warns the Prime Minister that he too will be subject to the same force, a view, as we have seen, borne out by history. For, in Lacanian terms, the Queen and the Prime Minister, like the rest of us, are the subjects of discourse. There can be no permanence of identity for anyone.

这一立场对心理学家和精神分析学家来说具有争议性，这是可以理解的，因为它质疑了内在身份的假设，即我们存在所必需的核心自我。然而，拉康的立场意味着文学人物与“真实的人”并无不同。两者都是话语的产物，尽管据我们所知，我们生活的世界并非为艺术目的而创造的。文学人物不再是实体本身，而是成为话语的主体，是文学系统的一部分，就像图像和符号一样。在这方面，拉康深受 20 世纪中叶结构主义者的影响，他们追随费迪南德索绪尔的脚步，坚持认为语言不应被理解为“现实”的表征或语言图景，而应被理解为一个需要解码才能应用于“现实”的系统。拉康用以下轶事来说明这一点：

This position is understandably controversial for psychologists and psychoanalysts, because it calls into question the assumption of an inner identity, a core ego that is essential to our being. However, Lacan’s position implies that literary characters are not different in kind from “real people.” Both are products of discourse, although the world we live in is not, so far as we know, created for artistic purposes. Literary characters cease to be entities in themselves and become agents of discourse, parts of a literary system, like images and symbols. In this respect Lacan is heavily influenced by the structuralists of the mid-twentieth century who, following in the footsteps of Ferdinand de Saussure, insisted that language should be understood not as a representation or linguistic picture of “reality” but as a system that requires decoding before it can be applied to “reality.” Lacan uses the following anecdote to illustrate this point:

一列火车抵达车站。一个小男孩和一个小女孩，兄妹俩，面对面坐在车厢里，旁边是窗户，随着火车停下，透过窗户可以看到车站站台上的建筑物。“看，”哥哥说，“我们在女士座！”：“白痴，”他的妹妹回答道，“你没看到我们在男士座吗？”（Ecrits，167）。

A train arrives at a station. A little boy and little girl, brother and sister, in a compartment face to face next to the window through which the buildings along the station platform can be seen passing as the train pulls to a stop. “Look,” says the brother, “we’re at Ladies!”: “Idiot,” replies his sister, “Can’t you see we’re at Gentlemen?” (Ecrits, 167).

兄妹俩看到的图像之间唯一的区别在于“女士们”和“先生们”这两个词，因为他们出现的门在其他方面可能完全相同。通过这种方式，拉康证明了语言不是现实的图景，而是一种需要破译才能看到“现实”的代码。然而，拉康的创新之处在于将索绪尔的概念应用于潜意识，大胆地断言：潜意识就是语言：“精神分析经验在潜意识中发现的是语言的整个结构。因此，从一开始，就必须重新思考潜意识仅仅是本能的根源这一观念”（Ecrits，163）。

The only difference between the images that the brother and sister see is in the words “Ladies” and “Gentlemen,” since the doors on which they appear are otherwise presumably identical. In this way, Lacan demonstrates that language is not a picture of reality but a code that needs to be deciphered before one can see “reality.” However, Lacan’s innovation is in adapting Saussure’s concept to the unconscious in the daring assertion that the unconscious is language: “what the psychoanalytic experience discovers in the unconscious is the whole structure of language. Thus from the outset, the notion that the unconscious is merely the seat of the instincts will have to be rethought” (Ecrits, 163).

无意识作为语言：“读者”

The unconscious as language: “The Reader”

拉康所说的无意识作为语言，在斯蒂芬·戴德利执导的《朗读者》（2008）中得到了充分的阐释，凯特·温丝莱特饰演汉娜·施密茨，并凭借此角色获得奥斯卡最佳女主角奖。大卫·克劳斯饰演青年时期的迈克尔·伯格，拉尔夫·费因斯饰演成年后的迈克尔·伯格。电影以 20 世纪 50 年代的柏林为背景，以电车售票员汉娜和 15 岁学生迈克尔之间的关系开场。迈克尔在放学回家的路上病得很重，陌生人汉娜帮助了他，并好心地送他回家。迈克尔康复后，他打电话给汉娜感谢她在他生病时给予的帮助，两人开始了性关系。他们经常发生性关系，然后迈克尔会读课本给汉娜听。然而，直到许多年后，他才知道汉娜在战争期间的活动，也知道她是个文盲。他们关系的早期阶段，两人都相对幸福，除了几次汉娜莫名其妙地发脾气，对迈克尔粗鲁无礼。引发这些脾气爆发的事件似乎只是一种愤怒的借口，而汉娜本人似乎并不理解这种愤怒。例如，有一次，迈克尔去电车看汉娜，但她拒绝和他说话。后来，回到家后，她对迈克尔大发雷霆，因为他在二等车厢，而她在一等车厢。当他抱怨她没有意识到他花了大量时间和精力来安排这次会面时，她怒气冲冲地让他离开，说他对她来说并不重要。迈克尔泪流满面地道歉并请求原谅，这种模式经常发生，以至于他后来表示，他总是道歉，而她从来不道歉。

What Lacan means by the unconscious as language is illustrated by “The Reader” (2008), directed by Stephen Daldry, with Kate Winslet as Hanna Schmitz, a part for which she received an Academy Award for Best Actress. Michael Berg as a young man is played by David Kross and as an adult by Ralph Fiennes. Set in Berlin in the 1950s, the film begins with the relationship between Hanna, a tramcar conductor, and Michael, a 15-year-old student. Becoming violently ill while returning home from school, Michael is helped by Hanna, a stranger, who kindly sees that he finds his way home. After Michael recovers from his illness, he calls on Hanna to thank her for helping him when he was unwell, and a sexual relationship begins. On a regular basis they have sex, then Michael reads to Hanna from his schoolbooks. He does not, however, learn about her wartime activities or that she is illiterate until many years later. This early period of their relationship is for both of them relatively happy except for a few instances when Hanna inexplicably loses her temper and is rude and unkind to Michael. The events that set off these eruptions of temper appear to be mere pretexts for a kind of anger that Hanna herself seems not to understand. For example, on one occasion, Michael goes to the tram to see Hanna, but she refuses to speak to him. Later, back at her home, she flares out at Michael because he was in the second-class compartment and she was in the first. When he complains that she does not realize that he took a great deal of time and effort to arrange the meeting, she heatedly tells him to leave and that he does not matter to her. In tears, Michael apologizes and begs for forgiveness, a pattern that occurs often enough that he later remarks that he always apologizes and she never does.

拉康用“攻击性”一词来解释这种行为，它指的是攻击性倾向，这种倾向只是偶尔表现出来，大部分时间都是被压抑的：

Lacan explains this kind of behavior by way of the term “aggressivity,” which means the tendency toward aggression that is only occasionally expressed, remaining for the most part repressed:

这种攻击意图显而易见：我们经常在个人对依赖他的人的形成方面观察到它：有意图的攻击性会侵蚀、破坏、瓦解；它会阉割；它会导致死亡。“我还以为你阳痿呢，”一位突然变成母老虎的母亲对她的儿子咆哮道，而她的儿子费了好大劲才承认自己有同性恋倾向（Ecrits，12）。

This aggressive intention is manifest: we constantly observe it in the formative aspect of an individual on those dependent upon him: intended aggressivity gnaws away, undermines, disintegrates; it castrates; it leads to death. “And I thought you were impotent,” growled a mother, suddenly transformed into a tigress, to her son, who, with great difficulty had admitted to her his homosexual tendencies (Ecrits, 12).

这位“母老虎”妈妈让我们想起汉娜伤害小迈克尔的情景，她声称迈克尔无法惹恼她，因为她不在乎他。拉康解释说，攻击性的根源与意象的概念有关，本章后面将详细讨论。在这里，只要记住拉康用这个术语来描述从保护茧中走出来的自我就足够了：

This “tigress” mother reminds us of Hanna wounding the young Michael by asserting that he is incapable of upsetting her because she does not care about him. Lacan explains that the source of aggressivity relates to the concept of the imago, to be discussed in detail later in this chapter. Here, it is sufficient to keep in mind that Lacan uses this term to describe the self emerging from its protective cocoon:

在古典心理学屡屡无法解释这些心理现象 [攻击性形式] 之后 […] 心理分析学家首次成功地尝试在它们所代表的具体现实层面上进行操作。这是因为他们从它们在主体中的形成功能出发，并揭示出，如果瞬时意象决定了这些倾向的个体变化，那么那些我们称之为意象的其他特定意象，正是作为母体的变化，为“本能”本身而构成 ( Ecrits，12)。

After the repeated failures of classical psychology to account for these mental phenomena [forms of aggressivity] […] psychoanalysts made the first successful attempts to operate at the level of the concrete reality that they represent. This was because they set out from their formative function in the subject, and revealed that if the transient images determined such individual inflexions of the tendencies, it is as variations of the matrices that those other specific images, which we refer to by the term imago, are constituted for the “instincts” themselves (Ecrits, 12).

拉康的分析告诉我们，汉娜正在与一个正在进入一个陌生而陌生的世界的自我作斗争。此外，拉康解释说，汉娜经历的这个过程是由性接触引发的，这并非巧合。我们记得，汉娜第一次注意到迈克尔被她的裙子激起了性欲。后来，她赤身裸体地站在他身后的浴缸里，摸着他勃起的阴茎，说道：“这就是你回来的原因。”性吸引力和由对方的性欲引起的性欲是这一过程的两个关键组成部分：

Lacan’s analysis suggests to us that Hanna is struggling with a self that is emerging into a strange and alien world. Moreover, Lacan explains, it is no coincidence that this process undergone by Hanna is initiated by a sexual encounter. We recall that Hanna first notices Michael being aroused by watching her dress. Later, standing behind him naked in the bath, feeling his erect penis, she remarks, “that’s why you came back.” Sexual attraction and arousal occasioned by the arousal of the other are two key components of this procedure:

正是在这种情色关系中，人类个体将一种使自己与自我疏远的形象固定在自己身上，这种情色关系中存在着能量和形式，这种激情的组织被他称为自我。这种形式将在主体的冲突性内部张力中结晶，这决定了他对他人欲望对象的欲望的觉醒（《文学》，21）。

It is in this erotic relation, in which the human individual fixes upon himself an image that alienates him from himself, that are to be found the energy and the form on which this organization of the passions that he will call his ego is based. This form will crystallize in the subject’s conflictual internal tension, which determines the awakening of his desire for the object of the other’s desire (Ecrits, 21).

考虑到汉娜的过去，这种分析似乎非常恰当。但在电影的早期，年轻的迈克尔并不知道汉娜是文盲。当她特别不自在地看着菜单时，观众开始瞥见她的问题。出于羞耻而隐藏她的文盲显然是她沮丧的根源，也是她偶尔发怒的原因之一，但我们随后了解到，汉娜有一个更深层次的问题，这个问题潜伏在她的潜意识中，直到她能够读写时她才能理解。

This analysis seems very apt given Hanna’s past. But at this early point in the film, young Michael has no idea that Hanna is illiterate. The audience begins to get a glimpse of her problem when she is particularly uncomfortable looking at a menu. Hiding her illiteracy out of shame is clearly a source of frustration which is one of the causes of her occasional eruptions of anger, but we subsequently learn that Hanna has a much deeper problem, one that lurks in her unconscious, undecipherable to her until she is able to read and write.

电影现在转向迈克尔，他是一名法学院的年轻人，似乎在学业上很出色，但在社交生活中却遇到了问题。他对汉娜的爱可能在他的潜意识中挥之不去，这或许可以解释部分原因是，当迈克尔发现汉娜是集中营看守时，他非常震惊。汉娜在法庭上作证说，她写了关于在燃烧的教堂里被遗弃等死的妇女的报告。之后，迈克尔向他的法学教授坦白，他掌握了对审判至关重要的信息，因为他现在意识到汉娜是文盲，不可能写出这份报告。教授当然告诉迈克尔，他有义务向法庭告知与案件有关的任何信息。但在这里，我们看到迈克尔怀有与汉娜相似的羞耻感。虽然她无法接受承认自己是文盲，但他拒绝与汉娜交谈或向法庭告知她的文盲，因为这会牵连到他与她的私人关系。对于汉娜和迈克尔来说，接触他们潜意识的手段都是通过语言。汉娜在监狱里通过将迈克尔朗读的录音带与图书馆里的书籍进行比较来学习阅读和写作。迈克尔谈到了他与汉娜的关系，但只是在她死后。在二十多年的牢狱生涯中，迈克尔从未给汉娜写过信或说过话。他没有给她回信，而是给她寄来自己朗读的磁带。在临终之际，也就是汉娜获释前几天，他们近三十年来第一次见面，她说她更喜欢听他朗读，而不是自己朗读，意识到那些日子已经过去了。

The movie now moves to Michael as a young adult in law school, who seems to be thriving academically but having problems in his social life. His love for Hanna perhaps lingers in his unconscious, which may explain in part why he is utterly devastated to discover that Hanna was a concentration camp guard. After Hanna has testified in court that she wrote the report about the women left to die in a burning church, Michael confesses to his law professor that he has information vital to the trial, for he now realizes that Hanna is illiterate and could not have written the report. The professor of course tells Michael that he is obliged to inform the court of anything relevant to the case. But here we confront Michael harboring shame reminiscent of that of Hanna. While she cannot reconcile herself to admitting to illiteracy, he refuses to talk to Hanna or inform the court of her illiteracy because it would implicate him in a personal relationship with her. And for both Hanna and Michael the means of getting in touch with their unconscious is by way of language. Hanna learns to read and write while in prison by comparing the tapes of Michael’s readings with the books in the library. And Michael speaks about his relationship with Hanna, but only after she is dead. During over two decades of prison time Michael never writes or speaks to Hanna. Instead of replying to her letters, he sends cassettes of him reading. And near the end when they meet for the first time in nearly thirty years a few days before her release, she states her preference for his reading over her own, recognizing that those days are past.

在下一个场景中，我们得知汉娜自杀身亡，并留下遗嘱，指示迈克尔将她所有的积蓄交给教堂大火中幸存的两名妇女之一。通过这种方式，汉娜向我们表明，在学习读写的过程中，她已经接受了作为一名警卫的责任，并理解了为什么迈克尔近三十年来无法与她说话或写信。汉娜的羞耻感变成了内疚感，无论是因为理解了迈克尔对她的看法，还是因为回答了她自己对法官的问题“你会怎么做？”，或者两者兼而有之。电影表明，羞耻是汉娜压抑内疚感的机制，让她的内疚感潜伏在潜意识中，最终她从字面上和象征意义上读懂了潜意识，导致她自杀。

In the next scene we learn that Hanna has committed suicide and left a will with instructions that Michael take all her savings to one of the two women who survived the church fire. By this means Hanna is showing us that in learning to read and write she has accepted responsibility for her acts as a guard and understood why Michael was unable to speak or write to her for nearly three decades. Hanna’s shame has become guilt, whether that results from an understanding of Michael’s view of her or from answering her own question to the judge, “What would you have done?”, or both. The movie suggests that shame was Hanna’s mechanism for repressing her guilt, leaving it dormant in her unconscious, and that she finally came to read, literally and figuratively, her unconscious, leading her to suicide.

汉娜死后，迈克尔的羞耻感转变为责任感。首先，按照汉娜的遗嘱，他把她的钱交给了唯一幸存下来的火灾幸存者。这位女士坚持要她把整个故事告诉她，结果迈克尔第一次承认了他和汉娜的早期爱情关系。然后在电影的最后一幕，迈克尔带着女儿来到汉娜的坟前，讲述了他和她的关系。由于他的女儿似乎是他唯一爱的人，他向她坦白不仅是承担责任，更重要的是，他试图解释和理解他对汉娜的爱。

Michael’s shame turns to responsibility after the death of Hanna. First, as bidden in Hanna’s will, he takes her money to the only survivor of the fire that is still alive. This woman insists that she be told the whole story, resulting in Michael telling for the first time, as he admits, of his early love relationship with Hanna. Then in the final scene of the film Michael takes his daughter to the grave of Hanna and recounts the story of his relationship with her. Since his daughter seems to be the only person alive whom he loves, his confession to her is not only an acceptance of responsibility but also, and more importantly, an attempt to explain and understand his love for Hanna.

在影片的结尾，我们不得不面对一个难题。为什么影片的标题是“读者”？汉娜成为一名读者有什么意义？当迈克尔向火灾中的最后一位幸存者解释说，他只是在他们的关系结束后，当迈克尔发现汉娜不识字时，她问这是否可以成为她行为的借口。迈克尔的回答“不”代表了我们所有人的心声。那么我们为什么要关心汉娜是否识字呢？毕竟，成为一名读者似乎并没有让汉娜的生活变得更好。事实上，这甚至可能导致她的自杀。阅读是她与迈克尔联系在一起的，她意识到她最喜欢的阅读形式——他给她读书，已经结束了。从一开始，阅读就是他们关系中的一个重要元素，但在某个时候它发生了变化。一开始他们先发生性关系，然后迈克尔给她读书。但后来汉娜宣布顺序要颠倒过来：“孩子”要先读书。阅读成为一种爱的形式，为他们做好了身体表现的准备。在最初的吸引之后，阅读成为他们坠入爱河的手段。

At the end of the film we are left to confront a difficult problem. Why is it entitled “The Reader”? Why does it matter that Hanna has become a reader? When Michael explains to the last survivor of the fire that he only discovered Hanna’s illiteracy after their relationship had ended, she asks if that excuses her behavior. Michael responds with a “no” that speaks for all of us. So why should we care that Hanna has become literate? After all, becoming a reader does not seem to make life more livable for Hanna. In fact, it may even contribute to her suicide. Reading is what she associates with Michael, and she recognizes that her favorite form of it, his reading to her, is over. From early on, reading had been an important element of their relationship, but at a certain point it changed. In the beginning they first had sex and then Michael read to her. But then Hanna announced that the order was to be reversed: the “kid” was to read first. Reading became a form of love that prepared them for its physical manifestation. After initial attraction, reading became their means of falling in love.

事实上，汉娜想要读书的愿望是试图内化迈克尔作为读者的声音；从某种意义上说，是进入他的大脑。也许这就是导致汉娜在最后几年放纵自己的原因，用监狱长的话来说，大概是在她能够读写之后的那段时间。拉康评论说“主体的无意识是他者的话语”（Ecrits，61）。汉娜是否理解迈克尔为何为与她的关系感到羞耻？这就是她在遗嘱中说“告诉迈克尔，我对你好”的意思吗？对汉娜来说，阅读是她第一次真正听到他人声音的手段吗？因此，阅读是否使她第一次听到了长期嵌入她潜意识中的受害者的声音？

Indeed, Hanna’s desire to read is an attempt to internalize Michael’s voice as a reader; in a sense, to climb into his brain. And perhaps that is what leads, in the words of the prison warden, to her letting herself go during her last few years, presumably the time after she was able to read and write. Lacan remarks that “the unconscious of the subject is the discourse of the other” (Ecrits, 61). Did Hanna come to understand why Michael was ashamed of his relationship with her? Is that what she means in her will by the phrase, “tell Michael that I said hello”? Is reading for Hanna the means by which she first really hears the voice of the other? And does it therefore enable her to hear for the first time the voices of her victims for so long embedded in her unconscious?

但是从电影一开始就一直读书的迈克尔又如何呢？我们该如何理解他的自我和解过程呢？同样，问题在于语言。他的问题涉及言语。直到最后一名火灾幸存者质问他，他才承认自己爱汉娜。之后，他才能够把整个故事讲给他的女儿听，这和他给汉娜读书一样，是一种爱的表现。他的女儿会从他的叙述中得到什么呢？她会谴责他没有调查汉娜的背景，以避免与一个自愿为纳粹工作的人扯上关系吗？还是她会接受迈克尔的行为就像一个正常的 15 岁孩子，符合 20 世纪 50 年代德国年轻人的话语范围？

But then what about Michael, who has been a reader from the beginning of the film? How are we to understand his process of self-reconciliation? Again, the issue is language. His problem involves speech. Not until he is challenged by the last survivor of the fire does he admit to his love of Hanna. After that, he is able to tell the entire story to his daughter, no less an act of love than his reading to Hanna. And what will his daughter gather from his narrative? Will she condemn him for not investigating Hanna’s background to avoid being involved with someone who worked willingly for the Nazis? Or will she accept that Michael behaved like a normal 15-year-old within the realm of discourse available to a young man in the Germany of the 1950s?

拉康对潜意识话语的看法意味着，基本道德、基本礼仪，以及那些引导人们怀疑纳粹时期在德国毫发无损地幸存下来的人的东西，并不是天生的或自然的，而是一种文化功能，是一种从话语中习得的概念。二十年后，在学习法律并在德国文化中长大后，迈克尔开始明白他的国家已经进入了一个新的后纳粹阶段。像迈克尔一样，我们也不得不挣扎于对汉娜的感情，汉娜是一个我们应该鄙视的女人，但在凯特·温斯莱特的精彩演绎下，我们对她产生了一些同情。拉康警告我们，潜意识是罪恶感的丰富来源，是一种语言必须读懂才能理解。一旦汉娜能够读懂自己的潜意识，她就不会逃避责任，相信自己不再值得迈克尔的爱。但在精神分析中，这个阶段通常涉及自弗洛伊德以来被称为“移情”的现象，即分析者将责任转移给分析师。正如我们所料，对于拉康来说，这个过程明显是话语性的：

The implication of Lacan’s view of the discourse of the unconscious is that basic morality, common decency, that which directs one to be suspicious of anyone who seems to have survived unscathed in Germany during the Nazi period is not innate or natural but a function of culture, a concept learned from discourse. Twenty years later, after studying law and growing up in a German culture, Michael comes to comprehend that his country has reached a new, post-Nazi stage. Like Michael, we are left to struggle with our feelings toward Hanna, a woman we should despise but for whom, with the help of Kate Winslet’s brilliant portrayal, we feel some empathy. Lacan cautions us that the unconscious, a rich source of guilt, is a language that must be read to be understood. Once Hanna can read her unconscious, she does not shirk from responsibility, believing that she no longer deserves Michael’s love. But in psychoanalysis this stage usually involves what, since Freud, is known as “transference,” when the analysand transfers responsibility to the analyst. As we would expect, for Lacan, this procedure is distinctly discursive:

我们希望避免病人给我们设下的陷阱。它本身就隐藏着一个秘密。“承担起压垮我的邪恶吧，”病人告诉我们，“但如果你仍然像现在这样自鸣得意、自满、泰然自若，你就不配听到它了”（《Ecrits》，15）。

We wish to avoid the trap […] that the patient addresses to us. It carries a secret within itself […]. “Take upon yourself,” the patient is telling us, “the evil that weighs me down; but if you remain smug, self-satisfied, unruffled as you are now, you won’t be worthy of hearing it” (Ecrits, 15).

汉娜唯一可以倾诉过去的人是迈克尔，但讽刺的是，他拒绝了，因为他自己感到羞耻，他自己需要一个倾诉者，而这种需要只有在汉娜死后他才需要面对。也许这就是迈克尔在汉娜的牢房里放声大哭的原因。

The only person Hanna can speak to about her past is Michael, who ironically refuses because of his own shame, his own need for an interlocutor, a need he only confronts after Hanna’s death. Perhaps that is why Michael bursts into tears in Hanna’s prison cell.

移情与“弗罗斯特/尼克松”

Transference and “Frost/Nixon”

《弗罗斯特/尼克松》（2008）由罗恩·霍华德执导，迈克尔·辛饰演大卫·弗罗斯特，弗兰克·兰格拉饰演理查德·尼克松，这是拉康将转移过程转化为话语形式的一个很好的例子。这部电影本身是关于报纸、电视、白宫录音带和电影形式的公共话语。它的结构是纪实新闻：行动经常被报纸记者、电视新闻研究员和广播/电视导演的回顾性评论打断，他们是大卫·弗罗斯特的顾问。他们的评论一起成为一个新闻叙事，提醒我们重演的历史事件是话语性的，是一个“远程历史”事件。

“Frost/Nixon” (2008), directed by Ron Howard, starring Michael Sheen as David Frost and Frank Langella as Richard Nixon, is a good example of the process of transference as modified by Lacan into a form of discourse. This film is itself about public discourse in the form of newspapers, television, White House tapes, and film. Its structure is that of documentary journalism: the action is regularly interrupted by retrospective comments from the newspaper reporter, television news researcher, and radio/television director who serve as advisers to David Frost. Their remarks together become a journalistic narrative reminding us that the historical event reenacted is discursive, a “tele-historical” event.

和汉娜一样，尼克松也是不承认自己有罪的又一例子，但尼克松绝不是文盲。1977 年，也就是这部电影拍摄的时候，尼克松已经辞去公职，但并未承认任何不当行为。而尼克松首次在电视上承认有罪，这颇具讽刺意味。在加州州长竞选失败后，他宣布媒体不会再“把尼克松踢来踢去”。正是出于这个原因，BBC 的管理层并不指望尼克松会认真考虑弗罗斯特的提议。然而，尼克松接受了，原因有二：钱，以及弗罗斯特不是记者，而是一个类似于游戏节目主持人的角色，因此尼克松认为他不是他的对手。除了一点之外，尼克松在所有方面都是对的：弗罗斯特能力不足。但是，正如英国广播公司的电视/广播总监指出的那样，弗罗斯特了解电视，这是一种话语媒体，而正如我们从他与肯尼迪的辩论中知道的那样，尼克松在电视中很容易受到攻击。

Like Hanna, Nixon is another example of unacknowledged culpability, but Nixon is far from illiterate. In 1977, when this film takes place, Nixon had resigned from office but had not admitted to any wrongdoing. And there is a striking irony in the fact that Nixon first admits guilt on television. After losing the gubernatorial race in California he announced that the media would not have “[Nixon] to kick around any more.” And it is precisely for this reason that the BBC managers do not expect Nixon to consider Frost’s offer seriously. Nixon accepts, however, for two reasons: money and the fact that Frost is not a journalist but something akin to a game show host, and so, Nixon assumes, no match for him. In all respects but one Nixon is right: Frost is out of his depth. But, as the BBC television/ radio director points out, Frost knows television, a discursive medium where Nixon, as we know from the debates with Kennedy, is vulnerable.

金钱对尼克松来说很重要，因为他觉得自己被排除在社会上层之外，在他看来，上层社会只属于东海岸的常春藤盟校毕业生。尼克松是加州惠蒂尔学院的本科生，杜克大学的研究生，他把金钱当作“阶级”或“上流社会”的替代品。他以为与弗罗斯特的较量会很容易，而这种假设在早期的采访中得到了证实，当时弗罗斯特不断被尼克松智胜和控制，尼克松对事实的掌握和修辞能力使他成为明显的赢家。但他们都知道，最后一次关于水门事件的采访是至关重要的。甚至在我们到达最后阶段之前，尼克松就开始放松对弗罗斯特的态度，注意到并评论了这位采访者的意大利懒汉和他好色之徒的名声。此外，尼克松向弗罗斯特指出，两人都信奉卫理公会，都有局外人的经历，弗罗斯特在剑桥，尼克松在华盛顿当权派。

Money is important to Nixon because he feels excluded from the upper echelons of society, which are in his view reserved for east-coast, ivy-league graduates. An undergraduate at Whittier College in California and a graduate student at Duke University, Nixon uses money as an alternative to “class” or “poshness.” And his assumption that dueling with Frost will be easy money is borne out in the early interviews when Frost is continually outmaneuvered and dominated by Nixon, whose command of facts and rhetorical powers make him a clear winner. But they both know that the last interview, on Watergate, is the crucial one. Even before we reach this final stage Nixon begins to ease up with Frost, noticing and remarking upon the interviewer’s Italian loafers and his reputation as a womanizer. Moreover, Nixon points out to Frost that both share Methodism and experiences as outsiders, Frost at Cambridge and Nixon among the Washington establishment.

在最后一次采访的前一天晚上，尼克松在醉酒状态下给弗罗斯特打电话，指出明天是他们两人生死攸关的时刻：这是尼克松第一次给予弗罗斯特同等的重视，他认识到如果第二天没有供词或令人震惊的新信息出现，弗罗斯特将毁于一旦，因为他在这一系列采访中投入了自己的金钱和声誉。人们会记得，在这次电话交谈中，尼克松承认自己喝了几杯酒，并怒斥东部当权派，愤怒地宣称他将继续与他们斗争，并用他的金钱和政治权力击败他们。他还声称弗罗斯特和他一样，永远无法被当权派接受，但他仍然继续努力争取当权派的认可。即使弗罗斯特回答说他不知道“总统先生”在说什么，尼克松也拒绝接受他的否认，继续对他的敌人大发雷霆。后来，尼克松对这次电话交谈毫无记忆，他清楚地表明，这次电话交谈是从他的潜意识中爆发出来的，后来被压抑了。在最后一次采访的早上，在等待摄制组准备就绪时，尼克松问了一个奇怪的问题，这也许是电影中唯一有趣的时刻：他询问弗罗斯特昨晚是否有过“通奸”。拉康认为，性欲或“享乐”与攻击性是移情情境中的关键因素。当然，正如分析师和被分析者一样，尼克松和弗罗斯特也是如此，移情是拉康所说的“陷阱”，一种将对方牵连到罪责和错误行为中的诡计。最后，这场对话还涉及到尼克松对自我的大胆宣称，即在接下来的决斗中他将不遗余力，这明确暗示他期望获胜——这本身就是一种自我怀疑的表现，或者用拉康的话来说，“沮丧”。

On the night before the final interview Nixon, in an inebriated state, phones Frost and points out that tomorrow is do or die for both of them: for the first time Nixon is giving Frost equal billing, recognizing that if no confession or startling new information emerges on the following day Frost will be ruined, having invested his own money and reputation in this series of interviews. It will be recalled that during this phone conversation, Nixon, admitting that he has had a few drinks, rails against the eastern establishment, angrily asserting that he will fight on against them and defeat them with his money and political power. He also asserts that Frost is like him, someone who can never be accepted by the establishment but who nevertheless continues to strive for its recognition. Even when Frost replies that he does not know what “Mr. President” is talking about, Nixon refuses to accept his denial, continuing to rant on about his enemies. Later retaining no memory of this phone conversation, Nixon gives a clear indication that it erupted from his unconscious and was later repressed. On the morning of the final interview while waiting for the camera crew to get ready, Nixon asks a bizarre question, marking perhaps the only comical moment in the film: he inquires if Frost engaged in any “fornication” last night. Lacan locates libido or “jouissance” along with aggressivity as key factors in transference situations. And, of course, as with the analyst and analysand, so too with Nixon and Frost, the transference is what Lacan, as we have seen, calls a “trap,” a ploy to implicate the other in guilt and wrong-doing. Finally this conversation also involves Nixon’s bold assertion of ego, that in the ensuing duel no holds will be barred, with the unmistakable implication that he expects to win—itself an indication of self-doubt or, in Lacan’s terms, “frustration.”

因为在他为他人重建的劳动中，他重新发现了使他像另一个人，并且注定它总是被别人从他手中夺走。

For in this labour which he undertakes to reconstruct for another, he rediscovers the fundamental alienation that made him construct it like another, and which has always destined it to be taken from him by another.

这个自我 […] 本质上是挫败感。 […] 因客体而受挫 […] 它越是复杂，与享乐的疏离就越深刻。

This ego […] is frustration in its essence. […] frustration by an object […] the more it is elaborated the more profound the alienation from his jouissance.

此时主体所体验到的攻击性与欲望受挫的动物攻击性无关[...]，[而是]与奴隶对其劳动受挫的反应是渴望死亡有关（Ecrits，46）。

The aggressivity experienced by the subject at this point has nothing to do with the animal aggressivity of frustrated desire […] [but of] the slave whose response to the frustration of his labour is a desire for death (Ecrits, 46).

后一句话最明显地体现在尼克松开始酗酒，试图逃避第二天的舌战，他声称自己对此表示欢迎，尤其是因为结果就是失忆，一种忘却的形式。相比之下，弗罗斯特实际上整晚都在回顾事实，这将使他能够让尼克松了解尼克松助手查尔斯·科尔森的情况。尼克松大吃一惊，被迫承认有掩盖行为，但他为自己辩护说，如果总统这么做，那是合法的。弗罗斯特大吃一惊，问尼克松是不是在说总统凌驾于法律之上。这时，尼克松的幕僚长杰克·布伦南冲进来阻止采访，但尼克松停顿了一下后又回来，说出了他著名的忏悔：“我让美国人民失望了。”这里的过程非常具有启发性。弗罗斯特首先问尼克松，他现在是否愿意承认任何错误行为，人们需要知道，也应该听到他关于这一点的回答。尼克松有些惊讶，回答说：“你想让我说什么？”然后，弗罗斯特放下他的剪贴板，某种意义上是他的剧本，成为他希望尼克松成为的那个尼克松：作为一名经验丰富的电视名人，他在这个令尼克松感到不安的媒介中展示或排练尼克松。直到那时，尼克松才会坦白。用拉康的话来说，他已经把别人的欲望当作自己的欲望。

The latter phrase is most apparent in Nixon’s turning to drink, an attempt to escape the next day’s verbal combat that he professes to welcome, particularly since the result is loss of memory, a form of oblivion. By contrast, Frost has in fact been up all night reviewing the facts, which will enable him to catch Nixon up on circumstances regarding Charles Colson, one of Nixon’s aides. Taken aback, Nixon is forced to admit that there was a cover-up, but he defends himself by asserting that if the President does it, it is legal. Shocked, Frost asks whether Nixon is saying that the President is above the law. At this point Nixon’s chief of staff, Jack Brennan, rushes in to stop the interview, but after a pause Nixon comes back and makes his famous confession, “I let the American people down.” The process here is very revealing. Frost first asks Nixon if he is now willing to admit to any wrong-doing, that the people need to know, deserve to hear from him on that point. Somewhat surprised, Nixon replies, “What would you have me say?” Frost then drops his clipboard, his script in a sense, and becomes for Nixon the Nixon that he wants Nixon to be: as an experienced television personality, he shows or rehearses Nixon in this medium that disconcerts him. Then and only then does Nixon confess. In Lacanian terms, he has taken on the desire of the other as his own.

弗罗斯特是如何做到其他人做不到的，让尼克松不仅承认错误判断，还承认自己的罪责？我相信，拉康认为，尼克松原本以为这场媒体或话语事件只涉及他演讲的才能，但其实还包含其他元素，从意大利游手好闲的人和弗罗斯特最新的迷人女友，到卫理公会、通奸和大学经历的讨论。尼克松对差异着迷，被相似之处吸引，他与弗罗斯特做出了反应，一度咄咄逼人地捍卫总统的权威，后来注意到弗罗斯特对总统凌驾于法律之上这一观点感到震惊。正如我们在电话交谈中看到的那样，尼克松已经确信自己与弗罗斯特有很多共同之处，而弗罗斯特本人，就像一位经验丰富的分析师一样，对此持怀疑态度。尽管如此，尼克松还是被弗罗斯特所吸引，因为他是一个魅力四射、社会成功的自我。拉康对这种形式的力比多的功能进行了如下解释：

How does Frost achieve what no one else could do, bring Nixon to admit not merely misjudgment but also culpability? Lacan would suggest, I believe, that this media or discursive event that Nixon expected to involve only his prowess at speech-making, included other elements, from Italian loafers and Frost’s latest glamorous girlfriend to discussions of Methodism, fornication, and university experiences. Fascinated by difference and drawn by similarity, Nixon reacts with Frost, at one point of aggressivity defending presidential authority and then noticing Frost’s shock at the notion that the president is above the law. Nixon, as we have seen in the phone conversation, has convinced himself that he has much in common with Frost, something Frost himself, rather like an experienced analyst, is skeptical about. Nevertheless, Nixon is attracted to Frost as a glamorous, socially successful form of himself. Lacan explains the function of libido in this form as follows:

这里有一个结构性的十字路口……以理解人类攻击性的本质及其与自我和客体形式主义的关系。正是在这种情色关系中，人类个体将一种使自己与自我疏远的形象固定在自己身上，这种情色关系中存在着能量和形式，他将这种激情组织称为自我。这种形式将在主体的冲突性内部张力中结晶，这决定了他对他人欲望对象的欲望的觉醒（Ecrits，21）。

There is a structural crossroads here […] to understand the nature of aggressivity in man and its relation with the formalism of the ego and his objects. It is in this erotic relation, in which the human individual fixes upon himself an image that alienates him from himself, that are to be found the energy and the form on which this organization of the passions that he will call his ego is based. This form will crystallize in the subject’s conflictual internal tension, which determines the awakening of his desire for the object of the other’s desire (Ecrits, 21).

拉康的观念有助于解释“弗罗斯特/尼克松”结局中许多令人费解的元素。最后一次采访中的一个关键点是弗罗斯特问到“人民”的问题。尼克松一直在为掩盖真相辩护，指出国会和媒体中他周围的政治党派之争。但那是在华盛顿的内心世界，所以当弗罗斯特提到人民时，尼克松一开始就措手不及，也就是说，他的意象从华盛顿特区的茧中浮现出来，看到了这个国家的其他地方，并承认他让那些人失望了。从那一刻起，正如报纸记者/叙述者指出的那样——值得注意的是，叙述者是一名记者，是媒体或话语的产物——尼克松的脸发生了显著的变化，现在因自我厌恶而肿胀，我们得知，弗罗斯特因在当时最大的电视观众面前揭露尼克松而受到称赞。一时间，尼克松几乎达到了悲剧的高度，他承认自己独自承担责任，并将终生承担责任，或者用叙述者的话来说，从今以后，水门事件之后，所有重大政治丑闻都将被称为“门”。我们注意到，用拉康的话来说，意象已经从镜像阶段的茧中移到了下一个阶段，即象征阶段，拉康用这个术语来理解话语领域。尼克松没有责怪媒体（尼克松的话语术语），而是首次承担了水门事件的责任。拉康将这一过程描述如下：

Lacan’s conceptions help explain the many puzzling elements in the conclusion of “Frost/Nixon.” A key point in the last interview is when Frost asks about the “people.” Nixon had been defending the cover-up by pointing to the political partisanship around him in Congress and the media. But that was in the inner Washington world, so that when Frost mentions the people Nixon is at first caught off balance, that is, the imago emerges from the Washington DC cocoon, sees the rest of the country and admits that he has let those people down. From that moment on, as the newspaper reporter/narrator points out—and it is important to note that the narrator is a journalist, a creature of the media or discourse—Nixon’s face changes markedly, now swollen with self-loathing, and we are informed that Frost was applauded for having exposed Nixon in front of the largest television audience of that era. And for a moment Nixon almost achieves tragic stature, acknowledging that he alone bears responsibility and will do so for the rest of his life, or, in the words of the narrator, that henceforth all great political scandals shall be known as “gates” after Watergate. We note that, in Lacanian terms, the imago has moved from the cocoon of the mirror stage to the next stage, the symbolic stage, the term Lacan uses for understanding the realm of discourse. Instead of blaming the media, Nixon’s term for discourse, Nixon for the first time accepts responsibility for Watergate. Lacan describes this procedure as follows:

如果你要对他讲话，那么你实际上是在讲别的东西，也就是说，你讲的不是他谈论自己时所讨论的东西，而是他向你讲话的东西，无论他说什么，这东西对他来说都永远无法理解，如果这话语是向你讲的，而你却不能从中得到回应，如果听到这话语以这种颠倒的形式出现，而你又不能通过把它回馈给他，使他既能认出它，又能让他认出它的真实性，那么你就无法得到这东西的双重满足（《文集》，144）。

If it is to him that you have to speak, it is literally of something else, that is, of something other than that which is in question when he speaks of himself, and which is the thing that speaks to you, a thing which, whatever he says, would remain forever inaccessible to him, if in being speech addressed to you it could not elicit its response in you, and if, from having heard its speech in this inverted form, you could not, by returning it to him, give him the double satisfaction of having recognized it and of making him recognize its truth (Ecrits, 144).

因此，当听到尼克松拒绝“卑躬屈膝”时，弗罗斯特巧妙地为他提供了一个有尊严的、几乎是悲剧性的忏悔，让尼克松获得了双重满足，因为他认识到这句话虽然不是完全贬低尼克松，但却是事实。

So, hearing Nixon’s refusal to “grovel,” Frost cleverly provides for him a dignified, almost tragic confession, giving Nixon the double satisfaction of having recognized it as less than totally demeaning but nevertheless as the truth.

但影片并未就此结束。在前往伦敦之前，弗罗斯特拜访了尼克松位于加利福尼亚州圣克莱门特的家。尼克松热情地邀请弗罗斯特和他的女友喝茶，祝贺弗罗斯特获得了如此多的观众，并得到了支持弗罗斯特、反对尼克松的评论。但他并不感到惊讶，因为“婊子养的”一直在找他的麻烦，这表明尼克松的形象已经退回到偏执狂的茧中。尽管如此，他还是向弗罗斯特的女伴道歉，承认自己骂了人，并在一个罕见的幽默时刻说，他本会说“婊子养的”，但他的仆人非常喜欢狗。然后，他大方地接受了弗罗斯特赠送的一双意大利乐福鞋，显然很感动，不知何故忘记了这样一个事实：弗罗斯特是新闻界的一部分，也许是最致命的一部分，他认为新闻界毁了他。相反，尼克松对弗罗斯特很着迷，私下问他是否喜欢他的聚会，承认嫉妒他的幸福，并承认他不适合当政治家，因为他不善于与人相处。然后我们回到拉康的两个关键要素：话语，“那人呢？”和力比多，尼克松被弗罗斯特对人的享受所吸引，尤其是对美女的享受。

Yet the film does not end there. Frost visits Nixon at his San Clemente, California home before leaving for London. Nixon cordially invites Frost and his girlfriend to tea, congratulates Frost on the vast audience and the pro-Frost anti-Nixon reviews. But he is not surprised, as the “sons of whores” have always been out to get him, indicating that Nixon’s imago has retreated back into the cocoon of paranoia. Nonetheless, he charmingly apologizes to Frost’s female companion for swearing, remarking, in a rare moment of humor, that he would have said “sons of bitches” but that his servant is very fond of dogs. Then he graciously accepts Frost’s gift of a pair of Italian loafers, clearly moved, somehow losing sight of the fact that Frost is a part, perhaps the most lethal part, of the journalistic establishment that he believes has ruined him. On the contrary, Nixon is fascinated by Frost, asks him in private if he enjoys his parties, admits envy of his happiness and confesses that he is unsuitable to be a politician because not at ease with people. We return then to the two key Lacanian elements: discourse, “what about the people?” and libido, Nixon’s attraction to Frost’s enjoyment of people, particularly beautiful women.

最后，尼克松对最后一次采访前一天晚上的电话交谈毫无记忆，于是他问弗罗斯特他们讨论了什么。弗罗斯特回答说“芝士汉堡”。但这只是部分准确；弗罗斯特好心地避免让“总统先生”为他的愤怒咆哮感到尴尬。但在那次谈话中，尼克松直面了弗罗斯特身上的他性，说他们两人的声誉都岌岌可危，两人面临的风险大致相同。但尼克松进入其他人的世界（弗罗斯特和“美国人民”）的那一刻，现在已经没有了记忆。我们观众只剩下尼克松所说的媒体和拉康所说的话语在对“狡猾的迪克”玩最后的把戏。因为我们目睹了尼克松退缩到自己的壳里的视觉记录，将他与人民在一起的时刻置于潜意识中，这或许有助于解释为什么这位唯一辞去美国总统职位的人在这些采访之后继续活了 17 年，正如电影告诉我们的那样。

Lastly, remembering nothing of the phone conversation on the evening before the final interview, Nixon asks Frost what they discussed. Frost replies “cheeseburgers.” But that is only partially accurate; Frost kindly refrains from embarrassing “Mr. President” about his angry rant. But in that conversation, Nixon had confronted the otherness of himself in Frost, saying that both of their reputations were on the line, with the stakes much the same for both. But that moment when Nixon entered the world of other people, Frost and “the American people,” has now passed without memory. And we in the audience are left with what Nixon calls the media and Lacan calls discourse playing its final trick on “tricky Dick.” For we witness the visual record of Nixon retreating into his shell, relegating his moment with the people into his unconscious, which may help explain how the only man who ever resigned the U.S. presidency lived on after these interviews, as the movie informs us, for 17 years.

因此，当尼克松的敌人欢呼雀跃时，他却继续执政近二十年。从这一事实中，我们能得出什么结论呢？这个试图操纵选举并被迫辞去总统职位的人，难道会背负着这种罪恶感生活 17 年吗？或者，他是否已经决定，媒体再一次选择他作为方便的替罪羊、嘲笑的对象，而不是钦佩他承担了忠诚助手的罪孽？在尼克松的案例中，先天自我的概念是否只是一种幻觉，它使我们能够承受媒体的打击，这是一种生存所必需的幻觉？从镜像阶段进入象征性话语领域的“意象”是我们自我的硬核，还是它已经演变成某种不同的东西，一种具有历史连续性但没有本质的身份？

So while his enemies celebrate, Nixon carries on for almost two more decades. What are we to conclude from this fact? Could the man who took responsibility for attempting to fix an election and was forced to resign the presidency for it, live with this guilt for 17 years? Or could he have decided that, once again, the media selected him as the convenient scapegoat, the object of scorn, instead of admiring him for carrying on his shoulders the sins of his loyal aides? Is the concept of an innate ego, beyond the tentacles of discourse, merely an illusion that allows us to bear the battering of the media in Nixon’s case, a necessary illusion for survival? Is the “imago” that emerges out of the mirror stage into the symbolic realm of discourse the hard core of our ego or does it evolve into something different, an identity that has historical continuity but no essence?

Imago 和《迷失东京》

Imago and “Lost in Translation”

为了思考这个拉康式的问题，我转向电影《迷失东京》（2003），该片由索菲亚·科波拉执导，比尔·默里饰演鲍勃·戴维斯，斯嘉丽·约翰逊饰演夏洛特。鲍勃和夏洛特分别前往东京，第一次见面是在一家酒店的酒吧，他们在那里分享了失眠和时差的经历。很快，他们就成为了朋友，因为他们都想离开东京，这对他们来说都是一种迷失方向和孤独的感觉。鲍勃必须留下来完成他丰厚的威士忌广告合同，而夏洛特则不能离开，直到她的丈夫完成他的摄影任务。这部电影提出的第一个问题是，为什么这两个截然不同的人——一个是刚结婚的年轻大学毕业生，一个是结婚 25 年的中年演员——在东京感到不自在，尽管在一家豪华、设备齐全的酒店里，他们得到了一切舒适和便利，服务也无可挑剔。在我看来，这部电影非常巧妙地向观众传达了角色的不适，将东京描绘成一个卡拉 OK 城市。它完全西化了，与纽约或洛杉矶几乎一模一样，只是语言和习俗截然不同。当出租车从机场抵达东京时，我们看到一大堆华而不实的霓虹灯招牌，对于只懂西方语言的人来说，这些招牌根本无法理解：问题还在于，日语和许多东方语言一样，是音节语言而不是字母语言，所以人们甚至无法逐字逐句地阅读这些招牌，就像我们大多数人很难读懂希腊语或俄语一样。更令人不安的是，与以各种文化的建筑为标志的欧洲外国城市不同，东京，至少是我们看到的城市部分，到处都是现代的玻璃和钢铁，一种电脑游戏城市，无处不在。鲍勃和夏洛特被话语的彻底变化弄得不知所措，这种话语像茧一样包罗万象，令人束手无策。事实上，有一次，鲍勃半开玩笑地对夏洛特说，他正在组织一次越狱活动，并邀请她加入，并立即得到了她的积极回应。

To consider this Lacanian question I turn to the film “Lost in Translation” (2003), directed by Sofia Coppola and starring Bill Murray as Bob Davis and Scarlett Johansson as Charlotte. Bob and Charlotte travel separately to Tokyo, first meeting in a hotel bar where they share the experience of sleeplessness and jet lag. Soon they become friends because of their desire to leave Tokyo that for both evokes feelings of disorientation and loneliness. Bob must remain to complete his lucrative contract for a whisky advertisement, and Charlotte cannot leave until her husband completes his photography assignment. The first question raised by the film is why are these two very different people, a young, recently married college graduate and a middle-aged actor married for 25 years, ill at ease in Tokyo, despite being provided every comfort and convenience in a luxurious, well appointed hotel with impeccable service. The film very adroitly communicates to the audience, in my view, the discomfort of the characters by displaying Tokyo as a sort of karaoke city. It is thoroughlyWesternized and up-to-date with almost everything one could find in New York or Los Angeles, except that the language and customs are very different. As the taxi arrives in Tokyo from the airport, we see a mass of gaudy neon signs that are all incomprehensible to those with only Western languages: the problem is compounded by the fact that Japanese, like many Eastern languages, is syllabic not alphabetical, so one cannot even try to read the signs letter by letter in the way that most of us can struggle with Greek or Russian. Still more disconcerting is that, unlike foreign European cities that are marked by architecture that is distinct to their various cultures, Tokyo, at least the part of the city that we see, is all contemporary glass and steel, a sort of computer-game city, anywhere and nowhere. Bob and Charlotte are disoriented by a radical change in discourse, a discourse that is as all-encompassing and constricting as a cocoon. In fact, at one point, Bob only half jokingly says to Charlotte he is organizing a prison break and invites her to join in, eliciting her immediate positive response.

正如拉康所预测的那样，他们通过力比多和彼此的吸引力“破茧而出”。他们一起面对新的话题，带夏洛特去急诊室接受治疗，然后去餐馆吃饭，在聚会上结识了一些当地人。但在他们走到一起之前，我们看到他们分开了，每个人都以不同的方式表现出对新文化的开放态度。当鲍勃第一次到达酒店时，酒店的各种官员都用日语向他打招呼，令他惊讶的是，还送给他礼物，鲍勃以他特有的幽默感开玩笑说，他们看起来都因为时差而很累，需要睡一觉。到达的第一天，夏洛特独自去参观一个宗教圣地。但尽管如此，他们都想尽快离开，直到他们相遇。

The “break-out” from the cocoon is accomplished, as Lacan would have predicted, by the libido, their attraction to one another. And together they tackle the new discourse, taking Charlotte to the emergency room for medical treatment, then going out to a restaurant and meeting some of the locals at a party. But we see them separately before they come together, and each in their different ways shows an openness to the new culture. When Bob first arrives at the hotel where various officials of the hotel address him in Japanese and, to his surprise, hand him gifts, Bob, with characteristic humor, quips that they all look tired with jet lag and need to get some sleep. On the first day of her arrival, Charlotte goes off on her own to visit a religious shrine. But nonetheless they both want to leave as soon as possible, until they meet one another.

事实上，鲍勃延长了逗留时间，以便能更多地了解夏洛特，并作为嘉宾出现在日本电视节目中，这是电影中最有趣和最奇怪的场景之一。这位滑稽的电视节目主持人不会说英语，鲍勃当然也不会说日语，但“采访”似乎很有效，因为作为一名经验丰富的演员，鲍勃通过肢体语言和手势掌握了所需的内容。他不知何故在一个陌生的新海洋中踏水，这不仅涉及语言，还涉及一种文化的所有精神刺激。有一次，这位性别有些模糊的主持人邀请鲍勃跳舞。鲍勃以克制的加州式随意态度，好心地参加了，这让这位小丑般的主持人很高兴。同样，夏洛特漫步到大厅，听一位美国明星告诉她的粉丝她对日本文化元素的兴趣。但从她的介绍和之前的谈话中可以清楚地看出，这位女士除了自己之外对其他任何事情都不感兴趣。于是，夏洛特走进另一个房间，那里有几位身着传统服饰的日本妇女正在插花：这群人的组织者显然以为夏洛特想参加，就先给她送了一束花，夏洛特默许了，感到很有趣，也有点感兴趣。

Indeed, Bob extends his stay so that he can see more of Charlotte, and appears as a guest on a Japanese television show, one of the funniest and most bizarre scenes of the movie. The zany television host speaks no English and Bob of course has no Japanese, yet the “interview” seems to work because, as a seasoned actor, Bob picks up what is required by way of body language and gesture. He is somehow treading water in a strange new sea that involves not just language but all the mental stimuli of a culture. At one point the host, whose gender is somewhat ambiguous, asks Bob to dance. With controlled California casualness, Bob good-naturedly participates, much to the glee of the clown-like host. Similarly, Charlotte wanders down to the lobby to hear an American starlet tell her fans about her interest in elements of Japanese culture. But it is clear from her presentation and her previous conversation that this woman is not interested in anything other than herself. So Charlotte wanders into another room where a number of Japanese women in traditional dress are involved in flower arrangement: the organizer of this group, apparently assuming that Charlotte wishes to participate, starts her off with a bouquet and Charlotte acquiesces, amused and somewhat interested.

影片一开始就明确地表明，鲍勃和夏洛特都对这种新文化持开放态度，但又深深地被它所排斥，而他们两人都无法理解这一点。拉康认为，我们在这里看到了潜意识的一个共同元素：

Bob and Charlotte are, the film makes plain at the outset, both open to this new culture but profoundly put off by it in ways that neither of them understands. Lacan suggests that we see here a shared element of the unconscious:

主题远远超出了个人“主观”体验的范围，完全达到了他能够获得的真理……是的，他的历史真理并不全部包含在他的剧本中，然而，他因只知道自己的台词而感到痛苦的震惊却标记在那里（Ecrits，61）。

The subject goes well beyond what is experienced “subjectively” by the individual, exactly as far as the truth he is able to attain […] Yes, this truth of his history is not all contained in his script, and yet the place is marked there by the painful shocks he feels from knowing only his own lines (Ecrits, 61).
