这里让我们想起了鲍勃拍摄威士忌广告时的情景。我们首先注意到，这位日本导演对鲍勃滔滔不绝、滔滔不绝，但翻译却简洁而礼貌。起初，鲍勃问他是否只说了这么多，但后来他习惯了接受翻译中会丢失很多内容，考虑到导演看似热情和脾气，这也许是一件好事。但日语原文和翻译之间的差距或鸿沟是一种文化鸿沟，加剧了迷失和不安。当导演用英语问鲍勃“OK？”时，这种差距更加明显，鲍勃平静地回答道：“OK。”这两个字母突然有了完全不同的含义，好像只是巧合地相同，但来自不同的语言。夏洛特在宗教圣地也有类似的经历。我们意识到正在发生一些庄严而神圣的事情，但完全无法理解它是什么。当鲍勃和夏洛特交谈时，他们的兴趣、困惑、疏离和着迷都显露出来。有一次，夏洛特问鲍勃是否愿意继续待在那里，得到的回答是，是的，接下来的几天他会在酒吧，并幽默地表达了她的感受。

Here we are reminded of Bob at the shooting of the whisky commercial. We first notice that the Japanese director speaks volubly and at length to Bob, but the translation is terse and polite. At first, Bob asks if that is all he was saying, but then he becomes accustomed to accepting that much is lost in translation and that, given the director’s seeming passion and temper, this is perhaps a blessing. But the gap or chasm between the original Japanese and the translation is a kind of cultural abyss that reinforces disorientation and unease. This gap is accentuated when the director resorts to English, “OK?” he says to Bob, who replies, in tranquil puzzlement, “OK.” The two letters suddenly take on a wholly different meaning, as if only coincidentally the same but from different languages. Charlotte has a similar experience at the religious shrine. We recognize that something solemn and spiritual is happening but are completely unable to grasp what it is. As Bob and Charlotte converse, their interest, puzzlement, alienation and fascination come to the fore. At one point Charlotte asks Bob whether he will be staying on, eliciting the reply that, yes, he will be at the bar for the next few days, humorously communicating how she also feels.

渐渐地，鲍勃和夏洛特开始走出酒店，在各个地方见面，并以某种方式与日本人“交谈”，这一发展使他们彼此更加亲近，直到接近结尾时，我们看到他们躺在床上，衣冠楚楚，但谈话非常亲密。他给了她关于她未来的令人安心的父亲般的建议，第二天早上，当她出现在他的酒店时，她知道他和另一个女人在那里过夜。我们可以因此认为鲍勃和夏洛特的关系只是友谊，而不是性吸引力或爱情吗？结局并没有令人满意地解决这个问题。鲍勃在大厅等着道别，但他们的离别很亲切，仅此而已。然后鲍勃透过车窗看到了她，车上载着他去机场，他命令司机停车。他拥抱并亲吻了她，在她耳边低语了一些我们从未听到的话——一些翻译中丢失的东西——这让她眼含泪花。他离开了她，倒退着走，深情地微笑着。他们之间的秘密是否对我们保密，因为你必须亲临现场才能理解？他们是否体验过无意识话语的分享，以及我们这些观众所处的文化鸿沟？

Gradually, Bob and Charlotte begin to navigate outside the hotel, meeting in various places and “conversing” in a way with the Japanese, a development that brings them closer to one another, until near the end we see them lying in bed together, fully clothed but in a quite intimate conversation. He gives her rather reassuring fatherly advice about her future, and, when the next morning she appears at his hotel, she is aware of another woman there with whom he has spent the night. Can we thus assume that Bob’s relationship with Charlotte was only friendship, not involving sexual attraction or love? The end does not satisfactorily resolve this question. Bob waits in the lobby to say goodbye, but their parting is cordial, nothing more. Then Bob sees her through the window of the car taking him to the airport, and orders the driver to stop. He embraces and kisses her, and whispers something in her ear that we never hear—something else lost in translation—which causes her eyes to brim with tears. He leaves her, walking backwards, smiling fondly. Is the secret between them kept from us because you had to be there to understand? Have they experienced a sharing of the discourse of the unconscious, of the cultural gap from which we in the audience are at one remove?

在我看来，这部电影给我们留下的疑惑和剧中角色的疑惑一样，让我们​​对到底发生了什么产生了疑惑。他们坠入爱河了吗？还是两个迷失方向的人在孤独中短暂的友谊？话语的变化改变了他们：是暂时的还是永久的，这是一个悬而未决的问题。让夏洛特回到丈夫身边、让鲍勃回到家人身边的自我，真的存在于他们内心深处吗？还是一种幻觉，让他们能够在一个充满陌生却又熟悉的话语的世界里，尤其是在一个可以轻易到达异国他乡的世界里，保持自我意识？我想，这个问题仍将存在争议。但拉康告诉我们，我们的自我、我们的身份，都受话语的束缚——无论是永久的还是暂时的——而对这一事实的缺乏认识，注定会像《弗罗斯特/尼克松》中的尼克松一样，永远重复意象阶段，从茧中重新出现，进入话语的象征领域，并误以为它是“真实”。拉康向我们展示了自我就像文学作品中的人物，是话语背景的产物，理解自我需要解释背景的能力，理解我们在话语中的位置，即使背景的影响只是暂时的。

The film, in my view, leaves us with the same doubts that the characters themselves probably feel, as to what did happen. Did they fall in love or was it merely the momentary friendship of two disoriented people sharing their isolation? The change in discourse changed them: whether temporarily or permanently is an open question. Is the ego that draws Charlotte back to her husband and Bob back to his family really somewhere deep in their psyches or an illusion that permits them to maintain their sense of selfhood in a world, especially in one marked by easy access to exotic places, of alien yet familiar discourses? That question will, I suspect, remain in dispute. But Lacan teaches us that our selfhood, our identity, is in the thrall of discourse—whether permanently or momentarily—and that lack of awareness of this fact dooms us like the Nixon of “Frost/Nixon” to forever repeat the stage of imago, reemerging from the cocoon to the symbolic realm of discourse and mistaking it for the “real.” Lacan shows us that the self is like a character in literature, a creature of a context called discourse, and that understanding that self requires the ability to interpret the context, to understand our place in the discourse, even if the effect of that context is only temporary.

《西班牙旅馆》 和《国王的演讲》

“L’Auberge espagnole” and “The King’s Speech”

一部最近的电影指出了本章中考虑的拉康元素之间的关系，那就是塞德里克·克拉皮什的《西班牙旅馆》。（2002 年），译名为“Pot Luck”，由奥黛丽·塔图和罗曼·杜里斯主演。泽维尔出生和成长于巴黎，他决定在巴塞罗那住一年，以学习西班牙语，这是一份工作的必备条件。作为一名就读于大学的伊拉斯谟学者，他无法独自生活，因此他先是寄宿在母亲的朋友家，然后是一些新认识的人家，直到他最终被一个国际公寓接纳为室友，公寓里有说丹麦语、英语（英国）、西班牙语、加泰罗尼亚语、德语、意大利语和法语（比利时）的人。虽然他学习的是经济学，但他从室友的各种语言和文化中获得了更深刻的教育。事实上，泽维尔的身份认同感因他与这些外国语言的对抗而发生了根本性的改变，正如“镜像阶段”的概念所暗示的那样。起初，他看起来是一个典型的法国年轻人，对学业非常认真，忠于他在巴黎的女朋友，对与其他人交往不感兴趣。然而，他逐渐适应了西班牙的生活方式，成为“旅馆”派对氛围的活跃参与者和爱好者。事实上，有一次他坚持让年轻的英国女人温迪停止工作，和其他人一起去酒吧。温迪在这次经历后发生了变化，对室友变得更加外向，最终与一个美国人发生了性关系。事实上，这部电影的社交世界，尤其是派对，总是充满语言，或者更准确地说是话语。因为虽然背景几乎完全是巴塞罗那，但学生们将自己的文化带入了西班牙场景。这种混合是泽维尔特别喜欢的。而乐趣的一部分是这种氛围暴露了潜意识的欲望：温迪，一个相当拘谨的英国女人，承认她对美国人的吸引力纯粹是性方面的，泽维尔从他的女同性恋室友那里学到了如何追求熟人的妻子。

A recent film that points to the relationship between the elements of Lacan considered in this chapter is Cédric Klapisch’s “L’Auberge espagnole” (2002), translated as “Pot Luck,” starring Audrey Tautou and Romain Duris. Born and bred in Paris, Xavier decides to live in Barcelona for a year in order to learn Spanish, a requirement for a job. As an Erasmus scholar enrolled in university he cannot afford to live alone, so he boards first with friends of his mother, then with some recent acquaintances, until he is finally accepted as a housemate in an international apartment including speakers of Danish, English (British), Spanish, Catalan, German, Italian, and French (Belgian). Although studying economics, he is educated more profoundly by the various languages and cultures of his housemates. In fact, Xavier’s sense of his identity is radically altered by his confrontation with these foreign tongues, as the notion of the “mirror stage” would suggest. At first he appears to be a typical young Frenchman, very serious about his studies, devoted to his girlfriend in Paris, and not interested in socializing with the others. Gradually, however, he acclimatizes to the Spanish way of life and becomes a lively participant and lover of the party atmosphere of the “auberge.” In fact on one occasion he insists that Wendy, the young British woman, should stop working all of the time and go out to the bar with the rest of the group. And Wendy changes as a result of this experience, becoming more outgoing with her housemates, eventually having a sexual relationship with an American. Indeed, the social world of this film, particularly the parties, is always richly textured with languages, or more accurately discourses. For although the setting is almost exclusively Barcelona the students bring their own cultures to bear upon the Spanish scene. This mixture is what Xavier particularly enjoys. And part of the pleasure is that this atmosphere exposes unconscious desires: Wendy, the rather uptight British woman, admits that her attraction to the American is purely sexual, and Xavier learns from his lesbian housemate how to woo the wife of an acquaintance.

正如拉康所预言的，力比多引领我们走向新的话语体验；语言学习涉及理解从经济到性的文化习俗。在房东突然来访之际，泽维尔新掌握的西班牙语能力挽救了局面。房东对公寓的混乱感到厌恶，命令他们搬出去。泽维尔与他讲道理，最终他让步了，但前提是他现在只和泽维尔打交道。相比之下，泽维尔与已婚女人的恋情始于他批评她对西班牙社会不宽容；具有讽刺意味的是，她因此对他更加着迷，羡慕他融入加泰罗尼亚文化。用拉康的话来说，她被另一个人的欲望所吸引。

The libido, as Lacan predicted, leads the way toward new discursive experiences; language learning involves comprehending cultural conventions, from economics to sex. On the occasion of a surprise visit from the landlord, Xavier’s new ability with Spanish saves the day. Disgusted at the mess, the landlord orders them out of the apartment. Xavier reasons with him, and eventually he relents, but only after insisting that he now deals exclusively with Xavier. By contrast, Xavier’s affair with the married woman begins when he criticizes her for being intolerant of Spanish society; ironically, she thus becomes more attracted to him, envying his integration with Catalan culture. In Lacanian terms, she is attracted to the desire of the other.

但新的快乐也会带来新的痛苦。我们看到人们在努力克服压抑欲望的代价时所遭受的痛苦。被泽维尔引诱的神经外科医生的妻子回到了她无聊的婚姻中。温迪的哥哥不得不假装是同性恋，以防止她的英国男友发现她和她的美国情人躺在床上。我们的本土文化要求压抑某些在其他文化中是允许的快乐。事实上，泽维尔对其他文化的迷恋是因为对家乡的失望。他经常对他的母亲——他镜像阶段的来源——生气（“攻击性”），原因他无法解释或理解，直到他离开法国并做出他知道母亲不会宽恕的行为。毫不奇怪，在异国他乡出现的新自我既让人感到解放，又让人感到恐惧。移情是这种体验的一个症状。电影中最生动的例子是泽维尔将他对婚外情的愧疚转移到妻子的丈夫——神经外科医生身上。情绪低落、睡眠不足的泽维尔向丈夫寻求生理上的解决办法；经过检查，医生告诉泽维尔，他的身体很好，但必须远离已经向他坦白一切的妻子。电影结尾处，泽维尔的巴黎女友马丁承认她对他撒谎说她有另一个情人，这体现了意象的概念。泽维尔告诉我们，他决定结束这段关系。为什么？马丁在戏弄他，但泽维尔虽然对马丁不忠，但并不是在玩游戏。泽维尔和他的室友们发生的事情是严重的，这是他们试图理解、应对和生活在新环境中的结果。最后，泽维尔对自己有了新的认识。他已经超越了爱马丁的自我，现在可以对母亲微笑并容忍母亲。他的母亲和马丁在巴黎一成不变。也许泽维尔自己看到的世界并不比马丁和他母亲的世界更真实或更真诚，但我相信，拉康的洞察力是对话语对我们做什么的警告，我们需要理解和适应这种现象。

But new pleasures occasion new pains. We see the agony of people coming to grips with the price one pays for acting upon desires that had hitherto remained repressed. The wife of the neurosurgeon whom Xavier had seduced returns to her boring marriage. And Wendy’s brother has to pretend to be gay in order to prevent her British boyfriend discovering her in bed with her American lover. Our cultures of origin require the repression of certain pleasures that are permissible in other cultures. In fact, Xavier’s fascination with other cultures is because of a sense of frustration with home. He is often angry (“aggressivity”) with his mother, the source of his mirror stage, for reasons he cannot explain or understand until he leaves France and acts in ways he knows his mother would not condone. Not surprisingly, the new self that emerges in a foreign country is at once liberating and frightening. Transference is one symptom of this experience. The most vivid illustration in the film is when Xavier transfers his guilt about his extramarital affair to the wife’s husband, the neurosurgeon. Depressed and sleep-deprived, Xavier turns to her husband for a physiological solution; after tests, the doctor tells Xavier that he is well physically but must stay away from his wife who has confessed all to him. The concept of the imago is seen at the end of the film when Martine, Xavier’s Parisian girlfriend, admits that she lied to him about having another lover. Xavier tells us that he has decided to end this relationship. Why? Martine was toying with him, but Xavier, although disloyal to Martine, was not playing a game. What happened to Xavier and his housemates was serious, the result of their attempts to understand, cope with, and live in a new environment. And in the end Xavier has a new sense of himself. He has grown beyond the self that loved Martine and can now smile at and tolerate his mother. His mother and Martine have remained unchanged in Paris. Perhaps the world that Xavier sees for himself is no more real or genuine than that of Martine and his mother, but Lacan’s insight, I believe, is a warning about what discourse does to us and that we need to understand and adapt to that phenomenon.

最新一部体现拉康概念的电影是《国王的演讲》（2011），由汤姆·霍珀执导，科林·菲尔斯、杰弗里·拉什和海伦娜·伯翰·卡特主演。在电影开头，当乔治五世国王指着“无线”的麦克风，警告说这个东西会让皇室成员变成“演员”时，我们就面临着话语问题。国王的断言可能是一个起源神话，但它使电影能够宣布其主题：即在这个历史阶段，皇室的影响以“无线”的声音的形式出现。起初，约克公爵和公爵夫人试图坚持认为他的言语问题只是机械性的。但很快就清楚了，问题的根源是心理上的。事实上，这似乎可以追溯到他生命的早期。我们了解到，他在婴儿时期有一个残忍的保姆，在很小的时候，他就因为是左撇子而受到惩罚，他的腿上还戴着支架来矫正它们的排列。到他四五岁时，他的兄弟们就模仿他的口吃来取笑他，国王鼓励他们这样做，相信这样可以治愈这位年轻的公爵。但结果当然恰恰相反；伯蒂接受了他的家庭镜像作为他的自我形象或身份，口吃仍然是他的标志个性的形成。在伯蒂从镜像阶段的想象世界向话语的象征世界过渡的早期，他受到了限制和约束。

The most recent film to exemplify Lacan’s concepts is “The King’s Speech” (2011), directed by Tom Hooper, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, and Helena Bonham Carter. Early in the film, when King George V points to the microphone of the “wireless,” warning that that object will make the royals into “actors,” we are in the presence of the problem of discourse. The King’s assertion may be an originary myth but it enables the film to announce its subject: namely that royal influence at this stage of history takes the form of a voice on the “wireless.” At first, the Duke and Duchess of York try to maintain that his speech problem is merely mechanical. But it soon becomes clear that the source of the problem is psychological. In fact, it seems to go back to a very early period of his life. We learn that in infancy he had a cruel nanny, that at a very early stage he was punished for being left-handed, and that his legs were set in braces to correct their alignment. By the time he was four or five years of age, his brothers made fun of him by imitating his stutter, and the King encouraged them to do so in the belief that it would cure the young Duke. But of course quite the opposite was the result; Bertie accepted the family mirror image of him as his self-image or identity, and the stammer remained the hallmark of his personality. In the early period when Bertie was emerging from the imaginary realm of the mirror stage to the symbolic one of discourse, he was constricted and restrained.

结果，他成为了一个深陷挫折的人，每当提及他早年的个人生活时，他就会以愤怒或不屑的形式爆发攻击性情绪，因为那时试图出现的意象受到了惩罚和限制。影片的转折点是他对语言治疗师莱昂内尔·罗格发脾气的时候。在谈到伯蒂与他哥哥的关系时，莱昂内尔告诉公爵，他会成为一名出色的国王。讽刺的是，伯蒂第一次在罗格面前采取了专制贵族的姿态，愤怒地斥责他是平民，并以一种与李尔王相当的傲慢态度将他赶出自己的面前。当然，正如罗格回想起来时意识到的，这里的愤怒是恐惧的结果。意象退回到育儿室/茧中，而不是面对作为国王在象征性的、话语的世界中占有一席之地的可能性。

As a result, he is a deeply frustrated man, subject to bouts of aggressivity that occur in the form of anger or dismissal whenever reference is made to his early personal life, for that is when the imago trying to emerge was punished and restricted. The turning point of the film is when he loses his temper with his speech therapist, Lionel Logue. During a conversation about Bertie’s relationship with his older brother, Lionel tells the Duke he will make an excellent king. Ironically, Bertie for the first time adopts the posture of an authoritarian aristocrat with Logue, angrily denouncing him as a commoner and dismissing him from his presence with an hauteur worthy of King Lear. Of course, the anger here, as Logue realizes in retrospect, is the result of fear. The imago retreats back into the nursery/cocoon rather than face the possibility of a place in the symbolic, discursive world as king.

但在暴怒中消失的口吃很快又回来了。伯蒂在内心抗拒国王，因为他对口吃的唯一安慰就是认为自己至少永远不会背负王位的责任。公爵夫人向他坦白，她两次拒绝了他的求婚，不是因为她不爱他，而是因为她对王室成员必须承担的公共服务感到犹豫。她继续解释说，她最终接受了，因为她相信，有了他的口吃，他们大部分时间都会过着私人生活。当历史环境迫使公爵成为公众焦点时，他转向洛格，为自己的爆发道歉，并开始认真治疗。

But the stammer that vanished in the moment of pitched anger soon returns. For Bertie resists the king within himself because his single consolation for his speech impediment is the assumption that he will at least never be burdened with the responsibility of being on the throne. As the Duchess confesses to him, she refused his proposal of marriage twice not because she did not love him but because of her hesitation about the public service required of members of the royal family. She goes on to explain that she accepted in the end, believing that with his stammer they would be left for the most part to their private life. When historical circumstances force the Duke into public prominence, he turns back to Logue, apologizes for his outburst and engages in serious therapy.

洛格探究了伯蒂潜意识中的话语，重点关注肢体语言和言语。王室禁止使用脏话，但伯蒂却可以自由发言，从而有机会流利地讲话。随着他获得自信并开始信任洛格，他向洛格吐露了父亲的临终遗言：“伯蒂的胆量比他所有兄弟加起来还要大”，这一见解在电影中得到了证实。最后，“胆量”和语言结合起来成就了乔治六世国王。找到自己的声音意味着与他人建立联系，与莱昂内尔交朋友，进入一个社会体系，根据拉康的说法，这个社会体系就像语言一样，允许一定的机动性和个性，但有明确的参数、规则和惯例。有一次，坎特伯雷大主教威胁要换掉洛格，但伯蒂拒绝了。当大主教解释他的决定时，他有责任保护他即将加冕的头颅，伯蒂巧妙地回答道：“那是我的头颅。” 权威和声音在保护朋友时出现，正如伯蒂现在提到的莱昂内尔。当伯蒂在社交场合说话是一种功能性行为时，他很少结巴。

Logue probes the discourse of Bertie’s unconscious, focusing on body language and speech. Profanity, something forbidden in the royal family, is let loose, allowing Bertie to have moments of fluent speech. As he gains self-confidence and begins to trust Logue, he confides in him about one of his father’s last remarks: “Bertie has more guts than all of the rest of his brothers put together,” an insight borne out by the film. In the end “guts” and language combine to make King George VI. Finding a voice involves relating to others, making a friend of Lionel, entering a social system which, according to Lacan, is like language, a realm that permits some maneuverability, some individuality, but with clear parameters, rules and conventions. At one point, the Archbishop of Canterbury threatens to replace Logue, but Bertie refuses to allow it. When the Archbishop justifies his decision by explaining that he has the duty to protect the head that he is about to crown, Bertie deftly replies, without a stammer, “that is my head.” Authority and voice arise in protecting a friend, as Bertie now refers to Lionel. When speech for Bertie is a functional act in a social context, he seldom stutters.

影片的片名和语言治疗师的声望（杰弗里·拉什获得的奥斯卡提名几乎与科林·菲尔斯和海伦娜·伯翰·卡特一样多）证明了话语的重要性及其心理影响。在罗格的帮助下，伯蒂认识到，要成为人民的领导者，他必须确立自己的声音，从拉康的角度来看，这涉及在公共话语中找到自己的位置。例如，在加冕典礼上，伯蒂坚持让莱昂内尔与家人坐在一起，以表示爱意，因为伯蒂只有和家人在一起时才真正感到自在，在那里他表现出对妻子和两个女儿的爱和忠诚。将莱昂内尔纳入内心圣殿是想象的茧与象征性的公共世界之间的调解标志，是家庭与社会之间的桥梁。

The title of the film and the prominence of the speech therapist—and Geoffrey Rush received almost as many nominations for the Academy Award as did Colin Firth and Helena Bonham Carter—testify to the importance of discourse, to its psychological ramifications. With the help of Logue, Bertie comes to recognize that to be the leader of his people he must establish his own voice, which is seen in Lacanian terms in this film as involving finding his place in public discourse. For example, at the coronation, Bertie insists that Lionel be seated with his family, a sign of affection, since Bertie is only truly at ease with his family, where he shows love and devotion for his wife and two daughters. Including Lionel in that inner sanctum is a sign of mediation between the imaginary cocoon and the symbolic public world, a bridge between family and society.

《国王的演讲》的结尾为本章提供了一个恰当的结论。乔治六世国王以相当流利和庄重的语气完成了他最长也是最重要的公开演讲。洛格指出，他只是在“w”上结巴了，国王回答说，他故意加上了“w”，这样他们就知道那是他。自嘲，尤其是以语言技巧的形式，增强了他的自尊心。我们看到 BBC 的广播技术人员在他离开演播室时为他鼓掌。科林·费斯出色地证明了，虽然这次演讲作为演说是成功的，但演讲需要付出极大的努力。简而言之，乔治六世国王首先通过演说获得了国王的地位，向他的臣民展示了他掌握对他的地位至关重要的话语形式的决心，即公开演讲。在这方面，他是一位拉康式的国王。科林·费斯凭借乔治六世国王的角色获得了奥斯卡最佳男主角奖，在我看来，这是他应得的奖励。但当今的英雄是一位话语之王，这也许是我们这个时代的一个标志吗？

The end of “The King’s Speech” provides an apt conclusion for this chapter. King George VI completes his longest and most important public address with a good degree of fluency and dignity. Logue points out that he only stumbled over the “w’s” and the King replies that he threw those in so they would know it was him. Humor about himself, particularly in the form of verbal deftness, enhances his self-esteem. We see the BBC radio technicians applauding him as he leaves the studio. Colin Firth brilliantly demonstrates that, although the speech succeeds as an oration, the delivery required a supreme effort. In short, King George VI first achieves the stature of a king by way of oratory, by showing his subjects his determination to master the form of discourse crucial to his position, public speaking. In that respect, he is a Lacanian king. Colin Firth received the Academy Award for Best Actor in his role as King George VI, a reward, in my view, he well deserved. But is it perhaps a sign of our time that the hero of the present is a discourse-king?

拉康的创新思想对个人而言具有直接重要性。下一章将探讨人群。弗里德里克·詹姆逊重新审视文学分析与我们文化的社会和政治结构之间的关系。

Lacan’s innovative ideas are of immediate importance to the individual. The next chapter considers groups of people. Fredric Jameson reexamines how literary analysis relates to the social and political structures of our culture.

第五章

CHAPTER FIVE

后马克思主义，弗里德里克·詹姆逊

Post-Marxism, Fredric Jameson

摘要：本章首先解释詹姆逊的创新在于建立了艺术品内在形式和外在形式之间的区别。第一部分讨论了如何分析形式或解释学，以《再见列宁》为例。《邮差》的音乐引入了内在形式。在下一节中，《窃听者的生活》有助于解释黑格尔的个人意识概念如何成为内在形式的源泉。詹姆逊在对《不朽的园丁》的分析中考虑了黑格尔和马克思之间的关系。《成事在人》体现了个人意识和经济史的辩证法，即内在形式和外在形式的焦点。尾声是对《达格纳姆制造》的简要分析，该分析明确区分了内在形式和外在形式。

Summary: The chapter begins by explaining that Jameson’s innovation is in establishing a distinction between the inner and outer form of artworks. The first section addresses how to analyze form, or hermeneutics, illustrated by “Goodbye Lenin.” Inner form is introduced by way of the music of “Il Postino.” In the next section, “The Lives of Others” helps explain how Hegel’s notion of individual consciousness is the source of inner form. The relationship for Jameson between Hegel and Marx is considered in the analysis of “The Constant Gardener.” The dialectic of individual consciousness and economic history, the focal point of inner and outer form, is exemplified in “Invictus.” The coda is a brief analysis of “Made in Dagenham” which makes overt a distinction between inner and outer form.

弗里德里克·詹姆逊对文学理论的贡献在于区分了艺术作品的内在形式和外在形式。詹姆逊通过这种方式解构了旧的或他所谓的“庸俗”马克思主义观点，这种观点只考虑表面上的外在形式，而不进行解释性分析。相比之下，内在形式需要关注单个文本的目的，并涉及“解释学”或解释。通过这种方式，我们将在结论中看到，詹姆逊的创新提供了一种洞察力，即个人正直的行为不仅被更大的社会和政治运动所吞噬，而且可以在马克思主义框架内，即对历史做出重要贡献。

Fredric Jameson’s contribution to literary theory is the distinction between the inner and outer form of artworks. By this means Jameson deconstructs the old or what he calls the “vulgar” Marxist view that considers only the outer form that is apparent without interpretive analysis. Inner form, by contrast, requires attention to the purpose of the individual text and involves “hermeneutics” or interpretation. By this means we shall see, in the conclusion, Jameson’s innovation provides an insight into how acts of individual integrity are not merely swallowed up in the larger social and political movements but can make an important contribution within a Marxist framework, that is, to history.

诠释学与《再见列宁》

Hermeneutics and “Goodbye Lenin”

詹姆逊通过解释学来解释内在形式：

Jameson explains inner form by considering hermeneutics:

[…]内在形式，是[…]一个解释学概念，也就是说，它并不意味着一种实证主义的真理，它以某种方式永恒地与其对象相关联，就像自然科学的规律一样；相反，它强调解释本身的操作，因为它随着时间的推移从外在形式移动到内在形式，就像在辩证过程中从一个时刻到另一个时刻一样。因此，批评家被召回他自己的程序，作为一种在时间中展开的形式，但也反映了他自己具体的社会和历史处境（《马克思主义与形式》，401）。

[…]inner form, is […] a hermeneutic concept, that is, it does not imply a truth of a positivistic kind somehow timelessly associated with its object, like the laws of the natural sciences; rather, it emphasizes the operation of interpretation itself, as it moves in time from outer to inner form as from one moment to another in a dialectical process. Thus the critic is recalled to his own procedures, as a form unfolding in time but also reflecting his own concrete social and historical situation (Marxism and Form, 401).

2003 年上映的《再见列宁》很好地说明了这种内在形式和外在形式之间的区别，该片由沃尔夫冈·贝克尔执导，丹尼尔·布鲁赫饰演亚历克斯·克纳。这部电影的外在形式可以描述如下。一个被柏林墙分开的德国家庭在柏林墙倒塌后重新团聚。尽管母亲即将去世，父亲又和另一个女人有了孩子，但这个家庭的重组是德国统一的一个缩影，尽管问题重重，但与之前的分离和疏远状况相比还是有所改善。如果只关注外在形式，用詹姆逊的话来说，“庸俗马克思主义者”可能会倾向于将这部电影解读为西德战胜东德、资本主义战胜共产主义的预兆。但对内在形式的分析却得出了一个截然不同的结论。

A good illustration of this distinction between inner and outer form can be seen in “Goodbye Lenin,” released in 2003, directed by Wolfgang Becker and starring Daniel Brühl as Alex Kerner. The outer form of this film might be described as follows. A German family separated by the Berlin Wall is, after the fall of the Wall, brought back together. Although the mother is dying and the father has children with another woman, the reassembling of this family is a microcosm of the reunification of Germany, which, although fraught with problems, is seen as an improvement over the previous situation of separation and alienation. Focusing upon this outer form, the “vulgar Marxist,” to use Jameson’s phrase, might be tempted to interpret the movie as heralding the triumph of West Germany over East Germany, of capitalism over communism. But an analysis of inner form leads to a very different conclusion.

更详细地研究这部电影，我们意识到一种涉及观点的辩证法。在序言中，亚历克斯是一个在柏林墙倒塌前生活在东德的小男孩，他解释了 1978 年东德人成为第一位进入太空的德国宇航员时他有多么自豪。电影以亚历克斯用火箭将母亲的骨灰发射到空中结束。在电影主体部分，亚历克斯现在已经成年，在柏林墙倒塌后，他乘出租车去西柏林看望父亲。他认出出租车司机就是多年前他的榜样宇航员。现在，共产主义东德的一位英雄开车送亚历克斯去西德。在亚历克斯的过去，宇航员以身作则，鼓励这个小男孩抬头仰望，从太空这个新奇而令人兴奋的角度看待他在地球上枯燥乏味的生活。相比之下，宇航员的出租车之旅暗示了一种不同的视角：我们不是沿着垂直的地球-太空轴，而是沿着东柏林和西柏林之间的水平轴行驶。

Examining the film in greater detail, we become aware of a dialectic involving points of view. In the prologue, Alex, a young boy living in East Germany before the fall of the Wall, explains how proud he was in 1978 when an East German was the first German cosmonaut to be launched into space. The movie concludes with Alex launching his mother’s ashes into the air by way of a rocket. In the body of the film, Alex, now an adult and after the fall of the Wall, takes a taxi to visit his father in West Berlin. He recognizes the cab driver as the cosmonaut who had years earlier been his role model. Now one of the heroes of communist East Germany drives Alex to West Germany. In Alex’s past the cosmonaut by his example had encouraged the young boy to look up, to see his dull, drab life on earth from the new and exciting perspective of space. By contrast, the cosmonaut’s taxi ride suggests a different perspective: instead of the vertical earth–space axis, we take a horizontal ride between East and West Berlin.

这种视角轴的交叉表明，这部电影并不满足于分裂的柏林两边之间的常见对比。用詹姆逊的话来说，我们“被召回我们自己的程序”，提醒我们要保持怀疑态度关于西方与东方的旧二分法，因为我们“自己的具体历史处境”是在柏林统一之后。这种解释所暗示的双重视角既考虑到水平轴，也考虑到垂直轴；我们同时看到了东西方的对比和统一德国的俯视。这种解释框架为电影的内容赋予了新的形式。詹姆逊这样描述形式与内容之间的关系：

This crossing of perspective axes signals that the film is not content with the usual contrast between the two sides of divided Berlin. In Jameson’s terms, we are “recalled to our own procedures,” alerting us to be skeptical about the old dichotomy of West versus East, since our “own concrete and historical situation” is situated after the unification of Berlin. The double perspective suggested by this interpretation keeps both the horizontal and vertical axes in mind; we see at once the East–West contrast and the view from above a unified Germany. This hermeneutic framework gives a new shape to the content of the film. Jameson describes the relationship between form and content as follows:

[形式和内容]具有一种同一性关系，但这种关系需要从一组术语完全转化为另一组术语：这两个维度是同一个，事实上，艺术的预备价值在于它使我们能够把握我们原本认为是个人经验的问题的本质上的历史和社会价值。然而，这是通过改变层次或观点来实现的，通过从经验转向其基础或具体情况，就像从形式转向内容或从内容转向形式一样（《马克思主义与形式》，第 407 页）。

[Form and content have] a relationship of identity which nonetheless requires a complete translation from one set of terms into the other: the two dimensions are one and indeed the propaedeutic value of art lies in the way in which it permits us to grasp the essentially historical and social value of what we had otherwise taken to be a question of individual experience. Yet this is done by shifting levels or points of view, by moving from the experience to its ground or concrete situation, as from a form to a content or from a content to a form (Marxism and Form, 407).

现在我们可以从交叉视角重新审视这部电影。亚历克斯的父亲逃往西方，成为一名富裕的医生，但把母亲和两个孩子留在东方，正如我们所料，他们的生活远没有那么奢侈。在电影接近尾声时，我们发现他实际上并没有抛弃家人。相反，他的母亲计划带着家人跟随他去西方，但她从未试图逃跑，因为她担心如果被抓住，她会失去孩子。亚历克斯和他的妹妹在母亲的引导下相信，他们的父亲抛弃了他们，过上了奢侈的生活，和另一个女人在一起，后来他们意识到，他等了他们三年，给他们写信，这些信被母亲藏了起来，表明了他对他们的爱和持续的关心。孩子们被母亲欺骗，相信他们的父亲是一个不负责任的资本家。亚历克斯和他的妹妹因此不再相信他们父亲在旧的二分法中的观点：自私的、个人主义的资本主义与集体的、公社的共产主义。这种二分法的根源当然是东德政府的宣传，我们以阅兵和颁奖仪式的形式看到这种宣传，颁奖仪式旨在表彰那些重视社区利益而非个人利益的工人。后者之所以如此突出，是因为亚历克斯的母亲是获奖者之一。通过这种方式，公共和私人结合在一起，这是詹姆逊内在形式概念的一个重要元素。

Now we can reconsider the film in relation to the cross-perspective form. Alex’s father escaped to the West, becoming a prosperous doctor but leaving his mother and two children in the East, living, as we would expect, in a much less luxurious fashion. Near the end, we discover that he has, in fact, not deserted his family. Rather, the plan was for the mother to follow him to the West with the family, but she never tried to escape, fearing that if caught she would lose her children. Alex and his sister, who had been led by their mother to believe that their father left them behind for a life of luxury and another woman, come to realize that for three years he waited for them and wrote them letters, hidden by the mother, indicating his love and continued concern for them. The children have been deceived by their mother into believing that their father is an irresponsible capitalist. Alex and his sister are thus disabused of the view of their father within the old dichotomy: selfish, individualistic capitalism versus collective, communal communism. The source of this dichotomy is of course East German government propaganda that we see in the form of a military parade and an award ceremony for workers who value the community over individual gain. The latter becomes prominent because Alex’s mother is one of the recipients. By this means the public and private come together, an important element of Jameson’s concept of inner form.

我们用来描述这种内在形式的术语[…]并不如运动本身重要，通过运动，我们重新进入了具体的地方，这种具体的地方被描述为[…]公共与私人之间、个人与社会经济现实之间、存在与历史本身之间的调解（《马克思主义与形式》，406）。

The terms in which we describe this inner form […] are however less important than the movement itself, by which we reemerge into that place of the concrete which has been described […] as the mediation between public and private, between individual and socio-economic realities, between the existential and history itself (Marxism and Form, 406).

亚历克斯的母亲克里斯蒂安娜私下欺骗了她的孩子，而东德政府的公开宣传也助长了这种关系。亚历克斯了解了这种关系，并向我们展示了这种关系是如何运作的，他开始欺骗母亲，让她相信柏林墙没有倒塌，东德仍然是一个可行的国家。亚历克斯的生存现实，即需要向母亲隐瞒柏林墙倒塌的事实，从历史的角度揭示了东德政府如何哄骗其民众相信它正在击败西方。

The private deception of her children by Christiane, Alex’s mother, is aided by the public propaganda of the East German government. Alex learns of this relationship and shows us precisely how it operates when he sets about deceiving his mother into believing that the Berlin Wall has not fallen and that East Germany remains a viable state. Alex’s existential reality, the need to hide from his mother the fall of the wall, reveals in historical terms how the East German government lulled its population into believing that it was defeating the West.

为了防止母亲再次心脏病发作，亚历克斯决定重现母亲熟悉的世界，即柏林墙倒塌前的东德。在俄罗斯朋友、技术奇才丹尼斯和其他家人的帮助下，亚历克斯在母亲的卧室里重现了共产主义东德平凡而日常的现实。由于这一过程需要拆除自柏林墙拆除和克里斯蒂安娜住院以来进行的西式重新装修，因此我们可以精确地看到东西方日常生活之间的细微差异。

To prevent his mother having another heart attack, Alex decides to recreate the world that is familiar to her, that of East Germany before the fall of the Wall. With the help of his Russian friend Dennis, a technological whiz, and the rest of the family, Alex recreates in his mother’s bedroom the mundane and routine reality of communist East Germany. And because this process requires the removal of the Western-style redecorating that occurred since the wall was dismantled and Christiane was in hospital, we see in precise detail the quotidian differences between everyday existence in the East and the West.

这个过程的另一个作用是，我们不再像通常那样从西方看东方，而是站在东方看西方，也就是从他人的角度看自己。我认为，我们从东方看到的景象与我们的预期截然不同。例如，柏林墙倒塌后，亚历克斯的工作从修理电器和技术设备（我们现在可能称之为绿色职业）变成了销售卫星电视天线，这种产品在一个失业率高、基本必需品供应极其短缺的社会中显得格格不入。另一个揭示真相的时刻是克里斯蒂安娜开始恢复，并冒险走出公寓楼。起初，她看到其他公寓的一堆家具，以为有些人要搬家了，却没有意识到他们正在丢弃过时的装饰。然后她注意到了昂贵的大型西方汽车，观众觉得柏林的这个地区已经变成了美国式的贫民窟，底特律，街道上到处都是闪亮的新车，到处都是贫困的残骸。最后克里斯蒂安娜看到列宁雕像被拖走了。亚历克斯找到母亲并把她带回公寓后，决定解释这一景象，声称东德出于慈善行为，向对生活方式感到失望的绝望的西德人敞开了大门——从电影的角度来看，这种说法现在似乎没有我们想象的那么牵强。我们看到列宁走向东方并指向东方的画面，只是现在我们想知道，这一引人注目的画面是否不仅意味着东德共产主义的终结，还意味着西德资本主义的重大变化。

A further function of this process is that instead of the usual viewpoint of the West looking at the East, we are placed in the East looking westward, that is, seeing ourselves from the point of view of the other. And what we see from the East, I would suggest, is something quite different from what we would expect. For example, after the Wall comes down, Alex’s job changes from repairing appliances and technical equipment, an occupation that we might now describe as green, to selling satellite TV aerials, a product that seems particularly out of place in a society with high unemployment and a very short supply of basic necessities. Another revealing moment is when Christiane begins to recover and ventures outside her apartment building. At first, seeing piles of furniture from the other apartments, she thinks that some people are moving, unaware that they are discarding their unfashionable décor. Then she notices expensive, large Western cars, and the audience feels that this sector of Berlin has been transformed into an American-style ghetto, a Detroit with its juxtaposition of shiny new cars on streets filled with the detritus of deprivation. Finally Christiane sees the statue of Lenin being towed away. Once Alex finds his mother and takes her back to the apartment, he decides to explain this spectacle by claiming that East Germany has, as an act of charity, opened its doors to desperate West Germans who are disillusioned with their way of life—a position that now from the perspective of the film seems much less far-fetched than we would have expected. We are left with the image of Lenin moving toward and pointing to the East, only now we wonder whether this striking image suggests not only the end of East German communism but also a major change in West German capitalism.

我们不再认为西方战胜了东方，而是有了更复杂的看法：东方从西方获得的好处是显而易见的，但东方所失去的却是西方所赋予的新优势。严密的社会保障网不仅限制了自由，也养活了克里斯蒂安娜一家和其他许多像他们一样的人。当电影结尾处亚历克斯将母亲的骨灰送上太空，向我们展示她现在所处的东德世界的照片时，这部电影的重点不仅仅是怀旧。就像骑士时代一样，东德共产主义也已成为过去，这种生活方式在大多数方面都已经消失，但并非全部。正如我们的社会仍然保留着一些骑士礼仪的残余，《再见列宁》的新“内在形式”视角也表明，我们最好不要拒绝柏林墙另一边的所有元素。因此，后马克思主义对这部电影的看法可以认为，它不是“资产阶级宣传”的一种形式，也不是西方为自己战胜东方而沾沾自喜，而是对这种态度的自满情绪的警告。

In place of the notion of the West triumphing over the East, we have a more complex view: the gains for the East from the West are obvious but thrown into new prominence is what has been lost, all the advantages of the tight social safety net that not only restricted freedom but also sustained Christiane’s family and many others like them. When Alex at the end of the film sends his mother’s ashes up into space and shows us pictures of her East German world now past, the point is not merely nostalgia. Like the age of chivalry, East German communism is relegated to the past, a way of life that in most respects but not all is well lost. And as we still maintain some remnants of chivalric courtesy in our society, so, too, the new “inner form” perspective of “Goodbye Lenin” suggests we would do well not to reject all elements of the sector of Berlin that lay on the other side of the Wall. The post-Marxist view of this film therefore could argue that instead of being a form of “bourgeois propaganda,” or the West congratulating itself on its victory over the East, it is a warning about the complacency of such an attitude.

总而言之，在我看来，《再见列宁》中的后马克思主义立场表明，东西德之间的竞争只是这部电影的表面主题。真正的具体情况是需要结合两个部门、两种意识形态的最佳方面，形成一个统一的国家，成为东德和西德人的家园。在这里，我们看到了詹姆逊所说的“具体事物的伪装和揭示”：

To summarize, the post-Marxist position on “Goodbye Lenin” suggests, in my view, that the East–West German rivalry is only the superficial topic of the film. The real concrete situation is the need to combine the best aspects of both sectors, both ideologies, to form a unified country that is a home for both East and West Germans. Here we see what Jameson describes as “the disguise and revelation of the concrete”:

如果这暗示了马克思主义批评将内部形式重建为具体事物的伪装和揭示，那么我们还需要谈谈这种理论对当前实践的判断的影响。因为声称批评家的任务是揭示作品的这种审查维度恰恰意味着，至少在当今艺术实践中，在艺术实践的社会中，作品的表面是一种结构上的神秘化（《马克思主义与形式》 ，第 413 页）。

If this suggests something of the way a Marxist criticism would reconstruct the inner form […] as both disguise and revelation of the concrete, it remains for us to say a word about the implications of such a theory for judgment […] as currently practiced. For to claim that the task of the critic is to reveal this censored dimension of the work implies precisely that, at least as art is practiced today, in the society in which it is practiced, the surface of the work is a kind of mystification in its structure (Marxism and Form, 413).

对于詹姆逊来说，发现内在形式通常需要穿透具有欺骗性的艺术表面，就像克里斯蒂安向她的孩子们展示的世界的画面，具有讽刺意味的是，她的孩子们也向她展示了这个世界。诠释学需要穿透外在美或漂亮的外表。

The discovery of inner form often involves, for Jameson, penetration beneath an artistic surface that is deceptive, like the picture of the world Christiane presents to her children and which ironically her children present to her. Hermeneutics involves piercing through the façade of external beauty or prettiness.

音乐的内在形式和“Il Postino”

Musical inner form and “Il Postino”

詹姆逊进一步在音乐的背景下描述了内在形式或微观世界的复杂概念，因为音乐是一种与其他艺术分离或关系不大的艺术。

Jameson further describes the complex notion of inner form or the microcosm in the context of music because it is the one art that separates itself from or has little relation to the other arts.

因此，西方音乐从一开始就将自己与整个文化区分开来，重新构建为一种自足的、独立领域远离当时的日常社会生活，并与之平行发展。音乐不仅因此获得了自己的内部历史，而且开始在较小的规模上复制社会和经济微观世界本身的所有结构和层次，并展示自己的内部辩证法、自己的生产者和消费者、自己的基础设施（《马克思主义与形式》，14）。

So it is that western music at the very outset marks itself off from the culture as a whole, reconstitutes itself as a self-contained and autonomous sphere at a distance from the everyday social life of the period and developing, as it were, parallel to it. Not only does music thereby acquire an internal history of its own, but it also begins to duplicate on a smaller scale all of the structures and levels of the social and economic microcosm itself, and displays its own internal dialectic, its own producers and consumers, its own infrastructure (Marxism and Form, 14).

詹姆逊以这种方式表明，小宇宙在其有限的范围内具有某种独立性。第四章讨论了汉斯·罗伯特·姚斯的观点，他用我们太阳系中的行星形象解释了这一概念。每颗行星都有自己的轨道，同时受到星座更大力量的限制。太阳系最终控制着它的星座，而它本身也受制于更大宇宙中更大力量。行星类似于文学体裁，星座就像艺术领域，太阳系相当于历史。

In this way Jameson suggests that a microcosm has within its limited sphere a certain kind of independence. Hans Robert Jauss, whose position was discussed in Chapter Four, has explained this notion by using the image of the planets within our solar system. Each planet has its own orbit while being restricted by the larger forces of the constellation. The solar system ultimately controls its constellation and is itself subject to the larger forces in the larger cosmos. The planets are analogous to literary genres, the constellation is like the realm of the arts, and the solar system is equivalent to history.

1994 年上映的电影《邮差》很好地诠释了这一观念。该片由迈克尔·雷德福执导，菲利普·诺瓦雷饰演智利著名诗人巴勃罗·聂鲁达，马西莫·特罗伊西饰演邮差马里奥。聂鲁达因其颠覆性的诗歌而被驱逐出祖国。意大利政府允许他定居在一座小岛上。岛上一个名叫马里奥的年轻人急于摆脱渔夫的生活，刚找到了一份邮差的工作。这位年轻的邮差很快就被聂鲁达这位诗人和情人所打动。爱上当地一位年轻女子后，他决定请聂鲁达帮助他成为一名诗人，以追求心爱的人。最终他成功了，至少他的爱情诗帮助贝阿特丽斯接受了他的求婚。

An apt illustration of this notion is contained in the movie “Il Postino,” released in 1994, directed by Michael Radford and starring Philippe Noiret as the famous Chilean poet Pablo Neruda, and Massimo Troisi as Mario the postman. Exiled from his native land because of his subversive poetry, Neruda is allowed by the Italian government to settle on a small island where a young man named Mario, desperate to escape the life of a fisherman, has just taken a job as a postman. The young postman soon becomes impressed with Neruda as a poet and lover. After falling in love with a young local woman he decides to ask Neruda to help him become a poet in order to woo his beloved. Eventually he succeeds, at least to the extent that his love poetry helps persuade Beatrice to accept his marriage proposal.

主题曲浪漫、甜美而忧郁，具有典型的意大利旋律：它获得了奥斯卡金像奖和英国电影学院奖的最佳配乐。当马里奥骑着自行车来到聂鲁达家时，每一幕都能听到主题曲的变奏，聂鲁达是诗歌和爱的语言的源泉。影片的大部分时间都穿插着温柔浪漫的音乐。然而，有两个明显的例外。当比阿特丽斯的母亲来找聂鲁达抱怨马里奥对她女儿的意图时，她打断了这对老夫妇的跳舞；他们一看到她，音乐就停了。当聂鲁达对马里奥坚持要他为比阿特丽斯写一首诗感到恼火时，音乐再次被愤怒的声音所取代。这两个例外清楚地表明，主要音乐主题与爱情和诗歌有关。

The theme song is a romantic, sweet yet melancholy and characteristically Italian melody: it received both an Academy and Bafta award for Best Soundtrack. A variation of it is heard in every scene when Mario rides his bike up to Neruda’s house, the source of poetry and the language of love. Most of the film is punctuated with gentle, romantic music. There are, however, two notable exceptions. When Beatrice’s mother comes to Neruda to complain of Mario’s designs on her daughter, she interrupts the older couple dancing; once they see her the music stops. And again the music is replaced with the noise of anger when Neruda is annoyed by Mario’s insistence that he write a poem for Beatrice. These two exceptions make clear that the main musical theme is associated with love and poetry.

如此一来，马里奥的爱情和聂鲁达的诗歌就具有了詹姆逊上文所描述的那种自主性。事实上，音乐停止或消失的两个场景都是诗歌或爱情的内在完整性受到质疑的时刻，也是我们看到“平行发展”的时刻詹姆逊描述道。比阿特丽斯的母亲认为马里奥对她的女儿有性意图，但邮递员对比阿特丽斯的执着和得体的追求证明她错了。聂鲁达反对马里奥要求写一首关于比阿特丽斯的诗，因为他从未见过或遇到过她；他告诉马里奥，诗歌不是定制的，最好的诗歌源于灵感。后来，作为友谊的表示，他陪马里奥去了客栈，遇见了比阿特丽斯，并当着她的面签署了一份献给他的朋友的献词。爱情和诗歌各自需要不同类型的正直，它们独立而又平行。但爱情和诗歌只是这部电影的一部分，这部电影主要关注政治，即聂鲁达流亡和马里奥死亡的原因。音乐再次强调了政治与诗歌之间的关系。在影片的最后一幕，当聂鲁达听着马里奥把诗献给他，并想象着邮递员的死亡时，背景中响起了这个主题，这次是柔和、哀伤的钢琴声，而不是明亮的手风琴声。

By this means, Mario’s love and Neruda’s poetry take on the sort of autonomy that Jameson describes above. Indeed, the two scenes where the music stops or is absent are both moments when the inner integrity of the poetry or love is questioned and where we see the “parallel development” Jameson describes. Beatrice’s mother believes Mario has sexual designs on her daughter, but the postman’s persistent and decorous courtship of Beatrice proves her wrong. Neruda objects to Mario’s request for a poem about Beatrice because he has never seen or met her; poetry, he teaches Mario, is not made to order but at its best springs from inspiration. Later, as an act of friendship he accompanies Mario to the inn, meets Beatrice, and in her presence signs a dedication to his friend. Love and poetry each require different kinds of integrity, separate but parallel. But love and poetry are only a part of this film that is mainly concerned with politics, the cause of Neruda’s exile and Mario’s death. The relation between politics and poetry is again emphasized by the music. In the final scene of the film, when Neruda is listening to Mario dedicating his poem to him and imagining the death of the postman, the theme is heard in the background, now on the soft, mournful piano rather than the bright accordion.

詹姆逊根据音乐和哲学描述了部分与整体的关系：

Jameson describes the part–whole relationship with reference to music and philosophy:

正如贝多芬的奏鸣曲代表着整体与部分的不稳定综合，黑格尔的哲学也是一种长期的张力，一方面是辩证法的整体组织，绝对精神是这一过程的最终结果，另一方面是个别时刻、辩证法的步骤、沿途各个步骤的具体分析。这两个组成部分相互依存，不能分开考虑（《马克思主义与形式》，第 47 页）。

Just as the Beethoven sonata stood as the precarious synthesis of whole and part, so the philosophy of Hegel is one long tension between the overall organization of the dialectic, with Absolute Spirit as the end result of the process, and the individual moments, the steps of the dialectic, the concrete analysis of the various steps along the way. The two components depend upon each other and cannot be considered separately (Marxism and Form, 47).

虽然影片中有关爱情和诗歌的部分以音乐主题为标志，通过内在形式发展，但它们被更大的整体所涵盖，而对马克思主义者来说，更大的整体始终是历史。在这场求爱中，背景是一场即将到来的选举。岛上没有饮用水源。定期向岛上运送水的船只无法为全岛人民提供足够的水。一位竞选公职的候选人承诺要改变这种情况，但当选后他未能兑现承诺。在竞选期间，但在选举之前，聂鲁达被允许返回智利。马里奥给他写了很多信，甚至给他寄了一张岛上声音的录音，但没有收到这位伟大诗人的回信。也许岛上的音乐现在只是聂鲁达作为国际知名艺术家生活的一小部分。随着时间的推移，马里奥有了孩子，大概在意大利共产党中很活跃，似乎被称为当地诗人，因为他被邀请在一次政党集会上朗诵他的作品。我们随后得知，在这次集会上，警方与示威者发生了争执，一些人被杀，其中一人就是马里奥。最后，聂鲁达回到了岛上——那里的音乐仍然是他生活的一部分——并遇到了与他同名的马里奥的儿子帕布利托。当马里奥的遗孀解释发生在马里奥身上的事情发生后，聂鲁达开始在脑海中重现当时的场景。影片结尾，聂鲁达沿着海滩散步，他和马里奥经常在那里谈论爱情和诗歌——熟悉的音乐旋律再次响起——同时我们看到了聂鲁达的想象。马里奥被要求在这场盛大的集会上发言，他是一位精神/诗歌领袖，他被电影中一个角色称为“ il popolo ”的人民的混乱所淹没。

While the parts of the film concerned with love and poetry develop by way of inner form, signaled by the musical motifs, they are subsumed by the larger whole that for the Marxist is always history. In the background during this courtship is an upcoming election. There is no source of potable water on the island. The ship that regularly delivers water to the island cannot provide enough for the whole population. One of the candidates running for office promises to remedy this situation, but when elected he fails to fulfill his promise. During the campaign but before the election, Neruda is allowed to return to Chile. Mario writes him many letters and even sends him a recording of the sounds of the island but does not receive a reply from the great poet. Perhaps the music of the island has now become only a small part of Neruda’s life as an internationally recognized artist. As time passes Mario has a child, presumably becomes active in the Italian communist party, and seems to be known as the local poet since he is invited to recite from his works at a political party rally. We subsequently learn that at this rally during an altercation between the police and demonstrators, some people were killed, one of whom was Mario. Finally Neruda returns to the island—its music still a part of his life—and meets his namesake, Mario’s son Pablito. When Mario’s widow explains what has happened to Mario, Neruda begins to recreate the scene in his mind. The film concludes with Neruda walking along the beach where he and Mario often conversed about love and poetry—the now familiar musical refrain is again heard—while we are shown what Neruda is imagining. Called to speak at this great assembly, a sort of spiritual/poetic leader, Mario is swallowed up in the melée of what one character in the film calls “il popolo,” the people.

马里奥最初被诗歌吸引是出于个人原因，他钦佩聂鲁达，并有兴趣用他所谓的“ metafore ”艺术来表达他对贝阿特丽斯的爱。但聂鲁达认为他是社会和政治群众运动的一部分，是改变意大利政府的尝试。所以我们将诗歌的辩证法理解为一个半独立的星球，使马里奥能够向贝阿特丽斯传达他的爱。但诗人马里奥也受制于更大的历史力量，在这种情况下导致了他的死亡。然而，这部电影给我们留下了两条轨道，而不是其中一条：小帕布利托，爱诗的孩子，和马里奥的死，政治舞台上诗歌的结果。聂鲁达看到了诗歌的两个方面，并向我们展示了这种关系的奇观，清楚地表明他如何能够同时致力于诗歌和与马里奥的友谊，同时用他所有的创造力来帮助推翻智利的独裁统治。

Mario was initially drawn to poetry for personal reasons, admiration for Neruda as an individual and an interest in using the art of what he calls “metafore” to express his love for Beatrice. But Neruda sees him as part of a social and political mass movement, an attempt to change the government in Italy. So we understand the dialectic of poetry as a semi-independent planet, enabling Mario to communicate his love to Beatrice. But Mario the poet is also subject to the larger forces of history, in this instance resulting in his death. Yet the film leaves us with both orbits, rather than either one or the other: little Pablito, the child of love poetry, and Mario’s death, the result of poetry in the political arena. Neruda sees both aspects of poetry and presents the spectacle of the relationship to us, making clear how he can be simultaneously committed to poetry and to his friendship with Mario while using all of his creative powers to help overthrow Chilean authoritarianism.

电影《邮差》本身是古代意义上的诗歌形式，表明当诗歌进入政治时，它既受制于历史的更强大力量，又对其产生影响。从这个意义上讲，这部电影献给马西莫·特罗伊西意义重大，他扮演邮差的角色，并在电影完成前去世。由于特罗伊西是著名的意大利闹剧演员，他的去世，就像马里奥作为一名崭露头角的诗人的去世一样，让我们​​不禁要问，对于后马克思主义来说，艺术家在任何个人无法控制的社会政治力量领域中的作用是什么。对于詹姆逊来说，内在形式是整体的黑格尔部分，是他希望在马克思主义体系中保留的个体。在《邮差》的结尾，我们只剩下音乐和诗歌作为变革的力量，但马里奥在历史中的地位又如何呢？这个问题仍未得到解答。马里奥追随聂鲁达的脚步，勇敢地将他的诗歌奉献给政治事业，但我们不知道他的个人牺牲是否在某种程度上促进了这一事业。

And the movie itself, “Il Postino,” is a form of poetry in the ancient sense of art, demonstrating that when poetry enters politics it is subject to—while having an effect upon—the larger forces of history. In this respect it is significant that the film is dedicated to Massimo Troisi, who played the part of the postman and died before the film was completed. Since Troisi was a well known actor of Italian farces, his death, like that of Mario as a budding poet, leads us to ask what for Post-Marxism is the function of the artist in the realm of socio-political forces beyond the control of any single person. For Jameson, inner form is the Hegelian part of the whole, the individual that he wishes to preserve in the Marxian system. At the end of “Il Postino” we are left with music and poetry as forces for change, but what of Mario’s place in history? That question remains unanswered. Following in the footsteps of Neruda, Mario courageously devoted his poetry to the political cause, but we have no idea if his personal sacrifice in any way furthered the cause.

个人在历史中的角色：“他人的生活”

The role of the individual in history: “The Lives of Others”

《邮差》以一个悲伤的结尾，让人想起了 2006 年上映的《他人的生活》中所探讨的问题，该片由弗洛里安·亨克尔·冯·多纳斯马克执导，乌尔里希·穆埃主演扮演史塔西队长格尔德·维斯勒的塞巴斯蒂安·科赫扮演剧作家格奥尔格·德雷曼，玛蒂娜·格德克扮演女演员克里斯塔-玛丽亚·西兰。《邮差》结尾处提到、《窃听者的生活》开头提出的问题是个人与国家的关系。特别是，《窃听者的生活》探讨了 20 世纪 80 年代初，即柏林墙倒塌前几年，独裁政权下的个人自由问题。主角格尔德·维斯勒是社会主义国家的一名忠诚的官员。事实上，他作为一名审讯员获得了如此高的声誉，以至于他开设了从国家敌人那里获取信息的艺术课程。尽管他的一些年轻学生质疑他的方法的道德性，但他坚持认为被告遭受的任何痛苦或不适都只是为了获取真相。此外，在他的私人生活中，我们看到一个独自住在一个相当简朴的公寓里，除了工作之外几乎没有其他生活的人。当他被赋予调查电影主角、剧作家乔治·德雷曼和他的同居女友、女演员克里斯塔-玛丽亚·西兰的任务时，他以一贯的高效完成了这项任务。他组织下属在嫌疑人居住的大楼阁楼上设置了一个监视巢穴，使他能够听到和看到他们家里发生的一切。

“Il Postino” ended with a sad reminder of the question that is pursued in “The Lives of Others” [“Das Leben der Anderen”], released in 2006, directed by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck and starring Ulrich Mühe as Stasi Captain Gerd Wiesler, Sebastian Koch as the playwright, Georg Dreyman, and Martina Gedeck as the actress, Christa-Maria Sieland. The issue alluded to at the end of “Il Postino” and raised at the beginning of “The Lives of Others” is the relationship between the individual and the state. In particular, “The Lives of Others” considers the question of individual liberty in an authoritarian regime of the early 1980s, just a few years before the fall of the Berlin Wall. Gerd Wiesler, the main character, is a devoted and loyal functionary of the socialist state. In fact, he has gained such a reputation as an interrogator that he conducts classes in the art of extracting information from the enemies of the state. And although some of his young students question the ethics of his methods, he maintains that any pain or discomfort suffered by the accused is solely for the purpose of extracting the truth. Moreover, in his private life we see a man who resides alone in a rather austere flat with little else in his life except his job. When he is given the task of investigating the main characters in the movie, playwright Georg Dreyman and his live-in girlfriend, actress Christa-Maria Sieland, he tackles the chore with his usual intense efficiency. He organizes his subordinates to set up a surveillance nest in the attic of the building where the suspects live, enabling him to hear and to see everything that occurs in their home.

但他发现，事情的发展与上级的期望正好相反。很快，他发现剧作家对推翻国家不感兴趣，而是将大部分精力放在了写剧本上。他对那些颠覆分子很友好，也很忠诚，但他鼓励他们发展自己的各种才能，不要沉迷于政治。最后，威斯勒发现，格奥尔格和克里斯塔-玛丽亚之间的关系并不是波西米亚式的安排，而是双方深厚而持久的爱。很快，威斯勒发现，党的官员强迫克里斯塔-玛丽亚和他有染，他意识到对格奥尔格的怀疑是错误的，是官员为了摆脱对手而捏造的，以赢得克里斯塔-玛丽亚的爱。

But what he discovers is the reverse of what he has been led by his superiors to expect. It soon becomes clear that the playwright is not interested in overthrowing the state; rather he focuses for the most part on writing his plays. He is friendly with and loyal to those who are subversives but encourages them to develop their various talents and not to become obsessed with politics. Finally, Wiesler sees that the relationship between Georg and Christa-Maria is not a bohemian arrangement but involves deep and abiding love on both their parts. Soon discovering that the party official is forcing Christa-Maria to have an affair with him, Wiesler realizes that the suspicions concerning Georg are false, a trumped-up case on the part of the official to get rid of his rival for the affections of Christa-Maria.

但威斯勒的转折点是音乐上的。当听说他的好友、被党列入黑名单的前戏剧导演自杀时，格奥尔格演奏了朋友给他的乐谱《好人奏鸣曲》。从此时起，威斯勒的忠诚从他的上级转向了两名被错误指控犯有反国家罪的嫌疑人。为什么？詹姆逊对贝多芬和黑格尔的评论尤其中肯：

But the turning point for Wiesler is a musical one. Upon hearing that his good friend and the former director of his plays who was blacklisted by the party has committed suicide, Georg plays the score given to him by his friend, entitled “Sonata for a Good Man.” From this point onward, Wiesler’s allegiance turns from his superiors to the two suspects being wrongly accused of crimes against the state. Why? Jameson’s remarks on Beethoven and Hegel are particularly pertinent:

对黑格尔思想的满意解读在任何时候都类似于聆听贝多芬奏鸣曲所要求的那样，其中的部分、音符或乐句必须被理解为其本身以及其在整体中的位置，如变奏、重复、变调等等（《马克思主义与形式》，47）。

A satisfactory reading of Hegel’s thought at any point resembles in structure the listening demanded by the Beethoven sonata, where the part, the note or phrase, must be apprehended both in itself and in respect to its position in the whole, as variation, reprise, modulation, and so forth (Marxism and Form, 47).

听着格奥尔格的演奏，威斯勒不仅在音乐中感受到了整体与部分的和谐，而且在格奥尔格和他的朋友之间也感受到了整体与部分的和谐；艺术和个人的正直融为一体。现在，威斯勒拒绝成为腐败的一方，与他的老同学文化部长不同，他没有在官僚阶层中晋升的野心，至少在以参与虚假调查为代价的情况下不会。威斯勒的个人正直提供了动机和监视，是颠覆系统的手段。值得注意的是，格奥尔格决定通过在西方发表一篇关于东方被压制的高自杀率的文章来反抗政府，这也是出于个人动机，而不是意识形态动机。威斯勒和格奥尔格似乎都不想破坏共产主义：他们都希望根除并远离个人腐败。格奥尔格和他的女友向威斯勒表明，艺术，无论是音乐、戏剧还是表演，都像个人一样，有自己的轨道，有自己的完整性，是整体的内在组成部分。

Listening to Georg playing, Wiesler feels the harmony of part and whole not only in the music but between Georg and his friend; artistic and personal integrity are joined. Now Wiesler refuses to be a party to corruption and, unlike his old school-friend, the Minister of Culture, he has no ambition to advance in the bureaucratic hierarchy, at least not if the price is being involved in a sham investigation. Wiesler’s personal integrity provides the motive and the surveillance, the means to subvert the system. And it is notable that Georg’s decision to turn on the government by publishing in the West an article on the suppressed high rate of suicides in the East is also prompted by a personal, not an ideological motive. Neither Wiesler nor Georg seem interested in undermining communism: they both wish to root out and remain apart from personal corruption. Georg and his girlfriend show Wiesler that art, be it music, drama, or acting, like individuals, has its own orbit, its own integrity, as an intrinsic part of the whole.

通过分析格奥尔格和克里斯塔-玛丽亚的内心世界，威斯勒像戏剧演员一样进入他们的世界，发现了格奥尔格和克里斯塔-玛丽亚的性格。首先，他被格奥尔格和克里斯塔-玛丽亚的爱情肉体所感动，于是雇了一名妓女，这对他来说似乎是一次全新的体验。其次，他安排格奥尔格发现克里斯塔-玛丽亚和党员官员之间的绯闻，并假装是她的粉丝，劝她停止这种安排。最后，也是最重要的，他从藏身之处拿走了打字机这个罪证，这样警方就不会找到针对格奥尔格的证据。此时，“好人”的音乐主题再次出现。当威斯勒告诉克里斯塔-玛丽亚，她有足够的才能在没有党员官员帮助的情况下获胜时，她称他为“好人”。影片结尾，当格奥尔格从档案中发现维斯勒是他的救命恩人时，他专门为维斯勒写了一本小说，名为《好人奏鸣曲》。

Wiesler discovers the personal integrity of Georg and Christa-Maria by analyzing their inner form, by entering into their world like an actor in a play. First, moved by the physical aspect of the love of Georg and Christa-Maria, he hires a prostitute in what appears to be a new experience for him. Second, he arranges for Georg to discover the affair between Christa-Maria and the party official, and he pretends to be a fan of hers in order to advise her to stop this arrangement. Finally and most importantly, he removes the incriminating evidence, the typewriter, from its hiding place so that the police will not find evidence against Georg. And at this point the musical motif of the “good man” reappears. When Wiesler tells Christa-Maria that she has enough talent to prevail without the help of the party official, she calls him a “good man.” At the end of the film when Georg discovers from the archives that Wiesler was his savior, he writes a novel dedicated to Wiesler, entitled A Sonata for a Good Man.

电影结尾处有一个场景专门讲述好人的故事。维斯勒被上级怀疑帮助格奥尔格和克里斯塔-玛丽亚逃避当局追捕，因此被降职到史塔西邮件室做一份低级工作。现在，共产主义东德垮台后，我们看到他在送邮件。在一家书店的橱窗里，他看到了格奥尔格的一本新小说，走进去，打开书，看到题词，买了一本，当被问到是否需要礼品包装时，他回答说：“不，这是给我的。”好人是有意识地拒绝参与腐败的人，因为尽管他撒谎并隐瞒证据，但他这样做是为了保护那些他知道是无辜的人。他做出了有意识的选择，并愿意承担后果。另一方面，这名党内官员现在看起来已经成为一名成功的商人，他继续折磨无辜者，他告诉乔治，警方知道他无法满足克里斯塔·玛丽亚的性需求，但我们知道这不是事实。

Near the end of the movie one scene is devoted to the good man. Suspected by his superiors of helping Georg and Christa-Maria evade the authorities, Wiesler was demoted to a menial job in the Stasi mail room, and now, after the fall of communist East Germany, we see him delivering mail. In the window of a bookstore he sees a new novel by Georg, goes in, opens the book, sees the dedication, buys a copy, and when asked if he wants it gift-wrapped, replies, “No, it’s for me.” The good man is the one who refuses consciously to participate in corruption, for although he lies and withholds evidence he does so to protect those he knows to be innocent. He made a conscious choice and remains willing to abide by the consequences. The party official, on the other hand, has now become, or so it appears, a successful businessman who continues to torment the innocent, telling Georg that the police knew he was unable to satisfy Christa-Maria’s sexual needs, something we know to be untrue.

我们在此注意到，威斯勒的人格正直使他在书中占有一席之地，因为他的正直与文学有着某种内在形式上的共同点。相比之下，腐败的党内官员让格奥尔格表达了他对这样的人竟然能掌管一个国家的失望。在电影接近尾声时，格奥尔格发现威斯勒救了他，并在此过程中牺牲了自己的职业生涯，于是他乘出租车前往威斯勒的住址。途中，他看到威斯勒在送邮件，于是观察了一下，但没有靠近他。在下一个也是最后一个场景中，两年多后，威斯勒发现了献给他的书。我们推断，格奥尔格认为最合适的感激方式是献给他一本书，这本书大概讲述了我们在电影中看到的故事，或者至少是其中的一部分。我们永远不知道这本书的主人公是自杀的导演阿尔伯特·杰斯卡，还是威斯勒，或者两者兼而有之。无论如何，这两个人都是牺牲职业生涯来保持个人正直的典范。这种叙述的一种可能形式是展示斯塔西（一个致力于“无所不知”的组织）的一名官员如何尊重无辜者的隐私权或他人的生命。我们已经超越了《邮差》的舞台。最后，我们记得，马里奥与聂鲁达共享聚光灯，但不是聂鲁达诗歌的主题。格奥尔格决定写一本献给维斯勒并可能关于维斯勒的书，这代表他希望在历史上为维斯勒留有一席之地，为后代提供一份替代史塔西失宠军官档案的资料。通过将小说《好人奏鸣曲》融入电影，我们得到了一个例子，说明个人如何在历史中占有一席之地，可以说是电影中的一种内在形式，这是黑格尔的大胆主张。

Here we note that Wiesler’s personal integrity has given him a place in a book, since his integrity shares with literature a kind of inner form. By contrast, the corrupt party official leads Georg to express his dismay that such people could ever be in charge of a country. Near the end of the film, after Georg has discovered that Wiesler saved him and sacrificed his career in the process, he takes a taxi to his address. On the way, seeing him delivering mail, he observes but does not approach him. In the next and final scene, over two years later, Wiesler discovers the book dedicated to him. We infer that Georg decided that the most appropriate form of gratitude would be a book dedicated to him that presumably tells the story we have seen in the film, or at least part of it. We never find out if the subject of the book is Albert Jerska, the director who committed suicide, or Wiesler, or both. In any event, both men are examples of those who sacrificed their careers to maintain personal integrity. One possible form of this narrative could be to show how an officer in the Stasi, an organization devoted to “knowing everything,” comes to respect the right to privacy of the innocent, or the lives of others. We have moved one stage beyond “Il Postino.” In the end, Mario, we recall, shares the spotlight with Neruda but is not the subject of Neruda’s poetry. Georg’s decision to write a book dedicated to and probably about Wiesler represents his desire to make a place for him in history, to provide for future generations an alternative to the Stasi file of a disgraced officer. By incorporating the novel, A Sonata for a Good Man, within the film, we are given an instance of how the individual has a place in history, an inner form, so to speak, within that of the film, a bold Hegelian assertion.

但马克思主义者可能会想知道，威斯勒的故事会如何改变历史的方向。具体来说，问题是，我们能否保护好人，保护那些拒绝服从命令伤害无辜者的人，即使冒着像“告密者”一样成为受害者的风险？对于詹姆逊来说，这个问题是根据黑格尔和马克思之间的关系来阐述的，即个人精神和国家机器之间的关系。

But a Marxist might wonder to what effect, how does Wiesler’s story change the direction of history. In particular, the question is can we protect the good man, the man who refuses to follow orders to victimize the innocent even at the risk, like a “whistle-blower,” of being himself victimized? For Jameson this problem is formulated in terms of the relationship between Hegel and Marx, that is, between the spirit of the individual and the apparatus of the state.

黑格尔与马克思：《不朽的园丁》

Hegel and Marx: “The Constant Gardener”

詹姆逊对这一问题进行了如下表述：

Jameson formulates this problem as follows:

我们将尝试重新定义黑格尔主义在马克思主义框架中扮演的角色：这个问题显然与旧中产阶级革命的价值观与当今革命意识和需求之间的关系有关。然而，显而易见的是，辩证分析中起作用的原则本身就是……主体与客体的对应性，以及我与非我、精神与物质或自我与世界的和解可能性——本身就是黑格尔体系的根本前提，甚至可以说，是黑格尔的智力发明（《马克思主义与形式》，44）。

We will try to redefine the role Hegelianism is called upon to play in a Marxist framework: the problem is clearly at one with the relationship between the values of the older middle-class revolution and revolutionary consciousness and needs of the present day. Yet it is at once evident that the very principle at work in the dialectical analyses […] that of the adequation of subject and object, and of the possibility of reconciliation of I and not I, of spirit and matter, or self and world—is itself the very premise of Hegel’s system and may be claimed to be virtually Hegel’s intellectual invention (Marxism and Form, 44).

正如标题“他人的生活”所表明的那样，这个问题不是意识形态的问题。威斯勒没有重新考虑他对共产主义的承诺。相反，他希望共产主义国家能够包容他人的生活，即允许合法的个人自由，而不会侵犯他人的自由。事实上，他作为审讯员的训练已经让他掌握了做出这种区分的艺术。当然，“庸俗”的马克思主义者可能会断言，不应根据那些滥用其原则的人来判断东德共产主义。但詹姆逊的内在形式与对政权的判断不同。他的方法表明，没有一个社会主义国家可以在不容忍黑格尔自我意识的情况下在历史上生存，这个问题在费尔南多·梅里尔斯执导的《不朽的园丁》（2005 年）中得到了突出体现，拉尔夫·费因斯饰演贾斯汀·奎尔，蕾切尔·薇兹饰演他的妻子泰莎。

As the title, “The Lives of Others,” makes clear, the issue is not ideological. Wiesler does not reconsider his commitment to communism. Rather he expects the communist state to accommodate the lives of others, that is, to permit individual liberty that is lawful and does not infringe upon the freedom of others. Indeed, his training as an interrogator has been the acquisition of expertise in the art of making just such a distinction. Of course, the “vulgar” Marxist may assert that East German communism should not be judged on the basis of those who abuse its principles. But Jameson’s inner form points to something different from judgment of the regime. His method suggests that no socialist state can abide in history without tolerance of Hegelian self-consciousness, an issue that is given prominence in “The Constant Gardener” (2005), directed by Fernando Meirelles, starring Ralph Fiennes as Justin Quayle and Rachel Weisz as his wife Tessa.

影片开头，贾斯汀·奎尔站起来，为他的上司、英国外交部非洲事务负责人伯纳德·佩勒格林爵士朗读演讲。演讲的主题是，战争的唯一可行替代方案是外交。影片接着表明，某些形式的外交可以像战争一样致命。影片结尾，佩勒格林被公开揭露为众多非洲人死亡的根源，其中许多是婴儿，因为他知道正在发生犯罪，但他没有阻止或揭露它，而是试图掩盖它。但我们该如何看待这个结论？那些取代伯纳德爵士及其同伙犯罪的人会比他们的前任更腐败吗，特别是因为外交部的高层也可能被指控犯有罪行但仍在位？我相信，这将是传统的马克思主义观点。然而，詹姆逊鼓励我们追求内在形式，这导致了不同的观点。

The film opens with Justin Quayle standing in and reading a lecture for his superior, Sir Bernard Pellegrin, Head of the Africa Desk at the British Foreign Office. The theme of the lecture is that the only viable alternative to war is diplomacy. The film goes on to show that some forms of diplomacy can be as lethal as war. At the film’s conclusion, Pellegrin is publicly exposed as the source of the death of numerous Africans, many of whom are infants, in that he knew that a crime was being perpetrated and, instead of preventing or exposing it, tried to cover it up. But what are we to make of this conclusion? Will those who replace Sir Bernard and his confederates in crime be any less corrupt than their predecessors, particularly as those higher up in the Foreign Office may also be implicated in the crime but remain in place? Such, I believe, would be the traditional Marxist view. Jameson, however, encourages us to pursue the inner form, which leads to a different point.

内在形式涉及奎尔和特莎的关系。奎尔是英国外交的典范。他和蔼可亲、谦逊谦逊、聪明机智，尽其所能为政府服务，但他也意识到，在一个像许多非洲国家一样的深陷困境的社会中，所能做的是有限的。有一次，当他和怀孕的特莎一起坐车时，特莎请他顺便载一个需要去附近医院的非洲家庭一程。他回答说，他必须把特莎的健康放在当地家庭的医疗需求之前。因此，奎尔试图通过保护家庭和私生活来保持个人正直，同时尽最大努力成为一名公职人员。他是一个热心的园丁，对于一个受过良好教育的外交官来说，这与伏尔泰的《老实人》的结尾有关，在这本书中，耕种自己的私人花园被描述为一种替代方式，可以避免被社会和政治所幻灭和操纵。政治力量在公共世界中的作用。事实上，当公共事务变得困难时，奎尔经常躲在他的花园里，在园艺活动中比在工作中发现更多的真正乐趣。

The inner form involves the relationship between Quayle and Tessa. Quayle is a fine example of British diplomacy. Congenial, diffident, self-effacing, quietly intelligent, he serves the government to the best of his capacity but is aware of the limitations of what can be done in a deeply troubled society like that of many African nations. At one point, when he and the pregnant Tessa are riding in a car, she asks him to give a lift to an African family that needs to get to a nearby hospital. He replies that he has to put her health ahead of the local family’s medical need. Thus Quayle attempts to maintain his personal integrity by protecting his family, his private life, while doing his best as a public official. He is a keen gardener, which for a well-educated diplomat would be associated with the end of Voltaire’s Candide, where cultivating one’s private garden is presented as an alternative to being disillusioned and manipulated by the social and political forces in the public world. Indeed Quayle often retreats to his garden when public matters become difficult, finding more genuine pleasure in horticultural pursuits than in his job.

我们第一次见到特莎时，她是一个无所畏惧的年轻学生，她问了奎尔一些他无法回答的问题，这些问题让他所代表的政府感到尴尬。但奎尔并没有被她的咄咄逼人的态度吓倒，反而钦佩她的勇气和直率。最终，他们结婚并去了肯尼亚，双方达成协议，在他履行委员会职责期间，特莎可以不受阻碍地继续进行药物研究。在非洲，特莎继续惹恼外交官，但奎尔仍然宽容、爱护她，钦佩她的勇气。

Tessa, when we first see her, is a fearless young student who asks Quayle questions that he cannot answer and that embarrass the government he represents. But instead of being put off by her aggression, he admires her courage and forthrightness. Eventually they marry and go to Kenya, with the understanding that she will be able to pursue her research on pharmaceuticals unhampered while he goes about his duties at the commission. In Africa, Tessa continues to ruffle diplomatic feathers, but Quayle remains tolerant, loving, and admiring of her courage.

但当特莎死于可疑情况时，奎尔搬出了他的花园，不再是和蔼可亲、圆滑的官员，而是更具攻击性和特莎的风格。在一集中，当奎尔不得不匆忙离开沙漠歹徒时，他要求让当地的一名儿童参与救援，这让我们想起了早些时候特莎让他送当地一家人去医院的事件。在那起早期事件中，他向特莎指出，这个国家到处都是需要他帮助的人。在后来的一集中，奎尔像特莎之前所说的那样，认为帮助一个人总比什么都不帮助要好。我们看到，奎尔不仅走出了自己的私人空间——他的花园，而且开始认识到个人的价值，即使在一个不重视个人价值的国家。

But when Tessa dies in suspicious circumstances, Quayle moves out of his garden and becomes less the genial, tactful functionary and more aggressive and Tessa-like. In one episode, when Quayle has to make a hasty departure from desert outlaws, he asks that one of the local children be included in the rescue, reminding us of the earlier incident when Tessa asked him to take a local family to a hospital. In that earlier incident, he pointed out to Tessa that the country was full of people needing his assistance. In the later episode Quayle argues, as Tessa had earlier, that helping one is better than helping none. We see that Quayle has not only moved out of his private shell, his garden, but also has come to see the value of the individual even in a country that shows little regard for such a value.

他的新态度让他发现，在特莎去世前不久，她曾向英国高级专员提交了一份报告，指出英国政府官员与一家制药公司有牵连，该公司利用非洲人作为结核病疫苗的实验对象，导致许多人死亡。最后，奎尔发现伯纳德·佩勒格林爵士下令除掉特莎。奎尔意识到，如果公开这些信息，他也将被除掉。但他有意识地决定这么做。

His new attitude results in his discovery that shortly before her death Tessa had given the British High Commissioner a report indicating that officials in the British Government were involved with a pharmaceutical company that was using Africans as guinea pigs for a tuberculosis vaccine that caused the death of many. Eventually, Quayle finds out that Sir Bernard Pellegrin ordered the elimination of Tessa. Quayle realizes that, in making this information public, he too will be eliminated. But he makes a conscious decision to do just that.

奎尔作为一个人物的发展构成了《不朽的园丁》的内在形式。重点是，人们熟悉的公共和私人之间的区别，奎尔在委员会的职责和他的花园之间的区别，已经无法再维持了。事实上，我们后来意识到，他在花园里使用的杀虫剂含有结核病疫苗中的一些致命成分。后马克思主义对《不朽的园丁》的解读与传统的马克思主义解读截然不同，后者可能关注这样一个事实：资本主义鼓励雄心勃勃的人追求个人经济利益，即培养不会破坏现状或危及资本追求的外交官。但正如我们在《窃听者的生活》中看到的那样，政府官员的腐败并不局限于资本主义。我相信，詹姆逊马克思主义者会关注像奎尔这样正直的外交官，他最终觉得继续这种间接导致腐败的生活方式是没有意义的。他的妻子和许多非洲儿童的死亡。他开始接受这样一个基本假设：他的私生活和妻子的私生活将与公共领域分开，这是没有根据的。这里的问题不仅仅涉及经济，因为奎尔没有资本主义野心。詹姆逊坚持认为后马克思主义要超越对经济的旧痴迷：

The development of Quayle as a character constitutes the inner form of “The Constant Gardener.” The point being made is that the familiar distinction between public and private, between Quayle’s duties at the commission and his garden, can no longer be maintained. Indeed we later realize that the pesticide that he uses in his garden has some of the deadly ingredients found in the tuberculosis vaccine. A post-Marxist interpretation of “A Constant Gardener” differs markedly from a traditional Marxist reading that would probably focus on the fact that capitalism encourages the ambitious to pursue their individual economic advantage, that is, fosters diplomats who do not rock the boat or endanger the pursuit of capital. But corruption of government officials is, as we have seen in “The Lives of Others,” not limited to capitalism. The Jamesonian Marxist would, I believe, focus on a diplomat of integrity, like Quayle, who feels in the end that there is no point in continuing a way of life that indirectly contributed to the deaths of his wife and many African children. He comes to accept that the basic assumption that his private life and that of his wife would be kept separate from the public sphere was unfounded. The issue here involves more than economics, since Quayle has no capitalist ambitions. Jameson insists that post-Marxism move beyond the old obsession with economics:

庸俗马克思主义的普遍缺陷，可以归因于对所谓经济水平本身的误解：因为就经济图式[…]声称要提供一个长期连续的经济发展模型而言，它本身就是一种理想，而且往往是一种无意识的理想主义构造（《马克思主义与形式》，375）。

The all-informing flaw of vulgar Marxism as such, may be traced to a misconception of the so-called economic level itself: for to the degree that the economic schema […] purports to furnish a continuous model of economic development over a long period, to that degree it is itself an ideal and indeed often an unconsciously idealistic construct (Marxism and Form, 375).

詹姆逊在这里暗示，庸俗的马克思主义者在强调经济的主导地位时，忽视了其他因素，而《不朽的园丁》中的男主角也参与其中。尽管制药公司的致命实验确实得到了英国政府出于经济原因的支持，但奎尔的个人发展却涉及其他因素。他对此事的调查对他的系统产生了冲击，这让人想起詹姆逊的以下描述：

Jameson is suggesting here that, in insisting upon the predominance of the economic, the vulgar Marxist neglects other elements, which in “The Constant Gardener” involve the main male character. Although it is true that the pharmaceutical company’s deadly experiment is supported by the British Government for economic reasons, Quayle’s personal development involves something else. His investigation of the matter results in a shock to his system that recalls Jameson description in the following terms:

黑格尔批判本质上是一种批判、消极、纠正的时刻，它迫使我们对自己的批判工具和批判范畴产生一种突然的自我意识。现在，当我们转向真正的马克思主义批判时，我们将通过类似的认识论冲击来识别它的存在，因为这种冲击是辩证思维的组成部分，与辩证思维密不可分，是突然转向更高意识水平、更大存在背景的标志（《马克思主义与形式》，第 375 页）。

A Hegelian criticism includes an essentially critical, negative, rectifying moment, one which enforces upon us an abrupt self-consciousness with regard to our own critical instruments and critical categories. When we turn now to a properly Marxist criticism, it will be through a similar epistemological shock that we will be able to identify its presence, for such a shock is constitutive of and inseparable from dialectical thinking, as the mark of an abrupt shift to a higher level of consciousness, to a larger context of being (Marxism and Form, 375).

奎尔震惊地发现，他的政府不仅卷入了腐败，而且整个网络的人都冒着生命危险揭露腐败。当奎尔在电影快结束时面对他的朋友和上司、英国驻肯尼亚高级专员公署负责人桑迪，拿出桑迪对特莎之死的贡献的证据时，我们看到了自我意识的冲击对一个以前被个人野心的经济驱动的人的影响。因此，奎尔新的自我意识不仅影响了奎尔和电影观众，也影响了犯罪者之一。此外，奎尔为了揭露伯纳德·佩勒格林爵士而牺牲了自己的生命，而伯纳德·佩勒格林爵士在电影开头断言，外交可以实现暴力无法实现的目标。奎尔写给他姐夫的揭露佩勒格林的信难道不是外交的最后一幕吗？这种外交坚持认为外交是基于承担个人责任后，情况会如何？《不朽的园丁》的内在形式鼓励我们思考，有良知的人是否能够改变迫使文明违背其最高价值的经济力量。但当然，无论是老马克思主义者还是新马克思主义者，都会指出，即使《不朽的园丁》的结论表明了改革英国立场的可能性，但同样隐含在这起罪行中的非洲人自己又该怎么办呢？我们还记得，特莎在一次使馆聚会上揭露了他们。现在出现了一个新问题：如果第三世界是问题的一部分而不是解决方案，那么替代方案是什么，我们该如何着手帮助第三世界？为了回答这个问题，我转向了 2009 年上映的《成事在人》，由克林特·伊斯特伍德执导，摩根·弗里曼饰演纳尔逊·曼德拉，马特·达蒙饰演弗朗索瓦·皮纳尔。

Quayle is shocked to discover not only that his government is implicated in the corruption but that an entire network of people are involved in risking their lives to expose the corruption. And when near the end he faces his friend and superior, Sandy, head of the British High Commission in Kenya, with proof of Sandy’s contribution to the death of Tessa, we see the effect of the shock of self-consciousness upon someone who had previously been driven by the economics of personal ambition. Hence Quayle’s new self-consciousness has an effect not only upon Quayle and the audience of the film but also on one of the perpetrators of the crime. Moreover, Quayle goes on to sacrifice his life in order to expose Sir Bernard Pellegrin, the person who asserted at the beginning of the film that diplomacy achieves what violence cannot. Is not Quayle’s letter to his brother-in-law exposing Pellegrin a final act of diplomacy, one that insists upon diplomacy based upon acceptance of personal responsibility? The inner form of “The Constant Gardener” encourages us to ask whether the individual of good conscience can alter the economic forces that impel civilizations to act in contradiction of their highest values. But of course the Marxist, old or new, will point out that, even if the conclusion of “The Constant Gardener” suggests the possibility of reforming the British position, what about the Africans themselves, equally implicit in this crime, whom, we recall, Tessa, had exposed at one of the embassy parties. A new question now arises: if the third world is a part of the problem and not the solution, what is the alternative, how are we to proceed to help the third world? To address this question, I turn to “Invictus,” released in 2009, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Morgan Freeman as Nelson Mandela and Matt Damon as François Pienaar.

经济与历史：《不可征服》

Economics and history: “Invictus”

影片标题源自威廉·埃内斯特·亨利 1875 年创作、1888 年发表的一首诗，结尾有这样一句著名诗句：“我主宰自己的命运，我掌控自己的灵魂。”曼德拉解释说，在罗本岛监狱服刑 26 年，在他最绝望的时刻，这些诗句激励他继续前行。亨利的自力更生主张显然与马克思主义的核心假设相矛盾，即所有个人都受到他们无法控制的社会和政治力量的制约。接受曼德拉用这些诗句来寄托精神是一回事，但相信南非在种族隔离之后的改革可以基于这样的原则则完全是另一回事。在影片中，曼德拉建议跳羚橄榄球队采纳亨利的理念，从而增加他们在世界杯上获胜的机会并团结一个新的南非。注重外在形式的庸俗马克思主义者可能会认为这部电影徒劳无功，试图让我们相信南非能够凭借个人勇气和决心摆脱孤立，重返国际社会。

The title refers to the poem written in 1875 and published in 1888 by William Ernest Henley that concludes with the famous lines: “I am the master of my fate / I am the captain of my soul.” Mandela explains that, when in prison on Robben Island for 26 years and at his lowest moments of despair, these lines inspired him to go on. Henley’s assertion of self-reliance is clearly at loggerheads with the central Marxist assumption that all individuals are subject to social and political forces beyond their control. It is one thing to accept that Mandela used these lines for spiritual sustenance but quite another to believe that the reformation of South Africa after apartheid could be based upon such a principle. In the film, Mandela suggests that the Springbok rugby team adopt Henley’s philosophy, thereby improving their chances in the World Cup and uniting a new South Africa. The vulgar Marxist focusing on outer form would be likely to see the film as a futile attempt to convince us that South Africa can be led out of isolation and back into the international community by individual grit and personal determination.

再次，通过追寻内在形式，我们可能会发现一种更可行、更复杂的立场。在影片的开篇，当选总统后，曼德拉开始制定与阿非利卡人和解的政策，这一政策引起了很大争议，并遭到了许多党内人士的坚决反对。在担任总统的第一天，他邀请在上一届政府工作过的官员（几乎全部是阿非利卡人）留任，继续在他的领导下任职。他的顾问和家人反对他的这项政策，但他坚持了下来。当曼德拉指派在种族隔离时期曾是秘密警察的阿非利卡人加入他的私人组织时，我们看到了问题的缩影保镖，加强总统的保护盾。正如保镖队长向曼德拉指出的那样，这些人曾试图杀死我们。曼德拉回答说，那是过去的事情了，但为了国家的未来，与敌人和解是必要的。

Once again, by pursuing inner form we may find a more viable and complex position. Very early on in the film, after being elected president, Mandela starts to institute a policy of reconciliation with the Afrikaners that is highly controversial and adamantly opposed by many of his party. On his first day as president, he invites the office holders who worked with the previous administration, almost all of whom are Afrikaners, to stay on and continue in their positions under his leadership. He is opposed in this policy by his own advisers and members of his family, but he persists. And we see a microcosm of the problem when Mandela assigns Afrikaners who under apartheid had been members of the secret police to join his personal bodyguards, bolstering the protective shield of the president. As the head bodyguard points out to Mandela, these are the people who tried to kill us. Mandela replies, that is in the past, but reconciliation with our enemies is necessary for the future of the country.

然而，黑人和阿非利卡人之间的关系紧张而脆弱，这并不令人意外。因此，曼德拉决定利用跳羚橄榄球队来团结国家。为什么？因为在服刑期间，他看到阿非利卡人狱警在打橄榄球，而黑人囚犯则在踢足球。因此，电影的开场，曼德拉被赶出监狱，就展示了骑兵队经过黑人贫民区，一边是踢足球的孩子们，另一边是踢橄榄球的阿非利卡人。事实上，橄榄球运动对阿非利卡人来说如此重要，以至于曼德拉党的成员投票决定将国家队的名称改为跳羚队，并更改其颜色，因为黑人将这两者与压迫者联系在一起。曼德拉不顾顾问的建议，冒险与这些党员对峙，并以微弱优势说服他们中的大多数人改变投票。他的下一步行动是会见跳羚队队长，向他强调该队的象征意义。最后，我们看到跳羚队已“从最高层”接到命令，前往黑人社区教黑人儿童如何打橄榄球。

Not surprisingly, however, the relations between the Blacks and the Afrikaners are tense and fragile. So Mandela decides to use the Springbok rugby team to unite the country. Why? Because during the term of his imprisonment he saw the Afrikaner guards playing rugby while the Black prisoners played soccer. For this reason the opening scene of the movie, Mandela being driven from prison, shows the cavalcade passing the black ghetto with the children playing soccer on one side and, on the other side, the Afrikaners playing rugby. Indeed, so important is the sport of rugby to the Afrikaners that the members of Mandela’s party vote to change the name of the national team, the Springboks, and their colors, both of which are associated by the blacks with their oppressors. Against the advice of his advisers, Mandela takes the risk of confronting these party members and narrowly convincing a slim majority of them to reverse their vote. His next move is to meet with the captain of the Springboks, to impress upon him the symbolic importance of the team. Lastly, we see that the Springboks have been ordered, “from the very top,” to go into the black communities to teach the black children how to play rugby.

曼德拉认为，南非需要一项全国性的体育运动，而要实现这一和解目标，黑人必须避免按照压迫者的期望，将他们的运动强加给白人。当然，夺得世界杯冠军并不是曼德拉可以指望的事情；这是一个很棒的额外收获。但曼德拉的目标是让不同肤色的人都支持同一支球队。他的观点并不是说政治就像橄榄球比赛。而是说南非前进的唯一可能途径是阿非利卡人和黑人之间的合作。摆脱压迫需要的不仅仅是从监狱中释放出来；只有在国家秩序井然、管理得当的情况下，个人才能充分发挥自己的潜力。而只有阿非利卡人才具备这方面的专长。当然，历史证实了曼德拉的判断，特别是如果津巴布韦被视为替代方案的话。

Mandela believes that the country needs a national sport and that this goal of reconciliation can only be achieved if the blacks avoid doing what their oppressors expect of them, imposing their sport on the white population. Of course, the winning of the World Cup was hardly something Mandela could have counted on; it was a wonderful added bonus. But the object was to get all the different colors of people to root for one team. And the point that is being made is not that politics is like a game of rugby. Rather that the only possible way for South Africa to move forward is by way of cooperation between the Afrikaners and the Blacks. Freedom from oppression requires more than release from prison; the individual can only realize his or her full potential if there is order in and proper management of the country. And the Afrikaners alone have the expertise for that. Certainly, history has borne out Mandela’s judgment, particularly if Zimbabwe is seen as the alternative.

此外，曼德拉的目标不是个人自由。作为一名马克思主义者，他的老追随者称他为“同志”，他敏锐地意识到更大的力量在束缚着个人。事实上，在他担任总统的大部分时间里，他都在前往最富有的第一世界国家，说服它们在南非投资。弗朗索瓦·皮纳尔的父亲曾开玩笑说，也许曼德拉很快就会访问南非。黑人和阿非利卡人之间的和解具有社会、政治和经济目的：南非拥有吸引外国投资所必需的劳动力、管理和资源以及基础设施。虽然外表看起来可能很天真宣称自力更生，其内在形式显示出对全球市场的微妙态度。

Furthermore, Mandela’s goal is not individual freedom. A Marxist whose old followers address him as “comrade,” he is keenly aware of the larger forces constricting the individual. In fact, he spends most of his presidency traveling to the richest first world nations to convince them to invest in South Africa. François Pienaar’s father jokes at one point that perhaps soon Mandela will visit South Africa. The reconciliation between Blacks and Afrikaners serves a social, political and economic end: South Africa has the labor, management, and resources, the infrastructure, necessary to encourage foreign investment. While outer form might see here a naïve assertion of self-reliance, inner form shows a subtle approach to the global market.

曼德拉所面临的来自本党和反对党的阻力，在詹姆逊看来涉及了一种过时的阶级概念：后马克思主义认为，阶级不是“联系和拒绝他人”的一种方式，而是“每个阶级的存在本身就意味着所有其他阶级的存在”：

The resistance that Mandela confronts from both his party and that of the opposition involves for Jameson an outmoded concept of class: instead of a class as a way “of relating to and refusing the others,” post-Marxism suggests that “each class implies the being of all the others in its very being”:

这种阶级关系概念[…]必然意味着其结构本身的去神秘化冲击。它总是会预先假定一种运动，从一个看似系统、连贯、自足的表面，转向其背后的历史情境，在此情境中，被审视的意识形态产品突然被证明具有功能性和战略价值，可以作为具体和局部斗争中确定类型的武器（《马克思主义与形式》，第 380-1 页）。

Such a relational concept of class […] will necessarily imply the shock of demystification in its very structure.
