It will always presuppose a movement from an apparently systematic, coherent, self-contained surface to that historical situation behind it in terms of which the ideological product under examination suddenly proves to have had a functional and strategic value as a weapon of a determinate kind in a concrete and local struggle (Marxism and Form, 380–1).

曼德拉明白，加强黑人和阿非利堪人、工人阶级和中产阶级之间的阶级分化，将对整个社会造成致命影响。因此，他选择橄榄球作为一种“震撼”手段，以“揭开”这两个阶级之间古老的意识形态斗争的神秘面纱，不是为了颠覆马克思主义的阶级概念，而是为了实现一个具体的目标，即保护社会结构。为什么？因为他认识到，如果富裕国家认为南非没有能力管理自己的事务，那么它们就不会在南非投资。同样，他对待全球资本主义的态度不是资本家的态度。当一位秘书向曼德拉指出他已经几个月没有领到工资时，他对自己赚的钱感到震惊，并决定将其中的三分之一捐给慈善机构。他对资本主义的态度与中国类似，即进入全球经济，但并不完全接受西方的企业家意识形态。但中国在投资，而曼德拉吸引的资本可以用于适合其国家特定需求的用途。从这个方面来说，曼德拉的贡献就在于把马克思主义运用到南非的具体斗争中去，也就是运用到历史中去。

Mandela understands that reinforcing class division between Blacks and Afrikaners, the working and middle classes, will prove fatal to the entire society. So he chooses rugby as a means of “shock” in order to “demystify” the old ideological battle between these two classes, not to subvert the Marxist concept of class but to achieve a concrete goal, preserving the very fabric of the society. Why? Because, he recognizes that none of the rich nations will invest in South Africa if they believe it is not capable of managing its affairs. Again, his approach to global capitalism is not as a capitalist. When a secretary points out to Mandela that he has not collected his salary for months, he is shocked at how much he earns and decides to donate a third of it to charity. His approach to capitalism is similar to that of China, to enter the global economy without completely accepting the entrepreneurial ideology of the West. But while China invests, Mandela attracts capital that can be used for purposes suitable to the specific needs of his country. In that respect, Mandela’s contribution is in bringing Marxism to bear upon the concrete struggle of South Africa, that is, upon history.

关于詹姆逊的后马克思主义观点，最后也是最需要强调的一点是，虽然他的创新涉及内在形式，但他最终还是回归到了外在形式，即现在、地方（无论是文学的还是现实的）在历史中的位置。回到乔斯的天文形象，内在形式是行星的轨道，外在形式是行星所属的更大的宇宙系统。但是，虽然曼德拉在《不可征服》中的伟大成就是带来了一种团结感，但在影片的结尾，这个新形成的整体将取得什么成就仍有待观察。我想大多数人都会同意，这个问题的答案仍在历史中展开。詹姆逊所说的历史是内在形式的容器，这一点在 2010 年上映的一部名为《达格纳姆制造》的电影中得到了更清晰的体现。该电影由奈杰尔·科尔执导，由约翰·库珀主演。莎莉·霍金斯饰演丽塔·奥格雷迪，米兰达·理查森饰演芭芭拉·卡斯尔，罗莎蒙德·派克饰演丽莎·霍普金斯，鲍勃·霍斯金斯饰演工会代表阿尔伯特·帕辛汉姆。

The last and most emphatic point to be made about Jameson’s post-Marxist view is that, while his innovation involves inner form, he ultimately comes to outer form or to the place of the present, the local, whether literary or actual, in history. To return to Jauss’s astronomical image, inner form is the orbit of a planet and outer form is the larger cosmological system of which the planet is a part. But while Mandela’s great achievement in “Invictus” is to have brought about a sense of unity, at the end of the film it remains to be seen what will be achieved by this newly formed whole. And I expect most would agree that the answer to that question is still unfolding in history. A less vague sense of what Jameson means by history as the container of inner form is illustrated by a movie entitled “Made in Dagenham,” directed by Nigel Cole, released in 2010, and starring Sally Hawkins as Rita O’Grady, Miranda Richardson as Barbara Castle, Rosamund Pike as Lisa Hopkins, and Bob Hoskins as Albert Passingham, the union representative.

历史作为内在形式的容器：“达格纳姆制造”

History as the container of inner form: “Made in Dagenham”

这部电影可以说是一部“派系电影”，因为它基于 1968 年英国发生的一起事件的准确历史事实，即伦敦郊区达格纳姆福特工厂的女机械师罢工。但它并不完全是一部纪录片，因为罢工者的领袖丽塔·奥格雷迪是一个虚构的人物——一个由相关历史人物组成的综合人物——而且这些人物的个人故事也并非基于历史证据。

This film is an exercise in “faction” since it is based upon accurate historical facts concerning an episode that occurred in the UK in 1968, namely the strike by female machinists at the Ford factory in Dagenham on the outskirts of London. But it is not completely a documentary, because the leader of the strikers, Rita O’Grady, is a fictive creation—a composite figure made up of the historical characters involved—and the personal stories of the characters are not based on historical evidence.

但这部电影的重点无疑是历史性的：首先，它解释了为什么在罢工两年后的 1970 年，英国通过了一项要求男女同工同酬的法律；其次，它提醒我们许多其他西方国家很快也通过了类似的立法。在下一章中，我将更详细地分析这部电影与女权主义的关系。在这里，我的重点是框架装置或外在形式；这部电影以 1968 年缝纫机工罢工的信息开始，以 1970 年的《平等工资法案》结束。从这个意义上说，《达格纳姆制造》是一部关于内在形式和外在形式之间、普通人日常生活与历史之间关系的电影。詹姆逊将这种转变描述为涉及历史距离的转变，电影中通过玛丽·奎恩特和比巴时装、大量吸烟，以及最重要的 1968 年报道达格纳姆机械师罢工的真实新闻片段，强调了这一点。詹姆逊解释说：

But the point of the film is decidedly historical: that is, first to explain why, in 1970, two years after the strike, Great Britain passed a law requiring equal pay for women; and, second, to remind us that many other Western countries soon followed with similar legislation. In the next chapter I shall analyze this film in more detail in relation to feminism. Here my focus is the framing device or outer form; the film begins with information about the sewing machinists’ strike of 1968 and concludes with reference to the Equal Pay Act of 1970. In this sense “Made in Dagenham” is a film about the relation between inner and outer form, between the quotidian lives of ordinary people and history. Jameson describes such a move as a shift involving historical distance, a point made emphatically in the film by the use of Mary Quant and Biba fashions, heavy cigarette smoking, and most importantly actual newsreel footage from 1968 reporting on the Dagenham machinists’ strike. Jameson explains:

这种转变本质上是历史距离本身的功能，是对历史事件的关注的功能；从遥远的地方看，文化对象似乎以相对被动的方式反映了它们的处境或基础设施，这既不是真的也不是假的，而是媒介本身的含义（《马克思主义与形式》，382）。

Such a shift is essentially a function of historical distance itself, of the focus on historical events; from far away cultural objects seem to reflect their situation or infrastructure in a relatively passive way, and this is neither true nor false but the implication of the medium itself (Marxism and Form, 382).

从 40 多年前工厂生活的遥远历史角度来看，女性同工同酬是公平和必要的，这一点显而易见，因此我们不禁要问，抵制的原因是什么。显而易见的答案是金钱；正如工会领导人指出的那样，只有降低男性工资才能提高女性工资。否则，正如福特代表所言，工厂将不得不在其他地方生产汽车才能实现盈利。资本主义经济是问题。但解决办法却另有所指，摄影机从遥远的历史视角转向更近的视角，正如詹姆逊所说：

From this distant historical perspective of factory life more than 40 years ago, it seems so obvious that equal pay for women is fair and necessary that we are led to wonder what was the reason for resistance. The obvious answer is money; as the union leaders point out, a raise in pay for the women will only be realized by lowering the pay of men. Otherwise, as the Ford representative maintains, the factory will have to make its cars elsewhere in order to realize a profit. Capitalist economics lie at the heart of the problem. But the solution entails something else, the camera changing from the distant historical view to a closer perspective, as Jameson puts it:

当我们越来越接近这种现象时[…]个体行为者开始浮现，我们开始强烈地意识到他们每个人的行为所产生的独特的生存境况；在这样的近距离关注中，阶级甚至不再可见（《马克思主义与形式》，382）。

As we move closer and closer to such phenomena […] the individual actors begin to emerge and we begin to become oppressively aware of the unique existential situations in which each of their acts springs into being; in such a focus, close up, classes are no longer even visible (Marxism and Form, 382).

三位背景截然不同的女性齐聚一堂，共同改变她们那个时代以及之后几代女性的工作条件：丽塔，住在住宅区的机械师，丽莎，大学毕业生，福特工厂经理的妻子，芭芭拉·卡斯尔，她那个时代最杰出的女性政治家。这三个人一起改变了历史的进程，但并不是因为她们形成了一个阶级或属于一个政党。她们各自都有不同的故事要讲，内在形式将在下一章中探讨，因为它们是女权主义的叙述。我在这里的观点是，1968-70 年有关女性同工同酬的历史事实包含——实际上这种关系是辩证的——内在形式，这是一场派系林立却又滑稽的罢工双方日常生活的描述。但是，正如詹姆逊提醒我们的那样，内在形式是一个解释学问题，也就是说，需要解释，而这种解释将解释内在形式和外在形式之间的关系。然而，现在应该清楚的是，这三位女性都达到了新的意识水平，詹姆逊将这一概念归功于黑格尔，以便对马克思主义历史领域产生影响。詹姆逊的创新向我们展示了个人的道德行为，从上层纳尔逊·曼德拉到中层贾斯汀·奎尔，再到底层邮递员马里奥、格尔德·威斯勒和丽塔·奥格雷迪，在马克思主义意义上都具有重要意义，而传统马克思主义者会将这一概念斥为“资产阶级宣传”。

Three women from very different backgrounds come together to alter the situation of the working conditions of the women of their time and generations after them: Rita, a machinist who lives on a housing estate, Lisa, a university graduate and the wife of the manager of the Ford factory, and Barbara Castle, the most prominent female politician of her day. Together these three alter the course of history, but not because they form a class or are part of a political party. They each have different stories to tell, inner forms that will be pursued in the next chapter because they are feminist narratives. My point here is that the historical facts of 1968–70 concerning equal pay for women encompass—actually the relationship is dialectical—the inner form, a factional yet comical account of the daily lives of those involved on both sides of the strike. But, as Jameson reminds us, inner form is a hermeneutical problem, that is, one requiring interpretation, and that interpretation will explain the relation between inner and outer form. It should be clear at this point, however, that each of the three women achieved a new level of consciousness, a concept Jameson attributes to Hegel, in order to have an effect upon the realm of Marxist history. Jameson’s innovation shows us that individual ethical acts, from the top, Nelson Mandela, to the middle, Justin Quayle, or to the bottom, Mario the postman, Gerd Wiesler, and Rita O’Grady, can be significant in Marxian terms, a notion that traditional Marxists would dismiss as “bourgeois propaganda.”

在本章和前四章中，我已经完成了对五位男性理论家的分析，现在我来谈谈埃莱娜·西苏 (Hélène Cixous) 的作品，她提供了一种女性替代方案，但并没有完全颠覆她的男性同行的替代方案。

Having now completed the analysis of five male theorists in this and the previous four chapters, I turn to the work of Hélène Cixous, who provides a female alternative, but not one that completely subverts those of her male counterparts.

第六章

CHAPTER SIX

后女权主义：海伦·西苏

Post-feminism: Hélène Cixous

摘要：本章首先解释，之所以选择西苏，是因为除了她的批判性作品之外，她的创作性写作也是她有影响力的女权主义立场不可或缺的一部分。西苏理论的主要创新元素是程序性的，这一方面受德里达的影响，但达到了道德上的解决。西苏理论的第一条公理“用身体写作”通过《朱莉和朱莉娅》得到解释。虽然女性身体可以作为一种交流形式，但下一节关于《达格纳姆制造》解释了女权主义如何影响人类行为。这种改变人们行为的力量的来源是力比多，《玛丽·安托瓦内特》对此进行了说明。西苏的女性力比多与男性力比多不同，正如对《红磨坊》的分析所见。在下一节中，“玫瑰街”说明了女性力比多如何改变男性权力结构。但这种改变可能只是暂时的：《穿普拉达的女魔头》展示了女性如何在体制内实现永久的改变。结论部分将西苏的进程与德里达的进程区分开来，强调关心、感情和爱，这些都是力比多的功能，它们不仅在更广泛的社会和政治方面产生道德结果，而且在个人爱情关系中也产生道德结果。

Summary: The chapter begins by explaining that Cixous was chosen because in addition to her critical works her creative writings are an integral part of her influential feminist position. The main innovative element of Cixous’s theory is procedural, an aspect influenced by Derrida, but one which reaches an ethical resolution. The first axiom of Cixous’s theory, “writing with the body,” is explained by way of “Julie and Julia.” While the female body may serve as a form of communication, the next section, on “Made in Dagenham,” explains how feminism affects human behavior. The source of this power to change how people act is the libido, which is illustrated by “Marie Antoinette.” The female libido is to be distinguished for Cixous from its male counterpart, as is seen in the analysis of “Moulin Rouge.” In the next section, “Rosenstrasse” illustrates how the female libido alters the male power structure. But this type of change may be only temporary: “The Devil Wears Prada” shows how women can make a permanent change within the establishment. The conclusion distinguishes Cixous’s process from that of Derrida by its emphasis on care, affection, and love, all functions of the libido, that produce ethical results not only in larger social and political terms but also for individual love relationships.

选择一位女权主义者是一个困难的决定，因为美国、英国、法国和其他国家都以不同类型的女权主义为标志，更不用说每个国家内部的个体差异了。但我之所以选择埃莱娜·西苏，是因为她是乔伊斯学者、小说家和剧作家，是该领域最具影响力的批评家之一，而且与许多女权主义者不同，她的批评和创作都与文学理论直接相关。西苏解构了文学理论的概念，同时阐述了一种替代理论：她回避所谓的“男性主宰理论”并提出自己的理论的方式，可以通过阅读本章，即遵循她的程序来最好地理解。只有遵循这一过程才能理解这一观点，这一事实至关重要，因为替代理论，一个包罗万象的概念，将是男性主宰的另一个例子。

The decision to choose one feminist is difficult because the United States, Great Britain, France, and other countries are marked by distinct types of feminism, to say nothing of the individual differences within each country. But I have chosen Hélène Cixous because, as a Joyce scholar as well as a novelist and playwright, she is one of the most influential critics in the field and, unlike many feminists, both her critical and her creative work bear directly upon literary theory. Cixous deconstructs the very notion of literary theory while articulating an alternative theory: the manner in which she avoids what she calls the “male master theory” while positing her own theory can best be understood by proceeding through this chapter, that is, by following her procedure. The very fact that this view can only be understood by following it in process is crucial, for the alternative, an all-encompassing concept, would be another example of male mastery.

用身体写作：《朱莉和朱莉娅》

Writing with the body: “Julie and Julia”

西苏认为，诗歌可以直接进入潜意识，而受到压抑的人，也就是女性，正是在潜意识中“设法生存”。西苏认为，女性压抑的解药是写作：“写你自己。你的身体必须被倾听。只有这样，潜意识的无限资源才会涌现出来。我们的石脑油将遍布全世界，不需要美元——无论是黑色的还是金色的——未经评估的价值，这些价值将改变旧游戏的规则”（《笑声》，879）。但女性写作是一种特殊的写作：

Cixous believes that poetry has direct access to the unconscious where the repressed, that is to say, women, “manage to survive.” The antidote to female repression, according to Cixous, is to write: “Write yourself. Your body must be heard. Only then will the immense resources of the unconscious spring forth. Our naphtha will spread throughout all the world, without dollars—black or gold—non-assessed values that will change the rules of the old game” (“The Laugh,” 879). But female writing is of a special sort:

[…] 女性必须通过自己的身体来写作，她们必须发明坚不可摧的语言，以摧毁隔阂、阶级、修辞、规则和准则，她们必须淹没、突破、超越最终的保留话语，包括嘲笑宣布“沉默”一词的想法的话语，包括以不可能为目标，在“不可能”一词前停下并将其写为“结束”的话语（《笑声》，881）。

[…] women must write through their bodies, they must invent the impregnable language that will wreck partitions, classes, and rhetorics, regulations and codes, they must, submerge, cut through, get beyond the ultimate reserve-discourse, including the one that laughs at the very idea of announcing the word “silence,” the one that, aiming for the impossible, stops short before the word “impossible” and writes it as “the end” (“The Laugh,” 881).

一部可能有助于我们理解通过身体写作概念的电影《朱莉和朱莉娅》，由诺拉·艾芙隆编剧和导演，于 2009 年首次上映，梅丽尔·斯特里普饰演朱莉娅·查尔德，艾米·亚当斯饰演朱莉·鲍威尔。身体元素在对朱莉娅·查尔德的精彩演绎中最为明显，梅丽尔·斯特里普生动地传达了她在电视烹饪节目中如此令人印象深刻的身体形象。从 20 世纪 60 年代开始，我就记得一个身材高挑、瘦长、有点脱节、快活的女人，声音尖细，经常因为弄乱自己的食谱而自嘲，这一特点让她深受美国年轻厨师的喜爱。她的食谱包含了初学者或用她的话来说“没有仆人的厨师”所需要的细节，尤其是第一次接触法国菜复杂性的年轻美国人。简而言之，朱莉娅·查尔德的食谱似乎预见了她在厨房里会犯的错误，这些失误后来成为了电视奇观。其中最具特色的是朱莉娅试图翻转煎蛋卷，结果煎锅里只剩下一半。从这个意义上说，她是在写自己的身体。

A film that may help us understand the notion of writing through the body, “Julie and Julia,” was written and directed by Nora Ephron, first released in 2009 and starring Meryl Streep as Julia Child and Amy Adams as Julie Powell. The element of the body is most evident in the fine portrayal of Julia Child whose physical presence, so imposing on her television cooking show, is vividly conveyed by Meryl Streep. From the 1960s I recall a tall, gangly, somewhat disjointed, jolly woman with a high-pitched voice often giggling at herself for messing up her own recipes, a trait that endeared her to America’s young cooks. Her cookbooks contained the sort of detail that beginners or, in her terms, “cooks without servants,” required, particularly young Americans being exposed for the first time to the complexities of French cuisine. In short, Julia Child’s cookbooks seemed to anticipate her own errors in the kitchen, mishaps that later became television spectacles. The most characteristic of these is Julia’s attempt to flip an omelet that ends up with only half of it in the frying pan. In that sense she was writing her own body.

在记述她早年生活时，西苏谈到了自己作为一名女性考虑进入男性写作世界时的尴尬：

In an account of her early life, Cixous tells of her awkwardness as a woman contemplating entry into the male world of writing:

因此，对于书之子来说：研究、沙漠、无穷无尽的空间，鼓励、阻止我们向前直行。对于误入森林的家庭主妇的女儿来说。受骗、失望，但充满好奇心。不是与狮身人面像进行伟大的神秘决斗，而是向狼的身体提出危险的问题：身体是用来做什么的？神话最终会把我们剥光。逻各斯张开大嘴，把我们整个吞下去（《西苏便携式》，46）。

So for the Sons of the Book: research, the desert, inexhaustible space, encouraging, discouraging the march straight ahead. For the daughters of the housewife straying into the forest. Deceived, disappointed, but brimming with curiosity. Instead of the great enigmatic duel with the Sphinx, the dangerous questioning addressed to the body of the Wolf: What is the body for? Myths end up having our hides. Logos opens its great maw, and swallows us whole (Portable Cixous, 46).

在影片中，朱莉娅就像一位“迷失在森林里的家庭主妇”，由于不知道该如何打发闲暇时间，她报读了一所法国烹饪学校。梅丽尔·斯特里普饰演一位笨拙的美国女性，周围都是一群细腻、精致的法国男性准厨师。她不知怎么地笨手笨脚地完成了课程，用自嘲式的幽默和热情赢得了一些同学的喜爱。她的几位法国女性朋友请朱莉娅帮助她们用英语写一本法国食谱，正是通过这本食谱的一个版本，我们认识了朱莉这个角色。

In the film, Julia is a sort of “housewife straying into the forest” when, unable to decide what to do with her leisure time, she enrolls in a French cooking school. Meryl Streep portrays a gawky American woman among the subtle, delicate French all-male would-be chefs. Somehow she bumbles her way through the classes, endearing herself to some of her classmates by her self-deprecating humor and enthusiasm. A few of her French female friends ask Julia to help them write a French cookbook in English, and it is by way of a version of this cookbook that we come to the character of Julie.

朱莉也在写自己的身体，她是一个“迷失在森林里的家庭主妇”，但现在我们从 1949 年的巴黎来到了 21 世纪的纽约，朱莉的写作形式是她在电脑上为博客写的日记。新婚不久的朱莉厌倦了她的工作，在烹饪中寻求慰藉。她决定花一年时间尝试朱莉娅·查尔德书中的每一个食谱（总共 524 个），并在她的博客上记录结果。影片中专门介绍朱莉·鲍威尔的部分是她博客写作的视觉版本，表达了一位年轻女性从大苹果城的公共事业中退出，转而享受家庭和家庭烹饪的私人空间。

Julie is also writing her own body and is a “housewife straying into the forest,” but now we are transported from the Paris of 1949 to twenty-first-century New York where Julie’s writing takes the form of a journal on a computer for her blog. Recently married, Julie is bored with her job and seeks solace in cooking. She decides to devote a year to trying every recipe in Julia Child’s book (524 in all), and to record the results on her blog. The portion of the film devoted to Julie Powell is a visual version of her blog writing, an expression of a young woman’s withdrawal from public careerism in the Big Apple to a private nest of family and home cooking.

朱莉指出，她和朱莉娅很相似，都是无聊的秘书，通过烹饪来获得乐趣和放松，我们还可以补充一点，她们都在努力寻找一种交流经验的方式，一个写书，另一个写博客，但她们的家庭生活却不同。朱莉娅的丈夫保罗对朱莉娅的支持无微不至，他们过着舒适的中上阶层生活。朱莉和她的丈夫努力维持生计，因为她必须至少在部分时间继续工作，她做饭常常导致丈夫忽视她，有一次，丈夫离开了她几天。然而，从最深层次的意义上讲，两位丈夫都支持他们的妻子，爱和支持被视为他们成功的关键，也就是说，出版书籍并成为一名成功的博主。因此，电影中的女性处于后女权主义阶段，妻子的职业不必排除她在家庭中的传统角色。但朱莉娅和朱莉都不是公开意义上的女权主义者；她们在男性主导的出版界努力写作传统上女性从事的烹饪事业。毫不奇怪，这两位女性都是被女性发现的：朱莉娅被一位编辑发现，朱莉娅被一位评论家发现。西苏解释了原因：

While, as Julie points out, she and Julia resemble one another in that both were bored secretaries who turned to cooking for pleasure and relief and, we might add, struggled to find a mode of communicating their experience, a book for one and a blog for the other, their home lives are different. Paul, Julia’s husband, is unfailingly supportive of Julia, and they live a comfortable upper-middle-class life. Julie and her husband struggle to make ends meet, and because she must continue working at least part of the time, her cooking often results in neglect of her husband who, on one occasion, leaves her for a few days. Nevertheless, in the deepest sense both husbands support their wives, and that love and support are seen as crucial to their success, that is, getting into print and becoming a successful blogger. The women in the film are therefore at a post-feminist stage where the wife’s career need not exclude her traditional role in the family. But neither Julia nor Julie is a feminist in any overt sense; they are struggling to write about a traditionally female endeavor, cooking, in a male-dominated publishing world. Not surprisingly, both women are discovered by females, Julia by an editor and Julie by a reviewer. Cixous explains the reason:

在女性的言语中，就像在她们的写作中一样，有一种元素永不停止回响，一旦我们被它渗透，被它深深地、不知不觉地触动，它就会保留感动我们的力量——这种元素就是歌曲：来自每个女人心中都活着的爱情之声的最初音乐。为什么与声音有这种特殊的关系？因为没有哪个女人像男人一样储存了那么多抵御冲动的防御手段。[…] 她体内至少有一点那位善良母亲的乳汁。她用白色墨水写作（“笑声”，878）。

In women’s speech, as in their writing, that element which never stops resonating, which once we have been permeated by it, profoundly and imperceptibly touched by it, retains the power of moving us—that element is the song: first music from the first voice of love which is alive in every woman. Why this privileged relationship with the voice? Because no woman stockpiles as many defenses for countering the drives as does a man. […] There is always within her at least a little of that good mother’s milk. She writes in white ink (“The Laugh,” 878).

重要的是要意识到，西苏并不是断言女性写作是女性独有的。事实上，有些男性比有些女性更有能力，但他们是例外，而不是常态。男性和女性写作之间的区别是文化上的，而不是自然的。上面的段落于 1975 年首次翻译成英文，文化状况无疑发生了一些变化，但可能并不剧烈。近 20 年后，西苏用不同的术语阐述了这个问题：

It is important to realize that Cixous is not asserting that feminine writing is somehow exclusive to women. Indeed, some men are more capable of it than some women, but they are the exceptions rather than the rule. The distinction between male and female writing is cultural, not natural. The passage above was first translated into English in 1975, and the cultural situation has undoubtedly changed somewhat, but perhaps not drastically. Writing nearly 20 years later, Cixous formulates the issue in different terms:

如果有人问我，[…] 我是否愿意拥有/成为一个男人的身体来尝试一下，我会说“当然”。我很想从另一个身体了解世界，能够真正从一边和另一边研究性别差异。[…] 但无论这种近似有多好，我永远不会转到另一边（Portable Cixous，56-7）。

If someone were to ask me, […] if I would like to have/be a man’s body to try it out, I would say “of course”. I would be fascinated to know the world from another body, to be able to really work on sexual difference from one side and from the other. […] But I will never pass over to the other side no matter how good the approximation is (Portable Cixous, 56–7).

性别差异并不完全局限于性别，但永远无法完全弥合。西苏在一则关于她个人经历的轶事中解释了这一复杂的悖论：

Sexual difference is not wholly confined to gender but can never be completely bridged. This complex paradox is explained by Cixous in an anecdote about her personal experience:

我这样说，就好像这个场景中的人物是：一个女人，一个男人，当然。这样的场景和这样的人物无疑是可能的，可能有一个男人是毫无疑问的男人，一个女人是毫无疑问的女人。但我从经验中知道（我只有在经验之后，也就是在犯错之后才知道），很多时候“女人”不是女人，“男人”也不是男人。[…] 我知道一个女人，乍一看就像是五个小男孩和一个小女孩的集合（《西苏传》，57）。

I spoke as if the characters in this scene were: a woman, and a man, obviously. Such a scene with such characters is no doubt possible, there could be a man who is a man-without-any-doubt, a woman who is a woman-without-any-doubt. But I know from experience (I only know anything after experience, that is, after errors) that very often a “woman” is not a woman, nor a “man” a man. […] I know a woman who is at second glance an ensemble of five little boys and one little girl (Portable Cixous, 57).

由于性别差异仍然存在，朱莉娅·查尔德上世纪中叶的食谱对朱莉·鲍威尔来说有着特殊的共鸣，因为她是一位现在。西苏斯再次解释了其中的原因：“女人身上始终存在着一种力量，这种力量是由他人——尤其是其他女人——创造的。在她身上，母体、摇篮、给予者，她自己，作为她的母亲和孩子；她是她自己的姐妹女儿”（《笑声》，880）。

Since gender differences persist, Julia Child’s cookbook from the middle of the last century has a special resonance for Julie Powell as a woman in the present. Again Cixous explains why: “There always remains in woman that force which produces/is produced by the other—in particular, the other woman. In her, matrix, cradler, herself giver as her mother and child; she is her own sister-daughter” (“The Laugh,” 880).

但是，尽管朱莉娅启发了朱莉，并促使她开始写日记，最终创作了她的书（和电影），但在电影快结束时，朱莉发现朱莉娅对朱莉娅的作品并不满意，这让她很伤心。原因尚不清楚。朱莉嘟囔着说她不尊重朱莉娅，但朱莉娅从未进一步追问或解释过。这个个人问题并不有趣，因为正如朱莉的丈夫指出的那样，更重要的一点是，朱莉眼中的朱莉娅才是最重要的；从某种意义上说，虚拟的朱莉娅比“真实的”朱莉娅更重要。朱莉最终接受了这样一个事实：朱莉娅现在是一个话语人物，一个由她的作品、她的电视表演以及关于她的写作和介绍所塑造的形象。所以电影以朱莉娅的丈夫在史密森尼博物馆纪念朱莉娅·查尔德的展览上为她拍照而结束。女性分享女性气质或女权主义的地方是在话语领域，这就是西苏鼓励女性书写她们的身体的原因。但这部作品的目的不仅仅是建立女性之间的个人关系，因为正如我们所见，朱莉娅对与朱莉的友谊不感兴趣。然而，这部电影表明，这些女性的作品之间存在着明显的话语关系，朱莉的成功是朱莉娅作品的直接结果。西苏斯的女性主义话语领域并没有受到个人仇恨的阻碍。然而，对于西苏斯来说，这种话语关系的结果明显是女性化的。

But although Julia inspires Julie, an inspiration that initiates Julie’s journal and results in her book (and the film), Julie is crushed to discover, near the end of the movie, that Julia was not favorably impressed by Julie’s work. It is not clear why this is so. Julie murmurs something about lack of respect that is never further pursued or explained. This personal problem is not of interest because the more important point, as Julie’s husband points out, is that the image Julie has of Julia is what matters; in a sense the virtual Julia is more significant than the “real” Julia. What Julie comes to accept at the end is that Julia is now a figure of discourse, an image produced by her writings, her television spectacle, and the writing as well as the presentations about her. So the movie ends with Julie’s husband photographing her at the Smithsonian exhibit honoring Julia Child. The place where women share their femininity or feminism is in the realm of discourse, and that is why Cixous encourages women to write their bodies. But the object of this writing is not merely to set up personal relationships between women, for, as we have seen, Julia is not interested in a friendship with Julie. Yet the movie demonstrates that there is a clear discursive relationship between the work of these women, and that Julie’s success is a direct result of the writing of Julia. Cixous’s feminist realm of discourse is not impeded by personal animosities. Yet the result of this discursive relationship is, for Cixous, distinctly feminine.

我们做某事的方式完全不同，我们热爱同一个人的方式也不同——语言——：这也可以通过阅读我们的文本看出来。

The way we do something completely differently, the way we passionately love the same person—Language—differently: this too can be seen by reading our texts.

我将通过写作唤起身体的各种姿势。对我来说，一开始什么都没有。我从没有文字，只有身体开始。这是一种让自己沉入谷底，让自己沉入谷底，一种灵魂的聚集。让我们等待。这需要一种潜意识，一种对力量的未表述的信仰，一种将要到来的物质性，一种将显现的地下海洋，一种始终存在的潮流，它将升起并带我而去（《西苏便携式》， 59）。

I will evoke various positions of the body-in-writing. For me, in the beginning, there is nothing. I begin without words and with body. It is a letting myself go to the bottom, letting myself sink to the bottom, a collecting together of the soul. Let us wait. This requires an unconscious, an unformulated belief in a force, in a materiality that will come, that will manifest itself, an underground sea, a current that is always there, that will rise and carry me (Portable Cixous, 59).

朱莉娅和朱莉之间的重要联系是话语上的，是朱莉娅的食谱和朱莉的博客之间的联系，这两种不同的话语形式是由个性和历史时代的差异造成的。这部电影为这种话语增加了一个维度，表明朱莉娅和朱莉娅都很幸运，有深爱她们的丈夫。事实上，正如朱莉所说的，如果没有丈夫的忠诚，她不可能成功，这与朱莉娅的话如出一辙。这两段婚姻中弥漫的爱是丈夫的鼓励和妇女们的作品、她们的书籍和博客都体现在背景和前景中。因为正是通过书籍、博客，甚至是向观众讲述这些话语形式的电影所传达的爱，激励了朱莉娅和朱莉这一代的女性（和男性）。

The important connection between Julia and Julie is discursive, between Julia’s cookbook and Julie’s blog, the two different forms of discourse accounted for by differences of personality and of historical era. The film adds a dimension to this discourse by demonstrating that Julia and Julie are both blessed with husbands who love them deeply. Indeed, as Julie asserts, echoing the exact words of Julia, she could not have succeeded without the devotion of her husband. The love that pervades these two marriages is present in both the background and the foreground, the encouragement of the husbands and in the women’s works, their books and blogs. For it is the love communicated by the book, the blog, and indeed the film that speaks to the audience of these forms of discourse, that inspires women (and men) of Julia’s and Julie’s generation.

女性沟通的目标：“达格纳姆制造”

The goal of feminine communication: “Made in Dagenham”

随之而来的问题是，虽然女性书写自己的身体可能会鼓励其他人参与讨论，正如朱莉娅的书对朱莉的影响所见，但是，除了个人发展之外，这个过程的目标是什么呢？我相信，这就是西苏的主要创新之处。她的目标不是模仿“男性主导”；相反，她希望解构这一概念。解构主义对西苏影响很大。事实上，在 2004 年西苏去世前的 35 年里，德里达一直鼓励西苏，与他一起阅读并分享会议和书籍。她写了两本关于德里达的书，并用以下的话明确表示了德里达的立场对她有多么重要：“解构主义将是我们这个时代最伟大的批判性警告姿态”（《西苏读本》，第十六页）。然而，正如我们将看到的，西苏清楚地将自己与德里达区分开来。

The next question that arises is that while women writing their own bodies may encourage others to join in the discourse, as seen in the influence of Julia’s book upon Julie, what, apart from personal development, is the goal of this process? And here, I believe, is Cixous’s major innovation. The goal is not to imitate “male mastery”; rather, she wishes to deconstruct this concept. Deconstruction is a major influence upon Cixous. In fact, for 35 years before his death in 2004, Derrida encouraged, read, and shared conferences and books with Cixous. She has written two books on Derrida and made clear how important his position is to her in the following terms: “Deconstruction will have been the greatest critical warning gesture of our time” (Cixous Reader, xvi). Nevertheless, as we shall see, Cixous clearly distinguishes herself from Derrida.

定义女性写作实践是不可能的，而且这种不可能将一直存在，因为这种实践永远无法理论化、封闭化、编码化——这并不意味着它不存在。但它将永远超越规范男性中心体系的话语；它确实会发生，也将继续发生在那些受哲学理论统治的领域之外。只有那些打破自动化的主体，那些任何权威都无法征服的边缘人物，才会构想出这种实践（《西苏传》， 35）。

It is impossible to define a feminine practice of writing, and this is an impossibility that will remain, for the practice can never be theorized, enclosed, coded—which doesn’t mean it doesn’t exist. But it will always surpass the discourse that regulates the phallocentric system; it does and will take place in areas other than those subordinated to philosophico-theoretical domination. It will be conceived of only by subjects who are breakers of automatisms, by peripheral figures that no authority can ever subjugate (Portable Cixous, 35).

为了理解这一具有挑战性的创新，一种与传统理论相悖的理论，我们可以更详细地研究一下第五章《达格纳姆制造》中简要讨论过的那部电影。在前面的讨论中，这部电影说明了影片的开头和结尾，即有关 1968 年罢工和 1970 年《平等工资法案》的信息，从字面上和象征意义上包围了影片的派系中心，赋予了它历史意义。《平等工资法案》也具有理论意义，因为它为全球经济市场引入了一种新观念，即性别不应成为决定工资的因素。

To understand this challenging innovation, a theory against traditional theory, we may examine in greater detail the film that was briefly discussed in Chapter Five, “Made in Dagenham.” In the previous discussion, this film served to illustrate the manner in which the beginning and end, namely, the information about the strike of 1968 and the Equal Pay Act of 1970, literally and figuratively enclosed the factional middle of the film, giving it historical significance. The Equal Pay Act is also of theoretical significance, for it introduces a new idea into the global economic market, that gender should not be a factor in determining salary.

然而，女缝纫机工们心中只有一个更本地化的目标。达格纳姆的同工同酬是的，也许运气好的话，同工同酬在整个英国，但做梦也想不到在整个西方世界。那么，这怎么会发生呢？地方性和实践性是如何变成普遍性和理论性的呢？要回答这个问题，我们来看看电影的中间部分，即罢工的进展。在工会代表鲍勃的帮助下，丽塔很快意识到，女性前进道路上的第一个也是最重要的障碍是达格纳姆工厂的男工人。正如工会领导人向她指出的那样，任何给女性的加薪都将通过减少给男性的工资来实现。同样在家里，领导罢工的女性很快就遭到了丈夫的抵制，因为丈夫必须替妻子做事，照顾孩子和做其他以前不属于她们责任的家务。

And yet the female sewing machinists had only a more local goal in mind. Equal pay for Dagenham, yes, and perhaps with luck equal pay throughout Great Britain, but never in their wildest dreams throughout the Western world. So how did it happen, how did the local and practical become general and theoretical? To answer this question we turn to the middle of the movie, the progress of the strike. Rita soon realizes with the help of Bob, the union representative, that the first and most important obstacle in the women’s way is the male workers at the Dagenham factory. As the union leaders point out to her, any raise in pay for the women will be realized by giving less to the men. Similarly at home, the women who lead the strike soon experience resistance from their husbands who have to fill in for their wives, that is, attend to the children and other household duties that were not previously their responsibility.

丽塔勇敢地面对这两个挑战，解构了男性的统治。她直面丈夫和男性工会领袖，从这个意义上说，她利用男性的侵略性来对付男性。但她用身体说话，从而唤起了丈夫的爱和工会领袖的钦佩。有一集就说明了这两种策略。当被叫到国务卿办公室时，丽塔拜访了福特达格纳姆总经理的妻子丽莎。当他开门时，她没有他那么慌乱，问起他的妻子，后来穿着丽莎的一件裙子出来了。在这里，我们看到了丽塔的多才多艺，与丈夫的坚定姿态，与妻子的温柔团结——“我需要一个帮助。”有趣的是，丽塔和丽莎的关系始于两人决定面对一位他们认为欺负孩子的男老师。丽莎组织了一份反对这位老师的请愿书，请丽塔签名，后来告诉她他们赢了。这位老师被要求离开学校。

Rita courageously faces both of these challenges by deconstructing male mastery. She confronts her husband and the male union leaders head on, and in that sense she uses male aggression against males. But she speaks with her body and thereby evokes love in her husband and admiration in the union leaders. One episode illustrates both tactics. When summoned to the office of the Secretary of State, Rita pays a visit to Lisa, the wife of the general manager of Ford Dagenham. When he answers the door she is less flustered than he, asks for his wife, and later emerges in one of Lisa’s dresses. Here we see Rita’s versatility, firm posture with the husband, gentle solidarity with wife—“I need a favor.” Interestingly, the relationship between Rita and Lisa began when both decided to confront a male teacher whom they believed was bullying their children. Lisa organizes a petition against this teacher, asks Rita to sign, and tells her later that they have won. The teacher has been asked to leave the school.

胜利的鼓舞下，丽莎来到丽塔家，鼓励她继续打击自己的丈夫。为什么？丽莎解释说，虽然她毕业于一流大学，成绩优异，但她的丈夫却把她当傻子一样对待，或者用西苏的话来说，把她当成“森林里流浪的家庭主妇”。丽塔和丽莎之间的交流不是文字上的，而是语言和肢体语言：

Emboldened by this victory, Lisa goes to Rita’s home, encouraging her to continue with her strike against her own husband. Why? Lisa explains that, although she is a graduate with a first-class degree from an excellent university, she is treated by her husband like a fool, or in Cixous’s terms, a “stray housewife in the forest.” The communication between Rita and Lisa is not textual but involves speech and body language:

对我而言，女人的身体是诞生女孩、男孩、人类和后代的柔软之处，这个“腰带以下”的地方就像两只手，就像明天，它承载着多重记忆，关于已经发生过什么的记忆，关于将要发生什么的记忆（《西苏文摘》，57）。

The woman-body, for me, is the place from where, the soft place from where girls or boys, humans, descendants are born, this place “below the belt” which is like two hands, like tomorrow, and has more than one memory, a memory of what has taken place, a memory of what will take place (Portable Cixous, 57).

她们之间产生的友谊意味着，穿着丽莎的 Biba 连衣裙的丽塔——具有男性般的友情和女性般的时尚感——有足够的信心与政府官员对峙和谈判。

Their resulting friendship means that Rita, wearing Lisa’s Biba dress—bolstered by the male-like comradeship and the female-like fashionableness—feels confident enough to confront and negotiate with the government official.

最重要的是，她对国务卿芭芭拉·卡斯尔采取了类似的双重策略，既有男性的直率，又有女性团结一致，卡斯尔夫人不但没有被丽塔的厚颜无耻吓到，反而大胆地对哈罗德·威尔逊首相使用同样的策略。这种策略之所以有效，是因为丽塔从不憎恨或排斥男性。西苏解释如下：

Most importantly, she adopts a similar double strategy with Barbara Castle, the Secretary of State, a mixture of male straightforwardness and female solidarity so that Mrs Castle, instead of being put off by Rita’s effrontery, is emboldened to use the same tactics with Prime Minister Harold Wilson. And the reason this tactic works is because Rita never hates or excludes men. Cixous explains as follows:

此外，阴茎在我的文章中随处可见，我给它一个位置和吸引力，这难道不明显吗？当然是的。我想要全部。我想要我的一切和他的一切。我为什么要剥夺自己的一部分呢？我想要我们所有人。女人当然有“爱的欲望”，而不是嫉妒的欲望。但不是因为她被阉割了；不是因为她被剥夺了，需要被填补，就像一些想要安慰自己或寻求报复的受伤的人一样。我不想要一个阴茎来装饰我的身体。但我确实渴望另一个人，完整的，完整的，男性或女性；因为生活意味着想要一切存在的东西，所有活着的东西，并希望它们活着。阉割？让别人玩弄它吧。什么是源于缺乏的欲望？一个相当微不足道的欲望（“笑声”，885）。

Besides, isn’t it evident that the penis gets around in my texts, that I give it a place and appeal? Of course I do. I want all. I want all of me with all of him. Why should I deprive myself of a part of us? I want all of us. Woman of course has a desire for a “loving desire” and not a jealous one. But not because she is gelded; not because she’s deprived and needs to be filled out, like some wounded person who wants to console herself or seek vengeance. I don’t want a penis to decorate my body with. But I do desire the other for the other, whole and entire, male or female; because living means wanting everything that is, everything that lives, and wanting it alive. Castration? Let others toy with it. What’s a desire originating from a lack? A pretty meager desire (“The Laugh,” 885).

丽塔从工厂里尽职尽责的妻子变成了领导者，首先是女性的领导者，然后是男性和女性的领导者。然而，她从未抛弃过以前的自己；即使她的新职责需要她忽略一些家务，她仍然是一位忠诚的妻子和母亲。西苏斯解释说，女性可以在不抛弃过去的情况下改变，以及这种内在的个人发展如何塑造她们的公众形象。为了理解这个概念，我将研究索菲亚·科波拉 (Sofia Coppola) 于 2006 年上映的《绝代艳后》，由克斯汀·邓斯特 (Kirsten Dunst) 主演。

Rita changes from the dutiful wife who works at the factory into a leader, first of the women and then of both the men and the women. And yet she never leaves her previous self behind; she remains a devoted wife and mother even if her new responsibilities necessitate some neglect of her domestic duties. Cixous explains that women can change without deserting their past and how that inner personal development shapes their public persona. To understand this notion I shall examine Sofia Coppola’s “Marie Antoinette,” released in 2006, starring Kirsten Dunst.

内心深处：“玛丽·安托瓦内特”

Deep down inside: “Marie Antoinette”

《玛丽·安托瓦内特》以一位 14 岁的女主角从奥地利来到法国，成为法国未来国王法国王太子的妻子为开端。她在性爱和政治方面毫无经验，对法国宫廷的行事方式也完全不熟悉。但即使在一开始，我们就开始看到她个性中的独特元素。她拒绝遵守许多法国习俗，坚持陪同丈夫打猎，并冷落国王的情妇杜巴利夫人。西苏斯解释说，女人很快就会看穿“礼节”的空洞：

“Marie Antoinette” begins with a 14-year-old heroine arriving from Austria to become the wife of the Dauphin, the future king of France. She is not at all experienced in matters sexual or political and is completely unfamiliar with the ways of the French court. But even at the outset we begin to see distinctive elements of her personality. She refuses to abide by many French conventions, insisting on accompanying her husband when hunting, and snubbing the King’s mistress, Madame du Barry. Cixous explains that women soon see through the inanity of “propriety”:

我认为当今女性颠覆了“个人”的范畴，因为如果通过法律、谎言、勒索和婚姻，女性对自己的权利与她的名字一起被剥夺，那么通过道德异化的运动，女性就能更清楚地看到“礼仪”的空洞，男性婚姻主观经济的简化吝啬，她对此表示双重抵制（“笑声”，883）。

I say women today overturn the “personal,” for if by means of laws, lies, blackmail, and marriage, her right to herself has been extorted at the same time as her name, she has been able, through the very movement of moral alienation, to see more closely the inanity of “propriety,” the reductive stinginess of the masculine-conjugal subjective economy, which she doubly resists (“The Laugh,” 883).

她抵达凡尔赛宫后的早期场景充满了空洞的“礼节”。我们看到一个裸体的年轻女子在决定谁是着装者的最高层时瑟瑟发抖。玛丽·安托瓦内特非常有耐心，但显然对仪式中随意、滑稽的元素感到好笑。同样，围绕着皇室夫妇吃早餐的仪式，一直重复到宫殿在革命期间被洗劫一空，变成了一种合唱。面对着朝臣，他们从后面被服务——这本身就是一场精心设计的常规表演——在站立的观众面前吃饭，但没有对他们说话。这部电影充满了空洞的仪式。另一个明显的空洞礼节的例子是杜巴利夫人，她对玛丽·安托瓦内特没有和她说话感到很受侮辱，因为宫廷的规则是，她不能说话，除非公主跟她说话。玛丽·安托瓦内特虽然瞧不起这名女子，但出于对国王的体谅，她简短地和她交谈了几句，国王点了点头表示赞同。总而言之，这是一出闹剧般的场景。

The early scenes after her arrival at Versailles are full of inane forms of “propriety.” We see a naked young woman shivering as decisions are made and then revised as to who is at the top of the hierarchy of dressers. Marie Antoinette is remarkably patient but clearly amused at the arbitrary, farcical element of the ceremony. Similarly, the ritual surrounding the royal couple eating breakfast, repeated until the palace is sacked during the revolution, becomes a sort of chorus. Facing the courtiers, they are served from behind—itself an elaborately conventionalized performance—eating in the presence of but not speaking to a standing audience. The film is punctuated by empty ritual. The other notable example of inane propriety concerns Madame du Barry, who is insulted that Marie Antoinette has not spoken to her, since the rule of court is that she may not speak until spoken to by the princess. Out of consideration for the King, Marie Antoinette, who despises the woman, speaks briefly to her, occasioning an approving nod from the King. All in all, a scene worthy of a farce.

安顿下来后，玛丽·安托瓦内特开始享受宫廷的奢华。但很快，她就面临着生下男性继承人的巨大压力，最终只允许少数随从，退居小特里亚农宫，那里成了她自己的私人宫廷。虽然奢华，但比起国王的宫廷，这里要朴素得多。然后，她搬到了哈默宫，这里本身就是一种高度浪漫、理想化的生活，至少与凡尔赛宫的生活相比是如此。在这里，我们开始看到公主逐渐成熟，认识到宫廷和朝臣的局限性。我们还了解到，她那句著名的名言“让他们吃蛋糕”是不准确的，也是断章取义的。宫廷内外的生活对这位年轻的公主产生了影响。

Once settled in, Marie Antoinette begins to enjoy the extravagant pleasures of the court. But soon she is under great pressure to produce a male heir and eventually restricts herself to a small retinue, retiring to the Petit Trianon that becomes her own private court. Although lavish, this setting is considerably less extravagant than the King’s court. She then moves on to Le Hameau, which in its own highly romantic, idealized way is simplicity itself, at least in comparison to the life at the main Château de Versailles. Here we begin to see the Princess maturing, recognizing the limitations of the court and the courtiers. We also learn that the famous phrase attributed to her, “let them eat cake,” is inaccurate and taken out of context. Life inside and outside of the court is having its effect upon the young princess.

一方面，她必然会把自己塑造成一个能够放弃一部分自我却又不失正直的人。但另一方面，她却在内心深处悄悄地成长和繁衍，因为另一方面，她比任何男人都更了解生活，更了解驱动力的经济性和自我管理之间的关系。与男人不同，男人如此珍视自己的头衔和头衔、自己的价值袋、自己的帽子、王冠以及与自己的头相关的一切，而女人却一点也不在乎被斩首（或阉割）的恐惧，她没有男性的胆量，而是冒险进入匿名状态，她可以融入其中，而不会因为自己是一个给予者而毁灭自己（“笑声”，883）。

On the one hand she has constituted herself necessarily as that person capable of losing a part of herself without losing integrity. But secretly, silently, deep down inside, she grows and multiplies, for, on the other hand, she knows far more about living and about the relation between the economy of the drives and management of the ego than any man. Unlike man, who holds so dearly to his title and his titles, his pouches of value, his cap, crown, and everything connected with his head, women couldn’t care less about the fear of decapitation (or castration), adventuring, without a masculine temerity, into anonymity, which she can merge with, without annihilating herself because she is a giver (“The Laugh,” 883).

在影片结尾，随着革命的临近，我们看到了玛丽·安托瓦内特性格的全面发展。她现在已经生下了两个男继承人，其中一人在幼年时去世。国王和王后的亲信劝他们离开巴黎，否则将冒着生命危险和家人的危险。但尽管王后非常保护她的孩子，但她一再坚称，她应该留在丈夫身边，同时派遣她的追随者和顾问前往该国。当暴徒终于到来时，她首先想到的是保护孩子们。在离开凡尔赛宫时，她和国王表现出一种我们以前从未见过的安静尊严。影片在他们去世前结束。我们看到的不是他们试图逃跑和随后被捕的过程，而是凡尔赛宫的废墟，这表明玛丽·安托瓦内特的个人发展，就像凡尔赛宫的废墟一样，是被忽视的历史碎片之一。玛丽·安托瓦内特最大的变化是由母亲身份产生的，因为最终她不仅保护了她的孩子和扈从，还保护了国王。西苏斯对这种母性行为的解释如下：

Near the end of the film, as the revolution approaches, we see the full development of Marie Antoinette’s personality. She has now produced two male heirs, one of whom dies in early childhood. Those close to the King and Queen advise them to leave Paris or risk their lives and those of their family. But although deeply protective of her children, the Queen repeatedly asserts that her place is to remain beside her husband while sending her followers and advisers to the country. When the mob finally arrives, her first thought is to protect the children. And in leaving Versailles she and the King display a quiet dignity that we have not seen in them before. The film ends before their death. Instead of showing their attempted escape and subsequent capture, we see the ruins of Versailles, suggesting that the personal development of Marie Antoinette, like the ruins of Versailles, is one of the neglected shards of history. The greatest change in Marie Antoinette is produced by motherhood, for in the end she is protecting not only her children and her retinue but also the King. Cixous explains this kind of motherly behavior as follows:

女人身上总是或多或少地体现着母亲的特质：她让一切变得美好，她滋养孩子，她抵制分离，她的力量不容阻挡，她能打破常规（《西苏便携式文本》，34）。

In women there is always more or less of the mother who makes everything alright, who nourishes, and who stands up against separation, a force that will not be put off and will knock the wind out of codes (Portable Cixous, 34).

玛丽·安托瓦内特从一位天真的奥地利贵族成长为一位王后和一位母亲，她利用宫廷特权地位逃避王后责任而被处决的经历，与凡尔赛宫的愚蠢惯例一样荒唐可笑。但这部电影旨在向我们展示，这位年轻女子在凡尔赛宫期间的经历是一种独特的女性内在成长，大多数男性无法理解，因为它与男性的成长完全不同。例如，玛丽·安托瓦内特出现在阳台上，面对着人群，低下头，让他们沉默不语，被他们无法理解的东西感动。索菲亚·科波拉向我们展示了历史学家忽视了女性成长的这一历史时刻，而西苏解释说，女性的这种历史时刻之所以被忽视，是因为它们涉及女性的性欲：

The personal development of Marie Antoinette from a naïve Austrian aristocrat into a Queen and a mother makes her execution for using her privileged position at court to evade responsibility as Queen as farcical as the inane conventions at Versailles. But the film is designed to show us that what happens to this young woman during her time at Versailles is a distinctly feminine kind of inner growth that most males cannot understand because it is radically different in kind from that of men. Consider, for example, the moment when Marie Antoinette appears on the balcony before the mob and bows her head, reducing them to silence, moved by something they cannot comprehend. Sofia Coppola shows us that this historical moment of coming into womanhood has been neglected by historians, and Cixous explains that such female historical moments are neglected because they involve the female libido:

我们将重新思考女性，从她身体的每一种形态和每个时期开始。[…] 由于她驱动力的“经济性”是惊人的，她不能不抓住机会直接或间接地改变所有基于男性节俭的交换体系。她的性欲将产生比一些人想象的更为激进的政治和社会变革影响（Portable Cixous，34）。

We will rethink womankind beginning with every form and every period of her body. […] Because the “economy” of her drives is prodigious, she cannot fail in seizing the occasion to speak to transform directly and indirectly all systems of exchange based on masculine thrift. Her libido will produce far more radical effects of political and social change than some might like to think (Portable Cixous, 34).

我们记得，在这部电影中，性欲成为一个问题，当时一位朝臣被迫向年轻的国王解释如何生孩子，这是国王和臣民成熟过程中的一个关键因素。王后。事实上，只有在性交完成后，国王和王后才会形成一种纽带，使他们能够相互尊重和影响。在此之前，他们的关系纯粹是传统的，另一种空洞的仪式。但对性欲在社会和政治生活中的作用的更详细考察是在 2001 年上映的《红磨坊》，由巴兹·鲁尔曼执导、制作和联合编剧，妮可·基德曼饰演萨汀。

We recall that the libido became an issue in this film when a courtier was obliged to make clear to the young King how one goes about making babies, a key factor in the process of maturation of both the King and the Queen. Indeed only after sexual congress has been completed do the King and Queen form a bond that permits them to respect and influence one another. Prior to that moment, their relationship was purely conventional, another hollow ritual. But a far more detailed examination of the function of libido in the social and political fabric of life is seen in “Moulin Rouge,” released in 2001, directed, produced and co-written by Baz Luhrmann and starring Nicole Kidman as Satine.

女性性欲：《红磨坊》

Female libido: “Moulin Rouge”

电影《红磨坊》是西苏对女性个人发展观念的另一个例证。电影的结尾再次强调了女主角的变化。我们还记得，莎蒂娜是一位想成为女演员的交际花/歌剧明星。她相信，如果她满足了歌剧赞助人公爵的愿望，他就会支持她的野心。但她爱上了诗人/词曲作家克里斯蒂安，但他没有钱，因此无法发展自己的事业。歌剧导演齐德勒鼓励莎蒂娜取悦公爵，这样他就会继续赞助演出。

Another illustration of Cixous’s conception of the personal development of the female can be seen in the film “Moulin Rouge.” Again, the conclusion of the movie highlights the change in the heroine. It will be recalled that Satine is the courtesan/opera star who wishes to be an actress. She believes that the Duke, the sponsor of the opera, will support her ambition if she satisfies his desires. But she falls in love with Christian, the poet/songwriter, who has no money and cannot therefore advance her career. Zidler, the director of the opera, encourages Satine to please the Duke so that he will continue to sponsor the show.

在电影的最后高潮部分，歌剧上演时，克里斯蒂安陷入绝望，因为他知道莎蒂娜同意与公爵共度一夜。但尽管莎蒂娜知道自己的职业生涯将被毁掉，但当她从公爵公寓的窗户看到克里斯蒂安时，她决定不背叛她心爱的人。她为什么会被诗人吸引？因为“诗人”，西苏斯坚持认为，不同于小说家，他们不是“表象主义的盟友。因为诗歌需要通过潜意识获得力量，因为潜意识，另一个无限的国度，是被压抑者得以生存的地方：女人，或者用霍夫曼的话来说，是仙女”（《笑声》，884）。西苏斯的观点在电影中通过音乐来表达，因为歌曲本身就是一种诗歌，而音乐剧的类型为我们准备了一个结局，表明这场演出的明星将不是一个普通的妓女。音乐是经济现实领域和“仙女”领域之间的媒介。西苏解释了为什么“仙女”对女性很重要：

In the final climactic episode of the movie, when the opera is being performed, Christian is in despair, knowing that Satine has agreed to spend the night with the Duke. But in spite of the fact that Satine knows her career will be ruined, she decides, upon seeing Christian from the window of the Duke’s apartment, not to betray her beloved. Why is she drawn to the poet? Because “the poets,” Cixous insists, differ from the novelists in not being “allies of representationalism. Because poetry involves gaining strength through the unconscious and because the unconscious, that other limitless country, is the place where the repressed manages to survive: women, or as Hoffmann would say, fairies” (“The Laugh,” 884). Cixous’s point is made in the movie by way of music, since the songs are themselves a kind of poetry, and the genre of the musical prepares us for a dénouement indicating that the star of the show will turn out not to be a common prostitute. Music mediates between the realm of economic reality and that of the “fairies.” Cixous explains why the “fairies” are important to women:

是的，我意识到，在谈论仙女时，我不那么害怕了。我感觉到，在仙女的帮助下，我可以说出和做任何事，尤其是我所相信和思考的一切，而不用担心“我所想”的东西一说出来，就会立即被理智的猛烈打击所摧毁，我的理智不一定是他的理智，或者被否认（《西苏传》，48）。

Yes I realize that in talking of a fairy, I am a bit less afraid. I sense that with the help of a fairy I can say and do whatever comes, and above all whatever I believe and thus think without worrying that what “I think”, as soon as it is said, will instantly be annihilated by a great blow of reason, of my reason, not necessarily his reason, or denial (Portable Cixous, 48).

但是，尽管仙女帮助女性表达自己，但问题依然存在，她们如何与居住在理性国度的男性——力量之源——进行交流。在电影中，这个问题出现在公爵威胁要停止音乐的时候，音乐是仙女国度的电影版。公爵坚持要改变结局，这样诗人/画家就不会赢得女主角。因此，最后，公爵和克里斯蒂安之间的竞争戏剧性地闯入了歌剧本身。公爵派了一名刺客去追克里斯蒂安，但舞台上的演员阻止他射杀克里斯蒂安，然后公爵本人试图杀死他，却被歌剧导演齐德勒阻止了，因为“演出必须继续”。没有什么可以阻止人类对诗意想象和爱情世界的深切渴望。克里斯蒂安赢得了莎蒂娜，但后来她死在他的怀里，最终死于肺结核，我们已经知道这件事，但一直对这两个对手保密

But although the fairies help women express themselves, the problem remains how do they communicate with men, the source of power, who dwell in the land of reason. In the film this problem arises when the Duke threatens to stop the music, the cinematic equivalent of the land of the fairies. The Duke insists that the end be changed so that the poet/painter does not win the heroine. And so, in the end, the drama of the rivalry between the Duke and Christian intrudes into the opera itself. The Duke sends an assassin after Christian, but the actors on stage prevent him from shooting Christian, and then the Duke himself tries to kill him, only to be prevented by Zidler, the opera director, because “the show must go on.” Nothing can stop the deep human desire for the world of poetic imagining and love. Christian wins Satine, but then she dies in his arms, finally succumbing to the consumption that we have known about but that has been kept a secret from the two rivals

影片的结局很复杂。萨蒂娜和克里斯蒂安赢了，因为他们希望的歌剧结局得以实现。然而，萨蒂娜的死阻止了他们自己希望的结局。但正如西苏斯警告我们的那样，死亡始终是女性力比多力量的一部分。萨蒂娜以话语而非现实的形式突破了公爵的经济、理性权力。观看歌剧的人无疑认为她的死是演出的一部分。因此，歌剧、诗意的音乐传达了女性力比多的力量，因为萨蒂娜战胜了公爵，保持了诗人/音乐家赢得女主角的结局。由于观众的反应是热烈的掌声，公爵可能会继续投资演出，因为它似乎是一个赚钱的机会。因此，经济仍然处于控制之中，这种压力无疑导致了萨蒂娜的死亡。我们不禁要问，女性力比多如何影响权力结构的性质，改变既得利益，特别是如果男性经济力量仍然存在的话？

The conclusion of the film is complex. Satine and Christian win in that the conclusion they want for the opera is realized. Nevertheless, Satine’s death prevents the resolution they wished for themselves. But death, as Cixous warns us, is always a part of the power of the female libido. Satine breaks through the economic, rational power of the Duke in the form of discourse, not reality. Those viewing the opera doubtless believe that her death is a part of the show. Thus the opera, poetic music, communicates the power of the female libido in that Satine has prevailed against the Duke, keeping the end in which the poet/musician wins the heroine. And since the audience response is wild applause, the Duke may keep his investment in the show since it appears to be a moneymaker. Thus economics remains in control, the pressure of which undoubtedly contributed to the death of Satine. How, we are left to wonder, can feminine libido affect the nature of the power structure, change the establishment, particularly if male economic forces remain in place?

《红磨坊》是朝着这个目标迈出的重要一步，歌剧中的歌剧将一名妓女塑造成了悲剧女主角。传统的道德等级制度被女性的性欲所解构；改变男性权力结构的第一步是改变男性的思维方式。通过考虑西苏的创作作品与她批判立场的关系，可以更好地理解这里体现的西苏的思想。在职业生涯早期，西苏重新评估了俄狄浦斯神话。《俄狄浦斯之名》是一部关于伊俄卡斯忒和俄狄浦斯爱情的悲剧。显然，乱伦禁忌当然决定了他们的命运，但对他们爱情的强度影响不大：

One important step toward this end is achieved in “Moulin Rouge” when the opera within an opera creates a tragic heroine out of a courtesan. The traditional moral hierarchy is deconstructed by way of female libido; the first step in changing the male power structure is altering how men think. The idea of Cixous that is here manifested can be better understood by considering how her creative work relates to her critical position. Early in her career, Cixous reevaluated the Oedipus myth. “The Name of Oedipus” is a tragedy about the love of Jocasta and Oedipus. Clearly, the incest taboo that of course seals their fate has little effect upon the intensity of their love:

乔卡斯塔生命打开了，它在我心中，在我面前，它扩展了。它是我们。微风吹乱了我的头发。这是生命的气息。

Jocasta Life opens up, it is within me, it is before me, it expands. And it is us. A breeze ruffles my hair. It is the breath of life.

俄狄浦斯为什么？为什么？为什么你是女人？你怎么是女人？你必须把她的一切都给我。

Oedipus Why? Why? Why are you woman? How are you woman? You must give me the whole of her everything.

（西苏便携式，230 ）

(Portable Cixous, 230)

在索福克勒斯的版本中，伊俄卡斯忒和俄狄浦斯的婚姻被视为前任王后和新国王之间的政治联盟，而本剧中我们看到的是一场激情四射的爱情联姻，没有道德上的遗憾，也没有提到乱伦或欺骗众神。相反，悲剧涉及女性性欲的消亡，伊俄卡斯忒恰如其分地只希望爱情能保护她们：

Unlike Sophocles’ version in which the marriage of Jocasta and Oedipus is taken to be a political alliance between the former Queen and the new King, here we have a passionate love match with no moral regrets, no mention of incest or the deception of the gods. Rather the tragedy concerns the demise of the female libido and, appropriately, Jocasta only wishes that love could protect them:

伊俄卡斯特我非常确定。今天早晨一阵烈风把我吹醒了。

Jocasta I was absolutely sure. This morning a burning wind wakes me.

我的床着火了

My bed goes up in flames

时间！时间已着火。

Time! Time has caught fire.

向你扑去，我的血液在燃烧。

Leaping toward you my blood is ablaze.

我冲—

I dash—

地面塌陷；爱无法保护我们。

The ground gives way; love does not protect us.

（西苏便携式，235 ）

(Portable Cixous, 235)

伊俄卡斯忒炽热的爱打破了乱伦的禁忌；她的激情吞噬了俄狄浦斯，改变了他的内心，改变了他看待世界的方式。要了解这个过程如何真正改变世界，我们来看看《玫瑰街》和西苏的一部喜剧。

Jocasta’s fiery love breaks through the incest taboo; her passion consumes Oedipus, altering his inner being, the way he sees the world. To understand how this process actually changes the world we turn to “Rosenstrasse” and a comic drama by Cixous.

改变世界：“玫瑰街”

Changing the world: “Rosenstrasse”

《玫瑰街》于 2003 年上映，由玛格丽特·冯·特罗塔执导，玛利亚·施拉德和卡佳·里曼主演。《玫瑰街》是故事中的故事。影片开头，露丝·温斯坦在纽约哀悼丈夫的去世。尽管她的家庭并不是特别正统，但露丝还是决定参加犹太教的 Shiva 仪式，即家人和亲密的朋友坐在地板上的垫子上，遮住所有镜子，30 天内不刮胡子、不接电话、不做日常工作。在此期间，露丝的女儿汉娜的未婚夫从南美赶来参加哀悼，但露丝命令他离开，因为他不是犹太人。影片结尾，我们回到了这间纽约公寓，汉娜和未婚夫在这里结婚，并得到了母亲的祝福。

Released in 2003, “Rosenstrasse” was directed by Margarethe von Trotta, and starred Maria Schrader and Katja Riemann. “Rosenstrasse” is a story within a story. In the beginning Ruth Weinstein is mourning the death of her husband in New York City. Although the family is not particularly orthodox, Ruth decides to sit Shiva, a Jewish ritual in which the family and close friends sit on cushions on the floor, cover all mirrors, do not shave, answer the phone, or carry out their usual tasks for 30 days. During this period, the fiancé of Hannah, Ruth’s daughter, arrives from South America to join in the mourning, but Ruth orders him to leave because he is not Jewish. At the end of the film we return to this New York apartment where Hannah and her fiancé are married and receive the blessing of her mother.

故事中的故事讲述了汉娜前往柏林了解母亲的过去，因为她拒绝谈论她在二战期间的青春岁月。汉娜发现，当八岁的露丝被纳粹夺走母亲时，她家族中最后一位幸存的成员，一位名叫莱娜的基督徒妇女，把她带回家照顾了三年，直到战争结束。汉娜假装是一名记者，在柏林找到了这位妇女，听她讲述了战争的故事，这就是电影中的故事。从这个内心故事中可以清楚地看出，犹太人和非犹太人的二分法现在似乎已经对露丝的这种控制其实是另一个问题的掩饰。露丝失去了母亲，对她的德国“雅利安”保护者莉娜产生了深厚的感情，但当战后她被送到美国的姨妈家时，她感到被这位第二位母亲背叛了。露丝认为，作为一名犹太人，她被信奉基督教的母亲抛弃了。然而，汉娜发现莉娜放走露丝只是因为她认为这对孩子更好。事实上，莉娜故意不表达对露丝失去的深切遗憾，以便让孩子更容易接受这一分手。事实上，莉娜一直珍藏着露丝童年的一些纪念品；汉娜带着莉娜的一枚戒指回到纽约，这枚戒指可以给孩子带来任何想要的东西。为了感谢女儿重新发现和重新诠释她的过去，露丝把戒指送给了汉娜。在接下来的婚礼上，露丝以我们在故事内部已经看到过的同样的祝福欢迎她的基督徒女婿加入这个家庭；当莱娜的犹太未婚夫向父母宣布他要娶她的计划时，他的母亲亲吻了莱娜，说了同样的话。因此，框架提出了一个严肃的问题。在狂热、系统的反犹太主义时期，德国的一些犹太人和一些基督徒是如何建立起桥梁的？这可能是历史上最糟糕的时期，当然也是德国经历过的最糟糕的时期。

The story within the story concerns Hannah’s trip to Berlin to find out about the past of her mother, since she refuses to talk about her youth during World War II. Hannah discovers that when Ruth, aged eight, was deprived by the Nazis of her mother, the last surviving member of her family, a Christian woman named Lena, took her home and looked after her for three years until the war ended. Pretending to be a journalist, Hannah finds this woman in Berlin and hears her story about the war, which is the story-within-the-story of the film. What becomes clear from this inner tale is that the Jew–gentile dichotomy that seems now to have such a hold on Ruth is a mask for an entirely different problem. Having lost her mother, Ruth becomes deeply attached to Lena, her German “Aryan” protectress, but then feels betrayed by this second mother when, after the war, she is sent to her aunt in the United States. Ruth believed that as a Jewess she was abandoned by her Christian mother. Hannah, however, discovers that Lena only let Ruth go because she thought it was better for the child. Indeed, Lena deliberately refrained from expressing her deep regret at the loss of Ruth in order to make the break easier for the child. In fact, Lena has always cherished some of Ruth’s childhood keepsakes; Hannah returns to New York with a ring from Lena, which was to bring whatever a child wished. To thank her daughter for rediscovering and reinterpreting her past, Ruth gives the ring to Hannah. At the wedding that follows, Ruth welcomes her Christian son-in-law into the family with the same blessing that we have already witnessed in the inner story; when Lena’s Jewish fiancé announced to his parents his plan to marry her, his mother kissed Lena uttering the same words. The framing device thus raises a serious question. How was a bridge formed between some Jews and some Christians in Germany during the period of rabid, systematic anti-semitism, probably the worst in all history and certainly the worst ever experienced in Germany?

为了回答这个问题，我转向了故事的内在。西苏斯对《哈姆雷特》的戏仿或许有助于我们为电影的这一部分做好准备。片名《蒙眼的未婚妻或阿梅莱特》，这里选择的场景涉及格特鲁德（这里称为格鲁莎）和哈姆雷特（阿梅莱特）之间的关系。正如喜剧的名字所暗示的那样，重点不是哈姆雷特和俄狄浦斯情结，也不是格特鲁德在针对老哈姆雷特的阴谋中所涉足的领域。相反，西苏斯关注的是母子俩的日常生活。这一特定场景的重点是“蒙眼的未婚妻”雷金，即奥菲莉亚的对应者，与阿梅莱特保持着某种关系。

To answer this question I turn to the inner story. Cixous’s parody of “Hamlet” may help prepare us for this part of the film. Entitled “The Blindfolded Fiancée or Amelait,” the scene here selected concerns the relationship between Gertrude (here called Gerutha) and Hamlet (Amelait). As the comical names suggest, the focus is not a consideration of Hamlet and the Oedipus complex or of Gertrude’s implication in the plot against the elder Hamlet. Instead, Cixous focuses upon the quotidian life of mother and son. The donnée of this particular scene is that the “blindfolded fiancée,” Reguine, the Ophelia counterpart, maintains some relationship with Amelait.

Amelait你会来参加我们的婚礼吗？

Amelait Will you come to our wedding?

Gerutha在哪里？什么时候？事情已经发展到这个地步了，你却什么都没告诉我？

Gerutha Where? When? It’s gone this far and you haven’t said a thing to me?

阿梅莱特好吧，那我们就不谈这个了。我什么也没说。

Amelait All right, then. We won’t talk about it any more. I said nothing.

Gerutha这又是一个笑话吗？

Gerutha Is this another joke?

Amelait你的婚礼在哪里？什么时候？我们可以办一场双人婚礼，一个四人帐篷。这是个好主意，可以省点钱。你觉得呢？

Amelait And your wedding: Where? When? We could have a double wedding, a canopy for four. That’s an idea, it would save some money. What do you think?

Gerutha这些笑话很无品味——自从青春期开始。

Gerutha These jokes in bad taste—ever since puberty.

Amelait一切都纠缠在一起，好东西尝起来却很糟糕，悲剧很搞笑，死亡令人难以忍受。再给我一些肉酱。希望你没有在里面下毒吧？因为我想给她一些。

Amelait Everything is tangled up, what’s good tastes bad, tragedy is hilarious, death is holding its sides. Give me some more of the paté. You didn’t poison it, I hope? Because I want to give her some.

（《西苏便携式计算机》 ，273 ）

(Portable Cixous, 273)

这一幕的喜剧/悲剧模仿涉及西苏的一个重要概念。众所周知，悲剧深深地影响着哈姆雷特和格特鲁德，在悲剧中，我们看到了平凡的喜剧时刻，他们一起喝茶。尽管他们之间存在根深蒂固的差异，这些差异很快就会导致两人的死亡，但凭借西苏的巧妙手法，他们向我们展示了一种谨慎的感情，一种我们在任何家庭餐桌上都能看到的母子之间的纽带。是的，差异是深刻的差异。但这些差异是相互影响的。性欲一直是哈姆雷特和格特鲁德之间的问题，但在这里，它以普通的家庭感情/关系的形式出现。我想说，正是这种家庭关系改变了“玫瑰街”内部故事的历史。这里的问题是，一群“雅利安”妻子发现她们的犹太丈夫被关押在罗森大街的一栋建筑里，重要的是要记住，影片的这一部分记录了历史事件。

The comic/tragic parody of this scene involves an important concept for Cixous. In the midst of tragedy that, as we know, intimately affects both Hamlet and Gertrude, we have a mundane comic moment, sharing a cup of tea. In spite of deep-seated differences between them, differences that will shortly result in the death of both, they show us, by virtue of Cixous’s deft touch, a certain wary affection, a bond between mother and son that we would expect to see at any family table. Differences, yes, deep differences. But differences that touch upon one another. Libido has always been the issue with Hamlet and Gertrude, but here it takes the form of ordinary family affection/connection. I want to suggest that it is precisely this sort of family relationship that changes history in the inner story of “Rosenstrasse.” The problem here is that a group of “Aryan” wives have discovered that their Jewish husbands are being kept in a building on Rosenstrasse, and it is important to keep in mind that this part of the film documents an historical occurrence.

妇女们开始各自尝试让丈夫获释，她们与纳粹军官交谈，并争辩说与雅利安人结婚的犹太人不应被视为犹太人。在她们试图通过官僚机构释放丈夫的尝试失败后，这些妇女采取了更传统的女性策略。一位妻子向她的贵族父亲求助，她因嫁给犹太人而剥夺了她的继承权，但他拒绝了。然后她尝试发生性关系，与一名军官在床上度过一夜，她希望这名军官能帮助她丈夫获释。这也失败了。这些妇女逐渐意识到传统的女性诡计是徒劳的，所以她们最终一起来到关押丈夫的大楼外。最终出现的女性团结的第一个迹象是，妇女们用诡计来查明她们的丈夫是否在里面，因为没有向妻子们提供有关他们的任何信息。一位妻子向莱娜解释说，她告诉警卫，她丈夫有她家的钥匙，但警卫从她丈夫那里得到的回答表明他还活着，而且在楼里。莱娜随后用同样的诡计来证明她的配给卡的存在，以确认她丈夫的存在。

The women begin by trying individually to bring about the release of their husbands, speaking to Nazi officers and arguing that Jews married to Aryans are not to be treated as Jews. Having failed in their attempts to free their men by way of the bureaucracy, the women resort to more traditional female tactics. One wife begs for help from her aristocratic father who has disinherited her for marrying a Jew, but he refuses. Then she tries sex, spending a night in bed with an officer whom she hopes will effect her husband’s release. That also fails. Gradually the women learn that traditional female wiles are futile, and so they end up together outside the building where their husbands are held captive. The first indication of the female solidarity that eventually ensues is the ruse the women use to find out if their husbands are inside, since no information about them has been given to the wives. One wife explains to Lena that she told the guard her husband had her house key: the reply the guard conveys from her husband indicates that he is alive and in the building. Lena then uses the same ruse with regard to her ration card to confirm the presence of her husband.

这里发生了两个关键事件。首先，当她们的男人即将被驱逐到集中营时，她们指责警卫是“杀人犯”。其次，当一队机枪手被派去驱散或用子弹射杀妇女时，她们坚守阵地，只是直视枪手。在这两种情况下，妇女们都以既不侵略也不消极的态度回应了男性的侵略。首先，她们指责男人不如男人，是杀人犯，是杀害那些对她们没有做过任何事的人的凶手。其次，她们拒绝退缩，几乎敢于让士兵伤害或杀死与她们妻子非常相似的雅利安妇女。而这一策略奇迹般地赢得了她们丈夫的释放。西苏解释了这种女性策略：

Here two key events occur. First, when it appears that their men are about to be deported to concentration camps they accuse the guards of being “murderers.” Second, when a squad of machine-gunners is sent in to disperse or mow down the women with bullets, they stand their ground, simply looking directly at the gunners. In both instances, the women have replied to male aggression with neither aggression nor passivity. First they accuse the men of being less than men, namely murderers, killers of those who have done nothing to them. Second, they refuse to back down, almost daring the soldiers to harm or kill Aryan women very like their own wives. And this strategy miraculously wins the release of their husbands. Cixous explains this female kind of tactics:

目的也不是占有“男人”的工具、概念、地位，或嫉妒他们的主宰地位。仅仅因为存在认同的风险并不意味着我们会屈服。让我们把事情留给战士，留给男性对如何主宰事物运作方式的痴迷——知道“它是如何运作的”才能“让它运作”。对我们来说，目的不是占有，以便内化或操纵，而是冲过去并“飞翔”（“笑声”，882）。

Nor is the point to appropriate “men’s” instruments, their concepts, their places, or to begrudge them their position of mastery. Just because there is a risk of identification doesn’t mean that we will succumb. Let’s leave it to the warriors, to masculine obsession with how to dominate the way things work—knowing “how it works” to “make it work.” For us the point is not to take possession, in order to internalize or manipulate, but rather to dash through and to “fly” (“The Laugh,” 882).

女人没有抵抗，也没有威胁男人。她们放弃了支配策略。她们设法反抗，但又不暗示男人会被取代或以任何方式失去权力，而这正是男人的执念。她们在战场上空飞行。而飞行，对西苏来说，是女性的特征：“飞行是女人的姿态。用语言飞行，并让它飞起来。我们都学会了飞行的艺术和它的众多技巧；几个世纪以来，我们只能通过飞行来占有任何东西。我们生活在飞行中，偷偷溜走，在需要的时候找到狭窄的通道和隐藏的交叉点”（《笑声》，882）。

The women offer no resistance; nor do they threaten the men. The tactics of mastery are abandoned. They manage to oppose without suggesting that the men are to be displaced or in any way to lose their power, a male obsession. They fly above the battlefield. And flying, for Cixous, is a female characteristic: “Flying is woman’s gesture. Flying in language and making it fly. We have all learned the art of flying and its numerous techniques; for centuries we have been able to possess anything only by flying. We’ve lived in flight, stealing away, finding, when desired, narrow passageways, hidden crossovers” (“The Laugh,” 882).

在这种情况下，狭窄的通道似乎是女人们坚定但不尖锐的提醒，她们与士兵的妻子、母亲和姐妹没有什么不同。男性主宰地位因此被解构。而促使这些女性忍受寒冷的夜晚等待、勇敢面对德国士兵、智胜警卫的根本动力是家庭感情，我们在阿梅莱特和格鲁莎之间看到的那种纽带，也是促使莉娜收养露丝的力量。而导致释放犹太丈夫的力量——正如电影所表明的那样，这是一个历史事实——也是改变露丝思维方式的力量。莉娜深爱着她，非常想念她，而不是一个被雅利安第二位母亲抛弃的年轻犹太女子。因此，这部电影表明，女性性欲通过改变人们的思维方式来影响历史；我们只能假设纳粹释放这些男人是因为他们不再把他们看作犹太人，而是雅利安人的丈夫。

In this instance the narrow passageway seems to be the firm but not shrill reminder by the women that they are no different from the soldiers’ wives, mothers, and sisters. Male mastery is thus deconstructed. And the underlying drive that enabled these women to endure the cold nights waiting, to stand up to the German soldiers, and to outwit the guards is family affection, that same bond we saw between Amelait and Gerutha, and that here led Lena to adopt Ruth. And the power that resulted in the release of the Jewish husbands—a historical fact, as the film makes plain—is also the force that changes Ruth’s way of thinking. Instead of a young Jewess being abandoned by an Aryan second mother, she is deeply loved and sorely missed by Lena. Thus, the film suggests that female libido affects history by changing how people think; we are left to assume that the Nazis released the men because they ceased to think of them as Jews but as husbands of Aryans.

尽管如此，在影片的结尾，我们还是想知道这些犹太丈夫最终是否被流放了。虽然现在人们普遍认为这些人确实在战争中幸存了下来，但影片中并不清楚他们是只是获得了暂时的缓刑还是真的活了下来。也许电影制片人希望重现当时的情况，当时没有一个妻子或丈夫知道纳粹对他们的未来计划是什么。但即使这种缓刑只是暂时的，也不会减损这些女性的成就。毕竟，让一个人免于被关进集中营一天是数百万人所无法做到的。无论如何，纳粹的权力结构显然只是暂时受到这些勇敢女性的影响。我们现在必须问，女性的性欲如何才能带来永久性的改变？

Nonetheless, at the end of this film we are left to wonder whether or not these Jewish husbands were eventually transported. Although it is now generally assumed that these men did survive the war, it is not clear in the film whether they were merely given a temporary reprieve or did actually survive. Perhaps the filmmakers wished to reproduce the situation at the time when none of the wives or husbands would have known what were the Nazis’ future plans for them. But even if the respite were only momentary, that would not detract from the achievement of the women. After all, to prevent one person being in a concentration camp for a single day was more than millions of people could achieve. In any event, the Nazi power structure was clearly only momentarily affected by these courageous women. How, we now must ask, can the female libido effect a permanent change?

女性的差异与变化：《穿普拉达的恶魔》

Female difference and change: “The Devil Wears Prada”

《穿普拉达的恶魔》于 2006 年上映，由大卫·弗兰科尔执导，梅丽尔·斯特里普饰演米兰达·普里斯特利，安妮·海瑟薇饰演安迪·萨克斯。这部电影表明，当女性成为权力结构的一部分时，女性的替代品就被创造出来了。在《穿普拉达的恶魔》中，米兰达·普里斯特利对工作和事业的投入与任何男人一样多，而且毫无疑问，她是一个比大多数男人更严厉、更苛刻的老板。毫不奇怪，她在家庭生活中付出了代价，花很少时间陪伴孩子，最终与丈夫离婚。然而，她要求她的新助理追随她的脚步，这再次不出所料地导致安迪·萨克斯疏远了她的搭档。但最终安迪选择不遵循米兰达的职业模式。她回到她的搭档身边，申请了一份不需要全身心投入的工作。令人惊讶的是，米兰达并不恨她，也不试图毁掉她的职业生涯。相反，她给了安迪一个很好的评价，并在最后克制地点头，表示她理解安迪的决定，这与米兰达为自己做出的选择以及她对安迪的期望完全相反。简而言之，米兰达有能力扼杀安迪的事业，但她决定帮助她而不是伤害她。西苏斯鼓励女性对差异的宽容：

Released in 2006 and directed by David Frankel, “The Devil Wears Prada” stars Meryl Streep as Miranda Priestly and Anne Hathaway as Andy Sachs. This film demonstrates that when women become a part of the power structure, female alternatives are created. In “The Devil Wears Prada,” Miranda Priestly is as devoted to her job and career as any man, and is undoubtedly a tougher and more demanding boss than most men. Not surprisingly, she pays a price in her family life, spending little time with her children and eventually being divorced by her husband. Yet she demands that her new assistant follow in her footsteps, which, again predictably, results in Andy Sachs alienating her partner. But in the end Andy chooses not to follow the career pattern of Miranda. She turns back to her partner and applies for a job that does not require a total life commitment. Surprisingly, Miranda does not hate her or try to ruin her career. On the contrary, she gives Andy a good reference and, in her final restrained nod, shows her understanding of Andy’s decision, the very opposite of Miranda’s choice for herself and of what she wanted for Andy. In short, Miranda had the power to stifle Andy’s career, but decided to help rather than hurt her. Cixous encourages the female tolerance of difference:

我们被重新拼凑到那根带我们回到过去的绳子上……打破这个圈子；不要停留在精神分析的封闭中。环顾四周。然后切入。如果我们是一个大军，那是因为解放战争至今只取得了微小的突破。但女性正蜂拥而至。我见过她们，她们既不会被欺骗也不会顾家，她们不会害怕作为女性的风险，她们不会害怕任何风险、任何欲望、任何尚未开发的空间，无论是在她们自己、他人还是其他任何地方。她们不迷恋，她们不否认，她们不恨。她们观察，她们接近，她们试图看到另一个女人、孩子、情人——不是为了加强她们自己的自恋或证实主人的坚固或软弱，而是为了让爱变得更好，去发明（“笑声”，885）。

We are pieced back to the string which leads back […] Break out of the circle; don’t remain within the psychoanalytic closure. Take a look round. Then cut through. And if we are legion, it is because the war of liberation has only as yet made a tiny breakthrough. But women are thronging to it. I’ve seen them, those who will be neither dupe nor domestic, those who will not fear the risk of being a woman, who will not fear any risk, any desire, any space still unexploited in themselves, among themselves or others or anywhere else. They do not fetishize, they do not deny, they do not hate. They observe, they approach, they try to see the other woman, the child, the lover—not to strengthen their own narcissism or verify the solidity or weakness of the master, but to make love better, to invent (“The Laugh,” 885).

《穿普拉达的恶魔》的结尾表明，米兰达作为时尚编辑的成功远远超过该行业中的大多数男性，因为她认识到自己的职业是建立在自由选择的基础上的，女性更喜欢她的品牌或风格。而选择权只有在有可能选择另一个品牌时才真正存在，或者在安迪·萨克斯的例子中，另一种职业。梅丽尔·斯特里普对米兰达的精彩演绎表明，她独特的女性力量在于能够心甘情愿地放弃权力，这是对掌控的另一种解构。西苏对这种女性力量的描述如下：

The end of “The Devil Wears Prada” suggests that Miranda’s success as fashion editor, well beyond that of most men in the profession, is her recognition that her business is based upon free choice, women preferring her brand or style. And choice is only really present when there is the possibility to select another brand, or, in the case of Andy Sachs, another kind of career. Meryl Streep’s brilliant portrayal of Miranda shows that her distinctly feminine power is in the ability to give up power willingly, another kind of deconstruction of mastery. Cixous describes this kind of female power as follows:

她爱的地方，所有旧的管理观念都被抛在身后。经过或多或少有意识的计算，她发现的不是她的和，而是她的差。在你以一种从未见过的方式看着我时，我就是你想要我成为的样子：在每一个瞬间。当我写作时，我们不知道我们能成为的一切都被写出来了，没有排除，没有规定，我们将成为的一切都呼唤着我们去不懈、陶醉、无法平息地寻找爱。我们彼此之间永远不会缺少什么（“笑声”，886）。

Wherever she loves all the old concepts of management are left behind. At the end of a more or less conscious computation, she finds not her sum but her differences. I am for you what you want me to be at the moment you look at me in a way you’ve never seen me before: at every instant. When I write, it’s everything that we don’t know we can be that is written out of me, without exclusions, without stipulation, and everything we will be calls us to the unflagging, intoxicating, unappeasable search for love. In one another we will never be lacking (“The Laugh,” 886).

米兰达用严厉的爱来教导安迪。首先，她毫不含糊地告诉安迪，她试图通过穿得朴素来逃避时尚是一种自欺欺人的行为。她解释说，安迪可能在一家折扣店以极低的价格买到的那件“天蓝色”毛衣最初是由她的公司以高昂的成本和极强的创造力制作的。最终，安迪意识到高级时装影响着所有女性，她不利用自己的地位听取身边时尚专家的意见来告诉她如何穿出自己的最佳优势是愚蠢的。

Miranda teaches Andy by way of tough love. First, she tells Andy in no uncertain terms that her attempt to avoid fashion by dressing down is a form of self-deception. She explains that the “cerulean” sweater that Andy probably bought at a discount store for a song was originally created by her company at a high cost and with intense creativity. Eventually, Andy comes to understand that high fashion affects all women and that she is foolish not to take advantage of her position to listen to the fashion experts around her who show her how to dress to her best advantage.

米兰达教给安迪的第二个教训是他们这个世界的残酷本质。当她提拔安迪担任艾米莉的职位时，她坚持要安迪告诉艾米莉，也就是说，要对她接受这个职位、取代她的同事的决定负责。安迪现在开始觉得这个世界不是她想要的，在这里她给她的老板上了一课。当两人一起在巴黎时，米兰达感动于安迪试图警告她可能会失去工作，她难得地放松了一会儿。她感谢安迪的忠诚，说安迪让她想起了年轻时的自己，并暗示她在商业上前途无量。当安迪回答说她不确定这是否是她想要的时，米兰达惊呼每个人都想要他们两个拥有的东西。此后不久，安迪辞职了，令她惊讶的是，新老板告诉了她米兰达在推荐信中说的话：尽管安迪令她非常失望，但如果不雇用她，那他就是傻瓜。

The second lesson Miranda teaches Andy is the cutthroat nature of their world. When she promotes Andy to Emily’s position, she insists that Andy tell Emily, that is, take responsibility for her decision to accept the position, to replace her colleague. Andy begins now to feel that this world is not where she wants to be, and here she teaches her boss a lesson. When the two are in Paris together, Miranda, moved that Andy tried to warn her about the possible loss of her job, lets her hair down for a rare moment. Acknowledging Andy’s loyalty, she says that Andy reminds her of herself when younger and suggests that she has a great future in the business. When Andy replies that she is not sure that is what she wants, Miranda exclaims that everybody wants what the two of them have. Shortly thereafter, Andy quits, and to her surprise her new boss tells her what Miranda said in her reference letter: although Andy was a great disappointment to her, he would be a fool not to hire her.

米兰达没有牺牲自己的高标准和权威，而是接受了安迪追求另一份职业的决定。她学会了接受差异，这对她做母亲大有裨益。西苏认为，女性的力量并不一定意味着顺从。穿普拉达的魔鬼与她的男同事是不同的老板。她对差异的接受不仅有利于与她共事的人，而且使她的产品对顾客更有吸引力，也就是说，迎合他们的选择。从这个意义上说，米兰达改变了那种能在权力结构顶端占上风的人。但米兰达的这种能力来自于西苏暗示，因为她是女性，在男性环境中仍保留着女性特质。男性如何才能学会以类似的方式行事？男性如何才能理解，还有另一种权力，即放弃权力，将权力交给他人？

Without compromising her high standards and her authority, Miranda has accepted Andy’s decision to pursue another career. She has learned to accept difference, something that will serve her well as a mother. Female power, Cixous asserts, does not necessitate conformity. The devil who wears Prada is a different kind of boss from her male counterpart. Her acceptance of difference not only serves those who work with her but also makes her product more attractive to her customers, that is, appealing to their choice. In that sense, Miranda has altered the kind of person who can prevail at the top of the power structure. But Miranda comes by this ability, Cixous implies, because she is a woman and maintains an element of her femininity in a male environment. How are men to learn to act in a similar fashion? How can a male come to understand that there is an alternative kind of power that involves giving power up, giving power to others?

女性爱情的学习过程：《社交网络》

The learning process of female love: “The Social Network”

最近的一部电影《社交网络》（2010）展示了男人如何从女人的爱中学习。这部电影由大卫·芬奇执导，杰西·艾森伯格主演。故事情节围绕 Facebook 创始人马克·扎克伯格展开，他试图与一位女性建立关系，但失败了。在第一幕中，即将成为他前女友的艾丽卡告诉马克，他是个“混蛋”，在最后一幕中，这位年轻的女律师退场时说：“你不是混蛋。你只是在努力成为混蛋。”在两次遭到拒绝后，马克转向电脑，先是发布了侮辱艾丽卡的帖子，后来，当律师拒绝了他的用餐邀请时，马克在 Facebook 上若有所思地凝视着艾丽卡的帖子。

A recent movie that suggests how men can learn from female love is “The Social Network” (2010), directed by David Fincher and starring Jesse Eisenberg. The plot is framed by Mark Zuckerberg, the founder of Facebook, failing miserably in an attempt to establish a relationship with a woman. In the first scene, Erica, his about to be ex-girlfriend, tells Mark that he is an “asshole,” and in the final scene the young female lawyer exits with the line “You are not an asshole. You just are trying very hard to be.” After both rebuffs, Mark turns to his computer, in the first instance posting insults against Erica, and later, after the lawyer turns down his invitation to a meal, gazing wistfully at Erica’s entry on Facebook.

在这两个与女人交往失败的场景之间，影片的主体部分是关于马克的成功，以及他在金钱充斥的计算机世界中的男性统治地位。这个领域由男性主导；如果有女性出现，也只是次要的、装饰品或奖杯。然而马克指出，Facebook 的最初目标是寻找性伴侣。在影片的结尾，拥有 250 亿美元的 Facebook 发明者独自坐在电脑前。男性统治的无爱世界令人悲伤和孤独。我们明白，影片结尾处女人对混蛋和试图成为混蛋的人的区分特别适合马克。为了成功完成他的项目，马克背叛了他最好的朋友，疏远了影片中那些似乎关心他的女人。然而，很明显，Facebook 背后的真正驱动力既不是金钱也不是声望，而是他无法找到爱情的沮丧。影片中的所有男人都利用女人进行性剥削，并利用企业家制度来赚钱。马克最好的朋友兼财务主管爱德华多虽然在女性面前更温文尔雅，但他与女友的关系却很糟糕。爱德华多不想进入 Facebook 的计算机世界，而是想通过广告掌握大笔金钱的金融世界。他与女友的最后危机恰好是这样一个情节：她烧毁了他为安抚女友而买的礼物。

The body of the film, between these two scenes of failure with women, is about Mark’s success, his male mastery in the big-money computer world. This realm is dominated by men; women, if present at all, are secondary, decorative ornaments or trophies. Yet Mark points out that the original goal of Facebook is to find a sexual partner. At the end of the film, the inventor of Facebook with his 25 billion dollars is alone at his computer. The loveless world of male mastery is sad and lonely. And we understand the distinction made by the woman at the end between an asshole and one trying to be an asshole as particularly apt for Mark. To succeed in his project Mark has betrayed his best friend and alienated the women in the film who seem to care about him. Yet it is clear that the real driving force behind Facebook is neither money nor prestige but frustration at his inability to find love. All the men in the film exploit women for sex and play the entrepreneurial system for money. Mark’s best friend and financial officer, Eduardo, although more suave with women, has a disastrous relationship with his girlfriend. Instead of the “cool” world of the computer aspect of Facebook, Eduardo wants to master the financial world of big money through advertising. The final crisis with his girlfriend is appropriately an episode when she burns a present he has bought to placate her.

但是，当爱德华多觉得女友的行为令人费解时，马克也同样不适应他“酷”的世界。他渴望女性的异性，但却通过男性主宰来追求它。这部电影给我们留下了这样的印象：Facebook 的名字恰如其分，只是一个幌子，虚拟现实是现实的拙劣替代品。Facebook 最好的时候，是一种超越现实的手段。计算机对人类来说就像是计算机，但马克却把自己囚禁在虚拟现实中。然而，影片的结尾却相当感人。这位年轻律师的最后评论自相矛盾。如果他不是一个混蛋，只是想要成为一个混蛋，那么这意味着如果他愿意，他可以尝试成为其他人。但这种改变需要一个过程，而不仅仅是一个需要掌握的概念，也许会涉及到马克的余生。如果是这样，那么它将是由一位足够关心他并向他提出这种可能性的女性发起的。

But while Eduardo finds his girlfriend’s behavior incomprehensible, Mark is equally ill at ease in his “cool” world. He longs for female otherness but goes after it by way of male mastery. The movie leaves us with the view that Facebook is aptly named, a mere façade, virtual reality as a poor substitute for reality. At its best, Facebook serves as a means of moving beyond the computer to people, but Mark has imprisoned himself in virtual reality. Yet the end of the film is quite poignant. The young lawyer’s final remark is paradoxical. If he is not an asshole, only trying to be one, the implication is that he could, if he wished, try to be something else. But that change involves a process, not simply a concept to be mastered, one that perhaps involves the rest of Mark’s life. If so, it will have been initiated by a female who cared enough to suggest it to him as a possibility.

西苏表明，放弃对男性统治的投入并寻求替代方案，我们的生活会更加丰富，我们不仅作为能够超越单一包罗万象的概念的理论家，而且作为生活在个体差异世界中的男性和女性个体，享受差异并从中受益。西苏将个体宽容的概念从具体和局部（个人突破）提升到一般原则或理论的水平。众所周知的塔木德教义可能适用于此：“拯救一个人就是拯救整个世界。”对西苏来说，拯救他人丰富了我们、我们的世界、我们的存在、思想和生活、理论和存在。但与任何男性主宰情节、任何包罗万象的概念不同，对差异的宽容是一个永无止境的过程，其最终目标是无法实现的。

Cixous demonstrates that, in giving up our investment in male mastery and seeking an alternative, we gain a richer life, not only as theoreticians who can evolve beyond a single all-encompassing conception, but also as individuals, male and female, living in a world of individual differences, enjoying and profiting from difference. Cixous raises the notion of individual tolerance above the specific and local—the personal break-through—to the level of general principle or theory. The well-known Talmudic doctrine is perhaps applicable here: “He (or she) who saves one person saves the whole world.” For Cixous, saving the other enriches us, our world, our being, thinking and living, theory and existence. But unlike any male master plot, any all-encompassing conception, tolerance of difference is a never-ending process with an ultimate goal that is unattainable.

西苏对女性对抗男性统治的方式进行了如下阐述：

Cixous formulates the way women confront male mastery as follows:

愉悦与法律的关系，以及个人对这种奇怪的、对立的关系的反应，表明了无论我们是男人还是女人，我们都会走上不同的人生道路。这里，决定一切的并不是生理性别。[…] 从文化上讲，女性更有可能获得愉悦，这是因为两性的文化和政治划分是基于性别差异、社会使用身体的方式以及对男性施加内在恐惧比对女性施加内在恐惧要容易得多这一事实。毕竟，所有女性实际上或实际上都有内在体验，一种对他人的承受能力的体验，一种由他人带来的非负面变化的体验，一种积极接受的体验（Cixous Reader，135）。

The relationship to pleasure and the law, the individual’s response to this strange, antagonistic relationship indicates, whether we are men or women, different paths through life. It is not anatomical sex that determines anything here. […] It happens culturally that women have more of a chance of gaining access to pleasure, because of the cultural and political division of the sexes, which is based on sexual difference, the way society has used the body and on the fact that it is much easier to inflict on men than on women the horror of the inside.
